verses.sanskrit_deva: सोम॑स्य मा त॒वसं॒ वक्ष्य॑ग्ने॒ वह्निं॑ चकर्थ वि॒दथे॒ यज॑ध्यै दे॒वाँ अच्छा॒ दीद्य॑द्यु॒ञ्जे अद्रिं॑ शमा॒ये अ॑ग्ने त॒न्वं॑ जुषस्व
verses.transliteration: sómasya mā tavásaṃ vákṣy agne  váhniṃ cakartha vidáthe yájadhyai  devā́m̐ áchā dī́dyad yuñjé ádriṃ  śamāyé agne tanvàṃ juṣasva

translation.text: THOU, Agni, who wilt have the strong, hast made me the Soma's priest, to worship in assembly. Thou shinest to the Gods, I set the pressstones. I toil; be joyful in thyself, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्राञ्चं॑ य॒ज्ञं च॑कृम॒ वर्ध॑तां॒ गीः स॒मिद्भि॑र॒ग्निं नम॑सा दुवस्यन् दि॒वः श॑शासुर्वि॒दथा॑ कवी॒नां गृत्सा॑य चित्त॒वसे॑ गा॒तुमी॑षुः
verses.transliteration: prā́ñcaṃ yajñáṃ cakr̥ma várdhatāṃ gī́ḥ  samídbhir agníṃ námasā duvasyan  diváḥ śaśāsur vidáthā kavīnā́ṃ  gŕ̥tsāya cit taváse gātúm īṣuḥ

translation.text: East have we turned the rite; may the hymn aid it. With wood and worship shall they honour Agni. From heaven the synods of the wise have learnt it: c'en for the quick and strong they seek advancement.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मयो॑ दधे॒ मेधि॑रः पू॒तद॑क्षो दि॒वः सु॒बन्धु॑र्ज॒नुषा॑ पृथि॒व्याः अवि॑न्दन्नु दर्श॒तम॒प्स्व१॒॑न्तर्दे॒वासो॑ अ॒ग्निम॒पसि॒ स्वसॄ॑णाम्
verses.transliteration: máyo dadhe médhiraḥ pūtádakṣo  diváḥ subándhur janúṣā pr̥thivyā́ḥ  ávindann u darśatám apsv àntár  devā́so agním apási svásr̥̄ṇām

translation.text: The Prudent, he whose will is pure, brought welfare, allied by birth to Heaven and Earth in kinship. The Gods discovered in the midst of waters beautiful Agni with the Sisters' labour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॑र्धयन्त्सु॒भगं॑ स॒प्त य॒ह्वीः श्वे॒तं ज॑ज्ञा॒नम॑रु॒षं म॑हि॒त्वा शिशुं॒ न जा॒तम॒भ्या॑रु॒रश्वा॑ दे॒वासो॑ अ॒ग्निं जनि॑मन्वपुष्यन्
verses.transliteration: ávardhayan subhágaṃ saptá yahvī́ḥ  śvetáṃ jajñānám aruṣám mahitvā́  śíśuṃ ná jātám abhy ā̀rur áśvāḥ-  devā́so agníṃ jániman vapuṣyan

translation.text: Him, Blessed One, the Seven strong Floods augmented, him white at birth and red when waxen mighty. As mother mares run to their new-born you ling, so at his birth the Gods wondered at Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒क्रेभि॒रङ्गै॒ रज॑ आतत॒न्वान्क्रतुं॑ पुना॒नः क॒विभिः॑ प॒वित्रैः॑ शो॒चिर्वसा॑नः॒ पर्यायु॑र॒पां श्रियो॑ मिमीते बृह॒तीरनू॑नाः
verses.transliteration: śukrébhir áṅgai rája ātatanvā́n  krátum punānáḥ kavíbhiḥ pavítraiḥ  śocír vásānaḥ páry ā́yur apā́ṃ  śríyo mimīte br̥hatī́r ánūnāḥ

translation.text: Spreading with radiant limbs throughout the region, purging his power with wise purifications, Robing himself in light, the life of waters, lie spreads abroad his high and perfect glories.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒व्राजा॑ सी॒मन॑दती॒रद॑ब्धा दि॒वो य॒ह्वीरव॑साना॒ अन॑ग्नाः सना॒ अत्र॑ युव॒तयः॒ सयो॑नी॒रेकं॒ गर्भं॑ दधिरे स॒प्त वाणीः॑
verses.transliteration: vavrā́jā sīm ánadatīr ádabdhāḥ-  divó yahvī́r ávasānā ánagnāḥ  sánā átra yuvatáyaḥ sáyonīr  ékaṃ gárbhaṃ dadhire saptá vā́ṇīḥ

translation.text: He sought heaven's Mighty Ones, the unconsuming, the unimpaired, not clothed and yet not naked. Then they, ancient and young, who dwell together, Seven sounding Rivers, as one germ received him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्ती॒र्णा अ॑स्य सं॒हतो॑ वि॒श्वरू॑पा घृ॒तस्य॒ योनौ॑ स्र॒वथे॒ मधू॑नाम् अस्थु॒रत्र॑ धे॒नवः॒ पिन्व॑माना म॒ही द॒स्मस्य॑ मा॒तरा॑ समी॒ची
verses.transliteration: stīrṇā́ asya saṃháto viśvárūpāḥ-  ghr̥tásya yónau sraváthe mádhūnām  ásthur átra dhenávaḥ pínvamānāḥ-  mahī́ dasmásya mātárā samīcī́

translation.text: His piles, assuming every form, are scattered where flow sweet waters, at the spring of fatness; There stood the milch-kine with full-laden udders, and both paired Mighty Mothers of the Wondrous.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब॒भ्रा॒णः सू॑नो सहसो॒ व्य॑द्यौ॒द्दधा॑नः शु॒क्रा र॑भ॒सा वपूं॑षि श्चोत॑न्ति॒ धारा॒ मधु॑नो घृ॒तस्य॒ वृषा॒ यत्र॑ वावृ॒धे काव्ये॑न
verses.transliteration: babhrāṇáḥ sūno sahaso vy àdyaud  dádhānaḥ śukrā́ rabhasā́ vápūṃṣi  ścótanti dhā́rā mádhuno ghr̥tásya  vŕ̥ṣā yátra vāvr̥dhé kā́vyena

translation.text: Carefully cherished, Son of Strength, thou shoncst assuming lasting and refulgent beauties. Full streams of fatness and sweet juice descended, there where the Mighty One grew strong by wisdom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पि॒तुश्चि॒दूध॑र्ज॒नुषा॑ विवेद॒ व्य॑स्य॒ धारा॑ असृज॒द्वि धेनाः॑ गुहा॒ चर॑न्तं॒ सखि॑भिः शि॒वेभि॑र्दि॒वो य॒ह्वीभि॒र्न गुहा॑ बभूव
verses.transliteration: pitúś cid ū́dhar janúṣā viveda  vy àsya dhā́rā asr̥jad ví dhénāḥ  gúhā cárantaṃ sákhibhiḥ śivébhir  divó yahvī́bhir ná gúhā babhūva

translation.text: From birth he knew even his Father's bosom, he set his voices and his streams in motion; Knew him who moved with blessed Friends in secret, with the young Dames of heaven. He stayed not hidden.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पि॒तुश्च॒ गर्भं॑ जनि॒तुश्च॑ बभ्रे पू॒र्वीरेको॑ अधय॒त्पीप्या॑नाः वृष्णे॑ स॒पत्नी॒ शुच॑ये॒ सब॑न्धू उ॒भे अ॑स्मै मनु॒ष्ये॒३॒॑ नि पा॑हि
verses.transliteration: pitúś ca gárbhaṃ janitúś ca babhre  pūrvī́r éko adhayat pī́pyānāḥ  vŕ̥ṣṇe sapátnī śúcaye sábandhū  ubhé asmai manuṣyè ní pāhi

translation.text: He nursed the Infant of the Sire and Maker: alone the Babe sucked many a teeming bosom. Guard, for the Bright and Strong, the fellow-spouses friendly to men and bound to him in kinship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒रौ म॒हाँ अ॑निबा॒धे व॑व॒र्धापो॑ अ॒ग्निं य॒शसः॒ सं हि पू॒र्वीः ऋ॒तस्य॒ योना॑वशय॒द्दमू॑ना जामी॒नाम॒ग्निर॒पसि॒ स्वसॄ॑णाम्
verses.transliteration: uraú mahā́m̐ anibādhé vavardha-  -ā́po agníṃ yaśásaḥ sáṃ hí pūrvī́ḥ  r̥tásya yónāv aśayad dámūnāḥ-  jāmīnā́m agnír apási svásr̥̄ṇām

translation.text: The Mighty One increased in space unbounded; full many a glorious flood gave strength to Agni. Friend of the house, within the lap of Order lay Agni, in the Sister Rivers' service.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒क्रो न ब॒भ्रिः स॑मि॒थे म॒हीनां॑ दिदृ॒क्षेयः॑ सू॒नवे॒ भाऋ॑जीकः उदु॒स्रिया॒ जनि॑ता॒ यो ज॒जाना॒पां गर्भो॒ नृत॑मो य॒ह्वो अ॒ग्निः
verses.transliteration: akró ná babhríḥ samithé mahī́nāṃ  didr̥kṣéyaḥ sūnáve bhā́r̥jīkaḥ  úd usríyā jánitā yó jajā́na-  -apā́ṃ gárbho nŕ̥tamo yahvó agníḥ

translation.text: As keen supporter where great waters gather, light-shedder whom the brood rejoice to look on; He who begat, and will beget, the dawnlights, most manly, Child of Floods, is youthful Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒पां गर्भं॑ दर्श॒तमोष॑धीनां॒ वना॑ जजान सु॒भगा॒ विरू॑पम् दे॒वास॑श्चि॒न्मन॑सा॒ सं हि ज॒ग्मुः पनि॑ष्ठं जा॒तं त॒वसं॑ दुवस्यन्
verses.transliteration: apā́ṃ gárbhaṃ darśatám óṣadhīnām  vánā jajāna subhágā vírūpam  devā́saś cin mánasā sáṃ hí jagmúḥ  pániṣṭhaṃ jātáṃ tavásaṃ duvasyan

translation.text: Him, varied in his form, the lovely Infant of floods and plants the blessed wood hath gendered. Gods even, moved in spirit, came around him, and served him at his birth, the Strong, the Wondrous.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृ॒हन्त॒ इद्भा॒नवो॒ भाऋ॑जीकम॒ग्निं स॑चन्त वि॒द्युतो॒ न शु॒क्राः गुहे॑व वृ॒द्धं सद॑सि॒ स्वे अ॒न्तर॑पा॒र ऊ॒र्वे अ॒मृतं॒ दुहा॑नाः
verses.transliteration: br̥hánta íd bhānávo bhā́r̥jīkam  agníṃ sacanta vidyúto ná śukrā́ḥ  gúheva vr̥ddháṃ sádasi své antár  apārá ūrvé amŕ̥taṃ dúhānāḥ

translation.text: Like brilliant lightnings, mighty luminaries accompany the light-diffusing Agni, Waxen, as 'twere in secret, in his dwelling, while in the boundless stall they milk out Amrit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ईळे॑ च त्वा॒ यज॑मानो ह॒विर्भि॒रीळे॑ सखि॒त्वं सु॑म॒तिं निका॑मः दे॒वैरवो॑ मिमीहि॒ सं ज॑रि॒त्रे रक्षा॑ च नो॒ दम्ये॑भि॒रनी॑कैः
verses.transliteration: ī́ḷe ca tvā yájamāno havírbhir  ī́ḷe sakhitváṃ sumatíṃ níkāmaḥ  devaír ávo mimīhi sáṃ jaritré  rákṣā ca no dámyebhir ánīkaiḥ

translation.text: I sacrificing serve thee with oblations and crave with longing thy good-will and friendship. Grant, with the Gods, thy grace to him who lauds thee, protect us with thy rays that guard the homestead.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒प॒क्षे॒तार॒स्तव॑ सुप्रणी॒तेऽग्ने॒ विश्वा॑नि॒ धन्या॒ दधा॑नाः सु॒रेत॑सा॒ श्रव॑सा॒ तुञ्ज॑माना अ॒भि ष्या॑म पृतना॒यूँरदे॑वान्
verses.transliteration: upakṣetā́ras táva supraṇīte-  -ágne víśvāni dhányā dádhānāḥ  surétasā śrávasā túñjamānāḥ-  abhí ṣyāma pr̥tanāyū́m̐r ádevān

translation.text: May we, O Agni, thou who leadest wisely, thy followers and masters of all treasures, Strong in the glory of our noble offspring, subdue the godless when they seek the battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ दे॒वाना॑मभवः के॒तुर॑ग्ने म॒न्द्रो विश्वा॑नि॒ काव्या॑नि वि॒द्वान् प्रति॒ मर्ताँ॑ अवासयो॒ दमू॑ना॒ अनु॑ दे॒वान्र॑थि॒रो या॑सि॒ साध॑न्
verses.transliteration: ā́ devā́nām abhavaḥ ketúr agne  mandró víśvāni kā́vyāni vidvā́n  práti mártām̐ avāsayo dámūnāḥ-  ánu devā́n rathiró yāsi sā́dhan

translation.text: Ensign of Gods hast thou become, O Agni, joy-giver, knower of all secret wisdom. Friend of the homestead, thou hast lightened mortals: carborne thou goest to the Gods, fulfilling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि दु॑रो॒णे अ॒मृतो॒ मर्त्या॑नां॒ राजा॑ ससाद वि॒दथा॑नि॒ साध॑न् घृ॒तप्र॑तीक उर्वि॒या व्य॑द्यौद॒ग्निर्विश्वा॑नि॒ काव्या॑नि वि॒द्वान्
verses.transliteration: ní duroṇé amŕ̥to mártyānāṃ  rā́jā sasāda vidáthāni sā́dhan  ghr̥tápratīka urviyā́ vy àdyaud  agnír víśvāni kā́vyāni vidvā́n

translation.text: Within the house hath sate the King immortal of mortals, filling full their sacred synods. Bedewed with holy oil he shineth widely, Agni, the knower of all secret wisdom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ गहि स॒ख्येभिः॑ शि॒वेभि॑र्म॒हान्म॒हीभि॑रू॒तिभिः॑ सर॒ण्यन् अ॒स्मे र॒यिं ब॑हु॒लं संत॑रुत्रं सु॒वाचं॑ भा॒गं य॒शसं॑ कृधी नः
verses.transliteration: ā́ no gahi sakhyébhiḥ śivébhir  mahā́n mahī́bhir ūtíbhiḥ saraṇyán  asmé rayím bahuláṃ sáṃtarutraṃ  suvā́cam bhāgáṃ yaśásaṃ kr̥dhī naḥ

translation.text: Come unto us with thine auspicious friendship, come speeding, Mighty, with thy mighty succours. Grant us abundant wealth that saves from danger, that brings a good repute, a glorious portion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ता ते॑ अग्ने॒ जनि॑मा॒ सना॑नि॒ प्र पू॒र्व्याय॒ नूत॑नानि वोचम् म॒हान्ति॒ वृष्णे॒ सव॑ना कृ॒तेमा जन्म॑ञ्जन्म॒न्निहि॑तो जा॒तवे॑दाः
verses.transliteration: etā́ te agne jánimā sánāni  prá pūrvyā́ya nū́tanāni vocam  mahā́nti vŕ̥ṣṇe sávanā kr̥témā́  jánmañ-janman níhito jātávedāḥ

translation.text: To thee who art of old these songs, O Agni, have I declared, the ancient and the later. These great libations to the Strong are offiered: in every birth is Jâtavedas stablished.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जन्म॑ञ्जन्म॒न्निहि॑तो जा॒तवे॑दा वि॒श्वामि॑त्रेभिरिध्यते॒ अज॑स्रः तस्य॑ व॒यं सु॑म॒तौ य॒ज्ञिय॒स्यापि॑ भ॒द्रे सौ॑मन॒से स्या॑म
verses.transliteration: jánmañ-janman níhito jātávedāḥ  viśvā́mitrebhir idhyate ájasraḥ  tásya vayáṃ sumataú yajñíyasya-  -ápi bhadré saumanasé syāma

translation.text: Stablished in every birth is Jâtavedas, kindled perpetual by the Viṣvâmitras. May we rest ever in the loving-kindness, in the auspicious grace of him the Holy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं य॒ज्ञं स॑हसाव॒न्त्वं नो॑ देव॒त्रा धे॑हि सुक्रतो॒ ररा॑णः प्र यं॑सि होतर्बृह॒तीरिषो॒ नोऽग्ने॒ महि॒ द्रवि॑ण॒मा य॑जस्व
verses.transliteration: imáṃ yajñáṃ sahasāvan tváṃ no  devatrā́ dhehi sukrato rárāṇaḥ  prá yaṃsi hotar br̥hatī́r íṣo naḥ-  -ágne máhi dráviṇam ā́ yajasva

translation.text: This sacrifice of ours do thou, O Mighty, O truly Wise, bear to the Gods rejoicing. Grant us abundant food, thou priestly Herald, vouchsafe to give us ample wealth, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इळा॑मग्ने पुरु॒दंसं॑ स॒निं गोः श॑श्वत्त॒मं हव॑मानाय साध स्यान्नः॑ सू॒नुस्तन॑यो वि॒जावाग्ने॒ सा ते॑ सुम॒तिर्भू॑त्व॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: íḷām agne purudáṃsaṃ saníṃ góḥ  śaśvattamáṃ hávamānāya sādha  syā́n naḥ sūnús tánayo vijā́vā-  -ágne sā́ te sumatír bhūtv asmé

translation.text: As holy food, Agni, to thine'invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us he born a son, and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वै॒श्वा॒न॒राय॑ धि॒षणा॑मृता॒वृधे॑ घृ॒तं न पू॒तम॒ग्नये॑ जनामसि द्वि॒ता होता॑रं॒ मनु॑षश्च वा॒घतो॑ धि॒या रथं॒ न कुलि॑शः॒ समृ॑ण्वति
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānarā́ya dhiṣáṇām r̥tāvŕ̥dhe  ghr̥táṃ ná pūtám agnáye janāmasi  dvitā́ hótāram mánuṣaś ca vāgháto  dhiyā́ ráthaṃ ná kúliśaḥ sám r̥ṇvati

translation.text: To him, Vaiṣvânara, who strengthens Holy Law, to Agni we present our praise like oil made pure. With thoughtful insight human priests bring him anear, our Herald from of old, as an axe forms a car.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स रो॑चयज्ज॒नुषा॒ रोद॑सी उ॒भे स मा॒त्रोर॑भवत्पु॒त्र ईड्यः॑ ह॒व्य॒वाळ॒ग्निर॒जर॒श्चनो॑हितो दू॒ळभो॑ वि॒शामति॑थिर्वि॒भाव॑सुः
verses.transliteration: sá rocayaj janúṣā ródasī ubhé  sá mātrór abhavat putrá ī́ḍyaḥ  havyavā́ḷ agnír ajáraś cánohito  dūḷábho viśā́m átithir vibhā́vasuḥ

translation.text: He made the heaven and earth resplendent by his birth: Child of two Mothers he was meet to be implored, Agni, oblation-bearer, gracious, ever-young, infallible, rich in radiant light, the guest of men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्रत्वा॒ दक्ष॑स्य॒ तरु॑षो॒ विध॑र्मणि दे॒वासो॑ अ॒ग्निं ज॑नयन्त॒ चित्ति॑भिः रु॒रु॒चा॒नं भा॒नुना॒ ज्योति॑षा म॒हामत्यं॒ न वाजं॑ सनि॒ष्यन्नुप॑ ब्रुवे
verses.transliteration: krátvā dákṣasya táruṣo vídharmaṇi  devā́so agníṃ janayanta cíttibhiḥ  rurucānám bhānúnā jyótiṣā mahā́m  átyaṃ ná vā́jaṃ saniṣyánn úpa bruve

translation.text: Within the range of their surpassinq power, by might, the Gods created Agni with inventive thought. I, eager to win strength, address him, like a steed, resplendent with his brilliance, with his ample light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ म॒न्द्रस्य॑ सनि॒ष्यन्तो॒ वरे॑ण्यं वृणी॒महे॒ अह्र॑यं॒ वाज॑मृ॒ग्मिय॑म् रा॒तिं भृगू॑णामु॒शिजं॑ क॒विक्र॑तुम॒ग्निं राज॑न्तं दि॒व्येन॑ शो॒चिषा॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ mandrásya saniṣyánto váreṇyaṃ  vr̥ṇīmáhe áhrayaṃ vā́jam r̥gmíyam  rātím bhŕ̥gūṇām uśíjaṃ kavíkratum  agníṃ rā́jantaṃ divyéna śocíṣā

translation.text: Eager to gain, we crave from him the friendly God strength confident, choiceworthy meet to be extolled: The Bhr̥igus' bounty, willing, strong with sages' lore, even Agni shining forth with light that comes from heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निं सु॒म्नाय॑ दधिरे पु॒रो जना॒ वाज॑श्रवसमि॒ह वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषः य॒तस्रु॑चः सु॒रुचं॑ वि॒श्वदे॑व्यं रु॒द्रं य॒ज्ञानां॒ साध॑दिष्टिम॒पसा॑म्
verses.transliteration: agníṃ sumnā́ya dadhire puró jánāḥ-  vā́jaśravasam ihá vr̥ktábarhiṣaḥ  yatásrucaḥ surúcaṃ viśvádevyaṃ  rudráṃ yajñā́nāṃ sā́dhadiṣṭim apásām

translation.text: For happiness, men, having trimmed the sacred grass, set Agni glorious for his strength before them here; Yea, with raised ladles, him bright, dear to all the Gods, perfecting aims of works, Rudra of solemn rites.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पाव॑कशोचे॒ तव॒ हि क्षयं॒ परि॒ होत॑र्य॒ज्ञेषु॑ वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषो॒ नरः॑ अग्ने॒ दुव॑ इ॒च्छमा॑नास॒ आप्य॒मुपा॑सते॒ द्रवि॑णं धेहि॒ तेभ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: pā́vakaśoce táva hí kṣáyam pári  hótar yajñéṣu vr̥ktábarhiṣo náraḥ  ágne dúva ichámānāsa ā́pyam  úpāsate dráviṇaṃ dhehi tébhyaḥ

translation.text: Around thy dwelling-place, O brightly-shining Priest, are men at sacrifice, whose sacred grass is trimmed. Wishing to do thee service, Agni, they are there, desirous of thy friendship grant them store of wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ रोद॑सी अपृण॒दा स्व॑र्म॒हज्जा॒तं यदे॑नम॒पसो॒ अधा॑रयन् सो अ॑ध्व॒राय॒ परि॑ णीयते क॒विरत्यो॒ न वाज॑सातये॒ चनो॑हितः
verses.transliteration: ā́ ródasī apr̥ṇad ā́ svàr maháj  jātáṃ yád enam apáso ádhārayan  só adhvarā́ya pári ṇīyate kavír  átyo ná vā́jasātaye cánohitaḥ

translation.text: He hath filled heaven and earth and the great realm of light, when at his birth the skilful held him in their hold. He like a horse is led forth to the sacrifice Sage, graciously inclined, that he may win us strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒म॒स्यत॑ ह॒व्यदा॑तिं स्वध्व॒रं दु॑व॒स्यत॒ दम्यं॑ जा॒तवे॑दसम् र॒थीर्ऋ॒तस्य॑ बृह॒तो विच॑र्षणिर॒ग्निर्दे॒वाना॑मभवत्पु॒रोहि॑तः
verses.transliteration: namasyáta havyádātiṃ svadhvaráṃ  duvasyáta dámyaṃ jātávedasam  rathī́r r̥tásya br̥ható vícarṣaṇir  agnír devā́nām abhavat puróhitaḥ

translation.text: Honour the oblation-bearer, him who knows fair rites, serve ye the Household Friend who knows all things that be. He drives the chariot of the lofty ordinance: Agni most active, is the great High Priest of Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ति॒स्रो य॒ह्वस्य॑ स॒मिधः॒ परि॑ज्मनो॒ऽग्नेर॑पुनन्नु॒शिजो॒ अमृ॑त्यवः तासा॒मेका॒मद॑धु॒र्मर्त्ये॒ भुज॑मु लो॒कमु॒ द्वे उप॑ जा॒मिमी॑यतुः
verses.transliteration: tisró yahvásya samídhaḥ párijmano  -agnér apunann uśíjo ámr̥tyavaḥ  tā́sām ékām ádadhur mártye bhújam  ulokám u dvé úpa jāmím īyatuḥ

translation.text: They who are free from death, fain for him, purified three splendours of the mighty Agni, circling all. To man, for his enjoyment, one of these they gave: the other two have passed into the sister sphere.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒शां क॒विं वि॒श्पतिं॒ मानु॑षी॒रिषः॒ सं सी॑मकृण्व॒न्त्स्वधि॑तिं॒ न तेज॑से स उ॒द्वतो॑ नि॒वतो॑ याति॒ वेवि॑ष॒त्स गर्भ॑मे॒षु भुव॑नेषु दीधरत्
verses.transliteration: viśā́ṃ kavíṃ viśpátim mā́nuṣīr íṣaḥ  sáṃ sīm akr̥ṇvan svádhitiṃ ná téjase  sá udváto niváto yāti véviṣat  sá gárbham eṣú bhúvaneṣu dīdharat

translation.text: Man's sacrificial food hath sharpened like an axe, for brightness, him the Sage of men, the people's Lord, Busied with sacred rites he mounts and he descends. He hath laid down his vital germ within these worlds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स जि॑न्वते ज॒ठरे॑षु प्रजज्ञि॒वान्वृषा॑ चि॒त्रेषु॒ नान॑द॒न्न सिं॒हः वै॒श्वा॒न॒रः पृ॑थु॒पाजा॒ अम॑र्त्यो॒ वसु॒ रत्ना॒ दय॑मानो॒ वि दा॒शुषे॑
verses.transliteration: sá jinvate jaṭháreṣu prajajñivā́n  vŕ̥ṣā citréṣu nā́nadan ná siṃháḥ  vaiśvānaráḥ pr̥thupā́jā ámartyo  vásu rátnā dáyamāno ví dāśúṣe

translation.text: He stirs with life in wombs dissimilar in kind, born as a Lion or a loudly-bellowing Bull: Vaiṣvânara immortal with wide-reaching might, bestowing goods and wealth on him who offiers gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वै॒श्वा॒न॒रः प्र॒त्नथा॒ नाक॒मारु॑हद्दि॒वस्पृ॒ष्ठं भन्द॑मानः सु॒मन्म॑भिः स पू॑र्व॒वज्ज॒नय॑ञ्ज॒न्तवे॒ धनं॑ समा॒नमज्मं॒ पर्ये॑ति॒ जागृ॑विः
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānaráḥ pratnáthā nā́kam ā́ruhad  divás pr̥ṣṭhám bhándamānaḥ sumánmabhiḥ  sá pūrvaváj janáyañ jantáve dhánaṃ  samānám ájmam páry eti jā́gr̥viḥ

translation.text: Vaiṣvânara, as of old, mounted the cope of heaven, heaven's ridge, well greeted, by those skilled in noble songs. He, as of old, producing riches for the folk, still watchful, traversesthe common way again.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तावा॑नं य॒ज्ञियं॒ विप्र॑मु॒क्थ्य१॒॑मा यं द॒धे मा॑त॒रिश्वा॑ दि॒वि क्षय॑म् तं चि॒त्रया॑मं॒ हरि॑केशमीमहे सुदी॒तिम॒ग्निं सु॑वि॒ताय॒ नव्य॑से
verses.transliteration: r̥tā́vānaṃ yajñíyaṃ vípram ukthyàm  ā́ yáṃ dadhé mātaríśvā diví kṣáyam  táṃ citráyāmaṃ hárikeśam īmahe  sudītím agníṃ suvitā́ya návyase

translation.text: For new prosperity we seek to Agni, him whose course is splendid, gold-haired, excellently bright, Whom Mâtariṣvan stablished, dweller in the heaven, meet for high praise and holy, sage and true to Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शुचिं॒ न याम॑न्निषि॒रं स्व॒र्दृशं॑ के॒तुं दि॒वो रो॑चन॒स्थामु॑ष॒र्बुध॑म् अ॒ग्निं मू॒र्धानं॑ दि॒वो अप्र॑तिष्कुतं॒ तमी॑महे॒ नम॑सा वा॒जिनं॑ बृ॒हत्
verses.transliteration: śúciṃ ná yā́mann iṣiráṃ svardŕ̥śaṃ  ketúṃ divó rocanasthā́m uṣarbúdham  agním mūrdhā́naṃ divó ápratiṣkutaṃ  tám īmahe námasā vājínam br̥hát

translation.text: As pure and swift of course, beholder of the light, who stands in heaven's bright sphere a sign, who wakes at dawn, Agni, the head of heaven, whom none may turn aside-to him the Powerful with mighty prayer we seek.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒न्द्रं होता॑रं॒ शुचि॒मद्व॑याविनं॒ दमू॑नसमु॒क्थ्यं॑ वि॒श्वच॑र्षणिम् रथं॒ न चि॒त्रं वपु॑षाय दर्श॒तं मनु॑र्हितं॒ सद॒मिद्रा॒य ई॑महे
verses.transliteration: mandráṃ hótāraṃ śúcim ádvayāvinaṃ  dámūnasam ukthyàṃ viśvácarṣaṇim  ráthaṃ ná citráṃ vápuṣāya darśatám  mánurhitaṃ sádam íd rāyá īmahe

translation.text: The cheerful Priest, the pure, in whom no guile is found, Friend of the House, praise-worthy, dear to all mankind, Fair to behold for beauty like a splendid car,– Agni the Friend of men we ever seek for wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वै॒श्वा॒न॒राय॑ पृथु॒पाज॑से॒ विपो॒ रत्ना॑ विधन्त ध॒रुणे॑षु॒ गात॑वे अ॒ग्निर्हि दे॒वाँ अ॒मृतो॑ दुव॒स्यत्यथा॒ धर्मा॑णि स॒नता॒ न दू॑दुषत्
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānarā́ya pr̥thupā́jase vípo  rátnā vidhanta dharúṇeṣu gā́tave  agnír hí devā́m̐ amŕ̥to duvasyáti-  áthā dhármāṇi sanátā ná dūduṣat

translation.text: To him who shines afar, Vaiṣvânara, shall bards give precious things that he may go on certain paths: For Agni the Immortal serves the Deities, and therefore never breaks their everlasting laws.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न्तर्दू॒तो रोद॑सी द॒स्म ई॑यते॒ होता॒ निष॑त्तो॒ मनु॑षः पु॒रोहि॑तः क्षयं॑ बृ॒हन्तं॒ परि॑ भूषति॒ द्युभि॑र्दे॒वेभि॑र॒ग्निरि॑षि॒तो धि॒याव॑सुः
verses.transliteration: antár dūtó ródasī dasmá īyate  hótā níṣatto mánuṣaḥ puróhitaḥ  kṣáyam br̥hántam pári bhūṣati dyúbhir  devébhir agnír iṣitó dhiyā́vasuḥ

translation.text: He, wondrous envoy, goes between the earth and heaven, firm seated as the Herald, great High Priest of men. He compassethwith rays the lofty dwelling-place, Agni, sent forward by the Gods, enriched with piayer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: के॒तुं य॒ज्ञानां॑ वि॒दथ॑स्य॒ साध॑नं॒ विप्रा॑सो अ॒ग्निं म॑हयन्त॒ चित्ति॑भिः अपां॑सि॒ यस्मि॒न्नधि॑ संद॒धुर्गिर॒स्तस्मि॑न्त्सु॒म्नानि॒ यज॑मान॒ आ च॑के
verses.transliteration: ketúṃ yajñā́nāṃ vidáthasya sā́dhanaṃ  víprāso agním mahayanta cíttibhiḥ  ápāṃsi yásminn ádhi saṃdadhúr gíras  tásmin sumnā́ni yájamāna ā́ cake

translation.text: Sages shall glorify Agni with earnest thoughts, ensign of sacrifice, who fills the synod full: In whom the singers have stored up their holy acts to him the worshipper looks for joy and happiness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पि॒ता य॒ज्ञाना॒मसु॑रो विप॒श्चितां॑ वि॒मान॑म॒ग्निर्व॒युनं॑ च वा॒घता॑म् आ वि॑वेश॒ रोद॑सी॒ भूरि॑वर्पसा पुरुप्रि॒यो भ॑न्दते॒ धाम॑भिः क॒विः
verses.transliteration: pitā́ yajñā́nām ásuro vipaścítāṃ  vimā́nam agnír vayúnaṃ ca vāghátām  ā́ viveśa ródasī bhū́rivarpasā  purupriyó bhandate dhā́mabhiḥ kavíḥ

translation.text: The Sire of sacrifice, great God of holy bards, Agni, the measure and the symbol of the priests, Hath entered heaven and earth that show in varied form: the Sage whom many love rejoiceth in his might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒न्द्रम॒ग्निं च॒न्द्रर॑थं॒ हरि॑व्रतं वैश्वान॒रम॑प्सु॒षदं॑ स्व॒र्विद॑म् वि॒गा॒हं तूर्णिं॒ तवि॑षीभि॒रावृ॑तं॒ भूर्णिं॑ दे॒वास॑ इ॒ह सु॒श्रियं॑ दधुः
verses.transliteration: candrám agníṃ candrárathaṃ hárivrataṃ  vaiśvānarám apsuṣádaṃ svarvídam  vigāháṃ tū́rṇiṃ táviṣībhir ā́vr̥tam  bhū́rṇiṃ devā́sa ihá suśríyaṃ dadhuḥ

translation.text: Bright Agni with the bright car, Lord of green domains, Vaiṣvânara dweller in the floods, who finds the light, Pervading, swift and wild, encompassed round with powers, him very glorious have the Gods established here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर्दे॒वेभि॒र्मनु॑षश्च ज॒न्तुभि॑स्तन्वा॒नो य॒ज्ञं पु॑रु॒पेश॑सं धि॒या र॒थीर॒न्तरी॑यते॒ साध॑दिष्टिभिर्जी॒रो दमू॑ना अभिशस्ति॒चात॑नः
verses.transliteration: agnír devébhir mánuṣaś ca jantúbhis  tanvānó yajñám purupéśasaṃ dhiyā́  rathī́r antár īyate sā́dhadiṣṭibhir  jīró dámūnā abhiśasticā́tanaḥ

translation.text: Agni, together with the Gods and Manu's folk by thought extending sacrifice in varied form, Goes, car-borne, to and fro with those who crown each rite, the fleet, the Household Friend, who turns the curse aside.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ जर॑स्व स्वप॒त्य आयु॑न्यू॒र्जा पि॑न्वस्व॒ समिषो॑ दिदीहि नः वयां॑सि जिन्व बृह॒तश्च॑ जागृव उ॒शिग्दे॒वाना॒मसि॑ सु॒क्रतु॑र्वि॒पाम्
verses.transliteration: ágne járasva svapatyá ā́yuni-  ūrjā́ pinvasva sám íṣo didīhi naḥ  váyāṃsi jinva br̥hatáś ca jāgr̥ve-  uśíg devā́nām ási sukrátur vipā́m

translation.text: Sing, Agni, for long life to us and noble sons: teem thou with plenty, shine upon us store of food. Increase the great man's strength, thou ever-vigilant: thou, longing for the Gods, knowest their hymns full well.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒श्पतिं॑ य॒ह्वमति॑थिं॒ नरः॒ सदा॑ य॒न्तारं॑ धी॒नामु॒शिजं॑ च वा॒घता॑म् अ॒ध्व॒राणां॒ चेत॑नं जा॒तवे॑दसं॒ प्र शं॑सन्ति॒ नम॑सा जू॒तिभि॑र्वृ॒धे
verses.transliteration: viśpátiṃ yahvám átithiṃ náraḥ sádā  yantā́raṃ dhīnā́m uśíjaṃ ca vāghátām  adhvarā́ṇāṃ cétanaṃ jātávedasam  prá śaṃsanti námasā jūtíbhir vr̥dhé

translation.text: The Mighty One, Lord of the people and their guest, the leader of their thoughts, devoted Friend of priests, Our solemn rites' announcer, Jâtavedas, men with worship ever praise, with urgings for their weal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒भावा॑ दे॒वः सु॒रणः॒ परि॑ क्षि॒तीर॒ग्निर्ब॑भूव॒ शव॑सा सु॒मद्र॑थः तस्य॑ व्र॒तानि॑ भूरिपो॒षिणो॑ व॒यमुप॑ भूषेम॒ दम॒ आ सु॑वृ॒क्तिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: vibhā́vā deváḥ suráṇaḥ pári kṣitī́r  agnír babhūva śávasā sumádrathaḥ  tásya vratā́ni bhūripoṣíṇo vayám  úpa bhūṣema dáma ā́ suvr̥ktíbhiḥ

translation.text: Agni the God resplendent, giver of great joy, hath on his lovely car compassed the lands with, might. Let us with pure laudations in his house approach the high laws of the nourisher of multitudes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वैश्वा॑नर॒ तव॒ धामा॒न्या च॑के॒ येभिः॑ स्व॒र्विदभ॑वो विचक्षण जा॒त आपृ॑णो॒ भुव॑नानि॒ रोद॑सी॒ अग्ने॒ ता विश्वा॑ परि॒भूर॑सि॒ त्मना॑
verses.transliteration: vaíśvānara táva dhā́māny ā́ cake  yébhiḥ svarvíd ábhavo vicakṣaṇa  jātá ā́pr̥ṇo bhúvanāni ródasī  ágne tā́ víśvā paribhū́r asi tmánā

translation.text: I celebrate thy glories, O Vaiṣvânara, wherewith thou, O farsighted God, has found the light. Thou filledst at thy birth both worlds, the earth and heaven: all this, O Agni, hast thou compassed of thyself.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वै॒श्वा॒न॒रस्य॑ दं॒सना॑भ्यो बृ॒हदरि॑णा॒देकः॑ स्वप॒स्यया॑ क॒विः उ॒भा पि॒तरा॑ म॒हय॑न्नजायता॒ग्निर्द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी भूरि॑रेतसा
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānarásya daṃsánābhyo br̥hád  áriṇād ékaḥ svapasyáyā kavíḥ  ubhā́ pitárā maháyann ajāyata-  -agnír dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ bhū́riretasā

translation.text: By his great skill the Sage alone hath brought to pass a great deed, mightier than Vaiṣvânara's wondrous acts. Agni sprang into being, magnifying both his Parents, Heaven and Earth, rich in prolific seed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मित्स॑मित्सु॒मना॑ बोध्य॒स्मे शु॒चाशु॑चा सुम॒तिं रा॑सि॒ वस्वः॑ आ दे॑व दे॒वान्य॒जथा॑य वक्षि॒ सखा॒ सखी॑न्त्सु॒मना॑ यक्ष्यग्ने
verses.transliteration: samít-samit sumánā bodhy asmé  śucā́-śucā sumatíṃ rāsi vásvaḥ  ā́ deva devā́n yajáthāya vakṣi  sákhā sákhīn sumánā yakṣy agne

translation.text: BE friendly with each kindled log of fuel, with every flash bestow the boon of riches. Bring thou the Gods, O God, unto our worship: serve, well-inclined, as Friend thy friends, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं दे॒वास॒स्त्रिरह॑न्ना॒यज॑न्ते दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॒ग्निः सेमं य॒ज्ञं मधु॑मन्तं कृधी न॒स्तनू॑नपाद्घृ॒तयो॑निं वि॒धन्त॑म्
verses.transliteration: yáṃ devā́sas trír áhann āyájante  divé-dive váruṇo mitró agníḥ  sémáṃ yajñám mádhumantaṃ kr̥dhī nas  tánūnapād ghr̥táyoniṃ vidhántam

translation.text: Agni whom daily Varuṇa and Mitra the Gods bring thrice a day to this our worship, Tanûnapât, enrich with meath our service that dwells with holy oil, that offers honour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र दीधि॑तिर्वि॒श्ववा॑रा जिगाति॒ होता॑रमि॒ळः प्र॑थ॒मं यज॑ध्यै अच्छा॒ नमो॑भिर्वृष॒भं व॒न्दध्यै॒ स दे॒वान्य॑क्षदिषि॒तो यजी॑यान्
verses.transliteration: prá dī́dhitir viśvávārā jigāti  hótāram iḷáḥ prathamáṃ yájadhyai  áchā námobhir vr̥ṣabháṃ vandádhyai  sá devā́n yakṣad iṣitó yájīyān

translation.text: The thought that bringeth every boon proceedeth to worship first the Priest of the libation, That we may greet the Strong One with our homage. Urged, may he bring the Gods, best Sacrificer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्ध्वो वां॑ गा॒तुर॑ध्व॒रे अ॑कार्यू॒र्ध्वा शो॒चींषि॒ प्रस्थि॑ता॒ रजां॑सि दि॒वो वा॒ नाभा॒ न्य॑सादि॒ होता॑ स्तृणी॒महि॑ दे॒वव्य॑चा॒ वि ब॒र्हिः
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvó vāṃ gātúr adhvaré akāri-  ūrdhvā́ śocī́ṃṣi prásthitā rájāṃsi  divó vā nā́bhā ny àsādi hótā  str̥ṇīmáhi devávyacā ví barhíḥ

translation.text: On high your way to sacrifice was made ready; the radiant flames went upward to the regions. Full in the midst of heaven the Priest is seated: sirew we the sacred grass where Gods may rest them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒प्त हो॒त्राणि॒ मन॑सा वृणा॒ना इन्व॑न्तो॒ विश्वं॒ प्रति॑ यन्नृ॒तेन॑ नृ॒पेश॑सो वि॒दथे॑षु॒ प्र जा॒ता अ॒भी॒३॒॑मं य॒ज्ञं वि च॑रन्त पू॒र्वीः
verses.transliteration: saptá hotrā́ṇi mánasā vr̥ṇānā́ḥ-  ínvanto víśvam práti yann r̥téna  nr̥péśaso vidátheṣu prá jātā́ḥ-  abhī̀máṃ yajñáṃ ví caranta pūrvī́ḥ

translation.text: Claiming in mind the seven priests' burntoblations, inciting all, they came in settled order. To this our sacrifice approach the many who show in hero beauty at assemblies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ भन्द॑माने उ॒षसा॒ उपा॑के उ॒त स्म॑येते त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ विरू॑पे यथा॑ नो मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो॒ जुजो॑ष॒दिन्द्रो॑ म॒रुत्वाँ॑ उ॒त वा॒ महो॑भिः
verses.transliteration: ā́ bhándamāne uṣásā úpāke  utá smayete tanvā̀ vírūpe  yáthā no mitró váruṇo jújoṣad  índro marútvām̐ utá vā máhobhiḥ

translation.text: Night and Dawn, lauded, hither come together, both smiling, different are their forms in colour, That Varuṇa and Mitra may accept us, and Indra, girt by Maruts, with his glories.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दैव्या॒ होता॑रा प्रथ॒मा न्यृ॑ञ्जे स॒प्त पृ॒क्षासः॑ स्व॒धया॑ मदन्ति ऋ॒तं शंस॑न्त ऋ॒तमित्त आ॑हु॒रनु॑ व्र॒तं व्र॑त॒पा दीध्या॑नाः
verses.transliteration: daívyā hótārā prathamā́ ny r̥̀ñje  saptá pr̥kṣā́saḥ svadháyā madanti  r̥táṃ śáṃsanta r̥tám ít tá āhur  ánu vratáṃ vratapā́ dī́dhyānāḥ

translation.text: I crave the grace of heaven's two chief Invokers: the seven swift steeds joy in their wonted manner. These speak of truth, praising the truth eternal, thinking on Order as the guards of Order.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ भार॑ती॒ भार॑तीभिः स॒जोषा॒ इळा॑ दे॒वैर्म॑नु॒ष्ये॑भिर॒ग्निः सर॑स्वती सारस्व॒तेभि॑र॒र्वाक्ति॒स्रो दे॒वीर्ब॒र्हिरेदं स॑दन्तु
verses.transliteration: ā́ bhā́ratī bhā́ratībhiḥ sajóṣāḥ-  íḷā devaír manuṣyèbhir agníḥ  sárasvatī sārasvatébhir arvā́k  tisró devī́r barhír édáṃ sadantu

translation.text: May Bhâratî with all her Sisters, Iḷâ accordant with the Gods, with mortalls Agni, Sarasvatî with all her kindred Rivers, come to this grass, Three Goddesses, and seat them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तन्न॑स्तु॒रीप॒मध॑ पोषयि॒त्नु देव॑ त्वष्ट॒र्वि र॑रा॒णः स्य॑स्व यतो॑ वी॒रः क॑र्म॒ण्यः॑ सु॒दक्षो॑ यु॒क्तग्रा॑वा॒ जाय॑ते दे॒वका॑मः
verses.transliteration: tán nas turī́pam ádha poṣayitnú  déva tvaṣṭar ví rarāṇáḥ syasva  yáto vīráḥ karmaṇyàḥ sudákṣo  yuktágrāvā jā́yate devákāmaḥ

translation.text: Well pleased with us do thou O God, O Tvashṭar, give ready issue to our procreant vigour, Whence springs the hero, powerful, skilled in action, lover of Gods, adjuster of the press-stones.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वन॑स्प॒तेऽव॑ सृ॒जोप॑ दे॒वान॒ग्निर्ह॒विः श॑मि॒ता सू॑दयाति सेदु॒ होता॑ स॒त्यत॑रो यजाति॒ यथा॑ दे॒वानां॒ जनि॑मानि॒ वेद॑
verses.transliteration: vánaspaté 'va sr̥jópa devā́n  agnír havíḥ śamitā́ sūdayāti  séd u hótā satyátaro yajāti  yáthā devā́nāṃ jánimāni véda

translation.text: Send to the Gods the oblation, Lord of Forests; and let the Immolator, Agni, dress it. He as the truer Priest shall offer worship, for the Gods' generations well he knoweth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ या॑ह्यग्ने समिधा॒नो अ॒र्वाङिन्द्रे॑ण दे॒वैः स॒रथं॑ तु॒रेभिः॑ ब॒र्हिर्न॑ आस्ता॒मदि॑तिः सुपु॒त्रा स्वाहा॑ दे॒वा अ॒मृता॑ मादयन्ताम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ yāhy agne samidhānó arvā́ṅ  índreṇa devaíḥ saráthaṃ turébhiḥ  barhír na āstām áditiḥ suputrā́  svā́hā devā́ amŕ̥tā mādayantām

translation.text: Come thou to us, O Agni, duly kindled, together with the potent Gods and Indra. On this our grass sit Aditi, happy Mother, and let our Hail delight the Gods Immortal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रत्य॒ग्निरु॒षस॒श्चेकि॑ता॒नोऽबो॑धि॒ विप्रः॑ पद॒वीः क॑वी॒नाम् पृ॒थु॒पाजा॑ देव॒यद्भिः॒ समि॒द्धोऽप॒ द्वारा॒ तम॑सो॒ वह्नि॑रावः
verses.transliteration: práty agnír uṣásaś cékitānaḥ-  -ábodhi vípraḥ padavī́ḥ kavīnā́m  pr̥thupā́jā devayádbhiḥ sámiddhaḥ-  -ápa dvā́rā támaso váhnir āvaḥ

translation.text: AGNI who shines against the Dawns is wakened. The holy Singer who precedes the sages. With far-spread lustre, kindled by the pious, the Priest hath thrown both gates of darkness open.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रेद्व॒ग्निर्वा॑वृधे॒ स्तोमे॑भिर्गी॒र्भिः स्तो॑तॄ॒णां न॑म॒स्य॑ उ॒क्थैः पू॒र्वीर्ऋ॒तस्य॑ सं॒दृश॑श्चका॒नः सं दू॒तो अ॑द्यौदु॒षसो॑ विरो॒के
verses.transliteration: préd v agnír vāvr̥dhe stómebhir  gīrbhí stotr̥̄ṇā́ṃ namasyà ukthaíḥ  pūrvī́r r̥tásya saṃdŕ̥śaś cakānáḥ  sáṃ dūtó adyaud uṣáso viroké

translation.text: Agni hath waxen mighty by laudations, to be adored with hymns of those who praise him. Loving the varied shows of holy Order at the first flush of dawn he shines as envoy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॑य्य॒ग्निर्मानु॑षीषु वि॒क्ष्व१॒॑पां गर्भो॑ मि॒त्र ऋ॒तेन॒ साध॑न् आ ह॑र्य॒तो य॑ज॒तः सान्व॑स्था॒दभू॑दु॒ विप्रो॒ हव्यो॑ मती॒नाम्
verses.transliteration: ádhāyy agnír mā́nuṣīṣu vikṣú-  -apā́ṃ gárbho mitrá r̥téna sā́dhan  ā́ haryató yajatáḥ sā́nv asthād  ábhūd u vípro hávyo matīnā́m

translation.text: Amid men's homes hath Agni been established, fulfilling with the Law, Friend, germ of waters. Loved and adored, the height he hath ascended, the Singer, object of our invocations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒त्रो अ॒ग्निर्भ॑वति॒ यत्समि॑द्धो मि॒त्रो होता॒ वरु॑णो जा॒तवे॑दाः मि॒त्रो अ॑ध्व॒र्युरि॑षि॒रो दमू॑ना मि॒त्रः सिन्धू॑नामु॒त पर्व॑तानाम्
verses.transliteration: mitró agnír bhavati yát sámiddho  mitró hótā váruṇo jātávedāḥ  mitró adhvaryúr iṣiró dámūnāḥ-  mitráḥ síndhūnām utá párvatānām

translation.text: Agni is Mitra when enkindled duly, Mitra as Priest, Varuṇa, Jâtavedas; Mitra as active minister, and House-Friend, Mitra of flowing rivers and of mountains.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पाति॑ प्रि॒यं रि॒पो अग्रं॑ प॒दं वेः पाति॑ य॒ह्वश्चर॑णं॒ सूर्य॑स्य पाति॒ नाभा॑ स॒प्तशी॑र्षाणम॒ग्निः पाति॑ दे॒वाना॑मुप॒माद॑मृ॒ष्वः
verses.transliteration: pā́ti priyáṃ ripó ágram padáṃ véḥ  pā́ti yahváś cáraṇaṃ sū́ryasya  pā́ti nā́bhā saptáśīrṣāṇam agníḥ  pā́ti devā́nām upamā́dam r̥ṣváḥ

translation.text: The Earth's, the Bird's dear lofty place he guardeth, he guardeth in his might the course of Sûrya, Guardeth the Seven-headed in the centre, guardeth sublime the Deities enjoyment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒भुश्च॑क्र॒ ईड्यं॒ चारु॒ नाम॒ विश्वा॑नि दे॒वो व॒युना॑नि वि॒द्वान् स॒सस्य॒ चर्म॑ घृ॒तव॑त्प॒दं वेस्तदिद॒ग्नी र॑क्ष॒त्यप्र॑युच्छन्
verses.transliteration: r̥bhúś cakra ī́ḍyaṃ cā́ru nā́ma  víśvāni devó vayúnāni vidvā́n  sasásya cárma ghr̥távat padáṃ vés  tád íd agnī́ rakṣaty áprayuchan

translation.text: The skilful God who knows all forms of knowledge made for himself a fair form, meet for worship. This Agni guards with care that never ceases the Sonia's skin, the Bird's place rich in fatness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ योनि॑म॒ग्निर्घृ॒तव॑न्तमस्थात्पृ॒थुप्र॑गाणमु॒शन्त॑मुशा॒नः दीद्या॑नः॒ शुचि॑र्ऋ॒ष्वः पा॑व॒कः पुनः॑पुनर्मा॒तरा॒ नव्य॑सी कः
verses.transliteration: ā́ yónim agnír ghr̥távantam asthāt  pr̥thúpragāṇam uśántam uśānáḥ  dī́dyānaḥ śúcir r̥ṣváḥ pāvakáḥ  púnaḥ-punar mātárā návyasī kaḥ

translation.text: Agni hath entered longingly the longing shrine rich with fatness, giving easy access. Resplendent, pure, sublime and purifying, again, again he renovates his Mothers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒द्यो जा॒त ओष॑धीभिर्ववक्षे॒ यदी॒ वर्ध॑न्ति प्र॒स्वो॑ घृ॒तेन॑ आप॑ इव प्र॒वता॒ शुम्भ॑माना उरु॒ष्यद॒ग्निः पि॒त्रोरु॒पस्थे॑
verses.transliteration: sadyó jātá óṣadhībhir vavakṣe  yádī várdhanti prasvò ghr̥téna  ā́pa iva pravátā śúmbhamānāḥ-  uruṣyád agníḥ pitrór upásthe

translation.text: Born suddenly, by plants he grew to greatness, when tender shoots with holy oil increased him, Like waters lovely when they hasten downward may Agni in his Parents' lap protect us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॑ ष्टु॒तः स॒मिधा॑ य॒ह्वो अ॑द्यौ॒द्वर्ष्म॑न्दि॒वो अधि॒ नाभा॑ पृथि॒व्याः मि॒त्रो अ॒ग्निरीड्यो॑ मात॒रिश्वा दू॒तो व॑क्षद्य॒जथा॑य दे॒वान्
verses.transliteration: úd u ṣṭutáḥ samídhā yahvó adyaud  várṣman divó ádhi nā́bhā pr̥thivyā́ḥ  mitró agnír ī́ḍyo mātaríśvā́  dūtó vakṣad yajáthāya devā́n

translation.text: Extolled, the Strong shone forth with kindled fuel to the earth's centre, to the height of heaven. May Agni, Friend, adorable Mâtariṣvan, as envoy bring the Gods unto our worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद॑स्तम्भीत्स॒मिधा॒ नाक॑मृ॒ष्वो॒३॒॑ऽग्निर्भव॑न्नुत्त॒मो रो॑च॒नाना॑म् यदी॒ भृगु॑भ्यः॒ परि॑ मात॒रिश्वा॒ गुहा॒ सन्तं॑ हव्य॒वाहं॑ समी॒धे
verses.transliteration: úd astambhīt samídhā nā́kam r̥ṣváḥ-  -agnír bhávann uttamó rocanā́nām  yádī bhŕ̥gubhyaḥ pári mātaríśvā  gúhā sántaṃ havyavā́haṃ samīdhé

translation.text: Best of all luminaries lofty Agni supported with his flame the height of heaven, When, far from Bhr̥igus, Mâtariṣvan kindled the oblation-bearer where he lay in secret.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इळा॑मग्ने पुरु॒दंसं॑ स॒निं गोः श॑श्वत्त॒मं हव॑मानाय साध स्यान्नः॑ सू॒नुस्तन॑यो वि॒जावाग्ने॒ सा ते॑ सुम॒तिर्भू॑त्व॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: íḷām agne purudáṃsaṃ saníṃ góḥ  śaśvattamáṃ hávamānāya sādha  syā́n naḥ sūnús tánayo vijā́vā-  -ágne sā́ te sumatír bhūtv asmé

translation.text: As holy food, Agni to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-word.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र का॑रवो मन॒ना व॒च्यमा॑ना देव॒द्रीचीं॑ नयत देव॒यन्तः॑ द॒क्षि॒णा॒वाड्वा॒जिनी॒ प्राच्ये॑ति ह॒विर्भर॑न्त्य॒ग्नये॑ घृ॒ताची॑
verses.transliteration: prá kāravo mananā́ vacyámānāḥ-  devadrī́cīṃ nayata devayántaḥ  dakṣiṇāvā́ḍ vājínī prā́cy eti  havír bháranty agnáye ghr̥tā́cī

translation.text: URGED on by deep devotion, O ye singers, bring, pious ones, the God-approaching ladle. Borne onward to the right it travels eastward, and, filled with oil, to Agni bears oblation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ रोद॑सी अपृणा॒ जाय॑मान उ॒त प्र रि॑क्था॒ अध॒ नु प्र॑यज्यो दि॒वश्चि॑दग्ने महि॒ना पृ॑थि॒व्या व॒च्यन्तां॑ ते॒ वह्न॑यः स॒प्तजि॑ह्वाः
verses.transliteration: ā́ ródasī apr̥ṇā jā́yamānaḥ-  utá prá rikthā ádha nú prayajyo  diváś cid agne mahinā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  vacyántāṃ te váhnayaḥ saptájihvāḥ

translation.text: Thou at thy birth didst fill both earth and heaven, yea, Most Adorable, thou didst exceed them. Even through the heaven's and through the earth's expanses let thy swift seventongued flames roll on, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यौश्च॑ त्वा पृथि॒वी य॒ज्ञिया॑सो॒ नि होता॑रं सादयन्ते॒ दमा॑य यदी॒ विशो॒ मानु॑षीर्देव॒यन्तीः॒ प्रय॑स्वती॒रीळ॑ते शु॒क्रम॒र्चिः
verses.transliteration: dyaúś ca tvā pr̥thivī́ yajñíyāso  ní hótāraṃ sādayante dámāya  yádī víśo mā́nuṣīr devayántīḥ  práyasvatīr ī́ḷate śukrám arcíḥ

translation.text: Both Heaven and Earth and Gods who should be worshipped establish thee as Priest for every dwelling, Whenever human families, God-devoted, bringing oblations; laud thy splendid lustre.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हान्त्स॒धस्थे॑ ध्रु॒व आ निष॑त्तो॒ऽन्तर्द्यावा॒ माहि॑ने॒ हर्य॑माणः आस्क्रे॑ स॒पत्नी॑ अ॒जरे॒ अमृ॑क्ते सब॒र्दुघे॑ उरुगा॒यस्य॑ धे॒नू
verses.transliteration: mahā́n sadhásthe dhruvá ā́ níṣatto  -antár dyā́vā mā́hine háryamāṇaḥ  ā́skre sapátnī ajáre ámr̥kte  sabardúghe urugāyásya dhenū́

translation.text: Firm in the Gods' home is the Mighty seated, between vast Heaven and Earth the well-beloved- Those Cows who yield, unharmed, their nectar, Spouses of the Far-Strider, everyoung, united.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्र॒ता ते॑ अग्ने मह॒तो म॒हानि॒ तव॒ क्रत्वा॒ रोद॑सी॒ आ त॑तन्थ त्वं दू॒तो अ॑भवो॒ जाय॑मान॒स्त्वं ने॒ता वृ॑षभ चर्षणी॒नाम्
verses.transliteration: vratā́ te agne maható mahā́ni  táva krátvā ródasī ā́ tatantha  tváṃ dūtó abhavo jā́yamānas  tváṃ netā́ vr̥ṣabha carṣaṇīnā́m

translation.text: Great are the deeds of thee, the Great, O Agni: thou by thy power hast spread out earth and heaven. As soon as thou wast born thou wast an envoy, thou, Mighty One, was Leader of the people.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तस्य॑ वा के॒शिना॑ यो॒ग्याभि॑र्घृत॒स्नुवा॒ रोहि॑ता धु॒रि धि॑ष्व अथा व॑ह दे॒वान्दे॑व॒ विश्वा॑न्त्स्वध्व॒रा कृ॑णुहि जातवेदः
verses.transliteration: r̥tásya vā keśínā yogyā́bhir  ghr̥tasnúvā róhitā dhurí dhiṣva  áthā́ vaha devā́n deva víśvān  svadhvarā́ kr̥ṇuhi jātavedaḥ

translation.text: Bind to the pole with cords of holy Order the long-maned ruddy steeds who sprinkle fatness. Bring hithier, O thou God, all Gods together: provide them noble worship, Jâtavedas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वश्चि॒दा ते॑ रुचयन्त रो॒का उ॒षो वि॑भा॒तीरनु॑ भासि पू॒र्वीः अ॒पो यद॑ग्न उ॒शध॒ग्वने॑षु॒ होतु॑र्म॒न्द्रस्य॑ प॒नय॑न्त दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: diváś cid ā́ te rucayanta rokā́ḥ-  uṣó vibhātī́r ánu bhāsi pūrvī́ḥ  apó yád agna uśádhag váneṣu  hótur mandrásya panáyanta devā́ḥ

translation.text: Even from the sky thy brilliant lights shone hither: still hast thou beamed through many a radiant morning, That the Gods praised their joyous Herald's labour eagerly burning, Agni, in the forests.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒रौ वा॒ ये अ॒न्तरि॑क्षे॒ मद॑न्ति दि॒वो वा॒ ये रो॑च॒ने सन्ति॑ दे॒वाः ऊमा॑ वा॒ ये सु॒हवा॑सो॒ यज॑त्रा आयेमि॒रे र॒थ्यो॑ अग्ने॒ अश्वाः॑
verses.transliteration: uraú vā yé antárikṣe mádanti  divó vā yé rocané sánti devā́ḥ  ū́mā vā yé suhávāso yájatrāḥ-  āyemiré rathyò agne áśvāḥ

translation.text: The Gods who take delight in air's wide region, or those the dwellers in heaven's realm of brightness, Or those, the Holy, prompt to hear, our helpers, who, carborne, turn their horses hither, Agni---

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऐभि॑रग्ने स॒रथं॑ याह्य॒र्वाङ्ना॑नार॒थं वा॑ वि॒भवो॒ ह्यश्वाः॑ पत्नी॑वतस्त्रिं॒शतं॒ त्रीँश्च॑ दे॒वान॑नुष्व॒धमा व॑ह मा॒दय॑स्व
verses.transliteration: aíbhir agne saráthaṃ yāhy arvā́ṅ  nānāratháṃ vā vibhávo hy áśvāḥ  pátnīvatas triṃśátaṃ trī́ṃś ca devā́n  anuṣvadhám ā́ vaha mādáyasva

translation.text: With these, borne on one ear, Agni, approach us, or borne on many, for thy steeds are able. Bring, with their Dames, the Gods, the Three and-Thirty, after thy Godlike nature, and be joyful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स होता॒ यस्य॒ रोद॑सी चिदु॒र्वी य॒ज्ञंय॑ज्ञम॒भि वृ॒धे गृ॑णी॒तः प्राची॑ अध्व॒रेव॑ तस्थतुः सु॒मेके॑ ऋ॒ताव॑री ऋ॒तजा॑तस्य स॒त्ये
verses.transliteration: sá hótā yásya ródasī cid urvī́  yajñáṃ-yajñam abhí vr̥dhé gr̥ṇītáḥ  prā́cī adhvaréva tasthatuḥ suméke  r̥tā́varī r̥tájātasya satyé

translation.text: He is the Priest at whose repeated worship even wide Heaven and Earth sing out for increase. They fair and true and holy coming forward stand at his sacrifice who springs from Order.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इळा॑मग्ने पुरु॒दंसं॑ स॒निं गोः श॑श्वत्त॒मं हव॑मानाय साध स्यान्नः॑ सू॒नुस्तन॑यो वि॒जावाग्ने॒ सा ते॑ सुम॒तिर्भू॑त्व॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: íḷām agne purudáṃsaṃ saníṃ góḥ  śaśvattamáṃ hávamānāya sādha  syā́n naḥ sūnús tánayo vijā́vā-  -ágne sā́ te sumatír bhūtv asmé

translation.text: As holy food, Agni, to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to usward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र य आ॒रुः शि॑तिपृ॒ष्ठस्य॑ धा॒सेरा मा॒तरा॑ विविशुः स॒प्त वाणीः॑ प॒रि॒क्षिता॑ पि॒तरा॒ सं च॑रेते॒ प्र स॑र्स्राते दी॒र्घमायुः॑ प्र॒यक्षे॑
verses.transliteration: prá yá ārúḥ śitipr̥ṣṭhásya dhāsér  ā́ mātárā viviśuḥ saptá vā́ṇīḥ  parikṣítā pitárā sáṃ carete  prá sarsrāte dīrghám ā́yuḥ prayákṣe

translation.text: THE seven tones risen from the whitebacked viand have made their way between the pair of Mothers. Both circumjacent Parents come together to yield us length of days they hasten forward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वक्ष॑सो धे॒नवो॒ वृष्णो॒ अश्वा॑ दे॒वीरा त॑स्थौ॒ मधु॑म॒द्वह॑न्तीः ऋ॒तस्य॑ त्वा॒ सद॑सि क्षेम॒यन्तं॒ पर्येका॑ चरति वर्त॒निं गौः
verses.transliteration: divákṣaso dhenávo vŕ̥ṣṇo áśvāḥ-  devī́r ā́ tasthau mádhumad váhantīḥ  r̥tásya tvā sádasi kṣemayántam  páry ékā carati vartaníṃ gaúḥ

translation.text: The Male who dwells in heaven hath Mares and Milchkine: he came to Goddesses who bring sweet treasure. To thee safe resting in the seat of Order the Cow alone upon her way proceedeth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ सी॑मरोहत्सु॒यमा॒ भव॑न्तीः॒ पति॑श्चिकि॒त्वान्र॑यि॒विद्र॑यी॒णाम् प्र नील॑पृष्ठो अत॒सस्य॑ धा॒सेस्ता अ॑वासयत्पुरु॒धप्र॑तीकः
verses.transliteration: ā́ sīm arohat suyámā bhávantīḥ  pátiś cikitvā́n rayivíd rayīṇā́m  prá nī́lapr̥ṣṭho atasásya dhāsés  tā́ avāsayat purudhápratīkaḥ

translation.text: Wise Master, wealthy finder-out of riches, he mounted those who may with case be guided. He, dark-backed, manifold with varied aspect, hath made them burst forth from their food the brushwood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: महि॑ त्वा॒ष्ट्रमू॒र्जय॑न्तीरजु॒र्यं स्त॑भू॒यमा॑नं व॒हतो॑ वहन्ति व्यङ्गे॑भिर्दिद्युता॒नः स॒धस्थ॒ एका॑मिव॒ रोद॑सी॒ आ वि॑वेश
verses.transliteration: máhi tvāṣṭrám ūrjáyantīr ajuryáṃ  stabhūyámānaṃ vaháto vahanti  vy áṅgebhir didyutānáḥ sadhásthe-  ékām iva ródasī ā́ viveśa

translation.text: Strength-giving streams bear hither him eternal, fain to support the mighty work. of Tvashṭar. He, flashing in his home with all his members, hath entered both the worlds as they were single.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जा॒नन्ति॒ वृष्णो॑ अरु॒षस्य॒ शेव॑मु॒त ब्र॒ध्नस्य॒ शास॑ने रणन्ति दि॒वो॒रुचः॑ सु॒रुचो॒ रोच॑माना॒ इळा॒ येषां॒ गण्या॒ माहि॑ना॒ गीः
verses.transliteration: jānánti vŕ̥ṣṇo aruṣásya śévam  utá bradhnásya śā́sane raṇanti  divorúcaḥ surúco rócamānāḥ-  íḷā yéṣāṃ gáṇyā mā́hinā gī́ḥ

translation.text: They know the red Bull's blessing, and are joyful under the flaming-coloured Lord's dominion: They who give shine from heavenwith fair effulgence, whose lofty song like Iḷâ must be honoured.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒तो पि॒तृभ्यां॑ प्र॒विदानु॒ घोषं॑ म॒हो म॒हद्भ्या॑मनयन्त शू॒षम् उ॒क्षा ह॒ यत्र॒ परि॒ धान॑म॒क्तोरनु॒ स्वं धाम॑ जरि॒तुर्व॒वक्ष॑
verses.transliteration: utó pitŕ̥bhyām pravídā́nu ghóṣam  mahó mahádbhyām anayanta śūṣám  ukṣā́ ha yátra pári dhā́nam aktór  ánu sváṃ dhā́ma jaritúr vavákṣa

translation.text: Yea, by tradition from the ancient sages they brought great strength from the two mighty Parents, To where the singer's Bull, the night's dispeller, after his proper law hath waxen stronger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ध्व॒र्युभिः॑ प॒ञ्चभिः॑ स॒प्त विप्राः॑ प्रि॒यं र॑क्षन्ते॒ निहि॑तं प॒दं वेः प्राञ्चो॑ मदन्त्यु॒क्षणो॑ अजु॒र्या दे॒वा दे॒वाना॒मनु॒ हि व्र॒ता गुः
verses.transliteration: adhvaryúbhiḥ pañcábhiḥ saptá víprāḥ  priyáṃ rakṣante níhitam padáṃ véḥ  prā́ñco madanty ukṣáṇo ajuryā́ḥ-  devā́ devā́nām ánu hí vratā́ gúḥ

translation.text: Seven holy singers guard with five Adhvaryus the Bird's beloved firmly-settled station. The willing Bulls, untouched by old, rejoice them: as Gods themselves the ways of Gods they follow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दैव्या॒ होता॑रा प्रथ॒मा न्यृ॑ञ्जे स॒प्त पृ॒क्षासः॑ स्व॒धया॑ मदन्ति ऋ॒तं शंस॑न्त ऋ॒तमित्त आ॑हु॒रनु॑ व्र॒तं व्र॑त॒पा दीध्या॑नाः
verses.transliteration: daívyā hótārā prathamā́ ny r̥̀ñje  saptá pr̥kṣā́saḥ svadháyā madanti  r̥táṃ śáṃsanta r̥tám ít tá āhur  ánu vratáṃ vratapā́ dī́dhyānāḥ

translation.text: I crave the grace of heaven's two chief Invokers: the seven swift steeds joy in their wonted manner. These speak of truth, praising the Truth Eternal, thinking on Order as the guards of Order.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृ॒षा॒यन्ते॑ म॒हे अत्या॑य पू॒र्वीर्वृष्णे॑ चि॒त्राय॑ र॒श्मयः॑ सुया॒माः देव॑ होतर्म॒न्द्रत॑रश्चिकि॒त्वान्म॒हो दे॒वान्रोद॑सी॒ एह व॑क्षि
verses.transliteration: vr̥ṣāyánte mahé átyāya pūrvī́r  vŕ̥ṣṇe citrā́ya raśmáyaḥ suyāmā́ḥ  déva hotar mandrátaraś cikitvā́n  mahó devā́n ródasī éhá vakṣi

translation.text: The many seek the great Steed as a stallion: the reins obey the Lord of varied colour. O heavenly Priest, most pleasant, full of wisdom, bring the great Gods to us, and Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पृ॒क्षप्र॑यजो द्रविणः सु॒वाचः॑ सुके॒तव॑ उ॒षसो॑ रे॒वदू॑षुः उ॒तो चि॑दग्ने महि॒ना पृ॑थि॒व्याः कृ॒तं चि॒देनः॒ सं म॒हे द॑शस्य
verses.transliteration: pr̥kṣáprayajo draviṇaḥ suvā́caḥ  suketáva uṣáso revád ūṣuḥ  utó cid agne mahinā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ  kr̥táṃ cid énaḥ sám mahé daśasya

translation.text: Rich Lord, the Mornings have gleamed forth in splendour, fair-rayed, fair-speaking, worshipped with all viands, Yea, with the glory of the earth, O Agni. Forgive us, for our weal, e'en sin cornmitted.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इळा॑मग्ने पुरु॒दंसं॑ स॒निं गोः श॑श्वत्त॒मं हव॑मानाय साध स्यान्नः॑ सू॒नुस्तन॑यो वि॒जावाग्ने॒ सा ते॑ सुम॒तिर्भू॑त्व॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: íḷām agne purudáṃsaṃ saníṃ góḥ  śaśvattamáṃ hávamānāya sādha  syā́n naḥ sūnús tánayo vijā́vā-  -ágne sā́ te sumatír bhūtv asmé

translation.text: As holy food, Agni, to thine invoker, give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son, and spreading offspring Agni, be this thy gracious will to usward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ञ्जन्ति॒ त्वाम॑ध्व॒रे दे॑व॒यन्तो॒ वन॑स्पते॒ मधु॑ना॒ दैव्ये॑न यदू॒र्ध्वस्तिष्ठा॒ द्रवि॑णे॒ह ध॑त्ता॒द्यद्वा॒ क्षयो॑ मा॒तुर॒स्या उ॒पस्थे॑
verses.transliteration: añjánti tvā́m adhvaré devayánto  vánaspate mádhunā daívyena  yád ūrdhvás tíṣṭhā dráviṇehá dhattād  yád vā kṣáyo mātúr asyā́ upásthe

translation.text: GOD-SERVING men, O Sovran of the Forest, with heavenly meath at sacrifice anoint thee. Grant wealth to us when thou art standing upright as when reposing on this Mother's bosom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समि॑द्धस्य॒ श्रय॑माणः पु॒रस्ता॒द्ब्रह्म॑ वन्वा॒नो अ॒जरं॑ सु॒वीर॑म् आ॒रे अ॒स्मदम॑तिं॒ बाध॑मान॒ उच्छ्र॑यस्व मह॒ते सौभ॑गाय
verses.transliteration: sámiddhasya śráyamāṇaḥ purástād  bráhma vanvānó ajáraṃ suvī́ram  āré asmád ámatim bā́dhamānaḥ-  úc chrayasva mahaté saúbhagāya

translation.text: Set up to eastward of the fire enkindled, accepting prayer that wastes not, rich in hero. Driving far from us poverty and famine, lift thyself up to bring us great good fortune.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उच्छ्र॑यस्व वनस्पते॒ वर्ष्म॑न्पृथि॒व्या अधि॑ सुमि॑ती मी॒यमा॑नो॒ वर्चो॑ धा य॒ज्ञवा॑हसे
verses.transliteration: úc chrayasva vanaspate  várṣman pr̥thivyā́ ádhi  súmitī mīyámāno  várco dhā yajñávāhase

translation.text: Lord of the Forest, raise. thyself up on the loftiest spot of earth. Give splendour, fixt and measured well, to him who brings the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: युवा॑ सु॒वासाः॒ परि॑वीत॒ आगा॒त्स उ॒ श्रेया॑न्भवति॒ जाय॑मानः तं धीरा॑सः क॒वय॒ उन्न॑यन्ति स्वा॒ध्यो॒३॒॑ मन॑सा देव॒यन्तः॑
verses.transliteration: yúvā suvā́sāḥ párivīta ā́gāt  sá u śréyān bhavati jā́yamānaḥ  táṃ dhī́rāsaḥ kaváya ún nayanti  svādhyò mánasā devayántaḥ

translation.text: Well-robed, enveloped he is come, the youthful: springing to life his glory waxeth greater. Contemplative in mind and God-adoring, sages of high intelligence upraise him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जा॒तो जा॑यते सुदिन॒त्वे अह्नां॑ सम॒र्य आ वि॒दथे॒ वर्ध॑मानः पु॒नन्ति॒ धीरा॑ अ॒पसो॑ मनी॒षा दे॑व॒या विप्र॒ उदि॑यर्ति॒ वाच॑म्
verses.transliteration: jātó jāyate sudinatvé áhnāṃ  samaryá ā́ vidáthe várdhamānaḥ  punánti dhī́rā apáso manīṣā́  devayā́ vípra úd iyarti vā́cam

translation.text: Sprung up he rises in the days' fair weather, increasing in the men-frequented synod. With song the wise and skilful consecrate him: his voice the God-adoring singer utters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यान्वो॒ नरो॑ देव॒यन्तो॑ निमि॒म्युर्वन॑स्पते॒ स्वधि॑तिर्वा त॒तक्ष॑ ते दे॒वासः॒ स्वर॑वस्तस्थि॒वांसः॑ प्र॒जाव॑द॒स्मे दि॑धिषन्तु॒ रत्न॑म्
verses.transliteration: yā́n vo náro devayánto nimimyúr  vánaspate svádhitir vā tatákṣa  té devā́saḥ sváravas tasthivā́ṃsaḥ  prajā́vad asmé didhiṣantu rátnam

translation.text: , Ye whom religious men have firmly planted; thou Forest Sovran whom the axe hath fashioned,– Let those the Stakes divine which here are standing be fain to grant us wealth with store of children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये वृ॒क्णासो॒ अधि॒ क्षमि॒ निमि॑तासो य॒तस्रु॑चः ते नो॑ व्यन्तु॒ वार्यं॑ देव॒त्रा क्षे॑त्र॒साध॑सः
verses.transliteration: yé vr̥kṇā́so ádhi kṣámi  nímitāso yatásrucaḥ  té no vyantu vā́ryaṃ  devatrā́ kṣetrasā́dhasaḥ

translation.text: O men who lift the ladles up, these hewn and planted in the ground, Bringing a blessing to the field, shall bear our precious gift to Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒दि॒त्या रु॒द्रा वस॑वः सुनी॒था द्यावा॒क्षामा॑ पृथि॒वी अ॒न्तरि॑क्षम् स॒जोष॑सो य॒ज्ञम॑वन्तु दे॒वा ऊ॒र्ध्वं कृ॑ण्वन्त्वध्व॒रस्य॑ के॒तुम्
verses.transliteration: ādityā́ rudrā́ vásavaḥ sunīthā́ḥ-  dyā́vākṣā́mā pr̥thivī́ antárikṣam  sajóṣaso yajñám avantu devā́ḥ-  ūrdhváṃ kr̥ṇvantv adhvarásya ketúm

translation.text: Âdityas, Rudras, Vasus, careful leaders, Earth, Heaven, and Pr̥ithivî and Air's mid-region, Accordant Deities shall bless our worship and make our sacrifice's ensign lofty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हं॒सा इ॑व श्रेणि॒शो यता॑नाः शु॒क्रा वसा॑नाः॒ स्वर॑वो न॒ आगुः॑ उ॒न्नी॒यमा॑नाः क॒विभिः॑ पु॒रस्ता॑द्दे॒वा दे॒वाना॒मपि॑ यन्ति॒ पाथः॑
verses.transliteration: haṃsā́ iva śreṇiśó yátānāḥ  śukrā́ vásānāḥ sváravo na ā́guḥ  unnīyámānāḥ kavíbhiḥ purástād  devā́ devā́nām ápi yanti pā́thaḥ

translation.text: Like swan's that flee in lengthened line, the Pillars have come to us arrayed in brilliant coIour. They, lifted up on high, by sages, eastward, go forth as Gods to the God's dwelling-places.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शृङ्गा॑णी॒वेच्छृ॒ङ्गिणां॒ सं द॑दृश्रे च॒षाल॑वन्तः॒ स्वर॑वः पृथि॒व्याम् वा॒घद्भि॑र्वा विह॒वे श्रोष॑माणा अ॒स्माँ अ॑वन्तु पृत॒नाज्ये॑षु
verses.transliteration: śŕ̥ṅgāṇīvéc chr̥ṅgíṇāṃ sáṃ dadr̥śre  caṣā́lavantaḥ sváravaḥ pr̥thivyā́m  vāghádbhir vā vihavé śróṣamāṇāḥ-  asmā́m̐ avantu pr̥tanā́jyeṣu

translation.text: Those Stakes upon the earth with rings that deck them seem to the eye like horns of horned creatures; Or, as upraised by priests in invocation, let them assist us in the rush to battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वन॑स्पते श॒तव॑ल्शो॒ वि रो॑ह स॒हस्र॑वल्शा॒ वि व॒यं रु॑हेम यं त्वाम॒यं स्वधि॑ति॒स्तेज॑मानः प्रणि॒नाय॑ मह॒ते सौभ॑गाय
verses.transliteration: vánaspate śatávalśo ví roha  sahásravalśā ví vayáṃ ruhema  yáṃ tvā́m ayáṃ svádhitis téjamānaḥ  praṇinā́ya mahaté saúbhagāya

translation.text: Lord of the Wood, rise with a hundred branches. with thousand branches may we rise to greatness, Tlou whom this hatchct, with an edge well whetted for great felicity, hath brought before us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सखा॑यस्त्वा ववृमहे दे॒वं मर्ता॑स ऊ॒तये॑ अ॒पां नपा॑तं सु॒भगं॑ सु॒दीदि॑तिं सु॒प्रतू॑र्तिमने॒हस॑म्
verses.transliteration: sákhāyas tvā vavr̥mahe  devám mártāsa ūtáye  apā́ṃ nápātaṃ subhágaṃ sudī́ditiṃ  suprátūrtim anehásam

translation.text: WE as thy friends have chosen thee, mortals a God, to be our help, The Waters' Child, the blessed, the resplendent One, victorious and beyond compare.

verses.sanskrit_deva: काय॑मानो व॒ना त्वं यन्मा॒तॄरज॑गन्न॒पः न तत्ते॑ अग्ने प्र॒मृषे॑ नि॒वर्त॑नं॒ यद्दू॒रे सन्नि॒हाभ॑वः
verses.transliteration: kā́yamāno vanā́ tváṃ  yán mātr̥̄́r ájagann apáḥ  ná tát te agne pramŕ̥ṣe nivártanaṃ  yád dūré sánn ihā́bhavaḥ

translation.text: Since thou delighting in the woods hast gone unto thy mother streams, Not to be scorned, Agni, is that return of thine when from afar thou now art here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अति॑ तृ॒ष्टं व॑वक्षि॒थाथै॒व सु॒मना॑ असि प्रप्रा॒न्ये यन्ति॒ पर्य॒न्य आ॑सते॒ येषां॑ स॒ख्ये असि॑ श्रि॒तः
verses.transliteration: áti tr̥ṣṭáṃ vavakṣitha-  -áthaivá sumánā asi  prá-prānyé yánti páry anyá āsate  yéṣāṃ sakhyé ási śritáḥ

translation.text: O'er pungent smoke host thou prevailed, and thus art thou benevolent. Some go before, and others round about thee sit, they in whose friendship thou hast place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ई॒यि॒वांस॒मति॒ स्रिधः॒ शश्व॑ती॒रति॑ स॒श्चतः॑ अन्वी॑मविन्दन्निचि॒रासो॑ अ॒द्रुहो॒ऽप्सु सिं॒हमि॑व श्रि॒तम्
verses.transliteration: īyivā́ṃsam áti srídhaḥ  śáśvatīr áti saścátaḥ  ánv īm avindan nicirā́so adrúho  -apsú siṃhám iva śritám

translation.text: Him who had passed beyond his foes, beyond continual pursuits, Him the unerring Ones, observant, found in floods, couched like a lion in his lair.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒सृ॒वांस॑मिव॒ त्मना॒ग्निमि॒त्था ति॒रोहि॑तम् ऐनं॑ नयन्मात॒रिश्वा॑ परा॒वतो॑ दे॒वेभ्यो॑ मथि॒तं परि॑
verses.transliteration: sasr̥vā́ṃsam iva tmánā-  -agním itthā́ tiróhitam  aínaṃ nayan mātaríśvā parāváto  devébhyo mathitám pári

translation.text: Him wandering at his own free will, Agni here hidden from our view, Him Mâtariṣvan brought to us from far away produced by friction, from the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं त्वा॒ मर्ता॑ अगृभ्णत दे॒वेभ्यो॑ हव्यवाहन विश्वा॒न्यद्य॒ज्ञाँ अ॑भि॒पासि॑ मानुष॒ तव॒ क्रत्वा॑ यविष्ठ्य
verses.transliteration: táṃ tvā mártā agr̥bhṇata  devébhyo havyavāhana  víśvān yád yajñā́m̐ abhipā́si mānuṣa  táva krátvā yaviṣṭhya

translation.text: O Bearer of Oblations, thus mortals received thee from the Gods, Whilst thou, the Friend of man, guardest each sacrifice with thine own power, Most Youthful One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्भ॒द्रं तव॑ दं॒सना॒ पाका॑य चिच्छदयति त्वां यद॑ग्ने प॒शवः॑ स॒मास॑ते॒ समि॑द्धमपिशर्व॒रे
verses.transliteration: tád bhadráṃ táva daṃsánā  pā́kāya cic chadayati  tvā́ṃ yád agne paśávaḥ samā́sate  sámiddham apiśarvaré

translation.text: Amid thy wonders this is good, yea, to the simple is it clear, When gathered round about thee, Agni, lie the herds where thou art kindled in the morn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ जु॑होता स्वध्व॒रं शी॒रं पा॑व॒कशो॑चिषम् आ॒शुं दू॒तम॑जि॒रं प्र॒त्नमीड्यं॑ श्रु॒ष्टी दे॒वं स॑पर्यत
verses.transliteration: ā́ juhotā svadhvaráṃ  śīrám pāvakáśociṣam  āśúṃ dūtám ajirám pratnám ī́ḍyaṃ  śruṣṭī́ deváṃ saparyata

translation.text: Offer to him who knows fair rites, who burns with purifying glow, Swift envoy, active, ancient, and adorable: serve ye the God attentively.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रीणि॑ श॒ता त्री स॒हस्रा॑ण्य॒ग्निं त्रिं॒शच्च॑ दे॒वा नव॑ चासपर्यन् औक्ष॑न्घृ॒तैरस्तृ॑णन्ब॒र्हिर॑स्मा॒ आदिद्धोता॑रं॒ न्य॑सादयन्त
verses.transliteration: trī́ṇi śatā́ trī́ sahásrāṇy agníṃ  triṃśác ca devā́ náva cāsaparyan  aúkṣan ghr̥taír ástr̥ṇan barhír asmai-  ā́d íd dhótāraṃ ny àsādayanta

translation.text: Three times a hundred Gods and thrice a thousand, and three times ten and nine have worshipped Agni, For him spread sacred grass, with oil bedewed him, and stablished him as Priest and Sacrificer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वाम॑ग्ने मनी॒षिणः॑ स॒म्राजं॑ चर्षणी॒नाम् दे॒वं मर्ता॑स इन्धते॒ सम॑ध्व॒रे
verses.transliteration: tvā́m agne manīṣíṇaḥ  samrā́jaṃ carṣaṇīnā́m  devám mártāsa indhate  sám adhvaré

translation.text: THEE Agni, God, Imperial Lord of all mankind, do mortal men With understanding kindle at thesacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वां य॒ज्ञेष्वृ॒त्विज॒मग्ने॒ होता॑रमीळते गो॒पा ऋ॒तस्य॑ दीदिहि॒ स्वे दमे॑
verses.transliteration: tvā́ṃ yajñéṣv r̥tvíjam  ágne hótāram īḷate  gopā́ r̥tásya dīdihi  své dáme

translation.text: They laud thee in their solemn rites, Agni, as Minister and Priest, Shine forth in thine own home as guardian of the Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स घा॒ यस्ते॒ ददा॑शति स॒मिधा॑ जा॒तवे॑दसे सो अ॑ग्ने धत्ते सु॒वीर्यं॒ स पु॑ष्यति
verses.transliteration: sá ghā yás te dádāśati  samídhā jātávedase  só agne dhatte suvī́ryaṃ  sá puṣyati

translation.text: He, verily, who honours thee with fuel, Knower of all life, He, Agni! wins heroic might, he prospers well.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स के॒तुर॑ध्व॒राणा॑म॒ग्निर्दे॒वेभि॒रा ग॑मत् अ॒ञ्जा॒नः स॒प्त होतृ॑भिर्ह॒विष्म॑ते
verses.transliteration: sá ketúr adhvarā́ṇām  agnír devébhir ā́ gamat  añjānáḥ saptá hótr̥bhir  havíṣmate

translation.text: Ensign of sacrifices, he, Agni, with Gods is come to us, Decked by the seven priests, to him who bringeth gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र होत्रे॑ पू॒र्व्यं वचो॒ऽग्नये॑ भरता बृ॒हत् वि॒पां ज्योतीं॑षि॒ बिभ्र॑ते॒ न वे॒धसे॑
verses.transliteration: prá hótre pūrvyáṃ váco  -agnáye bharatā br̥hát  vipā́ṃ jyótīṃṣi bíbhrate  ná vedháse

translation.text: ToAgni, the Invoking Priest, offer your best, your lofty speech, To him Ordainer-like who brings the light of songs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निं व॑र्धन्तु नो॒ गिरो॒ यतो॒ जाय॑त उ॒क्थ्यः॑ म॒हे वाजा॑य॒ द्रवि॑णाय दर्श॒तः
verses.transliteration: agníṃ vardhantu no gíro  yáto jā́yata ukthyàḥ  mahé vā́jāya dráviṇāya darśatáḥ

translation.text: Let these our hymns make Agni grow, whence, meet for laud, he springs to life, To mighty strength and great possession, fair to see.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ यजि॑ष्ठो अध्व॒रे दे॒वान्दे॑वय॒ते य॑ज होता॑ म॒न्द्रो वि रा॑ज॒स्यति॒ स्रिधः॑
verses.transliteration: ágne yájiṣṭho adhvaré  devā́n devayaté yaja  hótā mandró ví rājasi-  áti srídhaḥ

translation.text: Best Sacrificer, bring the Gods, O Agni, to the pious man: A joyful Priest, thy splendour drive our foes afar

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नः॑ पावक दीदिहि द्यु॒मद॒स्मे सु॒वीर्य॑म् भवा॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ अन्त॑मः स्व॒स्तये॑
verses.transliteration: sá naḥ pāvaka dīdihi  dyumád asmé suvī́ryam  bhávā stotŕ̥bhyo ántamaḥ  svastáye

translation.text: As such, O Purifier, shine on us heroic glorious might: Be nearest Friend to those who laud thee, for their weal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं त्वा॒ विप्रा॑ विप॒न्यवो॑ जागृ॒वांसः॒ समि॑न्धते ह॒व्य॒वाह॒मम॑र्त्यं सहो॒वृध॑म्
verses.transliteration: táṃ tvā víprā vipanyávo  jāgr̥vā́ṃsaḥ sám indhate  havyavā́ham ámartyaṃ  sahovŕ̥dham

translation.text: So, wakeful, versed in sacred hymns, the holy singers kindly thee. Oblation-bearer, deathless, cherisher of strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर्होता॑ पु॒रोहि॑तोऽध्व॒रस्य॒ विच॑र्षणिः स वे॑द य॒ज्ञमा॑नु॒षक्
verses.transliteration: agnír hótā puróhito  -adhvarásya vícarṣaṇiḥ  sá veda yajñám ānuṣák

translation.text: AGNI is Priest, the great High Priest of sacrifice, most swift in act: He knows the rite in constant course.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स ह॑व्य॒वाळम॑र्त्य उ॒शिग्दू॒तश्चनो॑हितः अ॒ग्निर्धि॒या समृ॑ण्वति
verses.transliteration: sá havyavā́ḷ ámartyaḥ-  uśíg dūtáś cánohitaḥ  agnír dhiyā́ sám r̥ṇvati

translation.text: Oblation-bearer, deathless, well inclined, an eager messenger, Agni comes nigh us with the thought.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर्धि॒या स चे॑तति के॒तुर्य॒ज्ञस्य॑ पू॒र्व्यः अर्थं॒ ह्य॑स्य त॒रणि॑
verses.transliteration: agnír dhiyā́ sá cetati  ketúr yajñásya pūrvyáḥ  árthaṃ hy àsya taráṇi

translation.text: Ensign of sacrifice from of old, Agni well knoweth with his thought To prosper this man's aim and hope.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निं सू॒नुं सन॑श्रुतं॒ सह॑सो जा॒तवे॑दसम् वह्निं॑ दे॒वा अ॑कृण्वत
verses.transliteration: agníṃ sūnúṃ sánaśrutaṃ  sáhaso jātávedasam  váhniṃ devā́ akr̥ṇvata

translation.text: Agni, illustrious from old time, the Son of Strength who knows all life, The Gods have made to their Priest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अदा॑भ्यः पुरए॒ता वि॒शाम॒ग्निर्मानु॑षीणाम् तूर्णी॒ रथः॒ सदा॒ नवः॑
verses.transliteration: ádābhyaḥ puraetā́  viśā́m agnír mā́nuṣīṇām  tū́rṇī ráthaḥ sádā návaḥ

translation.text: Infallible is Agni, he who goes before the tribes of men, A chariot swift and ever new.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा॒ह्वान्विश्वा॑ अभि॒युजः॒ क्रतु॑र्दे॒वाना॒ममृ॑क्तः अ॒ग्निस्तु॒विश्र॑वस्तमः
verses.transliteration: sāhvā́n víśvā abhiyújaḥ  krátur devā́nām ámr̥ktaḥ  agnís tuvíśravastamaḥ

translation.text: Strength of the Gods which none may harm, subduing all his enemies, Agni is mightiest in fame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि प्रयां॑सि॒ वाह॑सा दा॒श्वाँ अ॑श्नोति॒ मर्त्यः॑ क्षयं॑ पाव॒कशो॑चिषः
verses.transliteration: abhí práyāṃsi vā́hasā  dāśvā́m̐ aśnoti mártyaḥ  kṣáyam pāvakáśociṣaḥ

translation.text: By offering sacred food to him the mortal worshipper obtains. A home from him whose light makes pure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ विश्वा॑नि॒ सुधि॑ता॒ग्नेर॑श्याम॒ मन्म॑भिः विप्रा॑सो जा॒तवे॑दसः
verses.transliteration: pári víśvāni súdhitā-  -agnér aśyāma mánmabhiḥ  víprāso jātávedasaḥ

translation.text: From Agni, by our hymns, may we gain all things that bring happiness, Singers of him who knows all life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ विश्वा॑नि॒ वार्या॒ वाजे॑षु सनिषामहे त्वे दे॒वास॒ एरि॑रे
verses.transliteration: ágne víśvāni vā́ryā  vā́jeṣu saniṣāmahe  tvé devā́sa érire

translation.text: O Agni, in our deeds of might may we obtain all precious things: Tle Gods are centred all in thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ आ ग॑तं सु॒तं गी॒र्भिर्नभो॒ वरे॑ण्यम् अ॒स्य पा॑तं धि॒येषि॒ता
verses.transliteration: índrāgnī ā́ gataṃ sutáṃ  gīrbhír nábho váreṇyam  asyá pātaṃ dhiyéṣitā́

translation.text: MOVED, Indra-Agni, by our hymn, come to the juice, the precious dew: Dr.ink ye thereof, impelled by song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी जरि॒तुः सचा॑ य॒ज्ञो जि॑गाति॒ चेत॑नः अ॒या पा॑तमि॒मं सु॒तम्
verses.transliteration: índrāgnī jaritúḥ sácā  yajñó jigāti cétanaḥ  ayā́ pātam imáṃ sutám

translation.text: O Indra-Agni, with the man who lauds you comes the wakening rite: So drink ye both this juice assured.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑म॒ग्निं क॑वि॒च्छदा॑ य॒ज्ञस्य॑ जू॒त्या वृ॑णे ता सोम॑स्ये॒ह तृ॑म्पताम्
verses.transliteration: índram agníṃ kavichádā  yajñásya jūtyā́ vr̥ṇe  tā́ sómasyehá tr̥mpatām

translation.text: Through force of sacrifice I choose Indra-Agni who love the wise: With Sorna let these sate them here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तो॒शा वृ॑त्र॒हणा॑ हुवे स॒जित्वा॒नाप॑राजिता इ॒न्द्रा॒ग्नी वा॑ज॒सात॑मा
verses.transliteration: tośā́ vr̥traháṇā huve  sajítvānā́parājitā  indrāgnī́ vājasā́tamā

translation.text: Indra and Agni I invoke, joint-victors, bounteous, unsubdued, Foe-slayers, best to win the spoil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वा॑मर्चन्त्यु॒क्थिनो॑ नीथा॒विदो॑ जरि॒तारः॑ इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ इष॒ आ वृ॑णे
verses.transliteration: prá vām arcanty ukthíno  nīthāvído jaritā́raḥ  índrāgnī íṣa ā́ vr̥ṇe

translation.text: Indra and Agni, singers skilled in melody hymn you, bringing lauds: I choose you for the sacred food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी नव॒तिं पुरो॑ दा॒सप॑त्नीरधूनुतम् सा॒कमेके॑न॒ कर्म॑णा
verses.transliteration: índrāgnī navatím púro  dāsápatnīr adhūnutam  sākám ékena kármaṇā

translation.text: Indra and Agni, ye cast down the ninety forts which Dâsas held, Together, with one mighty deed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ अप॑स॒स्पर्युप॒ प्र य॑न्ति धी॒तयः॑ ऋ॒तस्य॑ प॒थ्या॒३॒॑ अनु॑
verses.transliteration: índrāgnī ápasas pári-  úpa prá yanti dhītáyaḥ  r̥tásya pathyā̀ ánu

translation.text: To Indra-Agni eeverent thoughts go forward from the holy task Along the path of sacred Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी तवि॒षाणि॑ वां स॒धस्था॑नि॒ प्रयां॑सि च यु॒वोर॒प्तूर्यं॑ हि॒तम्
verses.transliteration: índrāgnī taviṣā́ṇi vāṃ  sadhásthāni práyāṃsi ca  yuvór aptū́ryaṃ hitám

translation.text: O Indra-Agni, powers are yours, and dwellings and delightful food Good is your readiness to act.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी रोच॒ना दि॒वः परि॒ वाजे॑षु भूषथः तद्वां॑ चेति॒ प्र वी॒र्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: índrāgnī rocanā́ diváḥ  pári vā́jeṣu bhūṣathaḥ  tád vāṃ ceti prá vīryàm

translation.text: Indra and Agni, in your deeds of might ye deck heaven's lucid realms: Famed is that hero strength of yours.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वो॑ दे॒वाया॒ग्नये॒ बर्हि॑ष्ठमर्चास्मै गम॑द्दे॒वेभि॒रा स नो॒ यजि॑ष्ठो ब॒र्हिरा स॑दत्
verses.transliteration: prá vo devā́yāgnáye  bárhiṣṭham arcāsmai  gámad devébhir ā́ sá no  yájiṣṭho barhír ā́ sadat

translation.text: To Agni, to this God of yours I sing aloud with utmost power. May he come to us with the Gods, and sit, best Offerer, on the grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तावा॒ यस्य॒ रोद॑सी॒ दक्षं॒ सच॑न्त ऊ॒तयः॑ ह॒विष्म॑न्त॒स्तमी॑ळते॒ तं स॑नि॒ष्यन्तोऽव॑से
verses.transliteration: r̥tā́vā yásya ródasī  dákṣaṃ sácanta ūtáyaḥ  havíṣmantas tám īḷate  táṃ saniṣyántó 'vase

translation.text: The Holy, whose are earth and heaven, and succour waits upon his strength; Him men who bring oblations laud, and they who wish to gain, for grace.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स य॒न्ता विप्र॑ एषां॒ स य॒ज्ञाना॒मथा॒ हि षः अ॒ग्निं तं वो॑ दुवस्यत॒ दाता॒ यो वनि॑ता म॒घम्
verses.transliteration: sá yantā́ vípra eṣāṃ  sá yajñā́nām áthā hí ṣáḥ  agníṃ táṃ vo duvasyata  dā́tā yó vánitā maghám

translation.text: He is the Sage who guides these men, Leader of sacred rites is he. Him your own Agni, serve ye well, who winneth and bestoweth wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नः॒ शर्मा॑णि वी॒तये॒ऽग्निर्य॑च्छतु॒ शंत॑मा यतो॑ नः प्रु॒ष्णव॒द्वसु॑ दि॒वि क्षि॒तिभ्यो॑ अ॒प्स्वा
verses.transliteration: sá naḥ śármāṇi vītáye  -agnír yachatu śáṃtamā  yáto naḥ pruṣṇávad vásu  diví kṣitíbhyo apsv ā́

translation.text: So may the gracious Agni grant most goodly shelter for our use; Whence in the heavens or in the floods he shall pour wealth upon our lands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दी॒दि॒वांस॒मपू॑र्व्यं॒ वस्वी॑भिरस्य धी॒तिभिः॑ ऋक्वा॑णो अ॒ग्निमि॑न्धते॒ होता॑रं वि॒श्पतिं॑ वि॒शाम्
verses.transliteration: dīdivā́ṃsam ápūrvyaṃ  vásvībhir asya dhītíbhiḥ  ŕ̥kvāṇo agním indhate  hótāraṃ viśpátiṃ viśā́m

translation.text: The singers kindle him, the Priest, Agni the Lord of tribes of men, Resplendent and without a peer through his own excellent designs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त नो॒ ब्रह्म॑न्नविष उ॒क्थेषु॑ देव॒हूत॑मः शं नः॑ शोचा म॒रुद्वृ॒धोऽग्ने॑ सहस्र॒सात॑मः
verses.transliteration: utá no bráhmann aviṣaḥ-  ukthéṣu devahū́tamaḥ  śáṃ naḥ śocā marúdvr̥dhaḥ-  -ágne sahasrasā́tamaḥ

translation.text: Help us, thou Brahman, best of all invokers of the Gods in song. Beam, Friend of Maruts, bliss on us, O Agni, a most liberal God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू नो॑ रास्व स॒हस्र॑वत्तो॒कव॑त्पुष्टि॒मद्वसु॑ द्यु॒मद॑ग्ने सु॒वीर्यं॒ वर्षि॑ष्ठ॒मनु॑पक्षितम्
verses.transliteration: nū́ no rāsva sahásravat  tokávat puṣṭimád vásu  dyumád agne suvī́ryaṃ  várṣiṣṭham ánupakṣitam

translation.text: Yea, grant us treasure thousandfold with children and with nourishment, And, Agni, splendid hero strength, exalted, wasting not away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ होता॑ म॒न्द्रो वि॒दथा॑न्यस्थात्स॒त्यो यज्वा॑ क॒वित॑मः॒ स वे॒धाः वि॒द्युद्र॑थः॒ सह॑सस्पु॒त्रो अ॒ग्निः शो॒चिष्के॑शः पृथि॒व्यां पाजो॑ अश्रेत्
verses.transliteration: ā́ hótā mandró vidáthāny asthāt  satyó yájvā kavítamaḥ sá vedhā́ḥ  vidyúdrathaḥ sáhasas putró agníḥ  śocíṣkeśaḥ pr̥thivyā́m pā́jo aśret

translation.text: THE pleasant Priest is come into the synod, true, skilled in sacrifice, most wise, Ordainer. Agni, the Son of Strength, whose car is lightning, whose hair is flame, hath shown on earth his lustre.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अया॑मि ते॒ नम॑उक्तिं जुषस्व॒ ऋता॑व॒स्तुभ्यं॒ चेत॑ते सहस्वः वि॒द्वाँ आ व॑क्षि वि॒दुषो॒ नि ष॑त्सि॒ मध्य॒ आ ब॒र्हिरू॒तये॑ यजत्र
verses.transliteration: áyāmi te námaÅktiṃ juṣasva  ŕ̥tāvas túbhyaṃ cétate sahasvaḥ  vidvā́m̐ ā́ vakṣi vidúṣo ní ṣatsi  mádhya ā́ barhír ūtáye yajatra

translation.text: To thee I offer reverent speech: accept it: to thee who markest it, victorious, faithful! Bring, thou who knowest, those who know, and seat thee amid the sacred grass, for help, O Holy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्रव॑तां त उ॒षसा॑ वा॒जय॑न्ती॒ अग्ने॒ वात॑स्य प॒थ्या॑भि॒रच्छ॑ यत्सी॑म॒ञ्जन्ति॑ पू॒र्व्यं ह॒विर्भि॒रा व॒न्धुरे॑व तस्थतुर्दुरो॒णे
verses.transliteration: drávatāṃ ta uṣásā vājáyantī  ágne vā́tasya pathyā̀bhir ácha  yát sīm añjánti pūrvyáṃ havírbhir  ā́ vandhúreva tasthatur duroṇé

translation.text: The Two who show their vigour, Night and Morning, by the wind's paths shall haste to thee O Agni. When men adorn the Ancient with oblations, these seek, as on two chariot-seats, the dwelling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒त्रश्च॒ तुभ्यं॒ वरु॑णः सह॒स्वोऽग्ने॒ विश्वे॑ म॒रुतः॑ सु॒म्नम॑र्चन् यच्छो॒चिषा॑ सहसस्पुत्र॒ तिष्ठा॑ अ॒भि क्षि॒तीः प्र॒थय॒न्त्सूर्यो॒ नॄन्
verses.transliteration: mitráś ca túbhyaṃ váruṇaḥ sahasvaḥ-  -ágne víśve marútaḥ sumnám arcan  yác chocíṣā sahasas putra tíṣṭhāḥ-  abhí kṣitī́ḥ pratháyan sū́ryo nr̥̄́n

translation.text: To thee, strong Agni! Varuṇa and Mitra and all the Maruts sang a song of triumph, What time unto the people's lands thou camest, spreading them as the Sun of men, with lustre.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं ते॑ अ॒द्य र॑रि॒मा हि काम॑मुत्ता॒नह॑स्ता॒ नम॑सोप॒सद्य॑ यजि॑ष्ठेन॒ मन॑सा यक्षि दे॒वानस्रे॑धता॒ मन्म॑ना॒ विप्रो॑ अग्ने
verses.transliteration: vayáṃ te adyá rarimā́ hí kā́mam  uttānáhastā námasopasádya  yájiṣṭhena mánasā yakṣi devā́n  ásredhatā mánmanā vípro agne

translation.text: Approaching with raised hands and adoration, we have this day fulfilled for thee thy longing. Worship the Gods with most devoted spirit, a Priest with no unfriendly thought, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वद्धि पु॑त्र सहसो॒ वि पू॒र्वीर्दे॒वस्य॒ यन्त्यू॒तयो॒ वि वाजाः॑ त्वं दे॑हि सह॒स्रिणं॑ र॒यिं नो॑ऽद्रो॒घेण॒ वच॑सा स॒त्यम॑ग्ने
verses.transliteration: tvád dhí putra sahaso ví pūrvī́r  devásya yánty ūtáyo ví vā́jāḥ  tváṃ dehi sahasríṇaṃ rayíṃ no  -adroghéṇa vácasā satyám agne

translation.text: For, Son of Strength, from thee come many succours, and powers abundant that a God possesses. Agni, to us with speech that hath no falsehood grant riches, real, to be told in thousands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तुभ्यं॑ दक्ष कविक्रतो॒ यानी॒मा देव॒ मर्ता॑सो अध्व॒रे अक॑र्म त्वं विश्व॑स्य सु॒रथ॑स्य बोधि॒ सर्वं॒ तद॑ग्ने अमृत स्वदे॒ह
verses.transliteration: túbhyaṃ dakṣa kavikrato yā́nīmā́  déva mártāso adhvaré ákarma  tváṃ víśvasya suráthasya bodhi  sárvaṃ tád agne amr̥ta svadehá

translation.text: Whatever, God, in sacrifice we mortals have wrought is all for thee, strong, wise of purpose! Be thou the Friend of each good chariot's master. All this enjoy thou here, immortal Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि पाज॑सा पृ॒थुना॒ शोशु॑चानो॒ बाध॑स्व द्वि॒षो र॒क्षसो॒ अमी॑वाः सु॒शर्म॑णो बृह॒तः शर्म॑णि स्याम॒ग्नेर॒हं सु॒हव॑स्य॒ प्रणी॑तौ
verses.transliteration: ví pā́jasā pr̥thúnā śóśucāno  bā́dhasva dviṣó rakṣáso ámīvāḥ  suśármaṇo br̥hatáḥ śármaṇi syām  agnér aháṃ suhávasya práṇītau

translation.text: RESPLENDENT with thy wide-extending lustre, dispel the terrors of the fiends who hate us May lofty Agni be my guide and shelter, the easily-invoked, the good Protector.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नो॑ अ॒स्या उ॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टौ॒ त्वं सूर॒ उदि॑ते बोधि गो॒पाः जन्मे॑व॒ नित्यं॒ तन॑यं जुषस्व॒ स्तोमं॑ मे अग्ने त॒न्वा॑ सुजात
verses.transliteration: tváṃ no asyā́ uṣáso vyùṣṭau  tváṃ sū́ra údite bodhi gopā́ḥ  jánmeva nítyaṃ tánayaṃ juṣasva  stómam me agne tanvā̀ sujāta

translation.text: Be thou To us, while now the morn is breaking, be thou a guardian when the Sun hath mounted.. Accept, as men accept a true-born infant, my laud, O Agni nobly born in body.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नृ॒चक्षा॑ वृष॒भानु॑ पू॒र्वीः कृ॒ष्णास्व॑ग्ने अरु॒षो वि भा॑हि वसो॒ नेषि॑ च॒ पर्षि॒ चात्यंहः॑ कृ॒धी नो॑ रा॒य उ॒शिजो॑ यविष्ठ
verses.transliteration: tváṃ nr̥cákṣā vr̥ṣabhā́nu pūrvī́ḥ  kr̥ṣṇā́sv agne aruṣó ví bhāhi  váso néṣi ca párṣi cā́ty áṃhaḥ  kr̥dhī́ no rāyá uśíjo yaviṣṭha

translation.text: Bull, who beholdest men, through many mornings, among the dark ones shine forth red, O Agni. Lead us, good Lord, and bear us over trouble: Help us who long, Most Youthful God, to riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अषा॑ळ्हो अग्ने वृष॒भो दि॑दीहि॒ पुरो॒ विश्वाः॒ सौभ॑गा संजिगी॒वान् य॒ज्ञस्य॑ ने॒ता प्र॑थ॒मस्य॑ पा॒योर्जात॑वेदो बृह॒तः सु॑प्रणीते
verses.transliteration: áṣāḷho agne vr̥ṣabhó didīhi  púro víśvāḥ saúbhagā saṃjigīvā́n  yajñásya netā́ prathamásya pāyór  jā́tavedo br̥hatáḥ supraṇīte

translation.text: Shine forth, a Bull invincible, O Agni, winning by conquest all the forts and treasures, Thou Jâtavedas who art skilled in guiding, the chief high saving sacrifice's Leader.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छि॑द्रा॒ शर्म॑ जरितः पु॒रूणि॑ दे॒वाँ अच्छा॒ दीद्या॑नः सुमे॒धाः रथो॒ न सस्नि॑र॒भि व॑क्षि॒ वाज॒मग्ने॒ त्वं रोद॑सी नः सु॒मेके॑
verses.transliteration: áchidrā śárma jaritaḥ purū́ṇi  devā́m̐ áchā dī́dyānaḥ sumedhā́ḥ  rátho ná sásnir abhí vakṣi vā́jam  ágne tváṃ ródasī naḥ suméke

translation.text: Lighting Gods hither, Agni, wisest Singer, bring thou to us many and flawless shelters. Bring vigour, like a car that gathers booty: bring us, O Agni, beauteous.Rarth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र पी॑पय वृषभ॒ जिन्व॒ वाजा॒नग्ने॒ त्वं रोद॑सी नः सु॒दोघे॑ दे॒वेभि॑र्देव सु॒रुचा॑ रुचा॒नो मा नो॒ मर्त॑स्य दुर्म॒तिः परि॑ ष्ठात्
verses.transliteration: prá pīpaya vr̥ṣabha jínva vā́jān  ágne tváṃ ródasī naḥ sudóghe  devébhir deva surúcā rucānó  mā́ no mártasya durmatíḥ pári ṣṭhāt

translation.text: Swell, O thou Bull and give those powers an impulse, e'en Earth and Heaven who yield their milk in plenty, Shining, O God, with Gods in clear effulgence. Let not a mortal's evil will obstruct us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इळा॑मग्ने पुरु॒दंसं॑ स॒निं गोः श॑श्वत्त॒मं हव॑मानाय साध स्यान्नः॑ सू॒नुस्तन॑यो वि॒जावाग्ने॒ सा ते॑ सुम॒तिर्भू॑त्व॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: íḷām agne purudáṃsaṃ saníṃ góḥ  śaśvattamáṃ hávamānāya sādha  syā́n naḥ sūnús tánayo vijā́vā-  -ágne sā́ te sumatír bhūtv asmé

translation.text: Agni, as holy food to thine invoker, give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading ofrspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यम॒ग्निः सु॒वीर्य॒स्येशे॑ म॒हः सौभ॑गस्य रा॒य ई॑शे स्वप॒त्यस्य॒ गोम॑त॒ ईशे॑ वृत्र॒हथा॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: ayám agníḥ suvī́ryasya-  -ī́śe maháḥ saúbhagasya  rāyá īśe svapatyásya gómataḥ-  ī́śe vr̥traháthānām

translation.text: THIS Agni is the Lord of great felicity and hero Strength; Lord of wealth in herds of kine; Lord of the battles with the foe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं न॑रो मरुतः सश्चता॒ वृधं॒ यस्मि॒न्रायः॒ शेवृ॑धासः अ॒भि ये सन्ति॒ पृत॑नासु दू॒ढ्यो॑ वि॒श्वाहा॒ शत्रु॑माद॒भुः
verses.transliteration: imáṃ naro marutaḥ saścatā vŕ̥dhaṃ  yásmin rā́yaḥ śévr̥dhāsaḥ  abhí yé sánti pŕ̥tanāsu dūḍhyò  viśvā́hā śátrum ādabhúḥ

translation.text: Wait, Maruts, Heroes, upon him the Prosperer in whom is bliss-increasing wealth; Who in fights ever conquer evil-hearted men, who overcome the enemy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स त्वं नो॑ रा॒यः शि॑शीहि॒ मीढ्वो॑ अग्ने सु॒वीर्य॑स्य तुवि॑द्युम्न॒ वर्षि॑ष्ठस्य प्र॒जाव॑तोऽनमी॒वस्य॑ शु॒ष्मिणः॑
verses.transliteration: sá tváṃ no rāyáḥ śiśīhi  mī́ḍhvo agne suvī́ryasya  túvidyumna várṣiṣṭhasya prajā́vato  -anamīvásya śuṣmíṇaḥ

translation.text: As such, O Agni, deal us wealth and hero might, O Bounteous One! Most lofty, very glorious, rich in progeny, free from disease and full of power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चक्रि॒र्यो विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना॒भि सा॑स॒हिश्चक्रि॑र्दे॒वेष्वा दुवः॑ आ दे॒वेषु॒ यत॑त॒ आ सु॒वीर्य॒ आ शंस॑ उ॒त नृ॒णाम्
verses.transliteration: cákrir yó víśvā bhúvanābhí sāsahíś  cákrir devéṣv ā́ dúvaḥ  ā́ devéṣu yátata ā́ suvī́rye-  ā́ śáṃsa utá nr̥ṇā́m

translation.text: He who made all that lives, who passes all in might, who orders service to the Gods, He works among the Gods, he works in hero strength, yea, also in the praise of men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॑ अ॒ग्नेऽम॑तये॒ मावीर॑तायै रीरधः मागोता॑यै सहसस्पुत्र॒ मा नि॒देऽप॒ द्वेषां॒स्या कृ॑धि
verses.transliteration: mā́ no agné 'mataye  mā́vī́ratāyai rīradhaḥ  mā́gótāyai sahasas putra mā́ nidé  -ápa dvéṣāṃsy ā́ kr̥dhi

translation.text: Give us not up to indigence, Agni, nor want of hero sons, Nor, Son of Strength, to lack of cattle, nor to blame. Drive. thou our enemies away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒ग्धि वाज॑स्य सुभग प्र॒जाव॒तोऽग्ने॑ बृह॒तो अ॑ध्व॒रे सं रा॒या भूय॑सा सृज मयो॒भुना॒ तुवि॑द्युम्न॒ यश॑स्वता
verses.transliteration: śagdhí vā́jasya subhaga prajā́vataḥ-  -ágne br̥ható adhvaré  sáṃ rāyā́ bhū́yasā sr̥ja mayobhúnā  túvidyumna yáśasvatā

translation.text: Help us to strength, blest Agni! rich in progeny, abundant, in our sacrifice. Flood us with riches yet more plenteous, bringing weal, with high renown, most Glorious One!

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मि॒ध्यमा॑नः प्रथ॒मानु॒ धर्मा॒ सम॒क्तुभि॑रज्यते वि॒श्ववा॑रः शो॒चिष्के॑शो घृ॒तनि॑र्णिक्पाव॒कः सु॑य॒ज्ञो अ॒ग्निर्य॒जथा॑य दे॒वान्
verses.transliteration: samidhyámānaḥ prathamā́nu dhármā  sám aktúbhir ajyate viśvávāraḥ  śocíṣkeśo ghr̥tánirṇik pāvakáḥ  suyajñó agnír yajáthāya devā́n

translation.text: DULY enkindled after ancient customs, bringing all treasures, he is balmed with unguents,– Flame-haired, oil-clad, the purifying Agni, skilled in fair rites, to bring the Gods for worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथाय॑जो हो॒त्रम॑ग्ने पृथि॒व्या यथा॑ दि॒वो जा॑तवेदश्चिकि॒त्वान् ए॒वानेन॑ ह॒विषा॑ यक्षि दे॒वान्म॑नु॒ष्वद्य॒ज्ञं प्र ति॑रे॒मम॒द्य
verses.transliteration: yáthā́yajo hotrám agne pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  yáthā divó jātavedaś cikitvā́n  evā́néna havíṣā yakṣi devā́n  manuṣvád yajñám prá tiremám adyá

translation.text: As thou, O Agni, skilful Jâtavedas, hast sacrificed as Priest of Earth, of Heaven, So with this offering bring the Gods, and prosper this sacrifice today as erst for Manu.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रीण्यायूं॑षि॒ तव॑ जातवेदस्ति॒स्र आ॒जानी॑रु॒षस॑स्ते अग्ने ताभि॑र्दे॒वाना॒मवो॑ यक्षि वि॒द्वानथा॑ भव॒ यज॑मानाय॒ शं योः
verses.transliteration: trī́ṇy ā́yūṃṣi táva jātavedas  tisrá ājā́nīr uṣásas te agne  tā́bhir devā́nām ávo yakṣi vidvā́n  áthā bhava yájamānāya śáṃ yóḥ

translation.text: Three are thy times of life, O Jâtavedas, and the three mornings are thy births, O Agni. With these, well-knowing, grant the Gods' kind favour, and help in stir aiid stress the man who worships.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निं सु॑दी॒तिं सु॒दृशं॑ गृ॒णन्तो॑ नम॒स्याम॒स्त्वेड्यं॑ जातवेदः त्वां दू॒तम॑र॒तिं ह॑व्य॒वाहं॑ दे॒वा अ॑कृण्वन्न॒मृत॑स्य॒ नाभि॑म्
verses.transliteration: agníṃ sudītíṃ sudŕ̥śaṃ gr̥ṇánto  namasyā́mas tvéḍyaṃ jātavedaḥ  tvā́ṃ dūtám aratíṃ havyavā́haṃ  devā́ akr̥ṇvann amŕ̥tasya nā́bhim
