translation.text: Agni most bright and fair with song we honour, yea, the adorable, O Jâtavedas. Thee, envoy, messenger, oblation-bearer, the Gods have made centre of life eternal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्त्वद्धोता॒ पूर्वो॑ अग्ने॒ यजी॑यान्द्वि॒ता च॒ सत्ता॑ स्व॒धया॑ च श॒म्भुः तस्यानु॒ धर्म॒ प्र य॑जा चिकि॒त्वोऽथा॑ नो धा अध्व॒रं दे॒ववी॑तौ
verses.transliteration: yás tvád dhótā pū́rvo agne yájīyān  dvitā́ ca sáttā svadháyā ca śambhúḥ  tásyā́nu dhárma prá yajā cikitvaḥ-  -áthā no dhā adhvaráṃ devávītau

translation.text: That Priest before thee, yet more skilled in worship, stablished of old, healthgiver by his nature,– After his custom offer, thou who knowest, and lay our sacrifice where Gods may taste it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भवा॑ नो अग्ने सु॒मना॒ उपे॑तौ॒ सखे॑व॒ सख्ये॑ पि॒तरे॑व सा॒धुः पु॒रु॒द्रुहो॒ हि क्षि॒तयो॒ जना॑नां॒ प्रति॑ प्रती॒चीर्द॑हता॒दरा॑तीः
verses.transliteration: bhávā no agne sumánā úpetau  sákheva sákhye pitáreva sādhúḥ  purudrúho hí kṣitáyo jánānām  práti pratīcī́r dahatād árātīḥ

translation.text: AGNI, be kind to us when we approach thee good as a friend to friend, as sire and mother. The races of mankind are great oppressors burn up malignity that strives against us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तपो॒ ष्व॑ग्ने॒ अन्त॑राँ अ॒मित्रा॒न्तपा॒ शंस॒मर॑रुषः॒ पर॑स्य तपो॑ वसो चिकिता॒नो अ॒चित्ता॒न्वि ते॑ तिष्ठन्ताम॒जरा॑ अ॒यासः॑
verses.transliteration: tápo ṣv àgne ántarām̐ amítrān  tápā śáṃsam áraruṣaḥ párasya  tápo vaso cikitānó acíttān  ví te tiṣṭhantām ajárā ayā́saḥ

translation.text: Agni, burn up the unfriendly who are near us, burn thou the foeman's curse who pays no worship. Burn, Vasu, thou who markest well, the foolish: let thine eternal nimble beams surround thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒ध्मेना॑ग्न इ॒च्छमा॑नो घृ॒तेन॑ जु॒होमि॑ ह॒व्यं तर॑से॒ बला॑य याव॒दीशे॒ ब्रह्म॑णा॒ वन्द॑मान इ॒मां धियं॑ शत॒सेया॑य दे॒वीम्
verses.transliteration: idhménāgna ichámāno ghr̥téna  juhómi havyáṃ tárase bálāya  yā́vad ī́śe bráhmaṇā vándamānaḥ-  imā́ṃ dhíyaṃ śataséyāya devī́m

translation.text: With fuel, Agni, and with oil, desirous, mine offering I present for strength and conquest, With prayer, so far as I have power, adoring-this hymn divine to gain a hundred treasures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उच्छो॒चिषा॑ सहसस्पुत्र स्तु॒तो बृ॒हद्वयः॑ शशमा॒नेषु॑ धेहि रे॒वद॑ग्ने वि॒श्वामि॑त्रेषु॒ शं योर्म॑र्मृ॒ज्मा ते॑ त॒न्वं१॒॑ भूरि॒ कृत्वः॑
verses.transliteration: úc chocíṣā sahasas putra stutó  br̥hád váyaḥ śaśamānéṣu dhehi  revád agne viśvā́mitreṣu śáṃ yór  marmr̥jmā́ te tanvàm bhū́ri kŕ̥tvaḥ

translation.text: Give with thy glow, thou Son of Strength, when lauded, great vital power to those who toil to serve thee. Give richly, Agni, to the Viṣvâmitras in rest and stir. Oft have we decked thy body.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कृ॒धि रत्नं॑ सुसनित॒र्धना॑नां॒ स घेद॑ग्ने भवसि॒ यत्समि॑द्धः स्तो॒तुर्दु॑रो॒णे सु॒भग॑स्य रे॒वत्सृ॒प्रा क॒रस्ना॑ दधिषे॒ वपूं॑षि
verses.transliteration: kr̥dhí rátnaṃ susanitar dhánānāṃ  sá ghéd agne bhavasi yát sámiddhaḥ  stotúr duroṇé subhágasya revát  sr̥prā́ karásnā dadhiṣe vápūṃṣi

translation.text: Give us, O liberal Lord, great gtore of riches, for, Agni, such art thou when duly kindled. Thou in the happy singer's home bestowest, amply with arms extended, things of beauty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निं होता॑रं॒ प्र वृ॑णे मि॒येधे॒ गृत्सं॑ क॒विं वि॑श्व॒विद॒ममू॑रम् स नो॑ यक्षद्दे॒वता॑ता॒ यजी॑यान्रा॒ये वाजा॑य वनते म॒घानि॑
verses.transliteration: agníṃ hótāram prá vr̥ṇe miyédhe  gŕ̥tsaṃ kavíṃ viśvavídam ámūram  sá no yakṣad devátātā yájīyān  rāyé vā́jāya vanate maghā́ni

translation.text: Aow, quick, sage, infallible, all-knowing, I choose to be our Priest at this oblation. In our Gods' service he, best skilled, shall worship: may he obtain us boons for strength and riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ते॑ अग्ने ह॒विष्म॑तीमिय॒र्म्यच्छा॑ सुद्यु॒म्नां रा॒तिनीं॑ घृ॒ताची॑म् प्र॒द॒क्षि॒णिद्दे॒वता॑तिमुरा॒णः सं रा॒तिभि॒र्वसु॑भिर्य॒ज्ञम॑श्रेत्
verses.transliteration: prá te agne havíṣmatīm iyarmi-  áchā sudyumnā́ṃ rātínīṃ ghr̥tā́cīm  pradakṣiṇíd devátātim urāṇáḥ  sáṃ rātíbhir vásubhir yajñám aśret

translation.text: Agni, to thee I lift the oil-fed ladle, bright, with an offering, bearing our oblation. From the right hand, choosing the Gods' attendance, he with rich presents hath arranged the worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स तेजी॑यसा॒ मन॑सा॒ त्वोत॑ उ॒त शि॑क्ष स्वप॒त्यस्य॑ शि॒क्षोः अग्ने॑ रा॒यो नृत॑मस्य॒ प्रभू॑तौ भू॒याम॑ ते सुष्टु॒तय॑श्च॒ वस्वः॑
verses.transliteration: sá téjīyasā mánasā tvóta  utá śikṣa svapatyásya śikṣóḥ  ágne rāyó nŕ̥tamasya prábhūtau  bhūyā́ma te suṣṭutáyaś ca vásvaḥ

translation.text: Of keenest spirit is the man thou aidest give us good offspring, thou who givest freely. In power of wealth most rich in men. O Agni, of thee, the Good, may we sing forth fair praises.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भूरी॑णि॒ हि त्वे द॑धि॒रे अनी॒काग्ने॑ दे॒वस्य॒ यज्य॑वो॒ जना॑सः स आ व॑ह दे॒वता॑तिं यविष्ठ॒ शर्धो॒ यद॒द्य दि॒व्यं यजा॑सि
verses.transliteration: bhū́rīṇi hí tvé dadhiré ánīkā-  -ágne devásya yájyavo jánāsaḥ  sá ā́ vaha devátātiṃ yaviṣṭha  śárdho yád adyá divyáṃ yájāsi

translation.text: Men as they worship thee the God, O Agni, have set on thee full many a brilliant, aspect. So bring Most Youthful One, the Gods' asserrigly, the Heavenly Host which thou to-day shalt honour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्त्वा॒ होता॑रम॒नज॑न्मि॒येधे॑ निषा॒दय॑न्तो य॒जथा॑य दे॒वाः स त्वं नो॑ अग्नेऽवि॒तेह बो॒ध्यधि॒ श्रवां॑सि धेहि नस्त॒नूषु॑
verses.transliteration: yát tvā hótāram anájan miyédhe  niṣādáyanto yajáthāya devā́ḥ  sá tváṃ no agne 'vitéhá bodhi-  ádhi śrávāṃsi dhehi nas tanū́ṣu

translation.text: When Gods anoint thee Priest at their oblation, and seat thee for thy task as Sacrificer, O Agni, be thou here our kind defender, and to ourselves vouchsafe the gift of glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निमु॒षस॑म॒श्विना॑ दधि॒क्रां व्यु॑ष्टिषु हवते॒ वह्नि॑रु॒क्थैः सु॒ज्योति॑षो नः शृण्वन्तु दे॒वाः स॒जोष॑सो अध्व॒रं वा॑वशा॒नाः
verses.transliteration: agním uṣásam aśvínā dadhikrā́ṃ  vyùṣṭiṣu havate váhnir ukthaíḥ  sujyótiṣo naḥ śr̥ṇvantu devā́ḥ  sajóṣaso adhvaráṃ vāvaśānā́ḥ

translation.text: WITH lauds at break of morn the priest invoketh Agni, Dawn, Dadhikrâs, and both the Aṣvins. With one consent the Gods whose light is splendid, longing to taste our sacrifice, shall hear us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ त्री ते॒ वाजि॑ना॒ त्री ष॒धस्था॑ ति॒स्रस्ते॑ जि॒ह्वा ऋ॑तजात पू॒र्वीः ति॒स्र उ॑ ते त॒न्वो॑ दे॒ववा॑ता॒स्ताभि॑र्नः पाहि॒ गिरो॒ अप्र॑युच्छन्
verses.transliteration: ágne trī́ te vā́jinā trī́ ṣadhásthā  tisrás te jihvā́ r̥tajāta pūrvī́ḥ  tisrá u te tanvò devávātās  tā́bhir naḥ pāhi gíro áprayuchan

translation.text: Three are thy powers, O Agni, three thy stations, three are thy tongues, yea, many, Child of Order! Three bodies hast thou which the Gods delight in: with these protect our hymns with care unceasing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ भूरी॑णि॒ तव॑ जातवेदो॒ देव॑ स्वधावो॒ऽमृत॑स्य॒ नाम॑ याश्च॑ मा॒या मा॒यिनां॑ विश्वमिन्व॒ त्वे पू॒र्वीः सं॑द॒धुः पृ॑ष्टबन्धो
verses.transliteration: ágne bhū́rīṇi táva jātavedo  déva svadhāvo 'mŕ̥tasya nā́ma  yā́ś ca māyā́ māyínāṃ viśvaminva  tvé pūrvī́ḥ saṃdadhúḥ pr̥ṣṭabandho

translation.text: O Agni, many are the names thou bearest, immortal, God, Divine, and Jâtavedas. And many charms of charmers, All-Inspirer! have they laid in thee, Lord of true attendants!

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर्ने॒ता भग॑ इव क्षिती॒नां दैवी॑नां दे॒व ऋ॑तु॒पा ऋ॒तावा॑ स वृ॑त्र॒हा स॒नयो॑ वि॒श्ववे॑दाः॒ पर्ष॒द्विश्वाति॑ दुरि॒ता गृ॒णन्त॑म्
verses.transliteration: agnír netā́ bhága iva kṣitīnā́ṃ  daívīnāṃ devá r̥tupā́ r̥tā́vā  sá vr̥trahā́ sanáyo viśvávedāḥ  párṣad víśvā́ti duritā́ gr̥ṇántam

translation.text: Agni, like Bhaga, leads the godly people, he who is true to Law and guards the seasons. Ancient, all-knowing, he the Vr̥itra-slayer shall bear the singer safe through every trouble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒धि॒क्राम॒ग्निमु॒षसं॑ च दे॒वीं बृह॒स्पतिं॑ सवि॒तारं॑ च दे॒वम् अ॒श्विना॑ मि॒त्रावरु॑णा॒ भगं॑ च॒ वसू॑न्रु॒द्राँ आ॑दि॒त्याँ इ॒ह हु॑वे
verses.transliteration: dadhikrā́m agním uṣásaṃ ca devī́m  bŕ̥haspátiṃ savitā́raṃ ca devám  aśvínā mitrā́váruṇā bhágaṃ ca  vásūn rudrā́m̐ ādityā́m̐ ihá huve

translation.text: I call on Savitar the God, on Morning, Br̥ihaspati, and Dadhikrâs, and Agni, On Varuṇa and Mitra, on the Aṣvins, Bhaga, the Vasus, Rudras and Âdityas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं नो॑ य॒ज्ञम॒मृते॑षु धेही॒मा ह॒व्या जा॑तवेदो जुषस्व स्तो॒काना॑मग्ने॒ मेद॑सो घृ॒तस्य॒ होतः॒ प्राशा॑न प्रथ॒मो नि॒षद्य॑
verses.transliteration: imáṃ no yajñám amŕ̥teṣu dhehi-  -imā́ havyā́ jātavedo juṣasva  stokā́nām agne médaso ghr̥tásya  hótaḥ prā́śāna prathamó niṣádya

translation.text: SET this our sacrifice among the Immortals: be pleased with these our presents, Jâtavedas. O Priest, O Agni, sit thee down before us, and first enjoy the drops of oil and fatness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: घृ॒तव॑न्तः पावक ते स्तो॒काः श्चो॑तन्ति॒ मेद॑सः स्वध॑र्मन्दे॒ववी॑तये॒ श्रेष्ठं॑ नो धेहि॒ वार्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: ghr̥távantaḥ pāvaka te  stokā́ ścotanti médasaḥ  svádharman devávītaye  śréṣṭhaṃ no dhehi vā́ryam

translation.text: For thee, O Purifier, flow the drops of fatness rich in oil. After thy wont vouchsafe to us the choicest boon that Gods may feast.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तुभ्यं॑ स्तो॒का घृ॑त॒श्चुतोऽग्ने॒ विप्रा॑य सन्त्य ऋषिः॒ श्रेष्ठः॒ समि॑ध्यसे य॒ज्ञस्य॑ प्रावि॒ता भ॑व
verses.transliteration: túbhyaṃ stokā́ ghr̥taścútaḥ-  -ágne víprāya santya  ŕ̥ṣiḥ śréṣṭhaḥ sám idhyase  yajñásya prāvitā́ bhava

translation.text: Agni, Most Excellent! for thee the Sage are drops that drip with oil. Thou art enkindled as the best of Seers. Help thou the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तुभ्यं॑ श्चोतन्त्यध्रिगो शचीवः स्तो॒कासो॑ अग्ने॒ मेद॑सो घृ॒तस्य॑ क॒वि॒श॒स्तो बृ॑ह॒ता भा॒नुनागा॑ ह॒व्या जु॑षस्व मेधिर
verses.transliteration: túbhyaṃ ścotanty adhrigo śacīvaḥ-  stokā́so agne médaso ghr̥tásya  kaviśastó br̥hatā́ bhānúnā́gāḥ-  havyā́ juṣasva medhira

translation.text: To thee, O Agni, mighty and resistless, to thee stream forth the drops of oil and fatness. With great light art thou come, O praised by poets! Accept our offering, O thou Sage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओजि॑ष्ठं ते मध्य॒तो मेद॒ उद्भृ॑तं॒ प्र ते॑ व॒यं द॑दामहे श्चोत॑न्ति ते वसो स्तो॒का अधि॑ त्व॒चि प्रति॒ तान्दे॑व॒शो वि॑हि
verses.transliteration: ójiṣṭhaṃ te madhyató méda údbhr̥tam  prá te vayáṃ dadāmahe  ścótanti te vaso stokā́ ádhi tvací  práti tā́n devaśó vihi

translation.text: Fatness exceeding rich, extracted from the midst,– this as our gift we offer thee. Excellent God, the drops run down upon thy skin. Deal them to each among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं सो अ॒ग्निर्यस्मि॒न्त्सोम॒मिन्द्रः॑ सु॒तं द॒धे ज॒ठरे॑ वावशा॒नः स॒ह॒स्रिणं॒ वाज॒मत्यं॒ न सप्तिं॑ सस॒वान्त्सन्त्स्तू॑यसे जातवेदः
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ só agnír yásmin sómam índraḥ  sutáṃ dadhé jaṭháre vāvaśānáḥ  sahasríṇaṃ vā́jam átyaṃ ná sáptiṃ  sasavā́n sán stūyase jātavedaḥ

translation.text: THIS is that Agni whence the longing Indra took the pressed Soma deep within his body. Winner of spoils in thousands, like a courser, with praise art thou exalted, Jâtavedas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ यत्ते॑ दि॒वि वर्चः॑ पृथि॒व्यां यदोष॑धीष्व॒प्स्वा य॑जत्र येना॒न्तरि॑क्षमु॒र्वा॑त॒तन्थ॑ त्वे॒षः स भा॒नुर॑र्ण॒वो नृ॒चक्षाः॑
verses.transliteration: ágne yát te diví várcaḥ pr̥thivyā́ṃ  yád óṣadhīṣv apsv ā́ yajatra  yénāntárikṣam urv ā̀tatántha  tveṣáḥ sá bhānúr arṇavó nr̥cákṣāḥ

translation.text: That light of thine in heaven and earth, O Agni, in plants, O Holy One, and in the waters, Wherewith thou hast spread wide the air's mid-region-bright is that splendour, wavy, manbeholding.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ दि॒वो अर्ण॒मच्छा॑ जिगा॒स्यच्छा॑ दे॒वाँ ऊ॑चिषे॒ धिष्ण्या॒ ये या रो॑च॒ने प॒रस्ता॒त्सूर्य॑स्य॒ याश्चा॒वस्ता॑दुप॒तिष्ठ॑न्त॒ आपः॑
verses.transliteration: ágne divó árṇam áchā jigāsi-  áchā devā́m̐ ūciṣe dhíṣṇyā yé  yā́ rocané parástāt sū́ryasya  yā́ś cāvástād upatíṣṭhanta ā́paḥ

translation.text: O Agni, to the sea of heaven thou goest: thou hast called hither Gods beheld in spirit. The waters, too, come hither, those up yonder in the Sun's realm of light, and those beneath it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒री॒ष्या॑सो अ॒ग्नयः॑ प्राव॒णेभिः॑ स॒जोष॑सः जु॒षन्तां॑ य॒ज्ञम॒द्रुहो॑ऽनमी॒वा इषो॑ म॒हीः
verses.transliteration: purīṣyā̀so agnáyaḥ  prāvaṇébhiḥ sajóṣasaḥ  juṣántāṃ yajñám adrúho  -anamīvā́ íṣo mahī́ḥ

translation.text: Let fires that dwell in mist, combined with those that have their home in floods, Guileless accept our sacrifice, great viands free from all disease.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इळा॑मग्ने पुरु॒दंसं॑ स॒निं गोः श॑श्वत्त॒मं हव॑मानाय साध स्यान्नः॑ सू॒नुस्तन॑यो वि॒जावाग्ने॒ सा ते॑ सुम॒तिर्भू॑त्व॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: íḷām agne purudáṃsaṃ saníṃ góḥ  śaśvattamáṃ hávamānāya sādha  syā́n naḥ sūnús tánayo vijā́vā-  -ágne sā́ te sumatír bhūtv asmé

translation.text: Agni, as holy food to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: निर्म॑थितः॒ सुधि॑त॒ आ स॒धस्थे॒ युवा॑ क॒विर॑ध्व॒रस्य॑ प्रणे॒ता जूर्य॑त्स्व॒ग्निर॒जरो॒ वने॒ष्वत्रा॑ दधे अ॒मृतं॑ जा॒तवे॑दाः
verses.transliteration: nírmathitaḥ súdhita ā́ sadhásthe  yúvā kavír adhvarásya praṇetā́  jū́ryatsv agnír ajáro váneṣu-  átrā dadhe amŕ̥taṃ jātávedāḥ

translation.text: RUBBED into life, well stablished in the dwelling, Leader of sacrifice, the Sage, the youthful, Here in the wasting fuel Jâtavedas, eternal, hath assumed immortal being.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अम॑न्थिष्टां॒ भार॑ता रे॒वद॒ग्निं दे॒वश्र॑वा दे॒ववा॑तः सु॒दक्ष॑म् अग्ने॒ वि प॑श्य बृह॒ताभि रा॒येषां नो॑ ने॒ता भ॑वता॒दनु॒ द्यून्
verses.transliteration: ámanthiṣṭām bhā́ratā revád agníṃ  deváśravā devávātaḥ sudákṣam  ágne ví paśya br̥hatā́bhí rāyā́-  -iṣā́ṃ no netā́ bhavatād ánu dyū́n

translation.text: Both Bharatas, Devaṣravas, Devavâta, have strongly rubbed to life effectual Agni. O Agni, look thou forth with ample riches: be, every day, bearer of food to feed us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दश॒ क्षिपः॑ पू॒र्व्यं सी॑मजीजन॒न्त्सुजा॑तं मा॒तृषु॑ प्रि॒यम् अ॒ग्निं स्तु॑हि दैववा॒तं दे॑वश्रवो॒ यो जना॑ना॒मस॑द्व॒शी
verses.transliteration: dáśa kṣípaḥ pūrvyáṃ sīm ajījanan  sújātam mātŕ̥ṣu priyám  agníṃ stuhi daivavātáṃ devaśravo  yó jánānām ásad vaśī́

translation.text: Him nobly born of old the fingers ten produced, him whom his Mothers counted dear. Praise Devavâta's Agni, thou Devaṣravas, him who shall be the people's Lord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि त्वा॑ दधे॒ वर॒ आ पृ॑थि॒व्या इळा॑यास्प॒दे सु॑दिन॒त्वे अह्ना॑म् दृ॒षद्व॑त्यां॒ मानु॑ष आप॒यायां॒ सर॑स्वत्यां रे॒वद॑ग्ने दिदीहि
verses.transliteration: ní tvā dadhe vára ā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  íḷāyās padé sudinatvé áhnām  dr̥ṣádvatyām mā́nuṣa āpayā́yāṃ  sárasvatyāṃ revád agne didīhi

translation.text: He set thee in the earth's most lovely station, in Iḷâ's place, in days of fair bright weather. On man, on Âpayâ, Agni! on the rivers Dr̥ishadvatî, Sarasvatî, shine richly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इळा॑मग्ने पुरु॒दंसं॑ स॒निं गोः श॑श्वत्त॒मं हव॑मानाय साध स्यान्नः॑ सू॒नुस्तन॑यो वि॒जावाग्ने॒ सा ते॑ सुम॒तिर्भू॑त्व॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: íḷām agne purudáṃsaṃ saníṃ góḥ  śaśvattamáṃ hávamānāya sādha  syā́n naḥ sūnús tánayo vijā́vā-  -ágne sā́ te sumatír bhūtv asmé

translation.text: Agni, as holy food to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading offspring Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ सह॑स्व॒ पृत॑ना अ॒भिमा॑ती॒रपा॑स्य दु॒ष्टर॒स्तर॒न्नरा॑ती॒र्वर्चो॑ धा य॒ज्ञवा॑हसे
verses.transliteration: ágne sáhasva pŕ̥tanāḥ-  abhímātīr ápāsya  duṣṭáras tárann árātīr  várco dhā yajñávāhase

translation.text: AGNI, subdue opposing bands, and drive our enemies away. Invincible, slay godless foes: give splendour to the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्न॑ इ॒ळा समि॑ध्यसे वी॒तिहो॑त्रो॒ अम॑र्त्यः जु॒षस्व॒ सू नो॑ अध्व॒रम्
verses.transliteration: ágna iḷā́ sám idhyase  vītíhotro ámartyaḥ  juṣásva sū́ no adhvarám

translation.text: Lit with libation, Agni, thou, deathless, who callest Gods to feast, Accept our sacrifice with joy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ द्यु॒म्नेन॑ जागृवे॒ सह॑सः सूनवाहुत एदं ब॒र्हिः स॑दो॒ मम॑
verses.transliteration: ágne dyumnéna jāgr̥ve  sáhasaḥ sūnav āhuta  édám barhíḥ sado máma

translation.text: With splendour, Agni, Son of Strength, thou who art worshipped, wakeful One. Seat thee on this my sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ विश्वे॑भिर॒ग्निभि॑र्दे॒वेभि॑र्महया॒ गिरः॑ य॒ज्ञेषु॒ य उ॑ चा॒यवः॑
verses.transliteration: ágne víśvebhir agníbhir  devébhir mahayā gíraḥ  yajñéṣu yá u cāyávaḥ

translation.text: With all thy fires, with all the Gods, Agni, exalt the songs we sing. And living men in holy rites.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ दा दा॒शुषे॑ र॒यिं वी॒रव॑न्तं॒ परी॑णसम् शि॒शी॒हि नः॑ सूनु॒मतः॑
verses.transliteration: ágne dā́ dāśúṣe rayíṃ  vīrávantam párīṇasam  śiśīhí naḥ sūnumátaḥ

translation.text: Grant, Agni, to the worshipper wealth rich in heroes, plenteous store, Make thou us rich with many sons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ दि॒वः सू॒नुर॑सि॒ प्रचे॑ता॒स्तना॑ पृथि॒व्या उ॒त वि॒श्ववे॑दाः ऋध॑ग्दे॒वाँ इ॒ह य॑जा चिकित्वः
verses.transliteration: ágne diváḥ sūnúr asi prácetās  tánā pr̥thivyā́ utá viśvávedāḥ  ŕ̥dhag devā́m̐ ihá yajā cikitvaḥ

translation.text: THOU art the sapient Son of Dyaus, O Agni, yes and the Child of Earth, who knowest all things. Bring the Gods specially, thou Sage, for worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निः स॑नोति वी॒र्या॑णि वि॒द्वान्त्स॒नोति॒ वाज॑म॒मृता॑य॒ भूष॑न् स नो॑ दे॒वाँ एह व॑हा पुरुक्षो
verses.transliteration: agníḥ sanoti vīryā̀ṇi vidvā́n  sanóti vā́jam amŕ̥tāya bhū́ṣan  sá no devā́m̐ éhá vahā purukṣo

translation.text: Agni the wise bestows the might of heroes grants strengthening food, preparing it for nectar. Thou who art rich in food bring the Gods hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर्द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी वि॒श्वज॑न्ये॒ आ भा॑ति दे॒वी अ॒मृते॒ अमू॑रः क्षय॒न्वाजैः॑ पुरुश्च॒न्द्रो नमो॑भिः
verses.transliteration: agnír dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ viśvájanye  ā́ bhāti devī́ amŕ̥te ámūraḥ  kṣáyan vā́jaiḥ puruścandró námobhiḥ

translation.text: Agni, infallible, lights Earth and Heaven, immortal Goddesses gracious to all men,– Lord through his strength, splendid through adorations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्न॒ इन्द्र॑श्च दा॒शुषो॑ दुरो॒णे सु॒ताव॑तो य॒ज्ञमि॒होप॑ यातम् अम॑र्धन्ता सोम॒पेया॑य देवा
verses.transliteration: ágna índraś ca dāśúṣo duroṇé  sutā́vato yajñám ihópa yātam  ámardhantā somapéyāya devā

translation.text: Come to the sacrifice, Agni and Indra come to the offerer's house who hath the Soma. Come, friendly-minded, Gods, to drink the Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ अ॒पां समि॑ध्यसे दुरो॒णे नित्यः॑ सूनो सहसो जातवेदः स॒धस्था॑नि म॒हय॑मान ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: ágne apā́ṃ sám idhyase duroṇé  nítyaḥ sūno sahaso jātavedaḥ  sadhásthāni maháyamāna ūtī́

translation.text: In the floods' home art thou enkindled, Agni, O Jâtavedas, Son of Strength, eternal, Exalting with thine help the gatheringplaces.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वै॒श्वा॒न॒रं मन॑सा॒ग्निं नि॒चाय्या॑ ह॒विष्म॑न्तो अनुष॒त्यं स्व॒र्विद॑म् सु॒दानुं॑ दे॒वं र॑थि॒रं व॑सू॒यवो॑ गी॒र्भी र॒ण्वं कु॑शि॒कासो॑ हवामहे
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānarám mánasāgníṃ nicā́yyā  havíṣmanto anuṣatyáṃ svarvídam  sudā́nuṃ deváṃ rathiráṃ vasūyávo  gīrbhī́ raṇváṃ kuśikā́so havāmahe

translation.text: REVERING in our heart Agni Vaiṣvânara, the finder of the light, whose promises are true, The liberal, gladsome, car-borne God we Kuṣikas invoke him with oblation, seeking wealth with songs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं शु॒भ्रम॒ग्निमव॑से हवामहे वैश्वान॒रं मा॑त॒रिश्वा॑नमु॒क्थ्य॑म् बृह॒स्पतिं॒ मनु॑षो दे॒वता॑तये॒ विप्रं॒ श्रोता॑र॒मति॑थिं रघु॒ष्यद॑म्
verses.transliteration: táṃ śubhrám agním ávase havāmahe  vaiśvānarám mātaríśvānam ukthyàm  bŕ̥haspátim mánuṣo devátātaye  vípraṃ śrótāram átithiṃ raghuṣyádam

translation.text: That Agni, bright, Vaiṣvânara, we invoke for help, and Mâtariṣvan worthy of the song of praise; Br̥ihaspati for man's observance of the Gods, the Singer prompt to hear, the swiftly-moving guest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वो॒ न क्रन्द॒ञ्जनि॑भिः॒ समि॑ध्यते वैश्वान॒रः कु॑शि॒केभि॑र्यु॒गेयु॑गे स नो॑ अ॒ग्निः सु॒वीर्यं॒ स्वश्व्यं॒ दधा॑तु॒ रत्न॑म॒मृते॑षु॒ जागृ॑विः
verses.transliteration: áśvo ná krándañ jánibhiḥ sám idhyate  vaiśvānaráḥ kuśikébhir yugé-yuge  sá no agníḥ suvī́ryaṃ sváśvyaṃ  dádhātu rátnam amŕ̥teṣu jā́gr̥viḥ

translation.text: Age after age Vaiṣvânara, neighing like a horse, is kindled with the women by the Kuṣikas. May Agni, he who wakes among Immortal Gods, grant us heroic strength and wealth in noble steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र य॑न्तु॒ वाजा॒स्तवि॑षीभिर॒ग्नयः॑ शु॒भे सम्मि॑श्लाः॒ पृष॑तीरयुक्षत बृ॒ह॒दुक्षो॑ म॒रुतो॑ वि॒श्ववे॑दसः॒ प्र वे॑पयन्ति॒ पर्व॑ताँ॒ अदा॑भ्याः
verses.transliteration: prá yantu vā́jās táviṣībhir agnáyaḥ  śubhé sámmiślāḥ pŕ̥ṣatīr ayukṣata  br̥hadúkṣo marúto viśvávedasaḥ  prá vepayanti párvatām̐ ádābhyāḥ

translation.text: Let them go forth, the strong, as flames of fire with might. Gathered for victory they have yoked their spotted deer. Pourers of floods, the Maruts, Masters of all wealth, they who can ne'er be conquered, make the mountains shake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्नि॒श्रियो॑ म॒रुतो॑ वि॒श्वकृ॑ष्टय॒ आ त्वे॒षमु॒ग्रमव॑ ईमहे व॒यम् ते स्वा॒निनो॑ रु॒द्रिया॑ व॒र्षनि॑र्णिजः सिं॒हा न हे॒षक्र॑तवः सु॒दान॑वः
verses.transliteration: agniśríyo marúto viśvákr̥ṣṭayaḥ-  ā́ tveṣám ugrám áva īmahe vayám  té svāníno rudríyā varṣánirṇijaḥ  siṃhā́ ná heṣákratavaḥ sudā́navaḥ

translation.text: The Maruts, Friends of men, are glorious as the fire: their mighty and resplendent succour we implore. Those storming Sons of Rudra clothed in robes of rain, boon-givers of good gifts, roar as the lions roar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्रातं॑व्रातं ग॒णंग॑णं सुश॒स्तिभि॑र॒ग्नेर्भामं॑ म॒रुता॒मोज॑ ईमहे पृष॑दश्वासो अनव॒भ्ररा॑धसो॒ गन्ता॑रो य॒ज्ञं वि॒दथे॑षु॒ धीराः॑
verses.transliteration: vrā́taṃ-vrātaṃ gaṇáṃ-gaṇaṃ suśastíbhir  agnér bhā́mam marútām ója īmahe  pŕ̥ṣadaśvāso anavabhrárādhasaḥ-  gántāro yajñáṃ vidátheṣu dhī́rāḥ

translation.text: We, band on band and troop following troop, entreat with fair lauds Agni's splendour and the Maruts' might, With spotted deer for steeds, with wealth that never fails, they, wise Ones, come to sacrifice at our gatherings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर॑स्मि॒ जन्म॑ना जा॒तवे॑दा घृ॒तं मे॒ चक्षु॑र॒मृतं॑ म आ॒सन् अ॒र्कस्त्रि॒धातू॒ रज॑सो वि॒मानोऽज॑स्रो घ॒र्मो ह॒विर॑स्मि॒ नाम॑
verses.transliteration: agnír asmi jánmanā jātávedāḥ-  ghr̥tám me cákṣur amŕ̥tam ma āsán  arkás tridhā́tū rájaso vimā́naḥ-  -ájasro gharmó havír asmi nā́ma

translation.text: Agni am I who know, by birth, all creatures. Mine eye is butter, in my mouth is nectar. I am light threefold, measurer of the region exhaustless heat am I, named burnt-oblation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रि॒भिः प॒वित्रै॒रपु॑पो॒द्ध्य१॒॑र्कं हृ॒दा म॒तिं ज्योति॒रनु॑ प्रजा॒नन् वर्षि॑ष्ठं॒ रत्न॑मकृत स्व॒धाभि॒रादिद्द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी पर्य॑पश्यत्
verses.transliteration: tribhíḥ pavítrair ápupod dhy àrkáṃ  hr̥dā́ matíṃ jyótir ánu prajānán  várṣiṣṭhaṃ rátnam akr̥ta svadhā́bhir  ā́d íd dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ páry apaśyat

translation.text: Bearing in mind a thought with light accordant, he purified the Sun with three refinings; By his own nature gained the highest treasure, and looked abroad over the earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तधा॑र॒मुत्स॒मक्षी॑यमाणं विप॒श्चितं॑ पि॒तरं॒ वक्त्वा॑नाम् मे॒ळिं मद॑न्तं पि॒त्रोरु॒पस्थे॒ तं रो॑दसी पिपृतं सत्य॒वाच॑म्
verses.transliteration: śatádhāram útsam ákṣīyamāṇaṃ  vipaścítam pitáraṃ váktvānām  meḷím mádantam pitrór upásthe  táṃ rodasī pipr̥taṃ satyavā́cam

translation.text: The Spring that fails not with a hundred streamlets, Father inspired of' prayers that men should utter, The Sparkler, joyous in his Parents' bosorn, -him, the Truth-speaker, sate ye, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वो॒ वाजा॑ अ॒भिद्य॑वो ह॒विष्म॑न्तो घृ॒ताच्या॑ दे॒वाञ्जि॑गाति सुम्न॒युः
verses.transliteration: prá vo vā́jā abhídyavo  havíṣmanto ghr̥tā́cyā  devā́ñ jigāti sumnayúḥ

translation.text: IN ladle dropping oil your food goes in oblation up to heaven, Goes to the Gods in search of bliss.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ईळे॑ अ॒ग्निं वि॑प॒श्चितं॑ गि॒रा य॒ज्ञस्य॒ साध॑नम् श्रु॒ष्टी॒वानं॑ धि॒तावा॑नम्
verses.transliteration: ī́ḷe agníṃ vipaścítaṃ  girā́ yajñásya sā́dhanam  śruṣṭīvā́naṃ dhitā́vānam

translation.text: Agni I laud, the Sage inspired, crowner of sacrifice through song, Who listens and gives bounteous gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ श॒केम॑ ते व॒यं यमं॑ दे॒वस्य॑ वा॒जिनः॑ अति॒ द्वेषां॑सि तरेम
verses.transliteration: ágne śakéma te vayáṃ  yámaṃ devásya vājínaḥ  áti dvéṣāṃsi tarema

translation.text: O Agni, if we might obtain control of thee the potent God, Then should we overcome our foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मि॒ध्यमा॑नो अध्व॒रे॒३॒॑ऽग्निः पा॑व॒क ईड्यः॑ शो॒चिष्के॑श॒स्तमी॑महे
verses.transliteration: samidhyámāno adhvaré-  -agníḥ pāvaká ī́ḍyaḥ  śocíṣkeśas tám īmahe

translation.text: Kindled at sacrifices he is Agni, hallower, meet for praise, With flame for hair: to him we seek.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पृ॒थु॒पाजा॒ अम॑र्त्यो घृ॒तनि॑र्णि॒क्स्वा॑हुतः अ॒ग्निर्य॒ज्ञस्य॑ हव्य॒वाट्
verses.transliteration: pr̥thupā́jā ámartyo  ghr̥tánirṇik svā̀hutaḥ  agnír yajñásya havyavā́ṭ

translation.text: Immortal Agni, shining far, enrobed with oil, well worshipped, bears The gifts of sacrifice away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं स॒बाधो॑ य॒तस्रु॑च इ॒त्था धि॒या य॒ज्ञव॑न्तः आ च॑क्रुर॒ग्निमू॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ sabā́dho yatásrucaḥ-  itthā́ dhiyā́ yajñávantaḥ  ā́ cakrur agním ūtáye

translation.text: The priests with ladles lifted up, worshipping here with holy thought, Have brought this Agni for our aid.

verses.sanskrit_deva: होता॑ दे॒वो अम॑र्त्यः पु॒रस्ता॑देति मा॒यया॑ वि॒दथा॑नि प्रचो॒दय॑न्
verses.transliteration: hótā devó ámartyaḥ  purástād eti māyáyā  vidáthāni pracodáyan

translation.text: Immortal, Sacrificer, God, with wondrous power he leads the way, Urging the great assembly on.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒जी वाजे॑षु धीयतेऽध्व॒रेषु॒ प्र णी॑यते विप्रो॑ य॒ज्ञस्य॒ साध॑नः
verses.transliteration: vājī́ vā́jeṣu dhīyate  -adhvaréṣu prá ṇīyate  vípro yajñásya sā́dhanaḥ

translation.text: Strong, he is set on deeds ofstrength. In sacrifices led in front, As Singer he completes the rite.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धि॒या च॑क्रे॒ वरे॑ण्यो भू॒तानां॒ गर्भ॒मा द॑धे दक्ष॑स्य पि॒तरं॒ तना॑
verses.transliteration: dhiyā́ cakre váreṇyo  bhūtā́nāṃ gárbham ā́ dadhe  dákṣasya pitáraṃ tánā

translation.text: Excellent, he was made by thought. The Germ of beings have I gained, Yea, and die Sire of active strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि त्वा॑ दधे॒ वरे॑ण्यं॒ दक्ष॑स्ये॒ळा स॑हस्कृत अग्ने॑ सुदी॒तिमु॒शिज॑म्
verses.transliteration: ní tvā dadhe váreṇyaṃ  dákṣasyeḷā́ sahaskr̥ta  ágne sudītím uśíjam

translation.text: Thee have I stablished, Excellent, O strengthened by the sage's prayer, Thee, Agni, longing, nobly bright.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निं य॒न्तुर॑म॒प्तुर॑मृ॒तस्य॒ योगे॑ व॒नुषः॑ विप्रा॒ वाजैः॒ समि॑न्धते
verses.transliteration: agníṃ yantúram aptúram  r̥tásya yóge vanúṣaḥ  víprā vā́jaiḥ sám indhate

translation.text: Agni, the swift and active One, singers, at time of sacrifice, Eagerly kindle with their food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्जो नपा॑तमध्व॒रे दी॑दि॒वांस॒मुप॒ द्यवि॑ अ॒ग्निमी॑ळे क॒विक्र॑तुम्
verses.transliteration: ūrjó nápātam adhvaré  dīdivā́ṃsam úpa dyávi  agním īḷe kavíkratum

translation.text: Agni the Son of Strength who shines up to the heaven in solemn rites, The wise of heart, I glorify.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ई॒ळेन्यो॑ नम॒स्य॑स्ति॒रस्तमां॑सि दर्श॒तः सम॒ग्निरि॑ध्यते॒ वृषा॑
verses.transliteration: īḷényo namasyàs  tirás támāṃsi darśatáḥ  sám agnír idhyate vŕ̥ṣā

translation.text: Meet to be lauded and adored, showing in beauty through the dark, Agni, the Strong, is kindled well.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृषो॑ अ॒ग्निः समि॑ध्य॒तेऽश्वो॒ न दे॑व॒वाह॑नः तं ह॒विष्म॑न्त ईळते
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣo agníḥ sám idhyate-  -áśvo ná devavā́hanaḥ  táṃ havíṣmanta īḷate

translation.text: Agni is kindled as a bull, like a horsebearer of the Gods: Men with oblations worship him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृष॑णं त्वा व॒यं वृ॑ष॒न्वृष॑णः॒ समि॑धीमहि अग्ने॒ दीद्य॑तं बृ॒हत्
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ tvā vayáṃ vr̥ṣan  vŕ̥ṣaṇaḥ sám idhīmahi  ágne dī́dyatam br̥hát

translation.text: Thee will we kindle as a bull, we who are Bulls ourselves, O Bull. Thee, Agni, shining mightily.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ जु॒षस्व॑ नो ह॒विः पु॑रो॒ळाशं॑ जातवेदः प्रा॒तः॒सा॒वे धि॑यावसो
verses.transliteration: ágne juṣásva no havíḥ  puroḷā́śaṃ jātavedaḥ  prātaḥsāvé dhiyāvaso

translation.text: AGNI who knowest all, accept our offering and the cake of meal, At dawn's libation, rich in prayer!

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रो॒ळा अ॑ग्ने पच॒तस्तुभ्यं॑ वा घा॒ परि॑ष्कृतः तं जु॑षस्व यविष्ठ्य
verses.transliteration: puroḷā́ agne pacatás  túbhyaṃ vā ghā páriṣkr̥taḥ  táṃ juṣasva yaviṣṭhya

translation.text: Agni, the sacrificial cake hath been prepared and dressed for thee: Accept it, O Most Youthful God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ वी॒हि पु॑रो॒ळाश॒माहु॑तं ति॒रोअ॑ह्न्यम् सह॑सः सू॒नुर॑स्यध्व॒रे हि॒तः
verses.transliteration: ágne vīhí puroḷā́śam  ā́hutaṃ tiróahnyam  sáhasaḥ sūnúr asy adhvaré hitáḥ

translation.text: Agni, enjoy the cake of meal and our oblation three days old: Thou, Son of Strength, art stablished at our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: माध्यं॑दिने॒ सव॑ने जातवेदः पुरो॒ळाश॑मि॒ह क॑वे जुषस्व अग्ने॑ य॒ह्वस्य॒ तव॑ भाग॒धेयं॒ न प्र मि॑नन्ति वि॒दथे॑षु॒ धीराः॑
verses.transliteration: mā́dhyaṃdine sávane jātavedaḥ  puroḷā́śam ihá kave juṣasva  ágne yahvásya táva bhāgadhéyaṃ  ná prá minanti vidátheṣu dhī́rāḥ

translation.text: Here at the midday sacrifice enjoy thou the sacrificial cake, wise, Jâtavedas! Agni, the sages in assemblies never minish the portion due to thee the Mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ तृ॒तीये॒ सव॑ने॒ हि कानि॑षः पुरो॒ळाशं॑ सहसः सून॒वाहु॑तम् अथा॑ दे॒वेष्व॑ध्व॒रं वि॑प॒न्यया॒ धा रत्न॑वन्तम॒मृते॑षु॒ जागृ॑विम्
verses.transliteration: ágne tr̥tī́ye sávane hí kā́niṣaḥ  puroḷā́śaṃ sahasaḥ sūnav ā́hutam  áthā devéṣv adhvaráṃ vipanyáyā  dhā́ rátnavantam amŕ̥teṣu jā́gr̥vim

translation.text: O Agni, at the third libation takewith joy the offered cake of sacrifice, thou, Son of Strength. Through skill in song bear to the Gods our sacrifice, watchful and fraught with riches, to Immortal God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ वृधा॒न आहु॑तिं पुरो॒ळाशं॑ जातवेदः जु॒षस्व॑ ति॒रोअ॑ह्न्यम्
verses.transliteration: ágne vr̥dhāná ā́hutim  puroḷā́śaṃ jātavedaḥ  juṣásva tiróahnyam

translation.text: O waxing Agni, knower, thou, of all, accept our gifts, the cake, And that prepared ere yesterday.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्ती॒दम॑धि॒मन्थ॑न॒मस्ति॑ प्र॒जन॑नं कृ॒तम् ए॒तां वि॒श्पत्नी॒मा भ॑रा॒ग्निं म॑न्थाम पू॒र्वथा॑
verses.transliteration: ástīdám adhimánthanam  ásti prajánanaṃ kr̥tám  etā́ṃ viśpátnīm ā́ bhara-  -agním manthāma pūrváthā

translation.text: HERE is the gear for friction, here tinder made ready for the spark. Bring thou the Matron: we will rub Agni in ancient fashion forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒रण्यो॒र्निहि॑तो जा॒तवे॑दा॒ गर्भ॑ इव॒ सुधि॑तो ग॒र्भिणी॑षु दि॒वेदि॑व॒ ईड्यो॑ जागृ॒वद्भि॑र्ह॒विष्म॑द्भिर्मनु॒ष्ये॑भिर॒ग्निः
verses.transliteration: aráṇyor níhito jātávedāḥ-  gárbha iva súdhito garbhíṇīṣu  divé-diva ī́ḍyo jāgr̥vádbhir  havíṣmadbhir manuṣyèbhir agníḥ

translation.text: In the two fire-sticks Jâtavedas lieth, even as the well-set germ in pregnant women, Agni who day by day must be exalted by men who watch and worship with oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त्ता॒नाया॒मव॑ भरा चिकि॒त्वान्त्स॒द्यः प्रवी॑ता॒ वृष॑णं जजान अ॒रु॒षस्तू॑पो॒ रुश॑दस्य॒ पाज॒ इळा॑यास्पु॒त्रो व॒युने॑ऽजनिष्ट
verses.transliteration: uttānā́yām áva bharā cikitvā́n  sadyáḥ právītā vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ jajāna  aruṣástūpo rúśad asya pā́jaḥ-  íḷāyās putró vayúne 'janiṣṭa

translation.text: Lay this with care on that which lies extended: straight hath she borne the Steerwhen made prolific. With his red pillar-radiant is his splendour -in our skilled task is born the Son of Iḷâ.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इळा॑यास्त्वा प॒दे व॒यं नाभा॑ पृथि॒व्या अधि॑ जात॑वेदो॒ नि धी॑म॒ह्यग्ने॑ ह॒व्याय॒ वोळ्ह॑वे
verses.transliteration: íḷāyās tvā padé vayáṃ  nā́bhā pr̥thivyā́ ádhi  jā́tavedo ní dhīmahi-  -ágne havyā́ya vóḷhave

translation.text: In Iḷâ's place we set thee down, upon the central point of earth, That, Agni Jâtavedas, thou mayst bear our offerings to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मन्थ॑ता नरः क॒विमद्व॑यन्तं॒ प्रचे॑तसम॒मृतं॑ सु॒प्रती॑कम् य॒ज्ञस्य॑ के॒तुं प्र॑थ॒मं पु॒रस्ता॑द॒ग्निं न॑रो जनयता सु॒शेव॑म्
verses.transliteration: mánthatā naraḥ kavím ádvayantam  prácetasam amŕ̥taṃ suprátīkam  yajñásya ketúm prathamám purástād  agníṃ naro janayatā suśévam

translation.text: Rub into life, ye men, the Sage, the guileless, Immortal, very wise and fair to look on. O men, bring forth the most propitious Agni, first ensign of the sacrifice to eastward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदी॒ मन्थ॑न्ति बा॒हुभि॒र्वि रो॑च॒तेऽश्वो॒ न वा॒ज्य॑रु॒षो वने॒ष्वा चि॒त्रो न याम॑न्न॒श्विनो॒रनि॑वृतः॒ परि॑ वृण॒क्त्यश्म॑न॒स्तृणा॒ दह॑न्
verses.transliteration: yádī mánthanti bāhúbhir ví rocate-  -áśvo ná vājy àruṣó váneṣv ā́  citró ná yā́mann aśvínor ánivr̥taḥ  pári vr̥ṇakty áśmanas tŕ̥ṇā dáhan

translation.text: When with their arms they rub him straight he shineth forth like a strong courser, red in colour, in the wood. Bright, checkless, as it were upon the Atvins' path, lie passeth by the stones and burneth up the grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जा॒तो अ॒ग्नी रो॑चते॒ चेकि॑तानो वा॒जी विप्रः॑ कविश॒स्तः सु॒दानुः॑ यं दे॒वास॒ ईड्यं॑ विश्व॒विदं॑ हव्य॒वाह॒मद॑धुरध्व॒रेषु॑
verses.transliteration: jātó agnī́ rocate cékitāno  vājī́ vípraḥ kaviśastáḥ sudā́nuḥ  yáṃ devā́sa ī́ḍyaṃ viśvavídaṃ  havyavā́ham ádadhur adhvaréṣu

translation.text: Agni shines forth when born, observant, mighty, the bountiful, the Singar praised by sages; Whom, as adorable and knowing all things, Gods set at solemn rites as offeringbearer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सीद॑ होतः॒ स्व उ॑ लो॒के चि॑कि॒त्वान्त्सा॒दया॑ य॒ज्ञं सु॑कृ॒तस्य॒ योनौ॑ दे॒वा॒वीर्दे॒वान्ह॒विषा॑ यजा॒स्यग्ने॑ बृ॒हद्यज॑माने॒ वयो॑ धाः
verses.transliteration: sī́da hotaḥ svá u loké cikitvā́n  sādáyā yajñáṃ sukr̥tásya yónau  devāvī́r devā́n havíṣā yajāsi-  ágne br̥hád yájamāne váyo dhāḥ

translation.text: Set thee, O Priest, in, thine own place, observant: lay down the sacrifice in the home of worship. Thou, dear to Gods, shalt serve them with oblation: Agni, give long life to the sacrificer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कृ॒णोत॑ धू॒मं वृष॑णं सखा॒योऽस्रे॑धन्त इतन॒ वाज॒मच्छ॑ अ॒यम॒ग्निः पृ॑तना॒षाट् सु॒वीरो॒ येन॑ दे॒वासो॒ अस॑हन्त॒ दस्यू॑न्
verses.transliteration: kr̥ṇóta dhūmáṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ sakhāyaḥ-  -ásredhanta itana vā́jam ácha  ayám agníḥ pr̥tanāṣā́ṭ suvī́ro  yéna devā́so ásahanta dásyūn

translation.text: Raise ye a mighty smoke, my fellow-workers! Ye shall attain to wealth without obstruction. This Agni is the battle-winning Hero by whom the Gods have overcome the Dasyus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं ते॒ योनि॑र्ऋ॒त्वियो॒ यतो॑ जा॒तो अरो॑चथाः तं जा॒नन्न॑ग्न॒ आ सी॒दाथा॑ नो वर्धया॒ गिरः॑
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ te yónir r̥tvíyo  yáto jātó árocathāḥ  táṃ jānánn agna ā́ sīda-  -áthā no vardhayā gíraḥ

translation.text: This is thine ordered place of birth whence sprung to life thou shonest forth. Knowing this, Agni, sit thee down, and prosper thou the songs we sing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तनू॒नपा॑दुच्यते॒ गर्भ॑ आसु॒रो नरा॒शंसो॑ भवति॒ यद्वि॒जाय॑ते मा॒त॒रिश्वा॒ यदमि॑मीत मा॒तरि॒ वात॑स्य॒ सर्गो॑ अभव॒त्सरी॑मणि
verses.transliteration: tánūnápād ucyate gárbha āsuró  nárāśáṃso bhavati yád vijā́yate  mātaríśvā yád ámimīta mātári  vā́tasya sárgo abhavat sárīmaṇi

translation.text: As Germ Celestial he is called Tanûnapât, and Narâṣansa born diffused in varied shape. Formed in his Mother he is Mâtariṣvan; he hath, in his course, become the rapid flight of wind.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒नि॒र्मथा॒ निर्म॑थितः सुनि॒धा निहि॑तः क॒विः अग्ने॑ स्वध्व॒रा कृ॑णु दे॒वान्दे॑वय॒ते य॑ज
verses.transliteration: sunirmáthā nírmathitaḥ  sunidhā́ níhitaḥ kavíḥ  ágne svadhvarā́ kr̥ṇu  devā́n devayaté yaja

translation.text: With strong attrition rubbed to life, laid down with careful hand, a Sage, Agni, make sacrifices good, and for the pious bring the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अजी॑जनन्न॒मृतं॒ मर्त्या॑सोऽस्रे॒माणं॑ त॒रणिं॑ वी॒ळुज॑म्भम् दश॒ स्वसा॑रो अ॒ग्रुवः॑ समी॒चीः पुमां॑सं जा॒तम॒भि सं र॑भन्ते
verses.transliteration: ájījanann amŕ̥tam mártyāso  -asremā́ṇaṃ taráṇiṃ vīḷújambham  dáśa svásāro agrúvaḥ samīcī́ḥ  púmāṃsaṃ jātám abhí sáṃ rabhante

translation.text: Mortals have brought to life the God Immortal, the Conqueror with mighty jaws, unfailing. The sisters ten, unwedded and united, together grasp the Babe, the new-born Infant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र स॒प्तहो॑ता सन॒काद॑रोचत मा॒तुरु॒पस्थे॒ यदशो॑च॒दूध॑नि न नि मि॑षति सु॒रणो॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ यदसु॑रस्य ज॒ठरा॒दजा॑यत
verses.transliteration: prá saptáhotā sanakā́d arocata  mātúr upásthe yád áśocad ū́dhani  ná ní miṣati suráṇo divé-dive  yád ásurasya jaṭhárād ájāyata

translation.text: Served by the seven priests, he shone forth from ancient time, when in his Mother's bosom, in her lap, he glowed. Giving delight each day he closeth not his eye, since from the Asura's body hewas brought to life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒मि॒त्रा॒युधो॑ म॒रुता॑मिव प्र॒याः प्र॑थम॒जा ब्रह्म॑णो॒ विश्व॒मिद्वि॑दुः द्यु॒म्नव॒द्ब्रह्म॑ कुशि॒कास॒ एरि॑र॒ एक॑एको॒ दमे॑ अ॒ग्निं समी॑धिरे
verses.transliteration: amitrāyúdho marútām iva prayā́ḥ  prathamajā́ bráhmaṇo víśvam íd viduḥ  dyumnávad bráhma kuśikā́sa érire-  éka-eko dáme agníṃ sám īdhire

translation.text: Even as the Maruts, onslaughts who attack the foe, those born the first of all knew the full power of prayer. The Kuṣikas have made the glorious hymn ascend, and, each one singly in his home, have kindled fire.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॒द्य त्वा॑ प्रय॒ति य॒ज्ञे अ॒स्मिन्होत॑श्चिकि॒त्वोऽवृ॑णीमही॒ह ध्रु॒वम॑या ध्रु॒वमु॒ताश॑मिष्ठाः प्रजा॒नन्वि॒द्वाँ उप॑ याहि॒ सोम॑म्
verses.transliteration: yád adyá tvā prayatí yajñé asmín  hótaś cikitvó 'vr̥ṇīmahīhá  dhruvám ayā dhruvám utā́śamiṣṭhāḥ  prajānán vidvā́m̐ úpa yāhi sómam

translation.text: As we, O Priest observant, have elected thee this day, what time the solemn sacrifice began, So surely hast thou worshipped, surely hast thou toiled: come thou unto the Soma, wise and knowing all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒च्छन्ति॑ त्वा सो॒म्यासः॒ सखा॑यः सु॒न्वन्ति॒ सोमं॒ दध॑ति॒ प्रयां॑सि तिति॑क्षन्ते अ॒भिश॑स्तिं॒ जना॑ना॒मिन्द्र॒ त्वदा कश्च॒न हि प्र॑के॒तः
verses.transliteration: ichánti tvā somyā́saḥ sákhāyaḥ  sunvánti sómaṃ dádhati práyāṃsi  títikṣante abhíśastiṃ jánānām  índra tvád ā́ káś caná hí praketáḥ

translation.text: THE friends who offer Soma long to find thee: they pour forth Soma and present their viands. They bear unmoved the cursing of the people, for all our wisdom comes from thee, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न ते॑ दू॒रे प॑र॒मा चि॒द्रजां॒स्या तु प्र या॑हि हरिवो॒ हरि॑भ्याम् स्थि॒राय॒ वृष्णे॒ सव॑ना कृ॒तेमा यु॒क्ता ग्रावा॑णः समिधा॒ने अ॒ग्नौ
verses.transliteration: ná te dūré paramā́ cid rájāṃsi-  ā́ tú prá yāhi harivo háribhyām  sthirā́ya vŕ̥ṣṇe sávanā kr̥témā́  yuktā́ grā́vāṇaḥ samidhāné agnaú

translation.text: Not far for thee are mid-air's loftiest regions: start hither, Lord of Bays, with thy Bay Horses. Made for the Firm and Strong are these libations. The pressing-stones are set and fire is kindled.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रः॑ सु॒शिप्रो॑ म॒घवा॒ तरु॑त्रो म॒हाव्रा॑तस्तुविकू॒र्मिर्ऋघा॑वान् यदु॒ग्रो धा बा॑धि॒तो मर्त्ये॑षु॒ क्व१॒॑ त्या ते॑ वृषभ वी॒र्या॑णि
verses.transliteration: índraḥ suśípro maghávā tárutro  mahā́vrātas tuvikūrmír ŕ̥ghāvān  yád ugró dhā́ bādhitó mártyeṣu  kvà tyā́ te vr̥ṣabha vīryā̀ṇi

translation.text: Fair cheeks hath Indra, Maghavan, the Victor, Lord of a great host, Stormer, strong in action. What once thou didst in might when mortals vexed thee,– where now, O Bull, are those thy hero exploits?

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं हि ष्मा॑ च्या॒वय॒न्नच्यु॑ता॒न्येको॑ वृ॒त्रा चर॑सि॒ जिघ्न॑मानः तव॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी पर्व॑ता॒सोऽनु॑ व्र॒ताय॒ निमि॑तेव तस्थुः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ hí ṣmā cyāváyann ácyutāni-  éko vr̥trā́ cárasi jíghnamānaḥ  táva dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ párvatāsaḥ-  -ánu vratā́ya nímiteva tasthuḥ

translation.text: For, overthrowing what hath ne'er been shaken, thou goest forth alone destroying Vr̥itras. For him who followeth thy Law the mountains and heaven and earth stand as if firmly stablished.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒ताभ॑ये पुरुहूत॒ श्रवो॑भि॒रेको॑ दृ॒ळ्हम॑वदो वृत्र॒हा सन् इ॒मे चि॑दिन्द्र॒ रोद॑सी अपा॒रे यत्सं॑गृ॒भ्णा म॑घवन्का॒शिरित्ते॑
verses.transliteration: utā́bhaye puruhūta śrávobhir  éko dr̥ḷhám avado vr̥trahā́ sán  imé cid indra ródasī apāré  yát saṃgr̥bhṇā́ maghavan kāśír ít te

translation.text: Yea, Much-invoked! in safety through thy glories alone thou speakest truth as Vr̥itra's slayer. E'en these two boundless worlds to thee, O Indra, what time thou graspest them, are but a handful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सू त॑ इन्द्र प्र॒वता॒ हरि॑भ्यां॒ प्र ते॒ वज्रः॑ प्रमृ॒णन्ने॑तु॒ शत्रू॑न् ज॒हि प्र॑ती॒चो अ॑नू॒चः परा॑चो॒ विश्वं॑ स॒त्यं कृ॑णुहि वि॒ष्टम॑स्तु
verses.transliteration: prá sū́ ta indra pravátā háribhyām  prá te vájraḥ pramr̥ṇánn etu śátrūn  jahí pratīcó anūcáḥ párāco  víśvaṃ satyáṃ kr̥ṇuhi viṣṭám astu

translation.text: Forthwith thy Bay steeds down the steep, O Indra, forth, crushing foemen, go thy bolt of thunder! Slay those who meet thee, those who flee, who follow: make all thy promise true; be all completed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्मै॒ धायु॒रद॑धा॒ मर्त्या॒याभ॑क्तं चिद्भजते गे॒ह्यं१॒॑ सः भ॒द्रा त॑ इन्द्र सुम॒तिर्घृ॒ताची॑ स॒हस्र॑दाना पुरुहूत रा॒तिः
verses.transliteration: yásmai dhā́yur ádadhā mártyāya-  -ábhaktaṃ cid bhajate gehyàṃ sáḥ  bhadrā́ ta indra sumatír ghr̥tā́cī  sahásradānā puruhūta rātíḥ

translation.text: The man to whom thou givest as Provider enjoys domestic plenty undivided. Blest, Indra, is thy favour dropping fatness: thy worship, Much-invoked! brings gifts in thousands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हदा॑नुं पुरुहूत क्षि॒यन्त॑मह॒स्तमि॑न्द्र॒ सं पि॑ण॒क्कुणा॑रुम् अ॒भि वृ॒त्रं वर्ध॑मानं॒ पिया॑रुम॒पाद॑मिन्द्र त॒वसा॑ जघन्थ
verses.transliteration: sahádānum puruhūta kṣiyántam  ahastám indra sám piṇak kúṇārum  abhí vr̥tráṃ várdhamānam píyārum  apā́dam indra tavásā jaghantha

translation.text: Thou, Indra, Much-invoked! didst crush to pieces Kuṇâru handless fiend who dwelt with Dânu. Thou with might, Indra, smotest dead the scorner, the footless Vr̥itra as he waxed in vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि सा॑म॒नामि॑षि॒रामि॑न्द्र॒ भूमिं॑ म॒हीम॑पा॒रां सद॑ने ससत्थ अस्त॑भ्ना॒द्द्यां वृ॑ष॒भो अ॒न्तरि॑क्ष॒मर्ष॒न्त्वाप॒स्त्वये॒ह प्रसू॑ताः
verses.transliteration: ní sāmanā́m iṣirā́m indra bhū́mim  mahī́m apārā́ṃ sádane sasattha  ástabhnād dyā́ṃ vr̥ṣabhó antárikṣam  árṣantv ā́pas tváyehá prásūtāḥ

translation.text: Thou hast established in her seat, O Indra, the level earth, vast, vigorous, unbounded. The Bull hath propped the heaven and air's mid-region. By thee sent onward let the floods flow hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ला॒तृ॒णो व॒ल इ॑न्द्र व्र॒जो गोः पु॒रा हन्तो॒र्भय॑मानो॒ व्या॑र सु॒गान्प॒थो अ॑कृणोन्नि॒रजे॒ गाः प्राव॒न्वाणीः॑ पुरुहू॒तं धम॑न्तीः
verses.transliteration: alātr̥ṇó valá indra vrajó góḥ  purā́ hántor bháyamāno vy ā̀ra  sugā́n pathó akr̥ṇon niráje gā́ḥ  prā́van vā́ṇīḥ puruhūtáṃ dhámantīḥ

translation.text: He who withheld the kine, in silence I yielded in fear before thy blow, O Indra. He made paths easy to drive forth the cattle. Loud-breathing praises helped the Much-invoked One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एको॒ द्वे वसु॑मती समी॒ची इन्द्र॒ आ प॑प्रौ पृथि॒वीमु॒त द्याम् उ॒तान्तरि॑क्षाद॒भि नः॑ समी॒क इ॒षो र॒थीः स॒युजः॑ शूर॒ वाजा॑न्
verses.transliteration: éko dvé vásumatī samīcī́  índra ā́ paprau pr̥thivī́m utá dyā́m  utā́ntárikṣād abhí naḥ samīké-  iṣó rathī́ḥ sayújaḥ śūra vā́jān

translation.text: Indra alone filled full the earth and heaven, the Pair who meet together, rich in treasures. Yea, bring thou near us from the air's mid-region strength, on thy car, and wholesome food, O Hero.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दिशः॒ सूर्यो॒ न मि॑नाति॒ प्रदि॑ष्टा दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ हर्य॑श्वप्रसूताः सं यदान॒ळध्व॑न॒ आदिदश्वै॑र्वि॒मोच॑नं कृणुते॒ तत्त्व॑स्य
verses.transliteration: díśaḥ sū́ryo ná mināti prádiṣṭāḥ-  divé-dive háryaśvaprasūtāḥ  sáṃ yád ā́naḷ ádhvana ā́d íd áśvair  vimócanaṃ kr̥ṇute tát tv àsya

translation.text: Sûrya transgresses not the ordered limits set daily by the Lord of Tawny Coursers. When to the goal he comes, his journey ended, his Steeds he looses: this is Indra's doing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दिदृ॑क्षन्त उ॒षसो॒ याम॑न्न॒क्तोर्वि॒वस्व॑त्या॒ महि॑ चि॒त्रमनी॑कम् विश्वे॑ जानन्ति महि॒ना यदागा॒दिन्द्र॑स्य॒ कर्म॒ सुकृ॑ता पु॒रूणि॑
verses.transliteration: dídr̥kṣanta uṣáso yā́mann aktór  vivásvatyā máhi citrám ánīkam  víśve jānanti mahinā́ yád ā́gād  índrasya kárma súkr̥tā purū́ṇi

translation.text: Men gladly in the course of night would look on the broad bright front of the refulgent Morning; And all acknowledge, when she comes in glory, the manifold and goodly works of Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: महि॒ ज्योति॒र्निहि॑तं व॒क्षणा॑स्वा॒मा प॒क्वं च॑रति॒ बिभ्र॑ती॒ गौः विश्वं॒ स्वाद्म॒ सम्भृ॑तमु॒स्रिया॑यां॒ यत्सी॒मिन्द्रो॒ अद॑धा॒द्भोज॑नाय
verses.transliteration: máhi jyótir níhitaṃ vakṣáṇāsu-  āmā́ pakváṃ carati bíbhratī gaúḥ  víśvaṃ svā́dma sámbhr̥tam usríyāyāṃ  yát sīm índro ádadhād bhójanāya

translation.text: A mighty splendour rests upon her bosom: bearing ripe milk the Cow, unripe, advances. All sweetness is collected in the Heifer, sweetness which Indra made for our enjoyment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ दृह्य॑ यामको॒शा अ॑भूवन्य॒ज्ञाय॑ शिक्ष गृण॒ते सखि॑भ्यः दु॒र्मा॒यवो॑ दु॒रेवा॒ मर्त्या॑सो निष॒ङ्गिणो॑ रि॒पवो॒ हन्त्वा॑सः
verses.transliteration: índra dŕ̥hya yāmakośā́ abhūvan  yajñā́ya śikṣa gr̥ṇaté sákhibhyaḥ  durmāyávo durévā mártyāso  niṣaṅgíṇo ripávo hántvāsaḥ

translation.text: Barring the way they come. Be firm, O Indra; aid friends to sacrifice and him who singeth. These must be slain by thee, malignant mortals, armed with ill arts, our quiverbearing foemen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं घोषः॑ शृण्वेऽव॒मैर॒मित्रै॑र्ज॒ही न्ये॑ष्व॒शनिं॒ तपि॑ष्ठाम् वृ॒श्चेम॒धस्ता॒द्वि रु॑जा॒ सह॑स्व ज॒हि रक्षो॑ मघवन्र॒न्धय॑स्व
verses.transliteration: sáṃ ghóṣaḥ śr̥ṇve 'vamaír amítrair  jahī́ ny èṣv aśániṃ tápiṣṭhām  vr̥ścém adhástād ví rujā sáhasva  jahí rákṣo maghavan randháyasva

translation.text: A cry is beard from enemies most near us: against them send thy fiercest-flaming weapon. Rend them from under, crush them and subdue them. Slay, Maghavan, and make the fiends our booty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद्वृ॑ह॒ रक्षः॑ स॒हमू॑लमिन्द्र वृ॒श्चा मध्यं॒ प्रत्यग्रं॑ शृणीहि आ कीव॑तः सल॒लूकं॑ चकर्थ ब्रह्म॒द्विषे॒ तपु॑षिं हे॒तिम॑स्य
verses.transliteration: úd vr̥ha rákṣaḥ sahámūlam indra  vr̥ścā́ mádhyam práty ágraṃ śr̥ṇīhi  ā́ kī́vataḥ salalū́kaṃ cakartha  brahmadvíṣe tápuṣiṃ hetím asya

translation.text: Root up the race of Raksasas, O Indra rend it in front and crush it in the middle. How long hast thou bebaved as one who wavers? Cast thy hot dart at him who hates devotion:

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒स्तये॑ वा॒जिभि॑श्च प्रणेतः॒ सं यन्म॒हीरिष॑ आ॒सत्सि॑ पू॒र्वीः रा॒यो व॒न्तारो॑ बृह॒तः स्या॑मा॒स्मे अ॑स्तु॒ भग॑ इन्द्र प्र॒जावा॑न्
verses.transliteration: svastáye vājíbhiś ca praṇetaḥ  sáṃ yán mahī́r íṣa āsátsi pūrvī́ḥ  rāyó vantā́ro br̥hatáḥ syāma-  -asmé astu bhága indra prajā́vān

translation.text: When borne by strong Steeds for our weal, O Leader, thou seatest thee at many noble viands. May we be winners of abundant riches. May Indra be our wealth with store of children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ भर॒ भग॑मिन्द्र द्यु॒मन्तं॒ नि ते॑ दे॒ष्णस्य॑ धीमहि प्ररे॒के ऊ॒र्व इ॑व पप्रथे॒ कामो॑ अ॒स्मे तमा पृ॑ण वसुपते॒ वसू॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ no bhara bhágam indra dyumántaṃ  ní te deṣṇásya dhīmahi prareké  ūrvá iva paprathe kā́mo asmé  tám ā́ pr̥ṇa vasupate vásūnām

translation.text: Bestow on us resplendent wealth. O Indra let us enjoy thine overflow of bounty. Wide as a sea our longing hath expanded, fulfil it, O thou Treasure-Lord of treasures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं कामं॑ मन्दया॒ गोभि॒रश्वै॑श्च॒न्द्रव॑ता॒ राध॑सा प॒प्रथ॑श्च स्व॒र्यवो॑ म॒तिभि॒स्तुभ्यं॒ विप्रा॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ वाहः॑ कुशि॒कासो॑ अक्रन्
verses.transliteration: imáṃ kā́mam mandayā góbhir áśvaiś  candrávatā rā́dhasā papráthaś ca  svaryávo matíbhis túbhyaṃ víprāḥ-  índrāya vā́haḥ kuśikā́so akran

translation.text: With kine and horses satisfy this longing with very splendid bounty skill extend it. Seeking the light, with hymns to thee, O Indra, Kuṣikas have brought their gift, the singers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ गो॒त्रा द॑र्दृहि गोपते॒ गाः सम॒स्मभ्यं॑ स॒नयो॑ यन्तु॒ वाजाः॑ दि॒वक्षा॑ असि वृषभ स॒त्यशु॑ष्मो॒ऽस्मभ्यं॒ सु म॑घवन्बोधि गो॒दाः
verses.transliteration: ā́ no gotrā́ dardr̥hi gopate gā́ḥ  sám asmábhyaṃ sanáyo yantu vā́jāḥ  divákṣā asi vr̥ṣabha satyáśuṣmo  -asmábhyaṃ sú maghavan bodhi godā́ḥ

translation.text: Lord of the kine, burst the kine's stable open: cows shall be ours, and strength that wins the booty. Hero, whose might is true, thy home is heaven: to us, O Maghavan, grant gifts of cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram  asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau  śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu  ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām

translation.text: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शास॒द्वह्नि॑र्दुहि॒तुर्न॒प्त्यं॑ गाद्वि॒द्वाँ ऋ॒तस्य॒ दीधि॑तिं सप॒र्यन् पि॒ता यत्र॑ दुहि॒तुः सेक॑मृ॒ञ्जन्त्सं श॒ग्म्ये॑न॒ मन॑सा दध॒न्वे
verses.transliteration: śā́sad váhnir duhitúr naptyàṃ gād  vidvā́m̐ r̥tásya dī́dhitiṃ saparyán  pitā́ yátra duhitúḥ sékam r̥ñján  sáṃ śagmyèna mánasā dadhanvé

translation.text: WISE, teaching, following the thought of Order, the sonless gained a grandson from his daughter. Fain, as a sire, to see his child prolific, he sped to meet her with an eager spirit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न जा॒मये॒ तान्वो॑ रि॒क्थमा॑रैक्च॒कार॒ गर्भं॑ सनि॒तुर्नि॒धान॑म् यदी॑ मा॒तरो॑ ज॒नय॑न्त॒ वह्नि॑म॒न्यः क॒र्ता सु॒कृतो॑र॒न्य ऋ॒न्धन्
verses.transliteration: ná jāmáye tā́nvo rikthám āraik  cakā́ra gárbhaṃ sanitúr nidhā́nam  yádī mātáro janáyanta váhnim  anyáḥ kartā́ sukŕ̥tor anyá r̥ndhán

translation.text: The Son left not his portion to the brother, he made a home to hold him who should gain, it. What time his Parents gave the Priest his being, of the good pair one acted, one promoted.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर्ज॑ज्ञे जु॒ह्वा॒३॒॑ रेज॑मानो म॒हस्पु॒त्राँ अ॑रु॒षस्य॑ प्र॒यक्षे॑ म॒हान्गर्भो॒ मह्या जा॒तमे॑षां म॒ही प्र॒वृद्धर्य॑श्वस्य य॒ज्ञैः
verses.transliteration: agnír jajñe juhvā̀ réjamāno  mahás putrā́m̐ aruṣásya prayákṣe  mahā́n gárbho máhy ā́ jātám eṣām  mahī́ pravŕ̥d dháryaśvasya yajñaíḥ

translation.text: Agni was born trembling with tongue that flickered, so that the Red's great children should be honoured. Great is their germ, that born of them is mighty, great the Bays' Lord's approach through sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि जैत्री॑रसचन्त स्पृधा॒नं महि॒ ज्योति॒स्तम॑सो॒ निर॑जानन् तं जा॑न॒तीः प्रत्युदा॑यन्नु॒षासः॒ पति॒र्गवा॑मभव॒देक॒ इन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: abhí jaítrīr asacanta spr̥dhānám  máhi jyótis támaso nír ajānan  táṃ jānatī́ḥ práty úd āyann uṣā́saḥ  pátir gávām abhavad éka índraḥ

translation.text: Conquering bands upon the Warrior waited: they recognized great light from out the darkness. The conscious Dawns went forth to meet his coming, and the sole Master of the kine was Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वी॒ळौ स॒तीर॒भि धीरा॑ अतृन्दन्प्रा॒चाहि॑न्व॒न्मन॑सा स॒प्त विप्राः॑ विश्वा॑मविन्दन्प॒थ्या॑मृ॒तस्य॑ प्रजा॒नन्नित्ता नम॒सा वि॑वेश
verses.transliteration: vīḷaú satī́r abhí dhī́rā atr̥ndan  prācā́hinvan mánasā saptá víprāḥ  víśvām avindan pathyā̀m r̥tásya  prajānánn ít tā́ námasā́ viveśa

translation.text: The sages freed them from their firmbuilt prison: the seven priests drove them forward with their spirit. All holy Order's pathway they discovered he, full of knowledge, shared these deeds through worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒दद्यदी॑ स॒रमा॑ रु॒ग्णमद्रे॒र्महि॒ पाथः॑ पू॒र्व्यं स॒ध्र्य॑क्कः अग्रं॑ नयत्सु॒पद्यक्ष॑राणा॒मच्छा॒ रवं॑ प्रथ॒मा जा॑न॒ती गा॑त्
verses.transliteration: vidád yádī sarámā rugṇám ádrer  máhi pā́thaḥ pūrvyáṃ sadhryàk kaḥ  ágraṃ nayat supády ákṣarāṇām  áchā rávam prathamā́ jānatī́ gāt

translation.text: When Saramâ had found the mountain's fissure, that vast and ancient place she plundered thoroughly. In the floods' van she led them forth, light-footed: she who well knew came first unto their lowing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग॑च्छदु॒ विप्र॑तमः सखी॒यन्नसू॑दयत्सु॒कृते॒ गर्भ॒मद्रिः॑ स॒सान॒ मर्यो॒ युव॑भिर्मख॒स्यन्नथा॑भव॒दङ्गि॑राः स॒द्यो अर्च॑न्
verses.transliteration: ágachad u vípratamaḥ sakhīyánn  ásūdayat sukŕ̥te gárbham ádriḥ  sasā́na máryo yúvabhir makhasyánn  áthābhavad áṅgirāḥ sadyó árcan

translation.text: Longing for friendship came the noblest singer: the hill poured forth its treasure for the pious. The Hero with young followers fought and conquered, and straightway Angiras was singing praises,

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒तःस॑तः प्रति॒मानं॑ पुरो॒भूर्विश्वा॑ वेद॒ जनि॑मा॒ हन्ति॒ शुष्ण॑म् प्र णो॑ दि॒वः प॑द॒वीर्ग॒व्युरर्च॒न्त्सखा॒ सखीँ॑रमुञ्च॒न्निर॑व॒द्यात्
verses.transliteration: satáḥ-sataḥ pratimā́nam purobhū́r  víśvā veda jánimā hánti śúṣṇam  prá ṇo diváḥ padavī́r gavyúr árcan  sákhā sákhīm̐r amuñcan nír avadyā́t

translation.text: Peer of each noble thing, yea, all excelling, all creatures doth he know, he slayeth Ṣushṇa. Our leader, fain for war, singing from heaven, as Friend he saved his lovers from dishonour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि ग॑व्य॒ता मन॑सा सेदुर॒र्कैः कृ॑ण्वा॒नासो॑ अमृत॒त्वाय॑ गा॒तुम् इ॒दं चि॒न्नु सद॑नं॒ भूर्ये॑षां॒ येन॒ मासाँ॒ असि॑षासन्नृ॒तेन॑
verses.transliteration: ní gavyatā́ mánasā sedur arkaíḥ  kr̥ṇvānā́so amr̥tatvā́ya gātúm  idáṃ cin nú sádanam bhū́ry eṣāṃ  yéna mā́sām̐ ásiṣāsann r̥téna

translation.text: They sate them down with spirit fain for booty, making with hymns a way to life eternal. And this is still their place of frequent session, whereby they sought to gain the months through Order.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒म्पश्य॑माना अमदन्न॒भि स्वं पयः॑ प्र॒त्नस्य॒ रेत॑सो॒ दुघा॑नाः वि रोद॑सी अतप॒द्घोष॑ एषां जा॒ते नि॒ष्ठामद॑धु॒र्गोषु॑ वी॒रान्
verses.transliteration: sampáśyamānā amadann abhí svám  páyaḥ pratnásya rétaso dúghānāḥ  ví ródasī atapad ghóṣa eṣāṃ  jāté niṣṭhā́m ádadhur góṣu vīrā́n

translation.text: Drawing the milk of ancient seed prolific, they joyed as they beheld their own possession. Their shout of triumph heated earth and heaven. When the kine showed, they bade the heroes rouse them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स जा॒तेभि॑र्वृत्र॒हा सेदु॑ ह॒व्यैरुदु॒स्रिया॑ असृज॒दिन्द्रो॑ अ॒र्कैः उ॒रू॒च्य॑स्मै घृ॒तव॒द्भर॑न्ती॒ मधु॒ स्वाद्म॑ दुदुहे॒ जेन्या॒ गौः
verses.transliteration: sá jātébhir vr̥trahā́ séd u havyaír  úd usríyā asr̥jad índro arkaíḥ  urūcy àsmai ghr̥távad bhárantī  mádhu svā́dma duduhe jényā gaúḥ

translation.text: Indra drove forth the kine, that Vr̥itra-slayer, while hymns of praise rose up and gifts were offered. For him the Cow, noble and far-extending, poured pleasant juices, bringing oil and sweetness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पि॒त्रे चि॑च्चक्रुः॒ सद॑नं॒ सम॑स्मै॒ महि॒ त्विषी॑मत्सु॒कृतो॒ वि हि ख्यन् वि॒ष्क॒भ्नन्तः॒ स्कम्भ॑नेना॒ जनि॑त्री॒ आसी॑ना ऊ॒र्ध्वं र॑भ॒सं वि मि॑न्वन्
verses.transliteration: pitré cic cakruḥ sádanaṃ sám asmai  máhi tvíṣīmat sukŕ̥to ví hí khyán  viṣkabhnánta skámbhanenā jánitrī  ā́sīnā ūrdhváṃ rabhasáṃ ví minvan

translation.text: They made a mansion for their Father, deftly provided him a great and glorious dwelling; With firm support parted and stayed the Parents, and, sitting, fixed him there erected, mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒ही यदि॑ धि॒षणा॑ शि॒श्नथे॒ धात्स॑द्यो॒वृधं॑ वि॒भ्वं१॒॑ रोद॑स्योः गिरो॒ यस्मि॑न्ननव॒द्याः स॑मी॒चीर्विश्वा॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ तवि॑षी॒रनु॑त्ताः
verses.transliteration: mahī́ yádi dhiṣáṇā śiśnáthe dhā́t  sadyovŕ̥dhaṃ vibhvàṃ ródasyoḥ  gíro yásminn anavadyā́ḥ samīcī́r  víśvā índrāya táviṣīr ánuttāḥ

translation.text: What time the ample chalice had impelled him, swift waxing, vast, to pierce the earth and heaven,– Him in whom blameless songs are all united: all powers invincible belong to Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मह्या ते॑ स॒ख्यं व॑श्मि श॒क्तीरा वृ॑त्र॒घ्ने नि॒युतो॑ यन्ति पू॒र्वीः महि॑ स्तो॒त्रमव॒ आग॑न्म सू॒रेर॒स्माकं॒ सु म॑घवन्बोधि गो॒पाः
verses.transliteration: máhy ā́ te sakhyáṃ vaśmi śaktī́r  ā́ vr̥traghné niyúto yanti pūrvī́ḥ  máhi stotrám áva ā́ganma sūrér  asmā́kaṃ sú maghavan bodhi gopā́ḥ

translation.text: I crave thy powers, I crave thy mighty friendship: full many a team goes to the Vr̥itra-slayer. Great is the laud, we seek the Princes' favour. Be thou, O Maghavan, our guard and keeper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: महि॒ क्षेत्रं॑ पु॒रु श्च॒न्द्रं वि॑वि॒द्वानादित्सखि॑भ्यश्च॒रथं॒ समै॑रत् इन्द्रो॒ नृभि॑रजन॒द्दीद्या॑नः सा॒कं सूर्य॑मु॒षसं॑ गा॒तुम॒ग्निम्
verses.transliteration: máhi kṣétram purú ścandráṃ vividvā́n  ā́d ít sákhibhyaś caráthaṃ sám airat  índro nŕ̥bhir ajanad dī́dyānaḥ  sākáṃ sū́ryam uṣásaṃ gātúm agním

translation.text: He, having found great, splendid, rich dominion, sent life and motion to his friends and lovers. Indra who shone together with the Heroes begot the song, the fire, and Sun and Morning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒पश्चि॑दे॒ष वि॒भ्वो॒३॒॑ दमू॑नाः॒ प्र स॒ध्रीची॑रसृजद्वि॒श्वश्च॑न्द्राः मध्वः॑ पुना॒नाः क॒विभिः॑ प॒वित्रै॒र्द्युभि॑र्हिन्वन्त्य॒क्तुभि॒र्धनु॑त्रीः
verses.transliteration: apáś cid eṣá vibhvò dámūnāḥ  prá sadhrī́cīr asr̥jad viśváścandrāḥ  mádhvaḥ punānā́ḥ kavíbhiḥ pavítrair  dyúbhir hinvanty aktúbhir dhánutrīḥ

translation.text: Vast, the House-Friend, he set the waters flowing, all-lucid, widely spread, that move together. By the wise cleansings of the meath made holy, through days, and nights they speed the swift streams onward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॑ कृ॒ष्णे वसु॑धिती जिहाते उ॒भे सूर्य॑स्य मं॒हना॒ यज॑त्रे परि॒ यत्ते॑ महि॒मानं॑ वृ॒जध्यै॒ सखा॑य इन्द्र॒ काम्या॑ ऋजि॒प्याः
verses.transliteration: ánu kr̥ṣṇé vásudhitī jihāte  ubhé sū́ryasya maṃhánā yájatre  pári yát te mahimā́naṃ vr̥jádhyai  sákhāya indra kā́myā r̥jipyā́ḥ

translation.text: To thee proceed the dark, the treasure-holders, both of them sanctified by Sûrya's bounty. The while thy ovely storming Friends, O Indra, fail to attain the measure of thy greatness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पति॑र्भव वृत्रहन्त्सू॒नृता॑नां गि॒रां वि॒श्वायु॑र्वृष॒भो व॑यो॒धाः आ नो॑ गहि स॒ख्येभिः॑ शि॒वेभि॑र्म॒हान्म॒हीभि॑रू॒तिभिः॑ सर॒ण्यन्
verses.transliteration: pátir bhava vr̥trahan sūnŕ̥tānāṃ  girā́ṃ viśvā́yur vr̥ṣabhó vayodhā́ḥ  ā́ no gahi sakhyébhiḥ śivébhir  mahā́n mahī́bhir ūtíbhiḥ saraṇyán

translation.text: Be Lord of joyous songs, O Vr̥itra-slayer, Bull dear to all, who gives the power of living. Come unto us with thine auspicious friendship, hastening, Mighty One, with mighty succours.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तम॑ङ्गिर॒स्वन्नम॑सा सप॒र्यन्नव्यं॑ कृणोमि॒ सन्य॑से पुरा॒जाम् द्रुहो॒ वि या॑हि बहु॒ला अदे॑वीः॒ स्व॑श्च नो मघवन्त्सा॒तये॑ धाः
verses.transliteration: tám aṅgirasván námasā saparyán  návyaṃ kr̥ṇomi sányase purājā́m  drúho ví yāhi bahulā́ ádevīḥ  svàś ca no maghavan sātáye dhāḥ

translation.text: Like Angiras I honour him with worship, and renovate old song for him the Ancient. Chase thou the many godless evil creatures, and give us, Maghavan, heaven's light to help m.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मिहः॑ पाव॒काः प्रत॑ता अभूवन्त्स्व॒स्ति नः॑ पिपृहि पा॒रमा॑साम् इन्द्र॒ त्वं र॑थि॒रः पा॑हि नो रि॒षो म॒क्षूम॑क्षू कृणुहि गो॒जितो॑ नः
verses.transliteration: míhaḥ pāvakā́ḥ prátatā abhūvan  svastí naḥ pipr̥hi pārám āsām  índra tváṃ rathiráḥ pāhi no riṣó  makṣū́-makṣū kr̥ṇuhi gojíto naḥ

translation.text: Far forth are spread the purifying waters convey thou us across them unto safety. Save us, our Charioteer, from harm, O Indra, soon, very soon, make us win spoil of cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अदे॑दिष्ट वृत्र॒हा गोप॑ति॒र्गा अ॒न्तः कृ॒ष्णाँ अ॑रु॒षैर्धाम॑भिर्गात् प्र सू॒नृता॑ दि॒शमा॑न ऋ॒तेन॒ दुर॑श्च॒ विश्वा॑ अवृणो॒दप॒ स्वाः
verses.transliteration: ádediṣṭa vr̥trahā́ gópatir gā́ḥ-  antáḥ kr̥ṣṇā́m̐ aruṣaír dhā́mabhir gāt  prá sūnŕ̥tā diśámāna r̥téna  dúraś ca víśvā avr̥ṇod ápa svā́ḥ

translation.text: His kine their Lord hath shown, e'en Vr̥itra's slayer, through the black hosts he passed with red attendants. Teaching us pleasant things by holy Order, to, us hath he thrown open all his portals.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram  asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau  śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu  ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām

translation.text: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered. The Strong who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ सोमं॑ सोमपते॒ पिबे॒मं माध्यं॑दिनं॒ सव॑नं॒ चारु॒ यत्ते॑ प्र॒प्रुथ्या॒ शिप्रे॑ मघवन्नृजीषिन्वि॒मुच्या॒ हरी॑ इ॒ह मा॑दयस्व
verses.transliteration: índra sómaṃ somapate píbemám  mā́dhyaṃdinaṃ sávanaṃ cā́ru yát te  praprúthyā śípre maghavann r̥jīṣin  vimúcyā hárī ihá mādayasva

translation.text: DRINK thou this Soma, Indra, Lord of Soma; drink thou the draught of noonday which thou Iovest. Puffing thy cheeks, impetuous, liberal Giver, here loose thy two Bay Horses and rejoice thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गवा॑शिरं म॒न्थिन॑मिन्द्र शु॒क्रं पिबा॒ सोमं॑ ररि॒मा ते॒ मदा॑य ब्र॒ह्म॒कृता॒ मारु॑तेना ग॒णेन॑ स॒जोषा॑ रु॒द्रैस्तृ॒पदा वृ॑षस्व
verses.transliteration: gávāśiram manthínam indra śukrám  píbā sómaṃ rarimā́ te mádāya  brahmakŕ̥tā mā́rutenā gaṇéna  sajóṣā rudraís tr̥pád ā́ vr̥ṣasva

translation.text: Quaff it pure, meal-blent, mixt with milk, O Indra; we have poured forth the Soma for thy rapture. Knit with the prayer-fulfilling band of Maruts, yea, with the Rudras, drink till thou art sated;

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये ते॒ शुष्मं॒ ये तवि॑षी॒मव॑र्ध॒न्नर्च॑न्त इन्द्र म॒रुत॑स्त॒ ओजः॑ माध्यं॑दिने॒ सव॑ने वज्रहस्त॒ पिबा॑ रु॒द्रेभिः॒ सग॑णः सुशिप्र
verses.transliteration: yé te śúṣmaṃ yé táviṣīm ávardhann  árcanta indra marútas ta ójaḥ  mā́dhyaṃdine sávane vajrahasta  píbā rudrébhiḥ ságaṇaḥ suśipra

translation.text: Those who gave increase to thy strength and vigour; the Maruts singing forth thy might, O Indra. Drink thou, O fair of cheek, whose hand wields thunder, with Rudras banded, at our noon libation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त इन्न्व॑स्य॒ मधु॑मद्विविप्र॒ इन्द्र॑स्य॒ शर्धो॑ म॒रुतो॒ य आस॑न् येभि॑र्वृ॒त्रस्ये॑षि॒तो वि॒वेदा॑म॒र्मणो॒ मन्य॑मानस्य॒ मर्म॑
verses.transliteration: tá ín nv àsya mádhumad vivipre-  índrasya śárdho marúto yá ā́san  yébhir vr̥trásyeṣitó vivéda-  -amarmáṇo mányamānasya márma

translation.text: They, even the Maruts who were there, excited with song the meath-created strength of Indra. By them impelled to act he reached the vitals Of Vr̥itra, though he deemed that none might wound him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒नु॒ष्वदि॑न्द्र॒ सव॑नं जुषा॒णः पिबा॒ सोमं॒ शश्व॑ते वी॒र्या॑य स आ व॑वृत्स्व हर्यश्व य॒ज्ञैः स॑र॒ण्युभि॑र॒पो अर्णा॑ सिसर्षि
verses.transliteration: manuṣvád indra sávanaṃ juṣāṇáḥ  píbā sómaṃ śáśvate vīryā̀ya  sá ā́ vavr̥tsva haryaśva yajñaíḥ  saraṇyúbhir apó árṇā sisarṣi

translation.text: Pleased, like a man, with our libation, Indra, drink, for enduring hero might, the Soma. Lord of Bays, moved by sacrifice come hither: thou with the Swift Ones stirrest floods and waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॒पो यद्ध॑ वृ॒त्रं ज॑घ॒न्वाँ अत्याँ॑ इव॒ प्रासृ॑जः॒ सर्त॒वाजौ शया॑नमिन्द्र॒ चर॑ता व॒धेन॑ वव्रि॒वांसं॒ परि॑ दे॒वीरदे॑वम्
verses.transliteration: tvám apó yád dha vr̥tráṃ jaghanvā́m̐  átyām̐ iva prā́sr̥jaḥ sártavā́jaú  śáyānam indra cáratā vadhéna  vavrivā́ṃsam pári devī́r ádevam

translation.text: When thou didst loose the streams to run like racers in the swift contest, having smitten Vr̥itra With flying weapon where he lay, O Indra, and, godless, kept the Goddesses encompassed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यजा॑म॒ इन्नम॑सा वृ॒द्धमिन्द्रं॑ बृ॒हन्त॑मृ॒ष्वम॒जरं॒ युवा॑नम् यस्य॑ प्रि॒ये म॒मतु॑र्य॒ज्ञिय॑स्य॒ न रोद॑सी महि॒मानं॑ म॒माते॑
verses.transliteration: yájāma ín námasā vr̥ddhám índram  br̥hántam r̥ṣvám ajáraṃ yúvānam  yásya priyé mamátur yajñíyasya  ná ródasī mahimā́nam mamā́te

translation.text: With reverence let us worship mighty Indra, great and sublime, eternal, everyouthful, Whose greatness the dear world-halves have not measured, no, nor conceived the might of him the Holy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑स्य॒ कर्म॒ सुकृ॑ता पु॒रूणि॑ व्र॒तानि॑ दे॒वा न मि॑नन्ति॒ विश्वे॑ दा॒धार॒ यः पृ॑थि॒वीं द्यामु॒तेमां ज॒जान॒ सूर्य॑मु॒षसं॑ सु॒दंसाः॑
verses.transliteration: índrasya kárma súkr̥tā purū́ṇi  vratā́ni devā́ ná minanti víśve  dādhā́ra yáḥ pr̥thivī́ṃ dyā́m utémā́ṃ  jajā́na sū́ryam uṣásaṃ sudáṃsāḥ

translation.text: Many are Indra's nobly wrought achievements, and none of all the Gods transgress his statutes. He beareth up this earth and heaven, and, doer of marvels, he begot the Sun and Morning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अद्रो॑घ स॒त्यं तव॒ तन्म॑हि॒त्वं स॒द्यो यज्जा॒तो अपि॑बो ह॒ सोम॑म् न द्याव॑ इन्द्र त॒वस॑स्त॒ ओजो॒ नाहा॒ न मासाः॑ श॒रदो॑ वरन्त
verses.transliteration: ádrogha satyáṃ táva tán mahitváṃ  sadyó yáj jātó ápibo ha sómam  ná dyā́va indra tavásas ta ójo  nā́hā ná mā́sāḥ śarádo varanta

translation.text: Herein, O Guileless One, is thy true greatness, that soon as born thou drankest up the Soma. Days may not check the power of thee the Mighty, nor the nights, Indra, nor the months, nor autumns.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं स॒द्यो अ॑पिबो जा॒त इ॑न्द्र॒ मदा॑य॒ सोमं॑ पर॒मे व्यो॑मन् यद्ध॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी आवि॑वेशी॒रथा॑भवः पू॒र्व्यः का॒रुधा॑याः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ sadyó apibo jātá indra  mádāya sómam paramé vyòman  yád dha dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ ā́viveśīr  áthābhavaḥ pūrvyáḥ kārúdhāyāḥ

translation.text: As soon as thou wast born in highest heaven thou drankest Soma to delight thee, Indra; And when thou hadst pervaded earth and heaven thou wast the first supporter of the singer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अह॒न्नहिं॑ परि॒शया॑न॒मर्ण॑ ओजा॒यमा॑नं तुविजात॒ तव्या॑न् न ते॑ महि॒त्वमनु॑ भू॒दध॒ द्यौर्यद॒न्यया॑ स्फि॒ग्या॒३॒॑ क्षामव॑स्थाः
verses.transliteration: áhann áhim pariśáyānam árṇaḥ-  ojāyámānaṃ tuvijāta távyān  ná te mahitvám ánu bhūd ádha dyaúr  yád anyáyā sphigyā̀ kṣā́m ávasthāḥ

translation.text: Thou, puissant God, more mighty, slewest. Ahi showing his strength when couched around the waters. The heaven itself attained not to thy greatness when with one hip of thine the earth was shadowed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञो हि त॑ इन्द्र॒ वर्ध॑नो॒ भूदु॒त प्रि॒यः सु॒तसो॑मो मि॒येधः॑ य॒ज्ञेन॑ य॒ज्ञम॑व य॒ज्ञियः॒ सन्य॒ज्ञस्ते॒ वज्र॑महि॒हत्य॑ आवत्
verses.transliteration: yajñó hí ta indra várdhano bhū́d  utá priyáḥ sutásomo miyédhaḥ  yajñéna yajñám ava yajñíyaḥ sán  yajñás te vájram ahihátya āvat

translation.text: Sacrifice, Indra, made thee wax so mighty, the dear oblation with the flowing Soma. O Worshipful, with worship help our worship, for worship helped thy bolt when slaying Ahi.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञेनेन्द्र॒मव॒सा च॑क्रे अ॒र्वागैनं॑ सु॒म्नाय॒ नव्य॑से ववृत्याम् यः स्तोमे॑भिर्वावृ॒धे पू॒र्व्येभि॒र्यो म॑ध्य॒मेभि॑रु॒त नूत॑नेभिः
verses.transliteration: yajñénéndram ávasā́ cakre arvā́g  aínaṃ sumnā́ya návyase vavr̥tyām  yá stómebhir vāvr̥dhé pūrvyébhir  yó madhyamébhir utá nū́tanebhiḥ

translation.text: With sacrifice and wish have I brought Indra; still for new blessings may I turn him hither, Him magnified by ancient songs and praises, by lauds of later time and days yet recent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒वेष॒ यन्मा॑ धि॒षणा॑ ज॒जान॒ स्तवै॑ पु॒रा पार्या॒दिन्द्र॒मह्नः॑ अंह॑सो॒ यत्र॑ पी॒पर॒द्यथा॑ नो ना॒वेव॒ यान्त॑मु॒भये॑ हवन्ते
verses.transliteration: vivéṣa yán mā dhiṣáṇā jajā́na  stávai purā́ pā́ryād índram áhnaḥ  áṃhaso yátra pīpárad yáthā no  nāvéva yā́ntam ubháye havante

translation.text: I have brought forth a song when longing seized me: ere the decisive day will I laud Indra; Then may lie safely bear us over trouble, as in a ship, when both sides invocate him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आपू॑र्णो अस्य क॒लशः॒ स्वाहा॒ सेक्ते॑व॒ कोशं॑ सिसिचे॒ पिब॑ध्यै समु॑ प्रि॒या आव॑वृत्र॒न्मदा॑य प्रदक्षि॒णिद॒भि सोमा॑स॒ इन्द्र॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́pūrṇo asya kaláśaḥ svā́hā  sékteva kóśaṃ sisice píbadhyai  sám u priyā́ ā́vavr̥tran mádāya  pradakṣiṇíd abhí sómāsa índram

translation.text: Full is his chalice: Glory! Like a pourer I have filled up the vessel for his drinking. Presented on the right, dear Soma juices have brought us Indra, to rejoice him, hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न त्वा॑ गभी॒रः पु॑रुहूत॒ सिन्धु॒र्नाद्र॑यः॒ परि॒ षन्तो॑ वरन्त इ॒त्था सखि॑भ्य इषि॒तो यदि॒न्द्रा दृ॒ळ्हं चि॒दरु॑जो॒ गव्य॑मू॒र्वम्
verses.transliteration: ná tvā gabhīráḥ puruhūta síndhur  nā́drayaḥ pári ṣánto varanta  itthā́ sákhibhya iṣitó yád indra-  -ā́ dr̥ḷháṃ cid árujo gávyam ūrvám

translation.text: Not the deep-flowing flood, O Much-invoked One! not hills that compass thee about restrain thee, Since here incited, for thy friends, O Indra, thou breakest e'en the firm built stall of cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram  asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau  śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu  ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām

translation.text: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र पर्व॑तानामुश॒ती उ॒पस्था॒दश्वे॑ इव॒ विषि॑ते॒ हास॑माने गावे॑व शु॒भ्रे मा॒तरा॑ रिहा॒णे विपा॑ट् छुतु॒द्री पय॑सा जवेते
verses.transliteration: prá párvatānām uśatī́ upásthād  áśve iva víṣite hā́samāne  gā́veva śubhré mātárā rihāṇé  vípāṭ chutudrī́ páyasā javete

translation.text: FORTH from the bosom of the mountains, eager as two swift mares with loosened rein contending, Like two bright mother cows who lick their youngling, Vipâṣ and Ṣutudrî speed down their waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रे॑षिते प्रस॒वं भिक्ष॑माणे॒ अच्छा॑ समु॒द्रं र॒थ्ये॑व याथः स॒मा॒रा॒णे ऊ॒र्मिभिः॒ पिन्व॑माने अ॒न्या वा॑म॒न्यामप्ये॑ति शुभ्रे
verses.transliteration: índreṣite prasavám bhíkṣamāṇe  áchā samudráṃ rathyèva yāthaḥ  samārāṇé ūrmíbhiḥ pínvamāne  anyā́ vām anyā́m ápy eti śubhre

translation.text: Impelled by Indra whom ye pray to urge you, ye move as 'twere on chariots to the ocean. Flowing together, swelling with your billows, O lucid Streams, each of you seeks the other.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छा॒ सिन्धुं॑ मा॒तृत॑मामयासं॒ विपा॑शमु॒र्वीं सु॒भगा॑मगन्म व॒त्समि॑व मा॒तरा॑ संरिहा॒णे स॑मा॒नं योनि॒मनु॑ सं॒चर॑न्ती
verses.transliteration: áchā síndhum mātŕ̥tamām ayāsaṃ  vípāśam urvī́ṃ subhágām aganma  vatsám iva mātárā saṃrihāṇé  samānáṃ yónim ánu saṃcárantī

translation.text: I have attained the most maternal River, we have approached Vipâṣ, the broad, the blessed. Licking as 'twere their calf the pair of Mothers flow onward to their common home together.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ना व॒यं पय॑सा॒ पिन्व॑माना॒ अनु॒ योनिं॑ दे॒वकृ॑तं॒ चर॑न्तीः न वर्त॑वे प्रस॒वः सर्ग॑तक्तः किं॒युर्विप्रो॑ न॒द्यो॑ जोहवीति
verses.transliteration: enā́ vayám páyasā pínvamānāḥ-  ánu yóniṃ devákr̥taṃ cárantīḥ  ná vártave prasaváḥ sárgataktaḥ  kiṃyúr vípro nadyò johavīti

translation.text: We two who rise and swell with billowy waters move forward to the home which Gods have made us. Our flood may not be stayed when urged to motion. What would the singer, calling to the Rivers?

verses.sanskrit_deva: रम॑ध्वं मे॒ वच॑से सो॒म्याय॒ ऋता॑वरी॒रुप॑ मुहू॒र्तमेवैः॑ प्र सिन्धु॒मच्छा॑ बृह॒ती म॑नी॒षाव॒स्युर॑ह्वे कुशि॒कस्य॑ सू॒नुः
verses.transliteration: rámadhvam me vácase somyā́ya  ŕ̥tāvarīr úpa muhūrtám évaiḥ  prá síndhum áchā br̥hatī́ manīṣā́-  -avasyúr ahve kuśikásya sūnúḥ

translation.text: Linger a little at my friendly bidding rest, Holy Ones, a moment in your journey. With hymn sublime soliciting your favour Kuṣika's son hath called unto the River.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ अ॒स्माँ अ॑रद॒द्वज्र॑बाहु॒रपा॑हन्वृ॒त्रं प॑रि॒धिं न॒दीना॑म् दे॒वो॑ऽनयत्सवि॒ता सु॑पा॒णिस्तस्य॑ व॒यं प्र॑स॒वे या॑म उ॒र्वीः
verses.transliteration: índro asmā́m̐ aradad vájrabāhur  ápāhan vr̥trám paridhíṃ nadī́nām  devò 'nayat savitā́ supāṇís  tásya vayám prasavé yāma urvī́ḥ

translation.text: Indra who wields the thunder dug our channels: he smote down Vr̥itra, him who stayed our currents. Savitar, God, the lovely-handed, led us, and at his sending forth we flow expanded.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒वाच्यं॑ शश्व॒धा वी॒र्यं१॒॑ तदिन्द्र॑स्य॒ कर्म॒ यदहिं॑ विवृ॒श्चत् वि वज्रे॑ण परि॒षदो॑ जघा॒नाय॒न्नापोऽय॑नमि॒च्छमा॑नाः
verses.transliteration: pravā́cyaṃ śaśvadhā́ vīryàṃ tád  índrasya kárma yád áhiṃ vivr̥ścát  ví vájreṇa pariṣádo jaghāna-  -ā́yann ā́pó 'yanam ichámānāḥ

translation.text: That hero deed of Indra must be lauded for ever that he rent Ahi in pieces. He smote away the obstructors with his thunder, and eager for their course forth flowed the waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तद्वचो॑ जरित॒र्मापि॑ मृष्ठा॒ आ यत्ते॒ घोषा॒नुत्त॑रा यु॒गानि॑ उ॒क्थेषु॑ कारो॒ प्रति॑ नो जुषस्व॒ मा नो॒ नि कः॑ पुरुष॒त्रा नम॑स्ते
verses.transliteration: etád váco jaritar mā́pi mr̥ṣṭhāḥ-  ā́ yát te ghóṣān úttarā yugā́ni  ukthéṣu kāro práti no juṣasva  mā́ no ní kaḥ puruṣatrā́ námas te

translation.text: Never forget this word of thine, O singer, which future generations shall reecho. In hymns, O bard, show us thy loving kindness. Humble us not mid men. To thee be honour!

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओ षु स्व॑सारः का॒रवे॑ शृणोत य॒यौ वो॑ दू॒रादन॑सा॒ रथे॑न नि षू न॑मध्वं॒ भव॑ता सुपा॒रा अ॑धोअ॒क्षाः सि॑न्धवः स्रो॒त्याभिः॑
verses.transliteration: ó ṣú svasāraḥ kāráve śr̥ṇota  yayaú vo dūrā́d ánasā ráthena  ní ṣū́ namadhvam bhávatā supārā́ḥ-  adhoakṣā́ḥ sindhavaḥ srotyā́bhiḥ

translation.text: List quickly, Sisters, to the bard who cometh to you from far away with car and wagon. Bow lowly down; be easy to be traversed stay, Rivers, with your floods below our axles.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ते॑ कारो शृणवामा॒ वचां॑सि य॒याथ॑ दू॒रादन॑सा॒ रथे॑न नि ते॑ नंसै पीप्या॒नेव॒ योषा॒ मर्या॑येव क॒न्या॑ शश्व॒चै ते॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ te kāro śr̥ṇavāmā vácāṃsi  yayā́tha dūrā́d ánasā ráthena  ní te naṃsai pīpyānéva yóṣā  máryāyeva kanyā̀ śaśvacaí te

translation.text: Yea, we will listen to thy words, O singer. With wain and car from far away thou comest. Low, like a nursing mother, will I bend me, and yield me as a maiden to her lover.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॒ङ्ग त्वा॑ भर॒ताः सं॒तरे॑युर्ग॒व्यन्ग्राम॑ इषि॒त इन्द्र॑जूतः अर्षा॒दह॑ प्रस॒वः सर्ग॑तक्त॒ आ वो॑ वृणे सुम॒तिं य॒ज्ञिया॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: yád aṅgá tvā bharatā́ḥ saṃtáreyur  gavyán grā́ma iṣitá índrajūtaḥ  árṣād áha prasaváḥ sárgataktaḥ-  ā́ vo vr̥ṇe sumatíṃ yajñíyānām

translation.text: Soon as the Bharatas have fared across thee, the warrior band, urged on and sped by Indra, Then let your streams flow on in rapid motion. I crave your favour who deserve our worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अता॑रिषुर्भर॒ता ग॒व्यवः॒ समभ॑क्त॒ विप्रः॑ सुम॒तिं न॒दीना॑म् प्र पि॑न्वध्वमि॒षय॑न्तीः सु॒राधा॒ आ व॒क्षणाः॑ पृ॒णध्वं॑ या॒त शीभ॑म्
verses.transliteration: átāriṣur bharatā́ gavyávaḥ sám  ábhakta vípraḥ sumatíṃ nadī́nām  prá pinvadhvam iṣáyantīḥ surā́dhāḥ-  ā́ vakṣáṇāḥ pr̥ṇádhvaṃ yātá śī́bham

translation.text: The warrior host, the Bharatas, fared over the singer won the favour of the Rivers. Swell with your billows, hasting, pouring riches. Fill full your channels, and roll swiftly onward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद्व॑ ऊ॒र्मिः शम्या॑ ह॒न्त्वापो॒ योक्त्रा॑णि मुञ्चत मादु॑ष्कृतौ॒ व्ये॑नसा॒घ्न्यौ शून॒मार॑ताम्
verses.transliteration: úd va ūrmíḥ śámyā hantu-  ā́po yóktrāṇi muñcata  mā́duṣkr̥tau vyènasā-  -aghnyaú śū́nam ā́ratām

translation.text: So let your wave bear up the pins, and ye, O Waters, spare the thongs; And never may the pair of Bulls, harmless and sinless, waste away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रः॑ पू॒र्भिदाति॑र॒द्दास॑म॒र्कैर्वि॒दद्व॑सु॒र्दय॑मानो॒ वि शत्रू॑न् ब्रह्म॑जूतस्त॒न्वा॑ वावृधा॒नो भूरि॑दात्र॒ आपृ॑ण॒द्रोद॑सी उ॒भे
verses.transliteration: índraḥ pūrbhíd ā́tirad dā́sam arkaír  vidádvasur dáyamāno ví śátrūn  bráhmajūtas tanvā̀ vāvr̥dhānó  bhū́ridātra ā́pr̥ṇad ródasī ubhé

translation.text: FORT-RENDER, Lord of Wealth, dispelling foemen, Indra with lightnings hath o'ercome the Dâsa. Impelled by prayer and waxen great in body, he hath filled earth and heaven, the Bounteous Giver.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒खस्य॑ ते तवि॒षस्य॒ प्र जू॒तिमिय॑र्मि॒ वाच॑म॒मृता॑य॒ भूष॑न् इन्द्र॑ क्षिती॒नाम॑सि॒ मानु॑षीणां वि॒शां दैवी॑नामु॒त पू॑र्व॒यावा॑
verses.transliteration: makhásya te taviṣásya prá jūtím  íyarmi vā́cam amŕ̥tāya bhū́ṣan  índra kṣitīnā́m asi mā́nuṣīṇāṃ  viśā́ṃ daívīnām utá pūrvayā́vā

translation.text: I stimulate thy zeal, the Strong, the Hero decking my song of praise forth; Immortal. O Indra, thou art equally the Leader of heavenly hosts and human generations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ वृ॒त्रम॑वृणो॒च्छर्ध॑नीतिः॒ प्र मा॒यिना॑ममिना॒द्वर्प॑णीतिः अह॒न्व्यं॑समु॒शध॒ग्वने॑ष्वा॒विर्धेना॑ अकृणोद्रा॒म्याणा॑म्
verses.transliteration: índro vr̥trám avr̥ṇoc chárdhanītiḥ  prá māyínām aminād várpaṇītiḥ  áhan vyàṃsam uśádhag váneṣu-  āvír dhénā akr̥ṇod rāmyā́ṇām

translation.text: Leading, his band Indra encompassed Vr̥itra; weak grew the wily leader of enchanters. He who burns fierce in forests slaughtered Vyansa, and made the Milch-kine of the nights apparent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रः॑ स्व॒र्षा ज॒नय॒न्नहा॑नि जि॒गायो॒शिग्भिः॒ पृत॑ना अभि॒ष्टिः प्रारो॑चय॒न्मन॑वे के॒तुमह्ना॒मवि॑न्द॒ज्ज्योति॑र्बृह॒ते रणा॑य
verses.transliteration: índraḥ svarṣā́ janáyann áhāni  jigā́yośígbhiḥ pŕ̥tanā abhiṣṭíḥ  prā́rocayan mánave ketúm áhnām  ávindaj jyótir br̥haté ráṇāya

translation.text: Indra, light-winner, days' Creator, conquered, victorious, hostile bands with those who loved him. For man the days' bright ensign he illumined, and found the light for his joy and gladness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒स्तुजो॑ ब॒र्हणा॒ आ वि॑वेश नृ॒वद्दधा॑नो॒ नर्या॑ पु॒रूणि॑ अचे॑तय॒द्धिय॑ इ॒मा ज॑रि॒त्रे प्रेमं वर्ण॑मतिरच्छु॒क्रमा॑साम्
verses.transliteration: índras tújo barháṇā ā́ viveśa  nr̥vád dádhāno náryā purū́ṇi  ácetayad dhíya imā́ jaritré  prémáṃ várṇam atirac chukrám āsām

translation.text: Forward to fiercely falling blows pressed Indra, herolike doing many hero exploits. These holy songs he taught the bard who gaised him, and widely spread these Dawns' resplendent colour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हो म॒हानि॑ पनयन्त्य॒स्येन्द्र॑स्य॒ कर्म॒ सुकृ॑ता पु॒रूणि॑ वृ॒जने॑न वृजि॒नान्त्सं पि॑पेष मा॒याभि॒र्दस्यूँ॑र॒भिभू॑त्योजाः
verses.transliteration: mahó mahā́ni panayanty asya-  índrasya kárma súkr̥tā purū́ṇi  vr̥jánena vr̥jinā́n sám pipeṣa  māyā́bhir dásyūm̐r abhíbhūtyojāḥ

translation.text: They laud the mighty acts of him the Mighty, the many glorious deeds performed by Indra. He in his strength, with all-surpassing prowess, through wondrous arts crushed the malignant Dasyus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒धेन्द्रो॑ म॒ह्ना वरि॑वश्चकार दे॒वेभ्यः॒ सत्प॑तिश्चर्षणि॒प्राः वि॒वस्व॑तः॒ सद॑ने अस्य॒ तानि॒ विप्रा॑ उ॒क्थेभिः॑ क॒वयो॑ गृणन्ति
verses.transliteration: yudhéndro mahnā́ várivaś cakāra  devébhyaḥ sátpatiś carṣaṇiprā́ḥ  vivásvataḥ sádane asya tā́ni  víprā ukthébhiḥ kaváyo gr̥ṇanti

translation.text: Lord of the brave, Indra who rules the people gave freedom to the Gods by might and battle. Wise singers glorify with chanted praises these his achievements in Vivasvan's dwelling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒त्रा॒साहं॒ वरे॑ण्यं सहो॒दां स॑स॒वांसं॒ स्व॑र॒पश्च॑ दे॒वीः स॒सान॒ यः पृ॑थि॒वीं द्यामु॒तेमामिन्द्रं॑ मद॒न्त्यनु॒ धीर॑णासः
verses.transliteration: satrāsā́haṃ váreṇyaṃ sahodā́ṃ  sasavā́ṃsaṃ svàr apáś ca devī́ḥ  sasā́na yáḥ pr̥thivī́ṃ dyā́m utémā́m  índram madanty ánu dhī́raṇāsaḥ

translation.text: Excellent, Conqueror, the victory-giver, the winner of the light and Godlike Waters, He who hath won this broad earth and this heaven, -in Indra they rejoice who love devotions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒सानात्याँ॑ उ॒त सूर्यं॑ ससा॒नेन्द्रः॑ ससान पुरु॒भोज॑सं॒ गाम् हि॒र॒ण्यय॑मु॒त भोगं॑ ससान ह॒त्वी दस्यू॒न्प्रार्यं॒ वर्ण॑मावत्
