verses.transliteration: sasā́nā́tyām̐ utá sū́ryaṃ sasāna-  -índraḥ sasāna purubhójasaṃ gā́m  hiraṇyáyam utá bhógaṃ sasāna  hatvī́ dásyūn prā́ryaṃ várṇam āvat

translation.text: He gained possession of the Sun and Horses, Indra obtained the Cow who feedeth many. Treasure of gold he won; he smote the Dasyus, and gave protection to the Aryan colour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ ओष॑धीरसनो॒दहा॑नि॒ वन॒स्पतीँ॑रसनोद॒न्तरि॑क्षम् बि॒भेद॑ व॒लं नु॑नु॒दे विवा॒चोऽथा॑भवद्दमि॒ताभिक्र॑तूनाम्
verses.transliteration: índra óṣadhīr asanod áhāni  vánaspátīm̐r asanod antárikṣam  bibhéda valáṃ nunudé vívācaḥ-  -áthābhavad damitā́bhíkratūnām

translation.text: He took the plants and days for his possession; he gained the forest trees and air's mid-region. Vala he cleft, and chased away opponents: thus was he tamer of the overweening.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram  asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau  śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu  ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām

translation.text: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers treasures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तिष्ठा॒ हरी॒ रथ॒ आ यु॒ज्यमा॑ना या॒हि वा॒युर्न नि॒युतो॑ नो॒ अच्छ॑ पिबा॒स्यन्धो॑ अ॒भिसृ॑ष्टो अ॒स्मे इन्द्र॒ स्वाहा॑ ररि॒मा ते॒ मदा॑य
verses.transliteration: tíṣṭhā hárī rátha ā́ yujyámānā  yāhí vāyúr ná niyúto no ácha  píbāsy ándho abhísr̥ṣṭo asmé  índra svā́hā rarimā́ te mádāya

translation.text: MOUNT the Bay Horses to thy chariot harnessed, and come to us like Vâyu with his coursers. Thou, hastening to us, shalt drink the Soma. Hail, Indra. We have poured it for thy rapture.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उपा॑जि॒रा पु॑रुहू॒ताय॒ सप्ती॒ हरी॒ रथ॑स्य धू॒र्ष्वा यु॑नज्मि द्र॒वद्यथा॒ सम्भृ॑तं वि॒श्वत॑श्चि॒दुपे॒मं य॒ज्ञमा व॑हात॒ इन्द्र॑म्
verses.transliteration: úpājirā́ puruhūtā́ya sáptī  hárī ráthasya dhūrṣv ā́ yunajmi  dravád yáthā sámbhr̥taṃ viśvátaś cid  úpemáṃ yajñám ā́ vahāta índram

translation.text: For him, the God who is invoked by many, the two swift Bay Steeds to the pole I harness, That they in fleet course may bring Indra hither, e'en to this sacrifice arranged completely.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उपो॑ नयस्व॒ वृष॑णा तपु॒ष्पोतेम॑व॒ त्वं वृ॑षभ स्वधावः ग्रसे॑ता॒मश्वा॒ वि मु॑चे॒ह शोणा॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे स॒दृशी॑रद्धि धा॒नाः
verses.transliteration: úpo nayasva vŕ̥ṣaṇā tapuṣpā́-  -utém ava tváṃ vr̥ṣabha svadhāvaḥ  grásetām áśvā ví mucehá śóṇā  divé-dive sadŕ̥śīr addhi dhānā́ḥ

translation.text: Bring the strong Steeds who drink the warm libation, and, Bull of Godlike nature, be thou gracious. Let thy Steeds eat; set free thy Tawny Horses, and roasted grain like this consume thou daily.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब्रह्म॑णा ते ब्रह्म॒युजा॑ युनज्मि॒ हरी॒ सखा॑या सध॒माद॑ आ॒शू स्थि॒रं रथं॑ सु॒खमि॑न्द्राधि॒तिष्ठ॑न्प्रजा॒नन्वि॒द्वाँ उप॑ याहि॒ सोम॑म्
verses.transliteration: bráhmaṇā te brahmayújā yunajmi  hárī sákhāyā sadhamā́da āśū́  sthiráṃ ráthaṃ sukhám indrādhitíṣṭhan  prajānán vidvā́m̐ úpa yāhi sómam

translation.text: Those who are yoked by prayer I harness, fleet friendly Bays who take their joy together. Mounting thy firm and easy car, O Indra, wise and all-knowing come thou to the Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा ते॒ हरी॒ वृष॑णा वी॒तपृ॑ष्ठा॒ नि री॑रम॒न्यज॑मानासो अ॒न्ये अ॒त्याया॑हि॒ शश्व॑तो व॒यं तेऽरं॑ सु॒तेभिः॑ कृणवाम॒ सोमैः॑
verses.transliteration: mā́ te hárī vŕ̥ṣaṇā vītápr̥ṣṭhā  ní rīraman yájamānāso anyé  atyā́yāhi śáśvato vayáṃ te-  -áraṃ sutébhiḥ kr̥ṇavāma sómaiḥ

translation.text: No other worshippers must stay beside them thy Bays, thy vigorous and smooth-backed Coursers. Pass by them all and hasten onward hither: with Soma pressed we will prepare to feast thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तवा॒यं सोम॒स्त्वमेह्य॒र्वाङ्छ॑श्वत्त॒मं सु॒मना॑ अ॒स्य पा॑हि अ॒स्मिन्य॒ज्ञे ब॒र्हिष्या नि॒षद्या॑ दधि॒ष्वेमं ज॒ठर॒ इन्दु॑मिन्द्र
verses.transliteration: távāyáṃ sómas tvám éhy arvā́ṅ  -śaśvattamáṃ sumánā asyá pāhi  asmín yajñé barhíṣy ā́ niṣádyā  dadhiṣvémáṃ jaṭhára índum indra

translation.text: Thine is this Sorna: hasten to approach it. Drink thou thereof, benevolent, and cease not. Sit on the sacred grass at this our worship, and take these drops into thy belly, Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्ती॒र्णं ते॑ ब॒र्हिः सु॒त इ॑न्द्र॒ सोमः॑ कृ॒ता धा॒ना अत्त॑वे ते॒ हरि॑भ्याम् तदो॑कसे पुरु॒शाका॑य॒ वृष्णे॑ म॒रुत्व॑ते॒ तुभ्यं॑ रा॒ता ह॒वींषि॑
verses.transliteration: stīrṇáṃ te barhíḥ sutá indra sómaḥ  kr̥tā́ dhānā́ áttave te háribhyām  tádokase puruśā́kāya vŕ̥ṣṇe  marútvate túbhyaṃ rātā́ havī́ṃṣi

translation.text: The grass is strewn for thee, pressed is the Soma; the grain is ready for thy Bays to feed on. To thee who lovest them, the very mighty, strong, girt by Maruts, are these gifts presented.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं नरः॒ पर्व॑ता॒स्तुभ्य॒मापः॒ समि॑न्द्र॒ गोभि॒र्मधु॑मन्तमक्रन् तस्या॒गत्या॑ सु॒मना॑ ऋष्व पाहि प्रजा॒नन्वि॒द्वान्प॒थ्या॒३॒॑ अनु॒ स्वाः
verses.transliteration: imáṃ náraḥ párvatās túbhyam ā́paḥ  sám indra góbhir mádhumantam akran  tásyāgátyā sumánā r̥ṣva pāhi  prajānán vidvā́n pathyā̀ ánu svā́ḥ

translation.text: This the sweet draught, with cows, the men, the mountains, the waters, Indra, have for thee made ready. Come, drink thereof, Sublime One, friendly-minded, foreseeing, knowing well the ways thou goest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याँ आभ॑जो म॒रुत॑ इन्द्र॒ सोमे॒ ये त्वामव॑र्ध॒न्नभ॑वन्ग॒णस्ते॑ तेभि॑रे॒तं स॒जोषा॑ वावशा॒नो॒३॒॑ऽग्नेः पि॑ब जि॒ह्वया॒ सोम॑मिन्द्र
verses.transliteration: yā́m̐ ā́bhajo marúta indra sóme  yé tvā́m ávardhann ábhavan gaṇás te  tébhir etáṃ sajóṣā vāvaśānáḥ-  -agnéḥ piba jihváyā sómam indra

translation.text: The Maruts, they with whom thou sharedst Soma, Indra, who made thee strong and were thine army,– With these accordant, eagerly desirous drink thou this Soma with the tongue of Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ पिब॑ स्व॒धया॑ चित्सु॒तस्या॒ग्नेर्वा॑ पाहि जि॒ह्वया॑ यजत्र अ॒ध्व॒र्योर्वा॒ प्रय॑तं शक्र॒ हस्ता॒द्धोतु॑र्वा य॒ज्ञं ह॒विषो॑ जुषस्व
verses.transliteration: índra píba svadháyā cit sutásya-  -agnér vā pāhi jihváyā yajatra  adhvaryór vā práyataṃ śakra hástād  -hótur vā yajñáṃ havíṣo juṣasva

translation.text: Drink, Indra, of the juice by thine own nature, or by the tongue of Agni, O thou Holy. Accept the sacrificial gift, O Ṣakra, from the Adhvaryu's hand or from the Hotar's.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram  asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau  śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu  ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām

translation.text: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong, who listens, who.gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मामू॒ षु प्रभृ॑तिं सा॒तये॑ धाः॒ शश्व॑च्छश्वदू॒तिभि॒र्याद॑मानः सु॒तेसु॑ते वावृधे॒ वर्ध॑नेभि॒र्यः कर्म॑भिर्म॒हद्भिः॒ सुश्रु॑तो॒ भूत्
verses.transliteration: imā́m ū ṣú prábhr̥tiṃ sātáye dhāḥ  śáśvac-chaśvad ūtíbhir yā́damānaḥ  suté-sute vāvr̥dhe várdhanebhir  yáḥ kármabhir mahádbhiḥ súśruto bhū́t

translation.text: WITH constant succours, fain thyself to share it, make this oblation which we bring effective. Grown great through strengthening gifts at each libation, he hath become renowned by mighty exploits.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑य॒ सोमाः॑ प्र॒दिवो॒ विदा॑ना ऋ॒भुर्येभि॒र्वृष॑पर्वा॒ विहा॑याः प्र॒य॒म्यमा॑ना॒न्प्रति॒ षू गृ॑भा॒येन्द्र॒ पिब॒ वृष॑धूतस्य॒ वृष्णः॑
verses.transliteration: índrāya sómāḥ pradívo vídānāḥ-  r̥bhúr yébhir vŕ̥ṣaparvā víhāyāḥ  prayamyámānān práti ṣū́ gr̥bhāya-  -índra píba vŕ̥ṣadhūtasya vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ

translation.text: For Indra were the Somas erst- discovered, whereby he grew strong-jointed, vast, and skilful. Indra , take quickly these presented juices: drink of the strong, that which the strong have shaken.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पिबा॒ वर्ध॑स्व॒ तव॑ घा सु॒तास॒ इन्द्र॒ सोमा॑सः प्रथ॒मा उ॒तेमे यथापि॑बः पू॒र्व्याँ इ॑न्द्र॒ सोमाँ॑ ए॒वा पा॑हि॒ पन्यो॑ अ॒द्या नवी॑यान्
verses.transliteration: píbā várdhasva táva ghā sutā́saḥ-  índra sómāsaḥ prathamā́ utémé  yáthā́pibaḥ pūrvyā́m̐ indra sómām̐  evā́ pāhi pányo adyā́ návīyān

translation.text: Drink and wax great. Thine are the juices, Indra, both Somas of old time and these we bring thee. Even as thou drankest, Indra, earlier Somas, so drink to-day, a new guest, meet for praises.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हाँ अम॑त्रो वृ॒जने॑ विर॒प्श्यु१॒॑ग्रं शवः॑ पत्यते धृ॒ष्ण्वोजः॑ नाह॑ विव्याच पृथि॒वी च॒नैनं॒ यत्सोमा॑सो॒ हर्य॑श्व॒मम॑न्दन्
verses.transliteration: mahā́m̐ ámatro vr̥jáne virapśī́-  -ugráṃ śávaḥ patyate dhr̥ṣṇv ójaḥ  nā́ha vivyāca pr̥thivī́ canaínaṃ  yát sómāso háryaśvam ámandan

translation.text: Great and impetuous, mighty-voiced in battle, surpassing power is his, and strength resistless. Him the broad earth hath never comprehended when Somas cheered the Lord of Tawny Coursers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हाँ उ॒ग्रो वा॑वृधे वी॒र्या॑य स॒माच॑क्रे वृष॒भः काव्ये॑न इन्द्रो॒ भगो॑ वाज॒दा अ॑स्य॒ गावः॒ प्र जा॑यन्ते॒ दक्षि॑णा अस्य पू॒र्वीः
verses.transliteration: mahā́m̐ ugró vāvr̥dhe vīryā̀ya  samā́cakre vr̥ṣabháḥ kā́vyena  índro bhágo vājadā́ asya gā́vaḥ  prá jāyante dákṣiṇā asya pūrvī́ḥ

translation.text: Mighty and strong he waxed for hero exploit: the Bull was furnished a Sage's wisdom. Indra is our kind Lord; his steers have vigour; his cows are many with abundant offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र यत्सिन्ध॑वः प्रस॒वं यथाय॒न्नापः॑ समु॒द्रं र॒थ्ये॑व जग्मुः अत॑श्चि॒दिन्द्रः॒ सद॑सो॒ वरी॑या॒न्यदीं॒ सोमः॑ पृ॒णति॑ दु॒ग्धो अं॒शुः
verses.transliteration: prá yát síndhavaḥ prasaváṃ yáthā́yann  ā́paḥ samudráṃ rathyèva jagmuḥ  átaś cid índraḥ sádaso várīyān  yád īṃ sómaḥ pr̥ṇáti dugdhó aṃśúḥ

translation.text: As floods according to their stream flow onward, so to the sea, as borne on cars, the waters. Vaster is Indra even than his dwelling, what time the stalk milked out, the Soma, fills him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मु॒द्रेण॒ सिन्ध॑वो॒ याद॑माना॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ सोमं॒ सुषु॑तं॒ भर॑न्तः अं॒शुं दु॑हन्ति ह॒स्तिनो॑ भ॒रित्रै॒र्मध्वः॑ पुनन्ति॒ धार॑या प॒वित्रैः॑
verses.transliteration: samudréṇa síndhavo yā́damānāḥ-  índrāya sómaṃ súṣutam bhárantaḥ  aṃśúṃ duhanti hastíno bharítrair  mádhvaḥ punanti dhā́rayā pavítraiḥ

translation.text: Eager to mingle with the sea, the rivers carry the well-pressed Soma juice to Indra. They drain the stalk out with their arms, quick-banded, and cleanse it with a stream of mead and filters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ह्र॒दा इ॑व कु॒क्षयः॑ सोम॒धानाः॒ समी॑ विव्याच॒ सव॑ना पु॒रूणि॑ अन्ना॒ यदिन्द्रः॑ प्रथ॒मा व्याश॑ वृ॒त्रं ज॑घ॒न्वाँ अ॑वृणीत॒ सोम॑म्
verses.transliteration: hradā́ iva kukṣáyaḥ somadhā́nāḥ  sám ī vivyāca sávanā purū́ṇi  ánnā yád índraḥ prathamā́ vy ā́śa  vr̥tráṃ jaghanvā́m̐ avr̥ṇīta sómam

translation.text: Like lakes appear his flanks filled full with Soma: yea, he contains libations in abundance. When Indra had consumed the first sweet viands, he, after slaying Vr̥itra, claimed the Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ तू भ॑र॒ माकि॑रे॒तत्परि॑ ष्ठाद्वि॒द्मा हि त्वा॒ वसु॑पतिं॒ वसू॑नाम् इन्द्र॒ यत्ते॒ माहि॑नं॒ दत्र॒मस्त्य॒स्मभ्यं॒ तद्ध॑र्यश्व॒ प्र य॑न्धि
verses.transliteration: ā́ tū́ bhara mā́kir etát pári ṣṭhād  vidmā́ hí tvā vásupatiṃ vásūnām  índra yát te mā́hinaṃ dátram ásti-  asmábhyaṃ tád dharyaśva prá yandhi

translation.text: Then bring thou hither, and let none prevent it: we know thee well, the Lord of wealth and treasure. That splendid gift which is thine own, O Indra, vouchsafe to us, Lord of the Tawny Coursers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मे प्र य॑न्धि मघवन्नृजीषि॒न्निन्द्र॑ रा॒यो वि॒श्ववा॑रस्य॒ भूरेः॑ अ॒स्मे श॒तं श॒रदो॑ जी॒वसे॑ धा अ॒स्मे वी॒राञ्छश्व॑त इन्द्र शिप्रिन्
verses.transliteration: asmé prá yandhi maghavann r̥jīṣinn  índra rāyó viśvávārasya bhū́reḥ  asmé śatáṃ śarádo jīváse dhāḥ-  asmé vīrā́ñ cháśvata indra śiprin

translation.text: O Indra, Maghavan, impetuous mover, grant us abundant wealth that brings all blessings. Give us a hundred autumns for our lifetime: give us, O fair-checked Indra, store of heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram  asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau  śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu  ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām

translation.text: Call we on Indra, Maghavan, auspicious, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वार्त्र॑हत्याय॒ शव॑से पृतना॒षाह्या॑य च इन्द्र॒ त्वा व॑र्तयामसि
verses.transliteration: vā́rtrahatyāya śávase  pr̥tanāṣā́hyāya ca  índra tvā́ vartayāmasi

translation.text: O INDRA, for the strength that slays Vr̥itra and conquers in the fight, We turn thee hitherward to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्वा॒चीनं॒ सु ते॒ मन॑ उ॒त चक्षुः॑ शतक्रतो इन्द्र॑ कृ॒ण्वन्तु॑ वा॒घतः॑
verses.transliteration: arvācī́naṃ sú te máno  utá cákṣuḥ śatakrato  índra kr̥ṇvántu vāghátaḥ

translation.text: O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers, may those who praise thee hitherward. Direct thy spirit and thine eye.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नामा॑नि ते शतक्रतो॒ विश्वा॑भिर्गी॒र्भिरी॑महे इन्द्रा॑भिमाति॒षाह्ये॑
verses.transliteration: nā́māni te śatakrato  víśvābhir gīrbhír īmahe  índrābhimātiṣā́hye

translation.text: O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers, with all our songs we invocate Thy names for triumph over foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रु॒ष्टु॒तस्य॒ धाम॑भिः श॒तेन॑ महयामसि इन्द्र॑स्य चर्षणी॒धृतः॑
verses.transliteration: puruṣṭutásya dhā́mabhiḥ  śaténa mahayāmasi  índrasya carṣaṇīdhŕ̥taḥ

translation.text: We strive for glory through the powers immense of him whom many praise, Of Indra who supports mankind.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रं॑ वृ॒त्राय॒ हन्त॑वे पुरुहू॒तमुप॑ ब्रुवे भरे॑षु॒ वाज॑सातये
verses.transliteration: índraṃ vr̥trā́ya hántave  puruhūtám úpa bruve  bháreṣu vā́jasātaye

translation.text: For Vr̥itra's slaughter I address Indra whom many invocate, To win us booty in the wars.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वाजे॑षु सास॒हिर्भ॑व॒ त्वामी॑महे शतक्रतो इन्द्र॑ वृ॒त्राय॒ हन्त॑वे
verses.transliteration: vā́jeṣu sāsahír bhava  tvā́m īmahe śatakrato  índra vr̥trā́ya hántave

translation.text: In battles be victorious. We seek thee, Lord of Hundred Powers, Indra, that Vr̥itra may be slain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यु॒म्नेषु॑ पृत॒नाज्ये॑ पृत्सु॒तूर्षु॒ श्रवः॑सु च इन्द्र॒ साक्ष्वा॒भिमा॑तिषु
verses.transliteration: dyumnéṣu pr̥tanā́jye  pr̥tsutū́rṣu śrávassu ca  índra sā́kṣvābhímātiṣu

translation.text: In splendid combats of the hosts, in glories where the fight is won. Indra, be victor over foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒ष्मिन्त॑मं न ऊ॒तये॑ द्यु॒म्निनं॑ पाहि॒ जागृ॑विम् इन्द्र॒ सोमं॑ शतक्रतो
verses.transliteration: śuṣmíntamaṃ na ūtáye  dyumnínam pāhi jā́gr̥vim  índra sómaṃ śatakrato

translation.text: Drink thou the Soma for our help, bright, vigilant, exceeding strong, O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒न्द्रि॒याणि॑ शतक्रतो॒ या ते॒ जने॑षु प॒ञ्चसु॑ इन्द्र॒ तानि॑ त॒ आ वृ॑णे
verses.transliteration: indriyā́ṇi śatakrato  yā́ te jáneṣu pañcásu  índra tā́ni ta ā́ vr̥ṇe

translation.text: O Ṣatakratu, powers which thou mid the Five Races hast displayed These, Indra, do I claim of thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग॑न्निन्द्र॒ श्रवो॑ बृ॒हद्द्यु॒म्नं द॑धिष्व दु॒ष्टर॑म् उत्ते॒ शुष्मं॑ तिरामसि
verses.transliteration: ágann indra śrávo br̥hád  dyumnáṃ dadhiṣva duṣṭáram  út te śúṣmaṃ tirāmasi

translation.text: Indra, great glory hast thou gained. Win splendid fame which none may mar We make thy might perpetual.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्वा॒वतो॑ न॒ आ ग॒ह्यथो॑ शक्र परा॒वतः॑ उ॒ लो॒को यस्ते॑ अद्रिव॒ इन्द्रे॒ह तत॒ आ ग॑हि
verses.transliteration: arvāváto na ā́ gahi-  átho śakra parāvátaḥ  ulokó yás te adrivaḥ-  índrehá táta ā́ gahi

translation.text: Come to us either from anear, Or, Ṣakra, come from far away. Indra, wherever be thy home, come to us thence, O Thunder-armed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि तष्टे॑व दीधया मनी॒षामत्यो॒ न वा॒जी सु॒धुरो॒ जिहा॑नः अ॒भि प्रि॒याणि॒ मर्मृ॑श॒त्परा॑णि क॒वीँरि॑च्छामि सं॒दृशे॑ सुमे॒धाः
verses.transliteration: abhí táṣṭeva dīdhayā manīṣā́m  átyo ná vājī́ sudhúro jíhānaḥ  abhí priyā́ṇi mármr̥śat párāṇi  kavī́m̐r ichāmi saṃdŕ̥śe sumedhā́ḥ

translation.text: HASTING like some strong courser good at drawing, a thought have I imagined like a workman. Pondering what is dearest and most noble, I long to see the sages full of wisdom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒नोत पृ॑च्छ॒ जनि॑मा कवी॒नां म॑नो॒धृतः॑ सु॒कृत॑स्तक्षत॒ द्याम् इ॒मा उ॑ ते प्र॒ण्यो॒३॒॑ वर्ध॑माना॒ मनो॑वाता॒ अध॒ नु धर्म॑णि ग्मन्
verses.transliteration: inótá pr̥cha jánimā kavīnā́m  manodhŕ̥taḥ sukŕ̥tas takṣata dyā́m  imā́ u te praṇyò várdhamānāḥ-  mánovātā ádha nú dhármaṇi gman

translation.text: Ask of the sages' mighty generations firm-minded and devout they framed the heaven. These are thy heart-sought strengthening directions, and they have come to be sky's upholders.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि षी॒मिदत्र॒ गुह्या॒ दधा॑ना उ॒त क्ष॒त्राय॒ रोद॑सी॒ सम॑ञ्जन् सं मात्रा॑भिर्ममि॒रे ये॒मुरु॒र्वी अ॒न्तर्म॒ही समृ॑ते॒ धाय॑से धुः
verses.transliteration: ní ṣīm íd átra gúhyā dádhānāḥ-  utá kṣatrā́ya ródasī sám añjan  sám mā́trābhir mamiré yemúr urvī́  antár mahī́ sámr̥te dhā́yase dhuḥ

translation.text: Assuming in this world mysterious natures, they decked the heaven and earth for high dominion, Measured with measures, fixed their broad expanses, set the great worlds apart held firm for safety.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒तिष्ठ॑न्तं॒ परि॒ विश्वे॑ अभूष॒ञ्छ्रियो॒ वसा॑नश्चरति॒ स्वरो॑चिः म॒हत्तद्वृष्णो॒ असु॑रस्य॒ नामा वि॒श्वरू॑पो अ॒मृता॑नि तस्थौ
verses.transliteration: ātíṣṭhantam pári víśve abhūṣañ  -śríyo vásānaś carati svárociḥ  mahát tád vŕ̥ṣṇo ásurasya nā́ma-  -ā́ viśvárūpo amŕ̥tāni tasthau

translation.text: Even as he mounted up they all adorned him: self-luminous he travels clothed in splendour. That is the Bull's, the Asura's mighty figure: he, omniform, hath reached the eternal waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: असू॑त॒ पूर्वो॑ वृष॒भो ज्याया॑नि॒मा अ॑स्य शु॒रुधः॑ सन्ति पू॒र्वीः दिवो॑ नपाता वि॒दथ॑स्य धी॒भिः क्ष॒त्रं रा॑जाना प्र॒दिवो॑ दधाथे
verses.transliteration: ásūta pū́rvo vr̥ṣabhó jyā́yān  imā́ asya śurúdhaḥ santi pūrvī́ḥ  dívo napātā vidáthasya dhībhíḥ  kṣatráṃ rājānā pradívo dadhāthe

translation.text: First the more ancient Bull engendered offspring; these are his many draughts that lent him vigour. From days of old ye Kings, two Sons of Heaven, by hymns of sacrifice have won dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रीणि॑ राजाना वि॒दथे॑ पु॒रूणि॒ परि॒ विश्वा॑नि भूषथः॒ सदां॑सि अप॑श्य॒मत्र॒ मन॑सा जग॒न्वान्व्र॒ते ग॑न्ध॒र्वाँ अपि॑ वा॒युके॑शान्
verses.transliteration: trī́ṇi rājānā vidáthe purū́ṇi  pári víśvāni bhūṣathaḥ sádāṃsi  ápaśyam átra mánasā jaganvā́n  vraté gandharvā́m̐ ápi vāyúkeśān

translation.text: Three seats ye Sovrans, in the Holy synod, many, yea, all, ye honour with your presence. There saw I, going thither in the spirit, Gandharvas in their course with wind-blown tresses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तदिन्न्व॑स्य वृष॒भस्य॑ धे॒नोरा नाम॑भिर्ममिरे॒ सक्म्यं॒ गोः अ॒न्यद॑न्यदसु॒र्यं१॒॑ वसा॑ना॒ नि मा॒यिनो॑ ममिरे रू॒पम॑स्मिन्
verses.transliteration: tád ín nv àsya vr̥ṣabhásya dhenór  ā́ nā́mabhir mamire sákmyaṃ góḥ  anyád-anyad asuryàṃ vásānāḥ-  ní māyíno mamire rūpám asmin

translation.text: That same companionship of her, the Milch-cow, here with the strong Bull's divers forms they stablished. Enduing still some new celestial figure, the skilful workers shaped a form around him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तदिन्न्व॑स्य सवि॒तुर्नकि॑र्मे हिर॒ण्ययी॑म॒मतिं॒ यामशि॑श्रेत् आ सु॑ष्टु॒ती रोद॑सी विश्वमि॒न्वे अपी॑व॒ योषा॒ जनि॑मानि वव्रे
verses.transliteration: tád ín nv àsya savitúr nákir me  hiraṇyáyīm amátiṃ yā́m áśiśret  ā́ suṣṭutī́ ródasī viśvaminvé  ápīva yóṣā jánimāni vavre

translation.text: Let no one here debar me from enjoying the golden light which Savitar diffuses. He covers both all-fostering worlds with praises even as a woman cherishes her children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं प्र॒त्नस्य॑ साधथो म॒हो यद्दैवी॑ स्व॒स्तिः परि॑ णः स्यातम् गो॒पाजि॑ह्वस्य त॒स्थुषो॒ विरू॑पा॒ विश्वे॑ पश्यन्ति मा॒यिनः॑ कृ॒तानि॑
verses.transliteration: yuvám pratnásya sādhatho mahó yád  daívī svastíḥ pári ṇaḥ syātam  gopā́jihvasya tasthúṣo vírūpā  víśve paśyanti māyínaḥ kr̥tā́ni

translation.text: Fulfil, ye twain, his work, the Great, the Ancient: as heavenly blessing keep your guard around us. All the wise Gods behold his varied actions who stands erect, whose voice is like a herdsman's.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram  asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau  śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu  ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām

translation.text: Call we on Indra, Maghavan, auspicious, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रं॑ म॒तिर्हृ॒द आ व॒च्यमा॒नाच्छा॒ पतिं॒ स्तोम॑तष्टा जिगाति या जागृ॑विर्वि॒दथे॑ श॒स्यमा॒नेन्द्र॒ यत्ते॒ जाय॑ते वि॒द्धि तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: índram matír hr̥dá ā́ vacyámānā-  -áchā pátiṃ stómataṣṭā jigāti  yā́ jā́gr̥vir vidáthe śasyámānā-  -índra yát te jā́yate viddhí tásya

translation.text: To Indra from the heart the hymn proceedeth, to him the Lord, recited, built with praises; The wakening song sung forth in holy synod: that which is born for thee, O Indra, notice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वश्चि॒दा पू॒र्व्या जाय॑माना॒ वि जागृ॑विर्वि॒दथे॑ श॒स्यमा॑ना भ॒द्रा वस्त्रा॒ण्यर्जु॑ना॒ वसा॑ना॒ सेयम॒स्मे स॑न॒जा पित्र्या॒ धीः
verses.transliteration: diváś cid ā́ pūrvyā́ jā́yamānā  ví jā́gr̥vir vidáthe śasyámānā  bhadrā́ vástrāṇy árjunā vásānā  séyám asmé sanajā́ pítryā dhī́ḥ

translation.text: Born from the heaven e'en in the days aforetime, wakening, sting aloud in holy synod, Auspicious, clad in white and shining raiment, this is the ancient hymn of our forefathers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒मा चि॒दत्र॑ यम॒सूर॑सूत जि॒ह्वाया॒ अग्रं॒ पत॒दा ह्यस्था॑त् वपूं॑षि जा॒ता मि॑थु॒ना स॑चेते तमो॒हना॒ तपु॑षो बु॒ध्न एता॑
verses.transliteration: yamā́ cid átra yamasū́r asūta  jihvā́yā ágram pátad ā́ hy ásthāt  vápūṃṣi jātā́ mithunā́ sacete  tamohánā tápuṣo budhná étā

translation.text: The Mother of the Twins hath borne Twin Children: my tongue's tip raised itself and rested silent. Killing the darkness at the light's foundation, the Couple newly born attain their beauty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नकि॑रेषां निन्दि॒ता मर्त्ये॑षु॒ ये अ॒स्माकं॑ पि॒तरो॒ गोषु॑ यो॒धाः इन्द्र॑ एषां दृंहि॒ता माहि॑नावा॒नुद्गो॒त्राणि॑ ससृजे दं॒सना॑वान्
verses.transliteration: nákir eṣāṃ ninditā́ mártyeṣu  yé asmā́kam pitáro góṣu yodhā́ḥ  índra eṣāṃ dr̥ṃhitā́ mā́hināvān  úd gotrā́ṇi sasr̥je daṃsánāvān

translation.text: Not one is found among them, none of mortals, to blame our sires who fought to win the cattle. Their strengthener was Indra the Majestic he spread their stalls of kine the Wonder-Worker.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सखा॑ ह॒ यत्र॒ सखि॑भि॒र्नव॑ग्वैरभि॒ज्ञ्वा सत्व॑भि॒र्गा अ॑नु॒ग्मन् स॒त्यं तदिन्द्रो॑ द॒शभि॒र्दश॑ग्वैः॒ सूर्यं॑ विवेद॒ तम॑सि क्षि॒यन्त॑म्
verses.transliteration: sákhā ha yátra sákhibhir návagvair  abhijñv ā́ sátvabhir gā́ anugmán  satyáṃ tád índro daśábhir dáśagvaiḥ  sū́ryaṃ viveda támasi kṣiyántam

translation.text: Where as a Friend with friendly men, Navagvas, with heroes, on his knees he sought the cattle. There, verily with ten Daṣagvas Indra found the Sun lying hidden in the darkness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॒ मधु॒ सम्भृ॑तमु॒स्रिया॑यां प॒द्वद्वि॑वेद श॒फव॒न्नमे॒ गोः गुहा॑ हि॒तं गुह्यं॑ गू॒ळ्हम॒प्सु हस्ते॑ दधे॒ दक्षि॑णे॒ दक्षि॑णावान्
verses.transliteration: índro mádhu sámbhr̥tam usríyāyām  padvád viveda śaphávan náme góḥ  gúhā hitáṃ gúhyaṃ gūḷhám apsú-  háste dadhe dákṣiṇe dákṣiṇāvān

translation.text: Indra found meath collected in the milch-cow, by foot and hoof, in the cow's place of pasture. That which lay secret, hidden in the waters, he held in his right hand, the rich rewarder.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज्योति॑र्वृणीत॒ तम॑सो विजा॒नन्ना॒रे स्या॑म दुरि॒ताद॒भीके॑ इ॒मा गिरः॑ सोमपाः सोमवृद्ध जु॒षस्वे॑न्द्र पुरु॒तम॑स्य का॒रोः
verses.transliteration: jyótir vr̥ṇīta támaso vijānánn  āré syāma duritā́d abhī́ke  imā́ gíraḥ somapāḥ somavr̥ddha  juṣásvendra purutámasya kāróḥ

translation.text: He took the light, discerning it from darkness: may we be far removed from all misfortune. These songs, O Soma-drinker, cheered by Soma, Indra, accept from thy most zealous poet.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज्योति॑र्य॒ज्ञाय॒ रोद॑सी॒ अनु॑ ष्यादा॒रे स्या॑म दुरि॒तस्य॒ भूरेः॑ भूरि॑ चि॒द्धि तु॑ज॒तो मर्त्य॑स्य सुपा॒रासो॑ वसवो ब॒र्हणा॑वत्
verses.transliteration: jyótir yajñā́ya ródasī ánu ṣyād  āré syāma duritásya bhū́reḥ  bhū́ri cid dhí tujató mártyasya  supārā́so vasavo barháṇāvat

translation.text: Let there be light through both the worlds for worship: may we be far from most overwhelming evil. Great woe comes even from the hostile mortal, piled up; but good at rescue are the Vasus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram  asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau  śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu  ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām

translation.text: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑ त्वा वृष॒भं व॒यं सु॒ते सोमे॑ हवामहे स पा॑हि॒ मध्वो॒ अन्ध॑सः
verses.transliteration: índra tvā vr̥ṣabháṃ vayáṃ  suté sóme havāmahe  sá pāhi mádhvo ándhasaḥ

translation.text: THEE, Indra, we invoke, the Bull, what time the Soma is expressed. So drink thou of the savoury juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑ क्रतु॒विदं॑ सु॒तं सोमं॑ हर्य पुरुष्टुत पिबा वृ॑षस्व॒ तातृ॑पिम्
verses.transliteration: índra kratuvídaṃ sutáṃ  sómaṃ harya puruṣṭuta  píbā́ vr̥ṣasva tā́tr̥pim

translation.text: Indra, whom many laud, accept the strength-conferring Soma juice: Quaff, pour down drink that satisfies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ प्र णो॑ धि॒तावा॑नं य॒ज्ञं विश्वे॑भिर्दे॒वेभिः॑ ति॒र स्त॑वान विश्पते
verses.transliteration: índra prá ṇo dhitā́vānaṃ  yajñáṃ víśvebhir devébhiḥ  tirá stavāna viśpate

translation.text: Indra, with all the Gods promote our wealth-bestowing sacrifice, Thou highly-lauded Lord of men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ सोमाः॑ सु॒ता इ॒मे तव॒ प्र य॑न्ति सत्पते क्षयं॑ च॒न्द्रास॒ इन्द॑वः
verses.transliteration: índra sómāḥ sutā́ imé  táva prá yanti satpate  kṣáyaṃ candrā́sa índavaḥ

translation.text: Lord of the brave, to thee proceed these drops of Soma juice expressed, The bright drops to thy dwelling-place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒धि॒ष्वा ज॒ठरे॑ सु॒तं सोम॑मिन्द्र॒ वरे॑ण्यम् तव॑ द्यु॒क्षास॒ इन्द॑वः
verses.transliteration: dadhiṣvā́ jaṭháre sutáṃ  sómam indra váreṇyam  táva dyukṣā́sa índavaḥ

translation.text: Within thy belly, Indra, take juice, Soma the most excellent: Thine are the drops celestial.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गिर्व॑णः पा॒हि नः॑ सु॒तं मधो॒र्धारा॑भिरज्यसे इन्द्र॒ त्वादा॑त॒मिद्यशः॑
verses.transliteration: gírvaṇaḥ pāhí naḥ sutám  mádhor dhā́rābhir ajyase  índra tvā́dātam íd yáśaḥ

translation.text: Drink our libation, Lord of hymns: with streams of meath thou art bedewed Our glory, Indra, is thy gift.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि द्यु॒म्नानि॑ व॒निन॒ इन्द्रं॑ सचन्ते॒ अक्षि॑ता पी॒त्वी सोम॑स्य वावृधे
verses.transliteration: abhí dyumnā́ni vanínaḥ-  índraṃ sacante ákṣitā  pītvī́ sómasya vāvr̥dhe

translation.text: To Indra go the treasures of the worshipper, which never fail: He drinks the Soma and is strong

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्वा॒वतो॑ न॒ आ ग॑हि परा॒वत॑श्च वृत्रहन् इ॒मा जु॑षस्व नो॒ गिरः॑
verses.transliteration: arvāváto na ā́ gahi-  parāvátaś ca vr̥trahan  imā́ juṣasva no gíraḥ

translation.text: From far away, from near at hand, O Vr̥itra-slayer, come to us: Accept the songs we sing to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॑न्त॒रा प॑रा॒वत॑मर्वा॒वतं॑ च हू॒यसे॑ इन्द्रे॒ह तत॒ आ ग॑हि
verses.transliteration: yád antarā́ parāvátam  arvāvátaṃ ca hūyáse  índrehá táta ā́ gahi

translation.text: When from the space between the near and far thou art invoked by us, Thence, Indra. come thou hitherward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ तू न॑ इन्द्र म॒द्र्य॑ग्घुवा॒नः सोम॑पीतये हरि॑भ्यां याह्यद्रिवः
verses.transliteration: ā́ tū́ na indra madryàg  -huvānáḥ sómapītaye  háribhyāṃ yāhy adrivaḥ

translation.text: INVOKED to drink the Soma juice, come with thy Bay Steeds, Thunder-armed Come, Indra, hitherward to me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒त्तो होता॑ न ऋ॒त्विय॑स्तिस्ति॒रे ब॒र्हिरा॑नु॒षक् अयु॑ज्रन्प्रा॒तरद्र॑यः
verses.transliteration: sattó hótā na r̥tvíyas  tistiré barhír ānuṣák  áyujran prātár ádrayaḥ

translation.text: Our priest is seated, true to time; the grass is regularly strewn; The pressing-stones were set at morn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा ब्रह्म॑ ब्रह्मवाहः क्रि॒यन्त॒ आ ब॒र्हिः सी॑द वी॒हि शू॑र पुरो॒ळाश॑म्
verses.transliteration: imā́ bráhma brahmavāhaḥ  kriyánta ā́ barhíḥ sīda  vīhí śūra puroḷā́śam

translation.text: These prayers, O thou who hearest prayer are offered: seat thee on the grass. Hero, enjoy the offered cake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रा॒र॒न्धि सव॑नेषु ण ए॒षु स्तोमे॑षु वृत्रहन् उ॒क्थेष्वि॑न्द्र गिर्वणः
verses.transliteration: rārandhí sávaneṣu ṇaḥ-  eṣú stómeṣu vr̥trahan  ukthéṣv indra girvaṇaḥ

translation.text: O Vr̥itra-slayer, be thou pleased with these libations, with these hymns, Song-loving Indra, with our lauds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒तयः॑ सोम॒पामु॒रुं रि॒हन्ति॒ शव॑स॒स्पति॑म् इन्द्रं॑ व॒त्सं न मा॒तरः॑
verses.transliteration: matáyaḥ somapā́m urúṃ  rihánti śávasas pátim  índraṃ vatsáṃ ná mātáraḥ

translation.text: Our hymns caress the Lord of Strength, vast, drinker of the Soma's juice, Indra, as mother-cows their calf.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स म॑न्दस्वा॒ ह्यन्ध॑सो॒ राध॑से त॒न्वा॑ म॒हे न स्तो॒तारं॑ नि॒दे क॑रः
verses.transliteration: sá mandasvā hy ándhaso  rā́dhase tanvā̀ mahé  ná stotā́raṃ nidé karaḥ

translation.text: Delight thee with the juice we pour for thine own great munificence: Yield not thy singer to reproach.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यमि॑न्द्र त्वा॒यवो॑ ह॒विष्म॑न्तो जरामहे उ॒त त्वम॑स्म॒युर्व॑सो
verses.transliteration: vayám indra tvāyávo  havíṣmanto jarāmahe  utá tvám asmayúr vaso

translation.text: We, Indra, dearly loving thee, bearing oblation, sing thee hymns Thou, Vasu, dearly lovest us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मारे अ॒स्मद्वि मु॑मुचो॒ हरि॑प्रिया॒र्वाङ्या॑हि इन्द्र॑ स्वधावो॒ मत्स्वे॒ह
verses.transliteration: mā́ré asmád ví mumuco  háripriyārvā́ṅ yāhi  índra svadhāvo mátsvehá

translation.text: O thou to whom thy Bays are dear, loose not thy Horses far from us: Here glad thee, Indra, Lord divine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्वाञ्चं॑ त्वा सु॒खे रथे॒ वह॑तामिन्द्र के॒शिना॑ घृ॒तस्नू॑ ब॒र्हिरा॒सदे॑
verses.transliteration: arvā́ñcaṃ tvā sukhé ráthe  váhatām indra keśínā  ghr̥tásnū barhír āsáde

translation.text: May long-maned Coursers, dropping oil, bring thee on swift car hitherward, Indra, to seat thee on the grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ नः सु॒तमा ग॑हि॒ सोम॑मिन्द्र॒ गवा॑शिरम् हरि॑भ्यां॒ यस्ते॑ अस्म॒युः
verses.transliteration: úpa naḥ sutám ā́ gahi  sómam indra gávāśiram  háribhyāṃ yás te asmayúḥ

translation.text: COME to the juice that we have pressed, to Sorna, Indra, bleat with milk: Come, favouring us, thy Bay-drawn car!

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमि॑न्द्र॒ मद॒मा ग॑हि बर्हिः॒ष्ठां ग्राव॑भिः सु॒तम् कु॒विन्न्व॑स्य तृ॒प्णवः॑
verses.transliteration: tám indra mádam ā́ gahi  barhiṣṭhā́ṃ grā́vabhiḥ sutám  kuvín nv àsya tr̥pṇávaḥ

translation.text: Come, Indra, to this gladdening drink, placed on the grass, pressed out with stones: Wilt thou not drink thy fill thereof?

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑मि॒त्था गिरो॒ ममाच्छा॑गुरिषि॒ता इ॒तः आ॒वृते॒ सोम॑पीतये
verses.transliteration: índram itthā́ gíro máma-  -áchāgur iṣitā́ itáḥ  āvŕ̥te sómapītaye

translation.text: To Indra have my songs of praise gone forth, thus rapidly sent hence, To turn him to the Soma-draught.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रं॒ सोम॑स्य पी॒तये॒ स्तोमै॑रि॒ह ह॑वामहे उ॒क्थेभिः॑ कु॒विदा॒गम॑त्
verses.transliteration: índraṃ sómasya pītáye  stómair ihá havāmahe  ukthébhiḥ kuvíd āgámat

translation.text: Hither with songs of praise we call Indra to drink the Soma juice: Will he not come to us by lauds?

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ सोमाः॑ सु॒ता इ॒मे तान्द॑धिष्व शतक्रतो ज॒ठरे॑ वाजिनीवसो
verses.transliteration: índra sómāḥ sutā́ imé  tā́n dadhiṣva śatakrato  jaṭháre vājinīvaso

translation.text: Indra, these Somas are expressed. Take them within thy belly, Lord Of Hundred Powers, thou Prince of Wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒द्मा हि त्वा॑ धनंज॒यं वाजे॑षु दधृ॒षं क॑वे अधा॑ ते सु॒म्नमी॑महे
verses.transliteration: vidmā́ hí tvā dhanaṃjayáṃ  vā́jeṣu dadhr̥ṣáṃ kave  ádhā te sumnám īmahe

translation.text: We know thee winner of the spoil, and resolute in battles, Sage! Therefore thy blessing we implore.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒ममि॑न्द्र॒ गवा॑शिरं॒ यवा॑शिरं च नः पिब आ॒गत्या॒ वृष॑भिः सु॒तम्
verses.transliteration: imám indra gávāśiraṃ  yávāśiraṃ ca naḥ piba  āgátyā vŕ̥ṣabhiḥ sutám

translation.text: Borne hither by thy Stallions, drink, Indra, this juice which we have pressed, Mingled with barley and with milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तुभ्येदि॑न्द्र॒ स्व ओ॒क्ये॒३॒॑ सोमं॑ चोदामि पी॒तये॑ ए॒ष रा॑रन्तु ते हृ॒दि
verses.transliteration: túbhyéd indra svá okyè  sómaṃ codāmi pītáye  eṣá rārantu te hr̥dí

translation.text: Indra, for thee, in thine own place, I urge the Soma for thy draught: Deep in thy heart let it remain,

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वां सु॒तस्य॑ पी॒तये॑ प्र॒त्नमि॑न्द्र हवामहे कु॒शि॒कासो॑ अव॒स्यवः॑
verses.transliteration: tvā́ṃ sutásya pītáye  pratnám indra havāmahe  kuśikā́so avasyávaḥ

translation.text: We call on thee, the Ancient One, Indra, to drink the Soma juice, We Kuṣikas who seek thine aid.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ या॑ह्य॒र्वाङुप॑ वन्धुरे॒ष्ठास्तवेदनु॑ प्र॒दिवः॑ सोम॒पेय॑म् प्रि॒या सखा॑या॒ वि मु॒चोप॑ ब॒र्हिस्त्वामि॒मे ह॑व्य॒वाहो॑ हवन्ते
verses.transliteration: ā́ yāhy arvā́ṅ úpa vandhureṣṭhā́s  távéd ánu pradívaḥ somapéyam  priyā́ sákhāyā ví mucópa barhís  tvā́m imé havyavā́ho havante

translation.text: MOUNTED upon thy chariot-seat approach us: thine is the Sorna-draught from days aforetime. Loose for the sacred grass thy dear companions. These men who bring oblation call thee hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ या॑हि पू॒र्वीरति॑ चर्ष॒णीराँ अ॒र्य आ॒शिष॒ उप॑ नो॒ हरि॑भ्याम् इ॒मा हि त्वा॑ म॒तयः॒ स्तोम॑तष्टा॒ इन्द्र॒ हव॑न्ते स॒ख्यं जु॑षा॒णाः
verses.transliteration: ā́ yāhi pūrvī́r áti carṣaṇī́r ā́m̐  aryá āśíṣa úpa no háribhyām  imā́ hí tvā matáya stómataṣṭāḥ-  índra hávante sakhyáṃ juṣāṇā́ḥ

translation.text: Come our true Friend, passing by many people; come with thy two Bay Steeds to our devotions; For these our hymns are calling thee, O Indra, hymns formed for praise, soliciting thy friendship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ य॒ज्ञं न॑मो॒वृधं॑ स॒जोषा॒ इन्द्र॑ देव॒ हरि॑भिर्याहि॒ तूय॑म् अ॒हं हि त्वा॑ म॒तिभि॒र्जोह॑वीमि घृ॒तप्र॑याः सध॒मादे॒ मधू॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ no yajñáṃ namovŕ̥dhaṃ sajóṣāḥ-  índra deva háribhir yāhi tū́yam  aháṃ hí tvā matíbhir jóhavīmi  ghr̥táprayāḥ sadhamā́de mádhūnām

translation.text: Pleased, with thy Bay Steeds, Indra, God, come quickly to this our sacrifice that heightens worship; For with my thoughts, presenting oil to feed thee, I call thee to the feast of sweet libations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ च॒ त्वामे॒ता वृष॑णा॒ वहा॑तो॒ हरी॒ सखा॑या सु॒धुरा॒ स्वङ्गा॑ धा॒नाव॒दिन्द्रः॒ सव॑नं जुषा॒णः सखा॒ सख्युः॑ शृणव॒द्वन्द॑नानि
verses.transliteration: ā́ ca tvā́m etā́ vŕ̥ṣaṇā váhāto  hárī sákhāyā sudhúrā sváṅgā  dhānā́vad índraḥ sávanaṃ juṣāṇáḥ  sákhā sákhyuḥ śr̥ṇavad vándanāni

translation.text: Yea, let thy two Bay Stallions bear thee hither, well limbed and good to draw, thy dear companions. Pleased with the corn-blent offering which we bring thee, may Indra, Friend, hear his friend's adoration.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कु॒विन्मा॑ गो॒पां कर॑से॒ जन॑स्य कु॒विद्राजा॑नं मघवन्नृजीषिन् कु॒विन्म॒ ऋषिं॑ पपि॒वांसं॑ सु॒तस्य॑ कु॒विन्मे॒ वस्वो॑ अ॒मृत॑स्य॒ शिक्षाः॑
verses.transliteration: kuvín mā gopā́ṃ kárase jánasya  kuvíd rā́jānam maghavann r̥jīṣin  kuvín ma ŕ̥ṣim papivā́ṃsaṃ sutásya  kuvín me vásvo amŕ̥tasya śíkṣāḥ

translation.text: Wilt thou not make me guardian of the people, make me, impetuous Maghavan, their ruler? Make me a R̥ishi having drunk of Soma? Wilt thou not give me wealth that lasts for ever?

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ त्वा॑ बृ॒हन्तो॒ हर॑यो युजा॒ना अ॒र्वागि॑न्द्र सध॒मादो॑ वहन्तु प्र ये द्वि॒ता दि॒व ऋ॒ञ्जन्त्याताः॒ सुस॑म्मृष्टासो वृष॒भस्य॑ मू॒राः
verses.transliteration: ā́ tvā br̥hánto hárayo yujānā́ḥ-  arvā́g indra sadhamā́do vahantu  prá yé dvitā́ divá r̥ñjánty ā́tāḥ  súsammr̥ṣṭāso vr̥ṣabhásya mūrā́ḥ

translation.text: Yoked to thy chariot, led thy tall Bays, Indra, companions of thy banquet, bear thee hither, Who from of old press to heaven's farthest limits, the Bull's impetuous and well-groomed Horses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ पिब॒ वृष॑धूतस्य॒ वृष्ण॒ आ यं ते॑ श्ये॒न उ॑श॒ते ज॒भार॑ यस्य॒ मदे॑ च्या॒वय॑सि॒ प्र कृ॒ष्टीर्यस्य॒ मदे॒ अप॑ गो॒त्रा व॒वर्थ॑
verses.transliteration: -índra píba vŕ̥ṣadhūtasya vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ  ā́ yáṃ te śyená uśaté jabhā́ra  yásya máde cyāváyasi prá kr̥ṣṭī́r  yásya máde ápa gotrā́ vavártha

translation.text: Drink of the strong pressed out by strong ones, Indra, that which the Falcon brought thee when thou longedst; In whose wild joy thou stirrest up the people, in whose wild joy thou didst unbar the cow-stalls.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram  asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau  śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu  ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām

translation.text: Call we on Indra, Makhavan, auspicious, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered; The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं ते॑ अस्तु हर्य॒तः सोम॒ आ हरि॑भिः सु॒तः जु॒षा॒ण इ॑न्द्र॒ हरि॑भिर्न॒ आ ग॒ह्या ति॑ष्ठ॒ हरि॑तं॒ रथ॑म्
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ te astu haryatáḥ  sóma ā́ háribhiḥ sutáḥ  juṣāṇá indra háribhir na ā́ gahi-  ā́ tiṣṭha háritaṃ rátham

translation.text: May this delightsome Soma be expressed for thee by tawny stones. Joying thereat, O Indra, with thy Bay Steeds come:. ascend thy golden-coloured car.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ह॒र्यन्नु॒षस॑मर्चयः॒ सूर्यं॑ ह॒र्यन्न॑रोचयः वि॒द्वाँश्चि॑कि॒त्वान्ह॑र्यश्व वर्धस॒ इन्द्र॒ विश्वा॑ अ॒भि श्रियः॑
verses.transliteration: haryánn uṣásam arcayaḥ  sū́ryaṃ haryánn arocayaḥ  vidvā́ṃś cikitvā́n haryaśva vardhase-  índra víśvā abhí śríyaḥ

translation.text: In love thou madest Ushas glow, in love thou madest Sûrya shine. Thou, Indra, knowing, thinking, Lord of Tawny Steeds, above all glories waxest great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यामिन्द्रो॒ हरि॑धायसं पृथि॒वीं हरि॑वर्पसम् अधा॑रयद्ध॒रितो॒र्भूरि॒ भोज॑नं॒ ययो॑र॒न्तर्हरि॒श्चर॑त्
verses.transliteration: dyā́m índro háridhāyasam  pr̥thivī́ṃ hárivarpasam  ádhārayad dharítor bhū́ri bhójanaṃ  yáyor antár háriś cárat

translation.text: The heaven with streams of golden hue, earth with her tints of green and gold- The golden Pair yield Indra plenteous nourishment: between them moves the golden One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज॒ज्ञा॒नो हरि॑तो॒ वृषा॒ विश्व॒मा भा॑ति रोच॒नम् हर्य॑श्वो॒ हरि॑तं धत्त॒ आयु॑ध॒मा वज्रं॑ बा॒ह्वोर्हरि॑म्
verses.transliteration: jajñānó hárito vŕ̥ṣā  víśvam ā́ bhāti rocanám  háryaśvo háritaṃ dhatta ā́yudham  ā́ vájram bāhvór hárim

translation.text: When born to life the golden Bull illumines all the realm of light. He takes his golden weapon, Lord of Tawny Steeds, the golden thunder in his arms.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ ह॒र्यन्त॒मर्जु॑नं॒ वज्रं॑ शु॒क्रैर॒भीवृ॑तम् अपा॑वृणो॒द्धरि॑भि॒रद्रि॑भिः सु॒तमुद्गा हरि॑भिराजत
verses.transliteration: índro haryántam árjunaṃ  vájraṃ śukraír abhī́vr̥tam  ápāvr̥ṇod dháribhir ádribhiḥ sutám  úd gā́ háribhir ājata

translation.text: The bright, the well-loved thunderbolt, girt with the bright, Indra disclosed, Disclosed the Soma juice pressed out by tawny stones, with tawny steeds drave forth the kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ म॒न्द्रैरि॑न्द्र॒ हरि॑भिर्या॒हि म॒यूर॑रोमभिः मा त्वा॒ के चि॒न्नि य॑म॒न्विं न पा॒शिनोऽति॒ धन्वे॑व॒ ताँ इ॑हि
verses.transliteration: ā́ mandraír indra háribhir  yāhí mayū́raromabhiḥ  mā́ tvā ké cin ní yaman víṃ ná pāśínaḥ-  -áti dhánveva tā́m̐ ihi

translation.text: COME hither, Indra, with Bay Steeds, joyous, with tails like peacocks' plumes. Let no men cheek thy course as fowlers stay the bird: pass o'er them as o'er desert lands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृ॒त्र॒खा॒दो व॑लंरु॒जः पु॒रां द॒र्मो अ॒पाम॒जः स्थाता॒ रथ॑स्य॒ हर्यो॑रभिस्व॒र इन्द्रो॑ दृ॒ळ्हा चि॑दारु॒जः
verses.transliteration: vr̥trakhādó valaṃrujáḥ  purā́ṃ darmó apā́m ajáḥ  sthā́tā ráthasya háryor abhisvaré-  índro dr̥ḷhā́ cid ārujáḥ

translation.text: He who slew Vr̥itra, burst the cloud, brake the strongholds and drave the floods, Indra who mounts his chariot at his Bay Steeds' cry, shatters e'en things that stand most firm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ग॒म्भी॒राँ उ॑द॒धीँरि॑व॒ क्रतुं॑ पुष्यसि॒ गा इ॑व प्र सु॑गो॒पा यव॑सं धे॒नवो॑ यथा ह्र॒दं कु॒ल्या इ॑वाशत
verses.transliteration: gambhīrā́m̐ udadhī́m̐r iva  krátum puṣyasi gā́ iva  prá sugopā́ yávasaṃ dhenávo yathā  hradáṃ kulyā́ ivāśata

translation.text: Like pools of water deep and full, like kine thou cherishest thy might; Like the milch-cows that go well-guarded to the mead, like water-brooks that reach the lake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ न॒स्तुजं॑ र॒यिं भ॒रांशं॒ न प्र॑तिजान॒ते वृ॒क्षं प॒क्वं फल॑म॒ङ्कीव॑ धूनु॒हीन्द्र॑ स॒म्पार॑णं॒ वसु॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ nas tújaṃ rayím bhara-  -áṃśaṃ ná pratijānaté  vr̥kṣám pakvám phálam aṅkī́va dhūnuhi-  -índra sampā́raṇaṃ vásu

translation.text: Bring thou us wealth with power to strike, our share, 'gainst him who calls it his. Shake, Indra, as with hooks, the tree for ripened fruit, for wealth to satisfy our wish.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒युरि॑न्द्र स्व॒राळ॑सि॒ स्मद्दि॑ष्टिः॒ स्वय॑शस्तरः स वा॑वृधा॒न ओज॑सा पुरुष्टुत॒ भवा॑ नः सु॒श्रव॑स्तमः
verses.transliteration: svayúr indra svarā́ḷ asi  smáddiṣṭiḥ sváyaśastaraḥ  sá vāvr̥dhāná ójasā puruṣṭuta  bhávā naḥ suśrávastamaḥ

translation.text: Indra, self-ruling Lord art thou, good Leader, of most glorious fame. So, waxen in thy strength, O thou whom many praise, be thou most swift to hear our call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒ध्मस्य॑ ते वृष॒भस्य॑ स्व॒राज॑ उ॒ग्रस्य॒ यूनः॒ स्थवि॑रस्य॒ घृष्वेः॑ अजू॑र्यतो व॒ज्रिणो॑ वी॒र्या॒३॒॑णीन्द्र॑ श्रु॒तस्य॑ मह॒तो म॒हानि॑
verses.transliteration: yudhmásya te vr̥ṣabhásya svarā́jaḥ-  ugrásya yū́na sthávirasya ghŕ̥ṣveḥ  ájūryato vajríṇo vīryā̀ṇi-  -índra śrutásya maható mahā́ni

translation.text: OF thee, the Bull, the Warrior, Sovran Ruler, joyous and fierce, ancient and ever youthful, The undecaying One who wields the thunder, renowned and great, great are the exploits, Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हाँ अ॑सि महिष॒ वृष्ण्ये॑भिर्धन॒स्पृदु॑ग्र॒ सह॑मानो अ॒न्यान् एको॒ विश्व॑स्य॒ भुव॑नस्य॒ राजा॒ स यो॒धया॑ च क्ष॒यया॑ च॒ जना॑न्
verses.transliteration: mahā́m̐ asi mahiṣa vŕ̥ṣṇyebhir  dhanaspŕ̥d ugra sáhamāno anyā́n  éko víśvasya bhúvanasya rā́jā  sá yodháyā ca kṣayáyā ca jánān

translation.text: Great art thou, Mighty Lord, through manly vigour, O fierce One, gathering spoil, subduing others, Thyself alone the universe's Sovran: so send forth men to combat and to rest them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र मात्रा॑भी रिरिचे॒ रोच॑मानः॒ प्र दे॒वेभि॑र्वि॒श्वतो॒ अप्र॑तीतः प्र म॒ज्मना॑ दि॒व इन्द्रः॑ पृथि॒व्याः प्रोरोर्म॒हो अ॒न्तरि॑क्षादृजी॒षी
verses.transliteration: prá mā́trābhī ririce rócamānaḥ  prá devébhir viśváto ápratītaḥ  prá majmánā divá índraḥ pr̥thivyā́ḥ  prórór mahó antárikṣād r̥jīṣī́

translation.text: He hath surpassed all measure in his brightness, yea, and the Gods, for none may be his equal. Impetuous Indra in his might cxccedcth wide vast mid-air and heaven and earth together.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒रुं ग॑भी॒रं ज॒नुषा॒भ्यु१॒॑ग्रं वि॒श्वव्य॑चसमव॒तं म॑ती॒नाम् इन्द्रं॒ सोमा॑सः प्र॒दिवि॑ सु॒तासः॑ समु॒द्रं न स्र॒वत॒ आ वि॑शन्ति
verses.transliteration: urúṃ gabhīráṃ janúṣābhy ùgráṃ  viśvávyacasam avatám matīnā́m  índraṃ sómāsaḥ pradívi sutā́saḥ  samudráṃ ná sraváta ā́ viśanti

translation.text: To Indra, even as rivers to the ocean, flow forth from days of old the Soma juices; To him wide deep and mighty from his birth-time, the well of holy thoughts, aIl-comprehending.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं सोम॑मिन्द्र पृथि॒वीद्यावा॒ गर्भं॒ न मा॒ता बि॑भृ॒तस्त्वा॒या तं ते॑ हिन्वन्ति॒ तमु॑ ते मृजन्त्यध्व॒र्यवो॑ वृषभ॒ पात॒वा उ॑
verses.transliteration: yáṃ sómam indra pr̥thivī́dyā́vā  gárbhaṃ ná mātā́ bibhr̥tás tvāyā́  táṃ te hinvanti tám u te mr̥janti-  adhvaryávo vr̥ṣabha pā́tavā́ u

translation.text: The Soma, Indra, which the earth and heaven bear for thee as a mother bears her infant, This they send forth to thee, this, vigorous Hero! Adhvaryus purify for thee to drink of.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒रुत्वाँ॑ इन्द्र वृष॒भो रणा॑य॒ पिबा॒ सोम॑मनुष्व॒धं मदा॑य आ सि॑ञ्चस्व ज॒ठरे॒ मध्व॑ ऊ॒र्मिं त्वं राजा॑सि प्र॒दिवः॑ सु॒ताना॑म्
verses.transliteration: marútvām̐ indra vr̥ṣabhó ráṇāya  píbā sómam anuṣvadhám mádāya  ā́ siñcasva jaṭháre mádhva ūrmíṃ  tváṃ rā́jāsi pradívaḥ sutā́nām

translation.text: DRINK, Indra, Marut-girt, as Bull, the Soma, for joy, for rapture even as thou listest. Pour down the flood of meath within thy belly: thou from of old art King of Soma juices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒जोषा॑ इन्द्र॒ सग॑णो म॒रुद्भिः॒ सोमं॑ पिब वृत्र॒हा शू॑र वि॒द्वान् ज॒हि शत्रूँ॒रप॒ मृधो॑ नुद॒स्वाथाभ॑यं कृणुहि वि॒श्वतो॑ नः
verses.transliteration: sajóṣā indra ságaṇo marúdbhiḥ  sómam piba vr̥trahā́ śūra vidvā́n  jahí śátrūm̐r ápa mŕ̥dho nudasva-  -áthā́bhayaṃ kr̥ṇuhi viśváto naḥ

translation.text: Indra, accordant, with the banded Maruts, drink Soma, Hero, as wise Vr̥itra-slayer. Slay thou our foemen, drive away assailants and make us safe on every side from danger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त ऋ॒तुभि॑र्ऋतुपाः पाहि॒ सोम॒मिन्द्र॑ दे॒वेभिः॒ सखि॑भिः सु॒तं नः॑ याँ आभ॑जो म॒रुतो॒ ये त्वान्वह॑न्वृ॒त्रमद॑धु॒स्तुभ्य॒मोजः॑
verses.transliteration: utá r̥túbhir r̥tupāḥ pāhi sómam  índra devébhiḥ sákhibhiḥ sutáṃ naḥ  yā́m̐ ā́bhajo marúto yé tvā́nu-  áhan vr̥trám ádadhus túbhyam ójaḥ

translation.text: And, drinker at due seasons, drink in season, Indra, with friendly Gods, our pressed-out Soma. The Maruts following, whom thou madest sharers, gave thee the victory, and thou slewest Vr̥itra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये त्वा॑हि॒हत्ये॑ मघव॒न्नव॑र्ध॒न्ये शा॑म्ब॒रे ह॑रिवो॒ ये गवि॑ष्टौ ये त्वा॑ नू॒नम॑नु॒मद॑न्ति॒ विप्राः॒ पिबे॑न्द्र॒ सोमं॒ सग॑णो म॒रुद्भिः॑
verses.transliteration: yé tvāhihátye maghavann ávardhan  yé śāmbaré harivo yé gáviṣṭau  yé tvā nūnám anumádanti víprāḥ  píbendra sómaṃ ságaṇo marúdbhiḥ

translation.text: Drink Soma, Indra, banded with the Maruts who, Maghavan, strengthened thee at Ahi's slaughter, 'Gainst Ṣambara, Lord of Bays! in winning cattle, and now rejoice in thee, the holy Singers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒रुत्व॑न्तं वृष॒भं वा॑वृधा॒नमक॑वारिं दि॒व्यं शा॒समिन्द्र॑म् वि॒श्वा॒साह॒मव॑से॒ नूत॑नायो॒ग्रं स॑हो॒दामि॒ह तं हु॑वेम
verses.transliteration: marútvantaṃ vr̥ṣabháṃ vāvr̥dhānám  ákavāriṃ divyáṃ śāsám índram  viśvāsā́ham ávase nū́tanāya-  -ugráṃ sahodā́m ihá táṃ huvema

translation.text: The Bull whose strength hath waxed, whom Maruts follow, free-giving Indra, the celestial Ruler, Mighty, all-conquering, the victory-giver, him let us call to grant us new protection.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒द्यो ह॑ जा॒तो वृ॑ष॒भः क॒नीनः॒ प्रभ॑र्तुमाव॒दन्ध॑सः सु॒तस्य॑ सा॒धोः पि॑ब प्रतिका॒मं यथा॑ ते॒ रसा॑शिरः प्रथ॒मं सो॒म्यस्य॑
verses.transliteration: sadyó ha jātó vr̥ṣabháḥ kanī́naḥ  prábhartum āvad ándhasaḥ sutásya  sādhóḥ piba pratikāmáṃ yáthā te  rásāśiraḥ prathamáṃ somyásya

translation.text: SOON as the young Bull sprang into existence he longed to taste the pressed-out Soma's liquor. Drink thou thy fill, according to thy longing, first, of the goodly mixture blent with Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यज्जाय॑था॒स्तदह॑रस्य॒ कामें॒ऽशोः पी॒यूष॑मपिबो गिरि॒ष्ठाम् तं ते॑ मा॒ता परि॒ योषा॒ जनि॑त्री म॒हः पि॒तुर्दम॒ आसि॑ञ्च॒दग्रे॑
verses.transliteration: yáj jā́yathās tád áhar asya kā́me  -aṃśóḥ pīyū́ṣam apibo giriṣṭhā́m  táṃ te mātā́ pári yóṣā jánitrī  maháḥ pitúr dáma ā́siñcad ágre

translation.text: That day when thou wast born thou, fain to taste it, drankest the plant's milk which the mountains nourish. That milk thy Mother first, the Dame who bare thee, poured for thee in thy mighty Father's dwelling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒प॒स्थाय॑ मा॒तर॒मन्न॑मैट्ट ति॒ग्मम॑पश्यद॒भि सोम॒मूधः॑ प्र॒या॒वय॑न्नचर॒द्गृत्सो॑ अ॒न्यान्म॒हानि॑ चक्रे पुरु॒धप्र॑तीकः
verses.transliteration: upasthā́ya mātáram ánnam aiṭṭa  tigmám apaśyad abhí sómam ū́dhaḥ  prayāváyann acarad gŕ̥tso anyā́n  mahā́ni cakre purudhápratīkaḥ

translation.text: Desiring food he came unto his Mother, and on her breast beheld the pungent Soma. Wise, he moved on, keeping aloof the others, and wrought great exploits in his varied aspects.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒ग्रस्तु॑रा॒षाळ॒भिभू॑त्योजा यथाव॒शं त॒न्वं॑ चक्र ए॒षः त्वष्टा॑र॒मिन्द्रो॑ ज॒नुषा॑भि॒भूया॒मुष्या॒ सोम॑मपिबच्च॒मूषु॑
verses.transliteration: ugrás turāṣā́ḷ abhíbhūtyojāḥ-  yathāvaśáṃ tanvàṃ cakra eṣáḥ  tváṣṭāram índro janúṣābhibhū́ya-  -āmúṣyā sómam apibac camū́ṣu

translation.text: Fierce, quickly conquering, of surpassing vigour, he framed his body even as he listed. E'en from his birth-time Indra conquered Tvashṭar, bore off the Soma and in beakers drank it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram  asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau  śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu  ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām

translation.text: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered; The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शंसा॑ म॒हामिन्द्रं॒ यस्मि॒न्विश्वा॒ आ कृ॒ष्टयः॑ सोम॒पाः काम॒मव्य॑न् यं सु॒क्रतुं॑ धि॒षणे॑ विभ्वत॒ष्टं घ॒नं वृ॒त्राणां॑ ज॒नय॑न्त दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: śáṃsā mahā́m índraṃ yásmin víśvāḥ-  ā́ kr̥ṣṭáyaḥ somapā́ḥ kā́mam ávyan  yáṃ sukrátuṃ dhiṣáṇe vibhvataṣṭáṃ  ghanáṃ vr̥trā́ṇāṃ janáyanta devā́ḥ

translation.text: GREAT Indra will I laud, in whom all people who drink the Soma have attained their longing; Whom, passing wise, Gods, Heaven and Earth, engendered, formed by a Master's hand, to crush the Vr̥itras.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं नु नकिः॒ पृत॑नासु स्व॒राजं॑ द्वि॒ता तर॑ति॒ नृत॑मं हरि॒ष्ठाम् इ॒नत॑मः॒ सत्व॑भि॒र्यो ह॑ शू॒षैः पृ॑थु॒ज्रया॑ अमिना॒दायु॒र्दस्योः॑
verses.transliteration: yáṃ nú nákiḥ pŕ̥tanāsu svarā́jaṃ  dvitā́ tárati nŕ̥tamaṃ hariṣṭhā́m  inátamaḥ sátvabhir yó ha śūṣaíḥ  pr̥thujráyā aminād ā́yur dásyoḥ

translation.text: Whom, most heroic, borne by Tawny Coursers, verily none subdueth in the battle; Who, reaching far, most vigorous, hath shortened the Dasyu's life with Warriors bold of spirit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हावा॑ पृ॒त्सु त॒रणि॒र्नार्वा॑ व्यान॒शी रोद॑सी मे॒हना॑वान् भगो॒ न का॒रे हव्यो॑ मती॒नां पि॒तेव॒ चारुः॑ सु॒हवो॑ वयो॒धाः
verses.transliteration: sahā́vā pr̥tsú taráṇir nā́rvā  vyānaśī́ ródasī mehánāvān  bhágo ná kāré hávyo matīnā́m  pitéva cā́ruḥ suhávo vayodhā́ḥ

translation.text: Victor in fight, swift mover like a warhorse, pervading both worlds, rainer down of blessings, To he invoked in war like Bhaga, Father, as 'twere, of hymns, fair, prompt to hear, strength-giver.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ध॒र्ता दि॒वो रज॑सस्पृ॒ष्ट ऊ॒र्ध्वो रथो॒ न वा॒युर्वसु॑भिर्नि॒युत्वा॑न् क्ष॒पां व॒स्ता ज॑नि॒ता सूर्य॑स्य॒ विभ॑क्ता भा॒गं धि॒षणे॑व॒ वाज॑म्
verses.transliteration: dhartā́ divó rájasas pr̥ṣṭá ūrdhvó  rátho ná vāyúr vásubhir niyútvān  kṣapā́ṃ vastā́ janitā́ sū́ryasya  víbhaktā bhāgáṃ dhiṣáṇeva vā́jam

translation.text: Supporting heaven, the high back of the region, his car is Vâyu with his team of Vasus. Illumining the nights, the Sun's creator, like Dhishaṇâ he deals forth strength and riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram  asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau  śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu  ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām

translation.text: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered; The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रः॒ स्वाहा॑ पिबतु॒ यस्य॒ सोम॑ आ॒गत्या॒ तुम्रो॑ वृष॒भो म॒रुत्वा॑न् ओरु॒व्यचाः॑ पृणतामे॒भिरन्नै॒रास्य॑ ह॒विस्त॒न्व१॒॑ः काम॑मृध्याः
verses.transliteration: índraḥ svā́hā pibatu yásya sómaḥ-  āgátyā túmro vr̥ṣabhó marútvān  óruvyácāḥ pr̥ṇatām ebhír ánnair  ā́sya havís tanvàḥ kā́mam r̥dhyāḥ

translation.text: LET Indra drink, All-hail! for his is Soma,– the mighty Bull come, girt by Maruts, hither. Far-reaching, let him fill him with these viands, and let our offering sate his body's longing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ते॑ सप॒र्यू ज॒वसे॑ युनज्मि॒ ययो॒रनु॑ प्र॒दिवः॑ श्रु॒ष्टिमावः॑ इ॒ह त्वा॑ धेयु॒र्हर॑यः सुशिप्र॒ पिबा॒ त्व१॒॑स्य सुषु॑तस्य॒ चारोः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ te saparyū́ javáse yunajmi  yáyor ánu pradívaḥ śruṣṭím ā́vaḥ  ihá tvā dheyur hárayaḥ suśipra  píbā tv àsyá súṣutasya cā́roḥ

translation.text: I yoke thy pair of trusty Steeds for swiftness, whose faithful service from of old thou lovest. Here, fair of cheek! let thy Bay Coursers place thee: drink of this lovely welleffused libation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गोभि॑र्मिमि॒क्षुं द॑धिरे सुपा॒रमिन्द्रं॒ ज्यैष्ठ्या॑य॒ धाय॑से गृणा॒नाः म॒न्दा॒नः सोमं॑ पपि॒वाँ ऋ॑जीषि॒न्त्सम॒स्मभ्यं॑ पुरु॒धा गा इ॑षण्य
verses.transliteration: góbhir mimikṣúṃ dadhire supārám  índraṃ jyaíṣṭhyāya dhā́yase gr̥ṇānā́ḥ  mandānáḥ sómam papivā́m̐ r̥jīṣin  sám asmábhyam purudhā́ gā́ iṣaṇya

translation.text: With milk they made Indra their good Preserver, lauding for help and rule the bounteous rainer. Impetuous God, when thou hast drunk the Soma, enraptured send us cattle in abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं कामं॑ मन्दया॒ गोभि॒रश्वै॑श्च॒न्द्रव॑ता॒ राध॑सा प॒प्रथ॑श्च स्व॒र्यवो॑ म॒तिभि॒स्तुभ्यं॒ विप्रा॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ वाहः॑ कुशि॒कासो॑ अक्रन्
verses.transliteration: imáṃ kā́mam mandayā góbhir áśvaiś  candrávatā rā́dhasā papráthaś ca  svaryávo matíbhis túbhyaṃ víprāḥ-  índrāya vā́haḥ kuśikā́so akran

translation.text: With kine and horses satisfy this longing with very splendid bounty still extend it. Seeking the light, with hymns to thee, O Indra, the Kuṣikas have brought their gift, the singers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram  asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau  śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu  ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām

translation.text: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered; The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒र्ष॒णी॒धृतं॑ म॒घवा॑नमु॒क्थ्य१॒॑मिन्द्रं॒ गिरो॑ बृह॒तीर॒भ्य॑नूषत वा॒वृ॒धा॒नं पु॑रुहू॒तं सु॑वृ॒क्तिभि॒रम॑र्त्यं॒ जर॑माणं दि॒वेदि॑वे
verses.transliteration: carṣaṇīdhŕ̥tam maghávānam ukthyàm  índraṃ gíro br̥hatī́r abhy ànūṣata  vāvr̥dhānám puruhūtáṃ suvr̥ktíbhir  ámartyaṃ járamāṇaṃ divé-dive

translation.text: HIGH hymns have sounded forth the praise of Maghavan, supporter of mankind, of Indra meet for lauds; Him who hath waxen great, invoked with beauteous songs, Immortal One, whose praise each day is sung aloud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तक्र॑तुमर्ण॒वं शा॒किनं॒ नरं॒ गिरो॑ म॒ इन्द्र॒मुप॑ यन्ति वि॒श्वतः॑ वा॒ज॒सनिं॑ पू॒र्भिदं॒ तूर्णि॑म॒प्तुरं॑ धाम॒साच॑मभि॒षाचं॑ स्व॒र्विद॑म्
verses.transliteration: śatákratum arṇaváṃ śākínaṃ náraṃ  gíro ma índram úpa yanti viśvátaḥ  vājasánim pūrbhídaṃ tū́rṇim aptúraṃ  dhāmasā́cam abhiṣā́caṃ svarvídam

translation.text: To Indra from all sides go forth my songs of praise, the Lord of Hundred Powers, strong, Hero, like the sea, Swift, winner of the booty, breaker-down of forts, faithful and ever-glorious, finder of the light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒क॒रे वसो॑र्जरि॒ता प॑नस्यतेऽने॒हसः॒ स्तुभ॒ इन्द्रो॑ दुवस्यति वि॒वस्व॑तः॒ सद॑न॒ आ हि पि॑प्रि॒ये स॑त्रा॒साह॑मभिमाति॒हनं॑ स्तुहि
verses.transliteration: ākaré vásor jaritā́ panasyate  -anehása stúbha índro duvasyati  vivásvataḥ sádana ā́ hí pipriyé  satrāsā́ham abhimātihánaṃ stuhi

translation.text: Where battle's spoil is piled the singer winneth praise, for Indra taketh care of matchless worshippers. He in Vivasvan's dwelling findeth his delight: praise thou the ever-conquering slayer of the foe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नृ॒णामु॑ त्वा॒ नृत॑मं गी॒र्भिरु॒क्थैर॒भि प्र वी॒रम॑र्चता स॒बाधः॑ सं सह॑से पुरुमा॒यो जि॑हीते॒ नमो॑ अस्य प्र॒दिव॒ एक॑ ईशे
verses.transliteration: nr̥ṇā́m u tvā nŕ̥tamaṃ gīrbhír ukthaír  abhí prá vīrám arcatā sabā́dhaḥ  sáṃ sáhase purumāyó jihīte  námo asya pradíva éka īśe

translation.text: Thee, valorous, most heroic of the heroes, shall the priests glorify with songg and praises. Full of all wondrous power he goes to conquest: worship is his, sole Lord from days aforetime.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पू॒र्वीर॑स्य नि॒ष्षिधो॒ मर्त्ये॑षु पु॒रू वसू॑नि पृथि॒वी बि॑भर्ति इन्द्रा॑य॒ द्याव॒ ओष॑धीरु॒तापो॑ र॒यिं र॑क्षन्ति जी॒रयो॒ वना॑नि
verses.transliteration: pūrvī́r asya niṣṣídho mártyeṣu  purū́ vásūni pr̥thivī́ bibharti  índrāya dyā́va óṣadhīr utā́po  rayíṃ rakṣanti jīráyo vánāni

translation.text: Abundant are the gifts he gives to mortals: for him the earth bears a rich store of treasures. The heavens, the growing plants, the living waters, the forest trees preserve their wealth for Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तुभ्यं॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि॒ गिर॑ इन्द्र॒ तुभ्यं॑ स॒त्रा द॑धिरे हरिवो जु॒षस्व॑ बो॒ध्या॒३॒॑पिरव॑सो॒ नूत॑नस्य॒ सखे॑ वसो जरि॒तृभ्यो॒ वयो॑ धाः
verses.transliteration: túbhyam bráhmāṇi gíra indra túbhyaṃ  satrā́ dadhire harivo juṣásva  bodhy ā̀pír ávaso nū́tanasya  sákhe vaso jaritŕ̥bhyo váyo dhāḥ

translation.text: To thee, O Indra, Lord of Bays, for ever are offered prayers and songs: accept them gladly. As Kinsman think thou of some fresh assistance; good Friend, give strength and life to those who praise thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑ मरुत्व इ॒ह पा॑हि॒ सोमं॒ यथा॑ शार्या॒ते अपि॑बः सु॒तस्य॑ तव॒ प्रणी॑ती॒ तव॑ शूर॒ शर्म॒न्ना वि॑वासन्ति क॒वयः॑ सुय॒ज्ञाः
verses.transliteration: índra marutva ihá pāhi sómaṃ  yáthā śāryāté ápibaḥ sutásya  táva práṇītī táva śūra śármann  ā́ vivāsanti kaváyaḥ suyajñā́ḥ

translation.text: Here, Indra, drink thou Soma with the Maruts, as thou didst drink the juice beside Saryata. Under thy guidance, in thy keeping, Hero, the singers serve, skilled in fair sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स वा॑वशा॒न इ॒ह पा॑हि॒ सोमं॑ म॒रुद्भि॑रिन्द्र॒ सखि॑भिः सु॒तं नः॑ जा॒तं यत्त्वा॒ परि॑ दे॒वा अभू॑षन्म॒हे भरा॑य पुरुहूत॒ विश्वे॑
verses.transliteration: sá vāvaśāná ihá pāhi sómam  marúdbhir indra sákhibhiḥ sutáṃ naḥ  jātáṃ yát tvā pári devā́ ábhūṣan  mahé bhárāya puruhūta víśve

translation.text: So eagerly desirous drink the Soma, our juice, O Indra, with thy friends the Maruts, Since at thy birth all Deities adorned thee for the great fight, O thou invoked of many.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒प्तूर्ये॑ मरुत आ॒पिरे॒षोऽम॑न्द॒न्निन्द्र॒मनु॒ दाति॑वाराः तेभिः॑ सा॒कं पि॑बतु वृत्रखा॒दः सु॒तं सोमं॑ दा॒शुषः॒ स्वे स॒धस्थे॑
verses.transliteration: aptū́rye maruta āpír eṣó  -ámandann índram ánu dā́tivārāḥ  tébhiḥ sākám pibatu vr̥trakhādáḥ  sutáṃ sómaṃ dāśúṣaḥ své sadhásthe

translation.text: He was your comrade in your zeal, O Maruts: they, rich in noble gifts, rejoiced in Indra. With them together let the Vr̥itra-slayer drink in his home the worshipper's libation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं ह्यन्वोज॑सा सु॒तं रा॑धानां पते पिबा॒ त्व१॒॑स्य गि॑र्वणः
verses.transliteration: idáṃ hy ánv ójasā  sutáṃ rādhānām pate  píbā tv àsyá girvaṇaḥ

translation.text: So, Lord of affluent gifts, this juice hath been pressed for thee with strength Drink of it, thou who lovest song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्ते॒ अनु॑ स्व॒धामस॑त्सु॒ते नि य॑च्छ त॒न्व॑म् स त्वा॑ ममत्तु सो॒म्यम्
verses.transliteration: yás te ánu svadhā́m ásat  suté ní yacha tanvàm  sá tvā mamattu somyám

translation.text: Incline thy body to this juice which suits thy Godlike nature well: May it cheer thee who lovest it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ते॑ अश्नोतु कु॒क्ष्योः प्रेन्द्र॒ ब्रह्म॑णा॒ शिरः॑ प्र बा॒हू शू॑र॒ राध॑से
verses.transliteration: prá te aśnotu kukṣyóḥ  préndra bráhmaṇā śíraḥ  prá bāhū́ śūra rā́dhase

translation.text: Brave Indra, let it work through both thy flanks, and through thy head by prayer, And through thine arms, to prosper us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धा॒नाव॑न्तं कर॒म्भिण॑मपू॒पव॑न्तमु॒क्थिन॑म् इन्द्र॑ प्रा॒तर्जु॑षस्व नः
verses.transliteration: dhānā́vantaṃ karambhíṇam  apūpávantam ukthínam  índra prātár juṣasva naḥ

translation.text: INDRA, accept at break of day our Soma mixt with roasted corn, With groats with cake, with eulogies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रो॒ळाशं॑ पच॒त्यं॑ जु॒षस्वे॒न्द्रा गु॑रस्व च तुभ्यं॑ ह॒व्यानि॑ सिस्रते
verses.transliteration: puroḷā́śam pacatyàṃ  juṣásvendrā́ gurasva ca  túbhyaṃ havyā́ni sisrate

translation.text: Accept, O Indra, and enjoy the well-dressed sacrificial cake: Oblations are poured forth to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रो॒ळाशं॑ च नो॒ घसो॑ जो॒षया॑से॒ गिर॑श्च नः व॒धू॒युरि॑व॒ योष॑णाम्
verses.transliteration: puroḷā́śaṃ ca no gháso  joṣáyāse gíraś ca naḥ  vadhūyúr iva yóṣaṇām

translation.text: Consume our sacrificial cake, accept the songs of praise we sing, As he who woes accepts his bride.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रो॒ळाशं॑ सनश्रुत प्रातःसा॒वे जु॑षस्व नः इन्द्र॒ क्रतु॒र्हि ते॑ बृ॒हन्
verses.transliteration: puroḷā́śaṃ sanaśruta  prātaḥsāvé juṣasva naḥ  índra krátur hí te br̥hán

translation.text: Famed from of old, accept the cake at our libation poured at dawn, Forgreat, O Indra, is thy power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: माध्यं॑दिनस्य॒ सव॑नस्य धा॒नाः पु॑रो॒ळाश॑मिन्द्र कृष्वे॒ह चारु॑म् प्र यत्स्तो॒ता ज॑रि॒ता तूर्ण्य॑र्थो वृषा॒यमा॑ण॒ उप॑ गी॒र्भिरीट्टे॑
verses.transliteration: mā́dhyaṃdinasya sávanasya dhānā́ḥ  puroḷā́śam indra kr̥ṣvehá cā́rum  prá yát stotā́ jaritā́ tū́rṇyartho  vr̥ṣāyámāṇa úpa gīrbhír ī́ṭṭe

translation.text: Let roasted corn of our midday libation, and sacrificial cake here please thee, Indra, What time the lauding singer, keen of purpose and eager as a bull, with hymns implores thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तृ॒तीये॑ धा॒नाः सव॑ने पुरुष्टुत पुरो॒ळाश॒माहु॑तं मामहस्व नः ऋ॒भु॒मन्तं॒ वाज॑वन्तं त्वा कवे॒ प्रय॑स्वन्त॒ उप॑ शिक्षेम धी॒तिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: tr̥tī́ye dhānā́ḥ sávane puruṣṭuta  puroḷā́śam ā́hutam māmahasva naḥ  r̥bhumántaṃ vā́javantaṃ tvā kave  práyasvanta úpa śikṣema dhītíbhiḥ

translation.text: At the third sacrifice, O thou whom many praise, give glory to the roasted corn and holy cake. With offered viands and with songs may we assist thee, Sage, whom Vâja and the R̥ibhus wait upon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पू॒ष॒ण्वते॑ ते चकृमा कर॒म्भं हरि॑वते॒ हर्य॑श्वाय धा॒नाः अ॒पू॒पम॑द्धि॒ सग॑णो म॒रुद्भिः॒ सोमं॑ पिब वृत्र॒हा शू॑र वि॒द्वान्
verses.transliteration: pūṣaṇváte te cakr̥mā karambháṃ  hárivate háryaśvāya dhānā́ḥ  apūpám addhi ságaṇo marúdbhiḥ  sómam piba vr̥trahā́ śūra vidvā́n

translation.text: The groats have we prepared for thee with Pûshan, corn for thee, Lord of Bay Steeds, with thy horses. Eat thou the meal-cake, banded with the Maruts, wise Hero, Vr̥itra-slayer, drink the Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ धा॒ना भ॑रत॒ तूय॑मस्मै पुरो॒ळाशं॑ वी॒रत॑माय नृ॒णाम् दि॒वेदि॑वे स॒दृशी॑रिन्द्र॒ तुभ्यं॒ वर्ध॑न्तु त्वा सोम॒पेया॑य धृष्णो
verses.transliteration: práti dhānā́ bharata tū́yam asmai  puroḷā́śaṃ vīrátamāya nr̥ṇā́m  divé-dive sadŕ̥śīr indra túbhyaṃ  várdhantu tvā somapéyāya dhr̥ṣṇo

translation.text: Bring forth the roasted corn to meet him quickly, cake for the bravest Hero mid the heroes. Indra, may hymns accordant with thee daily strengthen thee, Bold One, for the draught of Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑पर्वता बृह॒ता रथे॑न वा॒मीरिष॒ आ व॑हतं सु॒वीराः॑ वी॒तं ह॒व्यान्य॑ध्व॒रेषु॑ देवा॒ वर्धे॑थां गी॒र्भिरिळ॑या॒ मद॑न्ता
verses.transliteration: índrāparvatā br̥hatā́ ráthena  vāmī́r íṣa ā́ vahataṃ suvī́rāḥ  vītáṃ havyā́ny adhvaréṣu devā  várdhethāṃ gīrbhír íḷayā mádantā

translation.text: ON a high car, O Parvata and Indra, bring pleasant viands, with brave heroes, hither. Enjoy the gifts, Gods, at our sacrifices wax strong by hymns, rejoice in our oblation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तिष्ठा॒ सु कं॑ मघव॒न्मा परा॑ गाः॒ सोम॑स्य॒ नु त्वा॒ सुषु॑तस्य यक्षि पि॒तुर्न पु॒त्रः सिच॒मा र॑भे त॒ इन्द्र॒ स्वादि॑ष्ठया गि॒रा श॑चीवः
verses.transliteration: tíṣṭhā sú kam maghavan mā́ párā gāḥ  sómasya nú tvā súṣutasya yakṣi  pitúr ná putráḥ sícam ā́ rabhe te-  índra svā́diṣṭhayā girā́ śacīvaḥ

translation.text: Stay still, O Maghavan, advance no farther. a draught of well-pressed Soma will I give thee. With sweetest song I grasp, O Mighty Indra, thy garment's hem as a child grasps his father's.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शंसा॑वाध्वर्यो॒ प्रति॑ मे गृणी॒हीन्द्रा॑य॒ वाहः॑ कृणवाव॒ जुष्ट॑म् एदं ब॒र्हिर्यज॑मानस्य सी॒दाथा॑ च भूदु॒क्थमिन्द्रा॑य श॒स्तम्
verses.transliteration: śáṃsāvādhvaryo práti me gr̥ṇīhi-  -índrāya vā́haḥ kr̥ṇavāva júṣṭam  édám barhír yájamānasya sīda-  -áthā ca bhūd ukthám índrāya śastám

translation.text: Adhvaryu, sing we both; sing thou in answer: make we a laud acceptable to Indra. Upon this sacrificer's grass he seated: to Indra shall our eulogy be uttered.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जा॒येदस्तं॑ मघव॒न्त्सेदु॒ योनि॒स्तदित्त्वा॑ यु॒क्ता हर॑यो वहन्तु य॒दा क॒दा च॑ सु॒नवा॑म॒ सोम॑म॒ग्निष्ट्वा॑ दू॒तो ध॑न्वा॒त्यच्छ॑
verses.transliteration: jāyéd ástam maghavan séd u yónis  tád ít tvā yuktā́ hárayo vahantu  yadā́ kadā́ ca sunávāma sómam  agníṣ ṭvā dūtó dhanvāty ácha

translation.text: A wife, O Maghavan is home and dwelling: so let thy Bay Steeds yoked convey thee hither. Whenever we press out for thee the Soma, let Agni as our Herald speed to call thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परा॑ याहि मघव॒न्ना च॑ या॒हीन्द्र॑ भ्रातरुभ॒यत्रा॑ ते॒ अर्थ॑म् यत्रा॒ रथ॑स्य बृह॒तो नि॒धानं॑ वि॒मोच॑नं वा॒जिनो॒ रास॑भस्य
verses.transliteration: párā yāhi maghavann ā́ ca yāhi-  -índra bhrātar ubhayátrā te ártham  yátrā ráthasya br̥ható nidhā́naṃ  vimócanaṃ vājíno rā́sabhasya

translation.text: Depart, O Maghavan;again come hither: both there and here thy goat is Indra, Brother, Where thy tall chariot hath a place to rest in, and where thqu loosest thy loud-neighing Courser.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अपाः॒ सोम॒मस्त॑मिन्द्र॒ प्र या॑हि कल्या॒णीर्जा॒या सु॒रणं॑ गृ॒हे ते॑ यत्रा॒ रथ॑स्य बृह॒तो नि॒धानं॑ वि॒मोच॑नं वा॒जिनो॒ दक्षि॑णावत्
verses.transliteration: ápāḥ sómam ástam indra prá yāhi  kalyāṇī́r jāyā́ suráṇaṃ gr̥hé te  yátrā ráthasya br̥ható nidhā́naṃ  vimócanaṃ vājíno dákṣiṇāvat

translation.text: Thou hast drunk Soma, Indra, turn thee homeward; thy joy is in thy home, thy racious Consort; Where thy tall chariot hath a place to rest in, and thy strong Courser is set free with guerdon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मे भो॒जा अङ्गि॑रसो॒ विरू॑पा दि॒वस्पु॒त्रासो॒ असु॑रस्य वी॒राः वि॒श्वामि॑त्राय॒ दद॑तो म॒घानि॑ सहस्रसा॒वे प्र ति॑रन्त॒ आयुः॑
verses.transliteration: imé bhojā́ áṅgiraso vírūpāḥ-  divás putrā́so ásurasya vīrā́ḥ  viśvā́mitrāya dádato maghā́ni  sahasrasāvé prá tiranta ā́yuḥ

translation.text: Bounteous are these, Angirases, Virûpas: the Asura's Heroes and the Sons of Heaven. They, giving store of wealth to Viṣvâmitra, prolong his life through countless Soma-pressings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रू॒पंरू॑पं म॒घवा॑ बोभवीति मा॒याः कृ॑ण्वा॒नस्त॒न्वं१॒॑ परि॒ स्वाम् त्रिर्यद्दि॒वः परि॑ मुहू॒र्तमागा॒त्स्वैर्मन्त्रै॒रनृ॑तुपा ऋ॒तावा॑
verses.transliteration: rūpáṃ-rūpam maghávā bobhavīti  māyā́ḥ kr̥ṇvānás tanvàm pári svā́m  trír yád diváḥ pári muhūrtám ā́gāt  svaír mántrair ánr̥tupā r̥tā́vā

translation.text: Maghavan weareth every shape at pleasure, effecting magic changes in his body, Holy One, drinker out of season, coming thrice, in a moment, through fit prayers, from heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हाँ ऋषि॑र्देव॒जा दे॒वजू॒तोऽस्त॑भ्ना॒त्सिन्धु॑मर्ण॒वं नृ॒चक्षाः॑ वि॒श्वामि॑त्रो॒ यदव॑हत्सु॒दास॒मप्रि॑यायत कुशि॒केभि॒रिन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: mahā́m̐ ŕ̥ṣir devajā́ devájūtaḥ-  -ástabhnāt síndhum arṇaváṃ nr̥cákṣāḥ  viśvā́mitro yád ávahat sudā́sam  ápriyāyata kuśikébhir índraḥ

translation.text: The mighty sage, God-born and God-incited, who looks on men, restrained the billowy river. When Viṣvâmitra was Sudâs's escort, then Indra through the Kuṣikas grew friendly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हं॒सा इ॑व कृणुथ॒ श्लोक॒मद्रि॑भि॒र्मद॑न्तो गी॒र्भिर॑ध्व॒रे सु॒ते सचा॑ दे॒वेभि॑र्विप्रा ऋषयो नृचक्षसो॒ वि पि॑बध्वं कुशिकाः सो॒म्यं मधु॑
verses.transliteration: haṃsā́ iva kr̥ṇutha ślókam ádribhir  mádanto gīrbhír adhvaré suté sácā  devébhir viprā r̥ṣayo nr̥cakṣaso  ví pibadhvaṃ kuśikāḥ somyám mádhu

translation.text: Like swans, prepare a song of praise with pressing-stones, glad in your hymns with juice poured forth in sacrifice. Ye singers, with the Gods, sages who look on men, ye Kutikas drink up the Soma's savoury meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॒ प्रेत॑ कुशिकाश्चे॒तय॑ध्व॒मश्वं॑ रा॒ये प्र मु॑ञ्चता सु॒दासः॑ राजा॑ वृ॒त्रं ज॑ङ्घन॒त्प्रागपा॒गुद॒गथा॑ यजाते॒ वर॒ आ पृ॑थि॒व्याः
verses.transliteration: úpa préta kuśikāś cetáyadhvam  áśvaṃ rāyé prá muñcatā sudā́saḥ  rā́jā vr̥tráṃ jaṅghanat prā́g ápāg údag  áthā yajāte vára ā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ

translation.text: Come forward, Kuṣikas, and be attentive; let loose Sudâs's horse to win him riches. East, west, and north, let the King slay the foeman, then at earth's choicest place perform his worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य इ॒मे रोद॑सी उ॒भे अ॒हमिन्द्र॒मतु॑ष्टवम् वि॒श्वामि॑त्रस्य रक्षति॒ ब्रह्मे॒दं भार॑तं॒ जन॑म्
verses.transliteration: yá imé ródasī ubhé  ahám índram átuṣṭavam  viśvā́mitrasya rakṣati  bráhmedám bhā́rataṃ jánam

translation.text: Praises to Indra have I sung, sustainer of this earth and heaven. This prayer of Viṣvâmitra keeps secure the race of Bharatas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒श्वामि॑त्रा अरासत॒ ब्रह्मेन्द्रा॑य व॒ज्रिणे॑ कर॒दिन्नः॑ सु॒राध॑सः
verses.transliteration: viśvā́mitrā arāsata  bráhméndrāya vajríṇe  kárad ín naḥ surā́dhasaḥ

translation.text: The Viṣvâmitras have sung forth this prayer to Indra Thunder-aimed: So let him make us prosperous.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किं ते॑ कृण्वन्ति॒ कीक॑टेषु॒ गावो॒ नाशिरं॑ दु॒ह्रे न त॑पन्ति घ॒र्मम् आ नो॑ भर॒ प्रम॑गन्दस्य॒ वेदो॑ नैचाशा॒खं म॑घवन्रन्धया नः
verses.transliteration: kíṃ te kr̥ṇvanti kī́kaṭeṣu gā́vo  nā́śíraṃ duhré ná tapanti gharmám  ā́ no bhara prámagandasya védo  naicāśākhám maghavan randhayā naḥ

translation.text: Among the Kîkaṭas what do thy cattle? They pour no milky draught, they heat no caldron. Bring thou to us the wealth of Pramaganda; give up to us, O Maghavan, the low-born.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒स॒र्प॒रीरम॑तिं॒ बाध॑माना बृ॒हन्मि॑माय ज॒मद॑ग्निदत्ता आ सूर्य॑स्य दुहि॒ता त॑तान॒ श्रवो॑ दे॒वेष्व॒मृत॑मजु॒र्यम्
verses.transliteration: sasarparī́r ámatim bā́dhamānā  br̥hán mimāya jamádagnidattā  ā́ sū́ryasya duhitā́ tatāna  śrávo devéṣv amŕ̥tam ajuryám

translation.text: Sasarparî, the gift of Jamadagnis, hath lowed with mighty voice dispelling famine. The Daughter of the Sun hath spread our glory among the Gods, imperishable, deathless.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒स॒र्प॒रीर॑भर॒त्तूय॑मे॒भ्योऽधि॒ श्रवः॒ पाञ्च॑जन्यासु कृ॒ष्टिषु॑ सा प॒क्ष्या॒३॒॑ नव्य॒मायु॒र्दधा॑ना॒ यां मे॑ पलस्तिजमद॒ग्नयो॑ द॒दुः
verses.transliteration: sasarparī́r abharat tū́yam ebhyaḥ-  -ádhi śrávaḥ pā́ñcajanyāsu kr̥ṣṭíṣu  sā́ pakṣyā̀ návyam ā́yur dádhānā  yā́m me palastijamadagnáyo dadúḥ

translation.text: Sasarparî brought glory speedily to these, over the generations of the Fivefold Race; Daughter of Paksa, she bestows new vital power, she whom the ancient Jamadagnis gave to me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्थि॒रौ गावौ॑ भवतां वी॒ळुरक्षो॒ मेषा वि व॑र्हि॒ मा यु॒गं वि शा॑रि इन्द्रः॑ पात॒ल्ये॑ ददतां॒ शरी॑तो॒ररि॑ष्टनेमे अ॒भि नः॑ सचस्व
verses.transliteration: sthiraú gā́vau bhavatāṃ vīḷúr ákṣo  méṣā́ ví varhi mā́ yugáṃ ví śāri  índraḥ pātalyè dadatāṃ śárītor  áriṣṭaneme abhí naḥ sacasva

translation.text: Strong be the pair of oxen, firm the axles, let not the pole slip nor the yoke be broken. May Indra, keep the yoke-pins from decaying: attend us, thou whose fellies are uninjured.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बलं॑ धेहि त॒नूषु॑ नो॒ बल॑मिन्द्रान॒ळुत्सु॑ नः बलं॑ तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय जी॒वसे॒ त्वं हि ब॑ल॒दा असि॑
verses.transliteration: bálaṃ dhehi tanū́ṣu no  bálam indrānaḷútsu naḥ  bálaṃ tokā́ya tánayāya jīváse  tváṃ hí baladā́ ási

translation.text: O Indra, give our bodies strength, strength to the bulls who draw the wains, Strength to our seed and progeny that they may live, for thou art he who giveth strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि व्य॑यस्व खदि॒रस्य॒ सार॒मोजो॑ धेहि स्पन्द॒ने शिं॒शपा॑याम् अक्ष॑ वीळो वीळित वी॒ळय॑स्व॒ मा यामा॑द॒स्मादव॑ जीहिपो नः
verses.transliteration: abhí vyayasva khadirásya sā́ram  ójo dhehi spandané śiṃśápāyām  ákṣa vīḷo vīḷita vīḷáyasva  mā́ yā́mād asmā́d áva jīhipo naḥ

translation.text: Enclose thee in the heart of Khayar timber, in the car wrought of Ṣinṣapâ put firmness. Show thyself strong, O Axle, fixed and strengthened: throw us not from the car whereon we travel.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यम॒स्मान्वन॒स्पति॒र्मा च॒ हा मा च॑ रीरिषत् स्व॒स्त्या गृ॒हेभ्य॒ आव॒सा आ वि॒मोच॑नात्
verses.transliteration: ayám asmā́n vánaspátir  mā́ ca hā́ mā́ ca rīriṣat  svasty ā́ gr̥hébhya ā́-  -avasā́ ā́ vimócanāt

translation.text: Let not this sovran of the wood leave us forlorn or injure us. Safe may we be until we reach our homes and rest us and unyoke.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॒तिभि॑र्बहु॒लाभि॑र्नो अ॒द्य या॑च्छ्रे॒ष्ठाभि॑र्मघवञ्छूर जिन्व यो नो॒ द्वेष्ट्यध॑रः॒ सस्प॑दीष्ट॒ यमु॑ द्वि॒ष्मस्तमु॑ प्रा॒णो ज॑हातु
verses.transliteration: índrotíbhir bahulā́bhir no adyá  yācchreṣṭhā́bhir maghavañ chūra jinva  yó no dvéṣṭy ádharaḥ sás padīṣṭa  yám u dviṣmás tám u prāṇó jahātu

translation.text: With various aids this day come to us, Indra, with best aids speed us, Maghavan, thou Hero. Let him who hatcth us fall headlong downward: him whom we hate let vital breath abandon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒र॒शुं चि॒द्वि त॑पति शिम्ब॒लं चि॒द्वि वृ॑श्चति उ॒खा चि॑दिन्द्र॒ येष॑न्ती॒ प्रय॑स्ता॒ फेन॑मस्यति
verses.transliteration: paraśúṃ cid ví tapati  śimbaláṃ cid ví vr̥ścati  ukhā́ cid indra yéṣantī  práyastā phénam asyati

translation.text: He heats his very axe, and then cuts a mere Semal blossom off. O Indra, like a caldron cracked and seething, so he pours out foam.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न साय॑कस्य चिकिते जनासो लो॒धं न॑यन्ति॒ पशु॒ मन्य॑मानाः नावा॑जिनं वा॒जिना॑ हासयन्ति॒ न ग॑र्द॒भं पु॒रो अश्वा॑न्नयन्ति
verses.transliteration: ná sā́yakasya cikite janāso  lodháṃ nayanti páśu mányamānāḥ  nā́vājinaṃ vājínā hāsayanti  ná gardabhám puró áśvān nayanti

translation.text: Men notice not the arrow, O ye people; they bring the red beast deeming it a bullock. A sluggish steed men run not with the courser, nor ever lead an ass before a charger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒म इ॑न्द्र भर॒तस्य॑ पु॒त्रा अ॑पपि॒त्वं चि॑कितु॒र्न प्र॑पि॒त्वम् हि॒न्वन्त्यश्व॒मर॑णं॒ न नित्यं॒ ज्या॑वाजं॒ परि॑ णयन्त्या॒जौ
verses.transliteration: imá indra bharatásya putrā́ḥ-  apapitváṃ cikitur ná prapitvám  hinvánty áśvam áraṇaṃ ná nítyaṃ  jyā̀vājam pári ṇayanty ājaú

translation.text: These men, the sons of Bharata, O Indra, regard not severance or close connexion. They urge their own steed as it were another's, and take him, swift as the bow's string, to battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं म॒हे वि॑द॒थ्या॑य शू॒षं शश्व॒त्कृत्व॒ ईड्या॑य॒ प्र ज॑भ्रुः शृ॒णोतु॑ नो॒ दम्ये॑भि॒रनी॑कैः शृ॒णोत्व॒ग्निर्दि॒व्यैरज॑स्रः
verses.transliteration: imám mahé vidathyā̀ya śūṣáṃ  śáśvat kŕ̥tva ī́ḍyāya prá jabhruḥ  śr̥ṇótu no dámyebhir ánīkaiḥ  śr̥ṇótv agnír divyaír ájasraḥ

translation.text: To him adorable, mighty, meet for synods, this strengthening hymn, unceasing, have they offered. May Agni hear us with his homely splendours, hear us, Eternal One, with heavenly lustre.

verses.sanskrit_deva: महि॑ म॒हे दि॒वे अ॑र्चा पृथि॒व्यै कामो॑ म इ॒च्छञ्च॑रति प्रजा॒नन् ययो॑र्ह॒ स्तोमे॑ वि॒दथे॑षु दे॒वाः स॑प॒र्यवो॑ मा॒दय॑न्ते॒ सचा॒योः
verses.transliteration: máhi mahé divé arcā pr̥thivyaí  kā́mo ma icháñ carati prajānán  yáyor ha stóme vidátheṣu devā́ḥ  saparyávo mādáyante sácāyóḥ

translation.text: To mighty Heaven and Earth I sing forth loudly: my wish goes out desirous and well knowing Both, at whose laud in synods, showing favour, the Gods rejoice them with the living mortal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वोर्ऋ॒तं रो॑दसी स॒त्यम॑स्तु म॒हे षु णः॑ सुवि॒ताय॒ प्र भू॑तम् इ॒दं दि॒वे नमो॑ अग्ने पृथि॒व्यै स॑प॒र्यामि॒ प्रय॑सा॒ यामि॒ रत्न॑म्
verses.transliteration: yuvór r̥táṃ rodasī satyám astu  mahé ṣú ṇaḥ suvitā́ya prá bhūtam  idáṃ divé námo agne pr̥thivyaí  saparyā́mi práyasā yā́mi rátnam

translation.text: O Heaven and Earth, may your great law he faithful: he ye our leaders for our high advantage. To Heaven and Earth I offer this my homage, with food, O Agni, as I pray for riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒तो हि वां॑ पू॒र्व्या आ॑विवि॒द्र ऋता॑वरी रोदसी सत्य॒वाचः॑ नर॑श्चिद्वां समि॒थे शूर॑सातौ ववन्दि॒रे पृ॑थिवि॒ वेवि॑दानाः
verses.transliteration: utó hí vām pūrvyā́ āvividré-  ŕ̥tāvarī rodasī satyavā́caḥ  náraś cid vāṃ samithé śū́rasātau  vavandiré pr̥thivi vévidānāḥ

translation.text: Yea, holy Heaven and Earth, the ancient sages whose word was ever true had power to find you; And brave men in the fightwhere heroes conquer, O Earth, have known you well and paid you honour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: को अ॒द्धा वे॑द॒ क इ॒ह प्र वो॑चद्दे॒वाँ अच्छा॑ प॒थ्या॒३॒॑ का समे॑ति ददृ॑श्र एषामव॒मा सदां॑सि॒ परे॑षु॒ या गुह्ये॑षु व्र॒तेषु॑
verses.transliteration: kó addhā́ veda ká ihá prá vocad  devā́m̐ áchā pathyā̀ kā́ sám eti  dádr̥śra eṣām avamā́ sádāṃsi  páreṣu yā́ gúhyeṣu vratéṣu

translation.text: What pathway leadeth to the Gods? Who knoweth this of a truth, and who will now declare it? Seen are their lowest dwelling-places only, but they are in remote and secret regions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒विर्नृ॒चक्षा॑ अ॒भि षी॑मचष्ट ऋ॒तस्य॒ योना॒ विघृ॑ते॒ मद॑न्ती नाना॑ चक्राते॒ सद॑नं॒ यथा॒ वेः स॑मा॒नेन॒ क्रतु॑ना संविदा॒ने
verses.transliteration: kavír nr̥cákṣā abhí ṣīm acaṣṭa  r̥tásya yónā víghr̥te mádantī  nā́nā cakrāte sádanaṃ yáthā véḥ  samānéna krátunā saṃvidāné

translation.text: The Sage who looketh on mankind hath viewed them bedewed, rejoicing in the seat of Order. They make a home as for a bird, though parted, with one same will finding themselves together.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मा॒न्या वियु॑ते दू॒रेअ॑न्ते ध्रु॒वे प॒दे त॑स्थतुर्जाग॒रूके॑ उ॒त स्वसा॑रा युव॒ती भव॑न्ती॒ आदु॑ ब्रुवाते मिथु॒नानि॒ नाम॑
verses.transliteration: samānyā́ víyute dūréante  dhruvé padé tasthatur jāgarū́ke  utá svásārā yuvatī́ bhávantī  ā́d u bruvāte mithunā́ni nā́ma

translation.text: Partners though parted, with far-distant limits, on one firm place both stand for ever watchful, And, being young for evermore, as sisters, speak to each other names that are united.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वेदे॒ते जनि॑मा॒ सं वि॑विक्तो म॒हो दे॒वान्बिभ्र॑ती॒ न व्य॑थेते एज॑द्ध्रु॒वं प॑त्यते॒ विश्व॒मेकं॒ चर॑त्पत॒त्रि विषु॑णं॒ वि जा॒तम्
verses.transliteration: víśvéd eté jánimā sáṃ vivikto  mahó devā́n bíbhratī ná vyathete  éjad dhruvám patyate víśvam ékaṃ  cárat patatrí víṣuṇaṃ ví jātám

translation.text: All living things they part and keep asunder; though bearing up the mighty Gods they reel not. One All is Lord of what is fixed and moving, that walks, that flies, this multiform creation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सना॑ पुरा॒णमध्ये॑म्या॒रान्म॒हः पि॒तुर्ज॑नि॒तुर्जा॒मि तन्नः॑ दे॒वासो॒ यत्र॑ पनि॒तार॒ एवै॑रु॒रौ प॒थि व्यु॑ते त॒स्थुर॒न्तः
