verses.transliteration: sánā purāṇám ádhy emy ārā́t-  maháḥ pitúr janitúr jāmí tán naḥ  devā́so yátra panitā́ra évair  uraú pathí vyùte tasthúr antáḥ

translation.text: Afar the Ancient from of old I ponder, our kinship with our mighty Sire and Father,– Singing the praise whereof the Gods by custom stand on the spacious far-extended pathway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं स्तोमं॑ रोदसी॒ प्र ब्र॑वीम्यृदू॒दराः॑ शृणवन्नग्निजि॒ह्वाः मि॒त्रः स॒म्राजो॒ वरु॑णो॒ युवा॑न आदि॒त्यासः॑ क॒वयः॑ पप्रथा॒नाः
verses.transliteration: imáṃ stómaṃ rodasī prá bravīmi-  r̥dūdárāḥ śr̥ṇavann agnijihvā́ḥ  mitráḥ samrā́jo váruṇo yúvānaḥ-  ādityā́saḥ kaváyaḥ paprathānā́ḥ

translation.text: This laud, O Heaven and Earth, to you I utter: let the kind-hearted hear, whose tongue is Agni, Young, Sovran Rulers, Varuṇa and Mitra, the wise and very glorious Âdityas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हिर॑ण्यपाणिः सवि॒ता सु॑जि॒ह्वस्त्रिरा दि॒वो वि॒दथे॒ पत्य॑मानः दे॒वेषु॑ च सवितः॒ श्लोक॒मश्रे॒राद॒स्मभ्य॒मा सु॑व स॒र्वता॑तिम्
verses.transliteration: híraṇyapāṇiḥ savitā́ sujihvás  trír ā́ divó vidáthe pátyamānaḥ  devéṣu ca savitaḥ ślókam áśrer  ā́d asmábhyam ā́ suva sarvátātim

translation.text: The fair-tongued Savitar, the golden-handed, comes thrice from heaven as Lord in our assembly. Bear to the Gods this song of praise, and send us, then, Savitar, complete and perfect safety.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒कृत्सु॑पा॒णिः स्ववाँ॑ ऋ॒तावा॑ दे॒वस्त्वष्टाव॑से॒ तानि॑ नो धात् पू॒ष॒ण्वन्त॑ ऋभवो मादयध्वमू॒र्ध्वग्रा॑वाणो अध्व॒रम॑तष्ट
verses.transliteration: sukŕ̥t supāṇíḥ svávām̐ r̥tā́vā  devás tváṣṭā́vase tā́ni no dhāt  pūṣaṇvánta r̥bhavo mādayadhvam  ūrdhvágrāvāṇo adhvarám ataṣṭa

translation.text: Deft worker, skiful-handed, helpful, holy, may Tvashṭar, God, give us these things to aid us, Take your delight, Ye R̥ibhus joined with Pûshan: ye have prepared the rite with stones adjusted.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒द्युद्र॑था म॒रुत॑ ऋष्टि॒मन्तो॑ दि॒वो मर्या॑ ऋ॒तजा॑ता अ॒यासः॑ सर॑स्वती शृणवन्य॒ज्ञिया॑सो॒ धाता॑ र॒यिं स॒हवी॑रं तुरासः
verses.transliteration: vidyúdrathā marúta r̥ṣṭimánto  divó máryā r̥tájātā ayā́saḥ  sárasvatī śr̥ṇavan yajñíyāso  dhā́tā rayíṃ sahávīraṃ turāsaḥ

translation.text: Borne on their flashing car, the spear-armed Maruts, the nimble Youths of Heaven, the Sons of Order, The Holy, and Sarasvatî, shall hear us: ye Mighty, give us wealth with noble offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विष्णुं॒ स्तोमा॑सः पुरुद॒स्मम॒र्का भग॑स्येव का॒रिणो॒ याम॑नि ग्मन् उ॒रु॒क्र॒मः क॑कु॒हो यस्य॑ पू॒र्वीर्न म॑र्धन्ति युव॒तयो॒ जनि॑त्रीः
verses.transliteration: víṣṇuṃ stómāsaḥ purudasmám arkā́ḥ-  bhágasyeva kāríṇo yā́mani gman  urukramáḥ kakuhó yásya pūrvī́r  ná mardhanti yuvatáyo jánitrīḥ

translation.text: To Vishṇu rich in marvels, songs And praises shall go as singers on the road of Bhaga,– The Chieftain of the Mighty Stride, whose Mothers, the many young Dames, never disregard him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॒ विश्वै॑र्वी॒र्यै॒३॒॑ः पत्य॑मान उ॒भे आ प॑प्रौ॒ रोद॑सी महि॒त्वा पु॒रं॒द॒रो वृ॑त्र॒हा धृ॒ष्णुषे॑णः सं॒गृभ्या॑ न॒ आ भ॑रा॒ भूरि॑ प॒श्वः
verses.transliteration: índro víśvair vīryaìḥ pátyamānaḥ-  ubhé ā́ paprau ródasī mahitvā́  puraṃdaró vr̥trahā́ dhr̥ṣṇúṣeṇaḥ  saṃgŕ̥bhyā na ā́ bharā bhū́ri paśváḥ

translation.text: Indra, who rules through all his powers heroic, hath with his majesty filled earth and heaven. Lord of brave hosts, Fort-crusher, Vr̥itra-slayer, gather thou up and bring us store of cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नास॑त्या मे पि॒तरा॑ बन्धु॒पृच्छा॑ सजा॒त्य॑म॒श्विनो॒श्चारु॒ नाम॑ यु॒वं हि स्थो र॑यि॒दौ नो॑ रयी॒णां दा॒त्रं र॑क्षेथे॒ अक॑वै॒रद॑ब्धा
verses.transliteration: nā́satyā me pitárā bandhupŕ̥chā  sajātyàm aśvínoś cā́ru nā́ma  yuváṃ hí sthó rayidaú no rayīṇā́ṃ  dātráṃ rakṣethe ákavair ádabdhā

translation.text: My Sires are the Nâsatyas, kind tokinsmen: the Aṣvins' kinship is a glorious title. For ye are they who give us store of riches: ye guard your gift uncheated by the bounteous.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हत्तद्वः॑ कवय॒श्चारु॒ नाम॒ यद्ध॑ देवा॒ भव॑थ॒ विश्व॒ इन्द्रे॑ सख॑ ऋ॒भुभिः॑ पुरुहूत प्रि॒येभि॑रि॒मां धियं॑ सा॒तये॑ तक्षता नः
verses.transliteration: mahát tád vaḥ kavayaś cā́ru nā́ma  yád dha devā bhávatha víśva índre  sákha r̥bhúbhiḥ puruhūta priyébhir  imā́ṃ dhíyaṃ sātáye takṣatā naḥ

translation.text: This is, ye Wise, your great and glorious title, that all ye Deities abide in Indra. Friend, Much-invoked! art thou with thy dear R̥ibhus: fashion ye this our hymn for our advantage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्य॒मा णो॒ अदि॑तिर्य॒ज्ञिया॒सोऽद॑ब्धानि॒ वरु॑णस्य व्र॒तानि॑ यु॒योत॑ नो अनप॒त्यानि॒ गन्तोः॑ प्र॒जावा॑न्नः पशु॒माँ अ॑स्तु गा॒तुः
verses.transliteration: aryamā́ ṇo áditir yajñíyāsaḥ-  ádabdhāni váruṇasya vratā́ni  yuyóta no anapatyā́ni gántoḥ  prajā́vān naḥ paśumā́m̐ astu gātúḥ

translation.text: Aryaman, Aditi deserve our worship: the laws of Varuṇa remain unbroken. The lot of childlessness remove ye from us, and let our course be rich in kine and offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वानां॑ दू॒तः पु॑रु॒ध प्रसू॒तोऽना॑गान्नो वोचतु स॒र्वता॑ता शृ॒णोतु॑ नः पृथि॒वी द्यौरु॒तापः॒ सूर्यो॒ नक्ष॑त्रैरु॒र्व१॒॑न्तरि॑क्षम्
verses.transliteration: devā́nāṃ dūtáḥ purudhá prásūtaḥ-  -ánāgān no vocatu sarvátātā  śr̥ṇótu naḥ pr̥thivī́ dyaúr utā́paḥ  sū́ryo nákṣatrair urv àntárikṣam

translation.text: May the Gods' envoy, sent to many a quarter, proclaim us sinless for our perfect safety. May Earth and Heaven, the Sun, the waters, hear us, and the wide firmament and constellations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शृ॒ण्वन्तु॑ नो॒ वृष॑णः॒ पर्व॑तासो ध्रु॒वक्षे॑मास॒ इळ॑या॒ मद॑न्तः आ॒दि॒त्यैर्नो॒ अदि॑तिः शृणोतु॒ यच्छ॑न्तु नो म॒रुतः॒ शर्म॑ भ॒द्रम्
verses.transliteration: śr̥ṇvántu no vŕ̥ṣaṇaḥ párvatāso  dhruvákṣemāsa íḷayā mádantaḥ  ādityaír no áditiḥ śr̥ṇotu  yáchantu no marútaḥ śárma bhadrám

translation.text: Hear us the mouatains which distil the rain-drops, and, resting firm, rejoice in freshening moisture. May Aditi with the Âdityas hear us, and Maruts grant us their auspicious shelter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सदा॑ सु॒गः पि॑तु॒माँ अ॑स्तु॒ पन्था॒ मध्वा॑ देवा॒ ओष॑धीः॒ सं पि॑पृक्त भगो॑ मे अग्ने स॒ख्ये न मृ॑ध्या॒ उद्रा॒यो अ॑श्यां॒ सद॑नं पुरु॒क्षोः
verses.transliteration: sádā sugáḥ pitumā́m̐ astu pánthāḥ-  mádhvā devā óṣadhīḥ sám pipr̥kta  bhágo me agne sakhyé ná mr̥dhyāḥ-  úd rāyó aśyāṃ sádanam purukṣóḥ

translation.text: Soft be our path for ever, well-provisioned: with pleasant meath, O Gods, the herbs besprinkle. Safe be my bliss, O Agni, in thy friendship: may I attain the seat of foodful. riches,

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वद॑स्व ह॒व्या समिषो॑ दिदीह्यस्म॒द्र्य१॒॑क्सं मि॑मीहि॒ श्रवां॑सि विश्वाँ॑ अग्ने पृ॒त्सु ताञ्जे॑षि॒ शत्रू॒नहा॒ विश्वा॑ सु॒मना॑ दीदिही नः
verses.transliteration: svádasva havyā́ sám íṣo didīhi-  asmadryàk sám mimīhi śrávāṃsi  víśvām̐ agne pr̥tsú tā́ñ jeṣi śátrūn  áhā víśvā sumánā dīdihī naḥ

translation.text: Enjoy the offering: beam thou strength upon us; combine thou for our good all kinds of glory. Conquer in battle, Agni, all those foemen, and light us every day with loving kindness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒षसः॒ पूर्वा॒ अध॒ यद्व्यू॒षुर्म॒हद्वि ज॑ज्ञे अ॒क्षरं॑ प॒दे गोः व्र॒ता दे॒वाना॒मुप॒ नु प्र॒भूष॑न्म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: uṣásaḥ pū́rvā ádha yád vyūṣúr  mahád ví jajñe akṣáram padé góḥ  vratā́ devā́nām úpa nú prabhū́ṣan  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: AT the first shining of the earliest Mornings, in the Cow's home was born the Great Eternal. Now shall the statutes of the Gods be valid. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion -

verses.sanskrit_deva: मो षू णो॒ अत्र॑ जुहुरन्त दे॒वा मा पूर्वे॑ अग्ने पि॒तरः॑ पद॒ज्ञाः पु॒रा॒ण्योः सद्म॑नोः के॒तुर॒न्तर्म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: mó ṣū́ ṇo átra juhuranta devā́ḥ-  mā́ pū́rve agne pitáraḥ padajñā́ḥ  purāṇyóḥ sádmanoḥ ketúr antár  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: Let not the Gods here injure us, O Agni, nor Fathers of old time who know the region, Nor the sign set between two ancient dwellings. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि मे॑ पुरु॒त्रा प॑तयन्ति॒ कामाः॒ शम्यच्छा॑ दीद्ये पू॒र्व्याणि॑ समि॑द्धे अ॒ग्नावृ॒तमिद्व॑देम म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: ví me purutrā́ patayanti kā́māḥ  śámy áchā dīdye pūrvyā́ṇi  sámiddhe agnā́v r̥tám íd vadema  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: My wishes fly abroad to many places: I glance back to the ancient sacrifices. Let us declare the truth when fire is kindled. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मा॒नो राजा॒ विभृ॑तः पुरु॒त्रा शये॑ श॒यासु॒ प्रयु॑तो॒ वनानु॑ अ॒न्या व॒त्सं भर॑ति॒ क्षेति॑ मा॒ता म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: samānó rā́jā víbhr̥taḥ purutrā́  śáye śayā́su práyuto vánā́nu  anyā́ vatsám bhárati kṣéti mātā́  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: King Universal, born to sundry quarters, extended through the wood be lies on couches. One Mother rests: another feeds the Infant. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒क्षित्पूर्वा॒स्वप॑रा अनू॒रुत्स॒द्यो जा॒तासु॒ तरु॑णीष्व॒न्तः अ॒न्तर्व॑तीः सुवते॒ अप्र॑वीता म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: ākṣít pū́rvāsv áparā anūrút  sadyó jātā́su táruṇīṣv antáḥ  antárvatīḥ suvate ápravītāḥ-  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: Lodged in old plants, he grows again in younger, swiftly within the newly-born and tender. Though they are unimpregned, he makes them fruitful. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒युः प॒रस्ता॒दध॒ नु द्वि॑मा॒ताब॑न्ध॒नश्च॑रति व॒त्स एकः॑ मि॒त्रस्य॒ ता वरु॑णस्य व्र॒तानि॑ म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: śayúḥ parástād ádha nú dvimātā́-  -abandhanáś carati vatsá ékaḥ  mitrásya tā́ váruṇasya vratā́ni  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: Now lying far away, Child of two Mothers, he wanders unrestrained, the single youngling. These are the laws of Varuṇa and Mitra. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्वि॒मा॒ता होता॑ वि॒दथे॑षु स॒म्राळन्वग्रं॒ चर॑ति॒ क्षेति॑ बु॒ध्नः प्र रण्या॑नि रण्य॒वाचो॑ भरन्ते म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: dvimātā́ hótā vidátheṣu samrā́ḷ  ánv ágraṃ cárati kṣéti budhnáḥ  prá ráṇyāni raṇyavā́co bharante  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: Child of two Mothers, Priest, sole Lord in synods, he still precedes while resting as foundation. They who speak sweetly bring him sweet addresses. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शूर॑स्येव॒ युध्य॑तो अन्त॒मस्य॑ प्रती॒चीनं॑ ददृशे॒ विश्व॑मा॒यत् अ॒न्तर्म॒तिश्च॑रति नि॒ष्षिधं॒ गोर्म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: śū́rasyeva yúdhyato antamásya  pratīcī́naṃ dadr̥śe víśvam āyát  antár matíś carati niṣṣídhaṃ gór  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: As to a friendly warrior when he battles, each thing that comes anear is seen to meet him. The hymn commingles with the cow's oblation. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि वे॑वेति पलि॒तो दू॒त आ॑स्व॒न्तर्म॒हाँश्च॑रति रोच॒नेन॑ वपूं॑षि॒ बिभ्र॑द॒भि नो॒ वि च॑ष्टे म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: ní veveti palitó dūtá āsu-  antár mahā́ṃś carati rocanéna  vápūṃṣi bíbhrad abhí no ví caṣṭe  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: Deep within these the hoary envoy pierceth; mighty, he goeth to the realm of splendour, And looketh on us, clad in wondrous beauty. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विष्णु॑र्गो॒पाः प॑र॒मं पा॑ति॒ पाथः॑ प्रि॒या धामा॑न्य॒मृता॒ दधा॑नः अ॒ग्निष्टा विश्वा॒ भुव॑नानि वेद म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: víṣṇur gopā́ḥ paramám pāti pā́thaḥ  priyā́ dhā́māny amŕ̥tā dádhānaḥ  agníṣ ṭā́ víśvā bhúvanāni veda  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: Vishṇu, the guardian, keeps the loftiest station, upholding dear, immortal dwelling-places. Agni knows well all these created beings. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नाना॑ चक्राते य॒म्या॒३॒॑ वपूं॑षि॒ तयो॑र॒न्यद्रोच॑ते कृ॒ष्णम॒न्यत् श्यावी॑ च॒ यदरु॑षी च॒ स्वसा॑रौ म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: nā́nā cakrāte yamyā̀ vápūṃṣi  táyor anyád rócate kr̥ṣṇám anyát  śyā́vī ca yád áruṣī ca svásārau  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: Ye, variant Pair, have made yourselves twin beauties: one of the Twain is dark, bright shines the other; And yet these two, the dark, the red, are Sisters. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा॒ता च॒ यत्र॑ दुहि॒ता च॑ धे॒नू स॑ब॒र्दुघे॑ धा॒पये॑ते समी॒ची ऋ॒तस्य॒ ते सद॑सीळे अ॒न्तर्म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: mātā́ ca yátra duhitā́ ca dhenū́  sabardúghe dhāpáyete samīcī́  r̥tásya té sádasīḷe antár  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: Where the two Cows, the Mother and the Daughter, meet and give suck yielding their lordly nectar, I praise them at the seat of law eternal. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न्यस्या॑ व॒त्सं रि॑ह॒ती मि॑माय॒ कया॑ भु॒वा नि द॑धे धे॒नुरूधः॑ ऋ॒तस्य॒ सा पय॑सापिन्व॒तेळा॑ म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: anyásyā vatsáṃ rihatī́ mimāya  káyā bhuvā́ ní dadhe dhenúr ū́dhaḥ  r̥tásya sā́ páyasāpinvatéḷā  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: Loud hath she lowed, licking the other's youngling. On what world hath the Milch-cow laid her udder? This Iḷâ streameth with the milk of Order. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पद्या॑ वस्ते पुरु॒रूपा॒ वपूं॑ष्यू॒र्ध्वा त॑स्थौ॒ त्र्यविं॒ रेरि॑हाणा ऋ॒तस्य॒ सद्म॒ वि च॑रामि वि॒द्वान्म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: pádyā vaste pururū́pā vápūṃṣi-  ūrdhvā́ tasthau tryáviṃ rérihāṇā  r̥tásya sádma ví carāmi vidvā́n  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: Earth weareth beauties manifold: uplifted, licking her Calf of eighteen months, she standeth. Well-skilled I seek the seat of law eternal. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒दे इ॑व॒ निहि॑ते द॒स्मे अ॒न्तस्तयो॑र॒न्यद्गुह्य॑मा॒विर॒न्यत् स॒ध्री॒ची॒ना प॒थ्या॒३॒॑ सा विषू॑ची म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: padé iva níhite dasmé antás  táyor anyád gúhyam āvír anyát  sadhrīcīnā́ pathyā̀ sā́ víṣūcī  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: Within a wondrous place the Twain are treasured: the one is manifest, the other hidden. One common pathway leads in two directions. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ धे॒नवो॑ धुनयन्ता॒मशि॑श्वीः सब॒र्दुघाः॑ शश॒या अप्र॑दुग्धाः नव्या॑नव्या युव॒तयो॒ भव॑न्तीर्म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ dhenávo dhunayantām áśiśvīḥ  sabardúghāḥ śaśayā́ ápradugdhāḥ  návyā-navyā yuvatáyo bhávantīr  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: Let the milch-kine that have no calves storm downward, yielding rich nectar, streaming, unexhausted, These who are ever new and fresh and youthful. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॒न्यासु॑ वृष॒भो रोर॑वीति॒ सो अ॒न्यस्मि॑न्यू॒थे नि द॑धाति॒ रेतः॑ स हि क्षपा॑वा॒न्त्स भगः॒ स राजा॑ म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: yád anyā́su vr̥ṣabhó róravīti  só anyásmin yūthé ní dadhāti rétaḥ  sá hí kṣápāvān sá bhágaḥ sá rā́jā  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: What time the Bull bellows in other regions, another herd receives the genial moisture; For he is Bhaga, King, the earth's Protector. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वी॒रस्य॒ नु स्वश्व्यं॑ जनासः॒ प्र नु वो॑चाम वि॒दुर॑स्य दे॒वाः षो॒ळ्हा यु॒क्ताः पञ्च॑प॒ञ्चा व॑हन्ति म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: vīrásya nú sváśvyaṃ janāsaḥ  prá nú vocāma vidúr asya devā́ḥ  ṣoḷhā́ yuktā́ḥ páñca-pañcā́ vahanti  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: Let us declare the Hero's wealth in horses, O all ye folk: of this the Gods have knowledge. Sixfold they bear him, or by fives are harnessed. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वस्त्वष्टा॑ सवि॒ता वि॒श्वरू॑पः पु॒पोष॑ प्र॒जाः पु॑रु॒धा ज॑जान इ॒मा च॒ विश्वा॒ भुव॑नान्यस्य म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: devás tváṣṭā savitā́ viśvárūpaḥ  pupóṣa prajā́ḥ purudhā́ jajāna  imā́ ca víśvā bhúvanāny asya  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: Tvashṭar the God, the omniform. Creator, begets and feeds mankind in various manner. His, verily, arc all these living creatures. Great is the Gods' supreme dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒ही समै॑रच्च॒म्वा॑ समी॒ची उ॒भे ते अ॑स्य॒ वसु॑ना॒ न्यृ॑ष्टे शृ॒ण्वे वी॒रो वि॒न्दमा॑नो॒ वसू॑नि म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: mahī́ sám airac camvā̀ samīcī́  ubhé té asya vásunā nyr̥̀ṣṭe  śr̥ṇvé vīró vindámāno vásūni  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: The two great meeting Bowls hath he united: each of the Pair is laden with histreasure. The Hero is renowned for gathering riches. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मां च॑ नः पृथि॒वीं वि॒श्वधा॑या॒ उप॑ क्षेति हि॒तमि॑त्रो॒ न राजा॑ पु॒रः॒सदः॑ शर्म॒सदो॒ न वी॒रा म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: imā́ṃ ca naḥ pr̥thivī́ṃ viśvádhāyāḥ-  úpa kṣeti hitámitro ná rā́jā  puraḥsádaḥ śarmasádo ná vīrā́ḥ-  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: Yea, and on this our earth the All-Sustainer dwells like a King with noble friends about him. In his protection heroes rest in safety. Great is the Cods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि॒ष्षिध्व॑रीस्त॒ ओष॑धीरु॒तापो॑ र॒यिं त॑ इन्द्र पृथि॒वी बि॑भर्ति सखा॑यस्ते वाम॒भाजः॑ स्याम म॒हद्दे॒वाना॑मसुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: niṣṣídhvarīs ta óṣadhīr utā́po  rayíṃ ta indra pr̥thivī́ bibharti  sákhāyas te vāmabhā́jaḥ syāma  mahád devā́nām asuratvám ékam

translation.text: Rich in their gifts for thee are herbs and waters, and earth brings all her wealth for thee, O Indra. May we as friends of thine share goodly treasures. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न ता मि॑नन्ति मा॒यिनो॒ न धीरा॑ व्र॒ता दे॒वानां॑ प्रथ॒मा ध्रु॒वाणि॑ न रोद॑सी अ॒द्रुहा॑ वे॒द्याभि॒र्न पर्व॑ता नि॒नमे॑ तस्थि॒वांसः॑
verses.transliteration: ná tā́ minanti māyíno ná dhī́rāḥ-  vratā́ devā́nām prathamā́ dhruvā́ṇi  ná ródasī adrúhā vedyā́bhir  ná párvatā nináme tasthivā́ṃsaḥ

translation.text: NOT men of magic skill, not men of wisdom impair the Gods' first steadfast ordinances. Ne'er may the earth and heaven which know not malice, nor the fixed hills, be bowed by sage devices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: षड्भा॒राँ एको॒ अच॑रन्बिभर्त्यृ॒तं वर्षि॑ष्ठ॒मुप॒ गाव॒ आगुः॑ ति॒स्रो म॒हीरुप॑रास्तस्थु॒रत्या॒ गुहा॒ द्वे निहि॑ते॒ दर्श्येका॑
verses.transliteration: ṣáḍ bhārā́m̐ éko ácaran bibharti-  r̥táṃ várṣiṣṭham úpa gā́va ā́guḥ  tisró mahī́r úparās tasthur átyāḥ-  gúhā dvé níhite dárśy ékā

translation.text: One, moving not away, supports six burthens: the Cows proceed to him the true, the Highest. Near stand three Mighty Ones who travel swiftly: two are concealed from sight, one is apparent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रि॒पा॒ज॒स्यो वृ॑ष॒भो वि॒श्वरू॑प उ॒त त्र्यु॒धा पु॑रु॒ध प्र॒जावा॑न् त्र्य॒नी॒कः प॑त्यते॒ माहि॑नावा॒न्त्स रे॑तो॒धा वृ॑ष॒भः शश्व॑तीनाम्
verses.transliteration: tripājasyó vr̥ṣabhó viśvárūpaḥ-  utá tryudhā́ purudhá prajā́vān  tryanīkáḥ patyate mā́hināvān  sá retodhā́ vr̥ṣabháḥ śáśvatīnām

translation.text: The Bull who wears all shapes, the triple-breasted, three-uddered, with a brood in many places, Ruleth majestic with his triple aspect, the Bull, the Everlasting Ones' impregner.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भीक॑ आसां पद॒वीर॑बोध्यादि॒त्याना॑मह्वे॒ चारु॒ नाम॑ आप॑श्चिदस्मा अरमन्त दे॒वीः पृथ॒ग्व्रज॑न्तीः॒ परि॑ षीमवृञ्जन्
verses.transliteration: abhī́ka āsām padavī́r abodhi-  ādityā́nām ahve cā́ru nā́ma  ā́paś cid asmā aramanta devī́ḥ  pŕ̥thag vrájantīḥ pári ṣīm avr̥ñjan

translation.text: When nigh them, as their tracer he observed them: he called aloud the dear name of Âdityas. The Goddesses, the Waters, stayed to meet him: they who were wandering separate enclosed him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्री ष॒धस्था॑ सिन्धव॒स्त्रिः क॑वी॒नामु॒त त्रि॑मा॒ता वि॒दथे॑षु स॒म्राट् ऋ॒ताव॑री॒र्योष॑णास्ति॒स्रो अप्या॒स्त्रिरा दि॒वो वि॒दथे॒ पत्य॑मानाः
verses.transliteration: trī́ ṣadhásthā sindhavas tríḥ kavīnā́m  utá trimātā́ vidátheṣu samrā́ṭ  r̥tā́varīr yóṣaṇās tisró ápyās  trír ā́ divó vidáthe pátyamānāḥ

translation.text: Streams! the wise Gods have thrice three habitations. Child of three Mothers, he is Lord in synods. Three are the holy Ladies of the Waters, thrice here from heaven supreme in our assembly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिरा दि॒वः स॑वित॒र्वार्या॑णि दि॒वेदि॑व॒ आ सु॑व॒ त्रिर्नो॒ अह्नः॑ त्रि॒धातु॑ रा॒य आ सु॑वा॒ वसू॑नि॒ भग॑ त्रातर्धिषणे सा॒तये॑ धाः
verses.transliteration: trír ā́ diváḥ savitar vā́ryāṇi  divé-diva ā́ suva trír no áhnaḥ  tridhā́tu rāyá ā́ suvā vásūni  bhága trātar dhiṣaṇe sātáye dhāḥ

translation.text: Do thou, O Savitar, from heaven thrice hither, three times a day, send down thy blessings daily. Send us, O Bhaga, triple wealth and treasure; cause the two worlds to prosper us, Preserver!

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिरा दि॒वः स॑वि॒ता सो॑षवीति॒ राजा॑ना मि॒त्रावरु॑णा सुपा॒णी आप॑श्चिदस्य॒ रोद॑सी चिदु॒र्वी रत्नं॑ भिक्षन्त सवि॒तुः स॒वाय॑
verses.transliteration: trír ā́ diváḥ savitā́ soṣavīti  rā́jānā mitrā́váruṇā supāṇī́  ā́paś cid asya ródasī cid urvī́  rátnam bhikṣanta savitúḥ savā́ya

translation.text: Savitar thrice from heaven pours down abundance, and the fair-handed kings Varuṇa, Mitra; And spacious Heaven and Earth, yea, and the Waters, solicit wealth that Savitar may send us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिरु॑त्त॒मा दू॒णशा॑ रोच॒नानि॒ त्रयो॑ राज॒न्त्यसु॑रस्य वी॒राः ऋ॒तावा॑न इषि॒रा दू॒ळभा॑स॒स्त्रिरा दि॒वो वि॒दथे॑ सन्तु दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: trír uttamā́ dūṇáśā rocanā́ni  tráyo rājanty ásurasya vīrā́ḥ  r̥tā́vāna iṣirā́ dūḷábhāsas  trír ā́ divó vidáthe santu devā́ḥ

translation.text: Three are the bright realms, best, beyond attainment, and three, the Asura's Heroes, rule as Sovrans, Holy and vigorous, never to be injured. Thrice may the Gods from heaven attend our synod.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र मे॑ विवि॒क्वाँ अ॑विदन्मनी॒षां धे॒नुं चर॑न्तीं॒ प्रयु॑ता॒मगो॑पाम् स॒द्यश्चि॒द्या दु॑दु॒हे भूरि॑ धा॒सेरिन्द्र॒स्तद॒ग्निः प॑नि॒तारो॑ अस्याः
verses.transliteration: prá me vivikvā́m̐ avidan manīṣā́ṃ  dhenúṃ cárantīm práyutām ágopām  sadyáś cid yā́ duduhé bhū́ri dhāsér  índras tád agníḥ panitā́ro asyāḥ

translation.text: MY thought with fine discernment hath discovered the Cow who wanders free without a herdsman, Her who hath straightway poured me food in plenty: Indra and Agni therefore are her praisers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रः॒ सु पू॒षा वृष॑णा सु॒हस्ता॑ दि॒वो न प्री॒ताः श॑श॒यं दु॑दुह्रे विश्वे॒ यद॑स्यां र॒णय॑न्त दे॒वाः प्र वोऽत्र॑ वसवः सु॒म्नम॑श्याम्
verses.transliteration: índraḥ sú pūṣā́ vŕ̥ṣaṇā suhástā  divó ná prītā́ḥ śaśayáṃ duduhre  víśve yád asyāṃ raṇáyanta devā́ḥ  prá vó 'tra vasavaḥ sumnám aśyām

translation.text: Indra and Pûshan, deft of hand and mighty, well-pleased have drained the heaven's exhaustless udder. As in this praise the Gods have all delighted, may I win blessing here from you, O Vasus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या जा॒मयो॒ वृष्ण॑ इ॒च्छन्ति॑ श॒क्तिं न॑म॒स्यन्ती॑र्जानते॒ गर्भ॑मस्मिन् अच्छा॑ पु॒त्रं धे॒नवो॑ वावशा॒ना म॒हश्च॑रन्ति॒ बिभ्र॑तं॒ वपूं॑षि
verses.transliteration: yā́ jāmáyo vŕ̥ṣṇa ichánti śaktíṃ  namasyántīr jānate gárbham asmin  áchā putráṃ dhenávo vāvaśānā́ḥ-  maháś caranti bíbhrataṃ vápūṃṣi

translation.text: Fain to lend vigour to the Bull, the siste.. with reverence recognize the germ within him. The Cows come lowing hither to the Youngling, to him endued with great and wondrous beauties.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छा॑ विवक्मि॒ रोद॑सी सु॒मेके॒ ग्राव्णो॑ युजा॒नो अ॑ध्व॒रे म॑नी॒षा इ॒मा उ॑ ते॒ मन॑वे॒ भूरि॑वारा ऊ॒र्ध्वा भ॑वन्ति दर्श॒ता यज॑त्राः
verses.transliteration: áchā vivakmi ródasī suméke  grā́vṇo yujānó adhvaré manīṣā́  imā́ u te mánave bhū́rivārāḥ-  ūrdhvā́ bhavanti darśatā́ yájatrāḥ

translation.text: Fixing with thought, at sacrifice, the press-stones, I bid the well-formed Heaven and Earth come hither; For these thy flames, which give men boons in plenty, rise up on high, the beautiful, the holy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या ते॑ जि॒ह्वा मधु॑मती सुमे॒धा अग्ने॑ दे॒वेषू॒च्यत॑ उरू॒ची तये॒ह विश्वाँ॒ अव॑से॒ यज॑त्रा॒ना सा॑दय पा॒यया॑ चा॒ मधू॑नि
verses.transliteration: yā́ te jihvā́ mádhumatī sumedhā́ḥ-  ágne devéṣūcyáta urūcī́  táyehá víśvām̐ ávase yájatrān  ā́ sādaya pāyáyā cā mádhūni

translation.text: Agni, thy meath-sweet tongue that tastes fair viands, which among Gods is called the farextended,– Therewith make all the Holy Odes be seated here for our help, and feed them with sweet juices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या ते॑ अग्ने॒ पर्व॑तस्येव॒ धारास॑श्चन्ती पी॒पय॑द्देव चि॒त्रा ताम॒स्मभ्यं॒ प्रम॑तिं जातवेदो॒ वसो॒ रास्व॑ सुम॒तिं वि॒श्वज॑न्याम्
verses.transliteration: yā́ te agne párvatasyeva dhā́rā-  -ásaścantī pīpáyad deva citrā́  tā́m asmábhyam prámatiṃ jātavedo  váso rā́sva sumatíṃ viśvájanyām

translation.text: Let thy stream give us drink, O God, O Agni, wonderful and exhaustless like the rain-clouds. Thus care for us, O Vasu Jâtavedas, show us thy loving-kindness, reaching all men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धे॒नुः प्र॒त्नस्य॒ काम्यं॒ दुहा॑ना॒न्तः पु॒त्रश्च॑रति॒ दक्षि॑णायाः आ द्यो॑त॒निं व॑हति शु॒भ्रया॑मो॒षसः॒ स्तोमो॑ अ॒श्विना॑वजीगः
verses.transliteration: dhenúḥ pratnásya kā́myaṃ dúhānā-  -antáḥ putráś carati dákṣiṇāyāḥ  ā́ dyotaníṃ vahati śubhráyāmā-  -uṣása stómo aśvínāv ajīgaḥ

translation.text: THE Ancient's Milch-cow yields the things we long for: the Son of Dakshina travels between them. She with the splendid chariot brings refulgence. The praise of Ushas hath awoke the Aṣvins.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒युग्व॑हन्ति॒ प्रति॑ वामृ॒तेनो॒र्ध्वा भ॑वन्ति पि॒तरे॑व॒ मेधाः॑ जरे॑थाम॒स्मद्वि प॒णेर्म॑नी॒षां यु॒वोरव॑श्चकृ॒मा या॑तम॒र्वाक्
verses.transliteration: suyúg vahanti práti vām r̥téna-  -ūrdhvā́ bhavanti pitáreva médhāḥ  járethām asmád ví paṇér manīṣā́ṃ  yuvór ávaś cakr̥mā́ yātam arvā́k

translation.text: They bear you hither by well-orderd statute: our sacred offerings rise as if to parents. Destroy in us the counsel of the niggard come hitherward, for we have shown you favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒युग्भि॒रश्वैः॑ सु॒वृता॒ रथे॑न॒ दस्रा॑वि॒मं शृ॑णुतं॒ श्लोक॒मद्रेः॑ किम॒ङ्ग वां॒ प्रत्यव॑र्तिं॒ गमि॑ष्ठा॒हुर्विप्रा॑सो अश्विना पुरा॒जाः
verses.transliteration: suyúgbhir áśvaiḥ suvŕ̥tā ráthena  dásrāv imáṃ śr̥ṇutaṃ ślókam ádreḥ  kím aṅgá vām práty ávartiṃ gámiṣṭhā-  -āhúr víprāso aśvinā purājā́ḥ

translation.text: With lightly-rolling car and well-yoked horses hear this, the press-stone's song, ye Wonder- Workers. Have not the sages of old time, ye Aṣvins, called you most prompt to come and stay misfortune?

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ म॑न्येथा॒मा ग॑तं॒ कच्चि॒देवै॒र्विश्वे॒ जना॑सो अ॒श्विना॑ हवन्ते इ॒मा हि वां॒ गोऋ॑जीका॒ मधू॑नि॒ प्र मि॒त्रासो॒ न द॒दुरु॒स्रो अग्रे॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ manyethām ā́ gataṃ kác cid évair  víśve jánāso aśvínā havante  imā́ hí vāṃ gór̥jīkā mádhūni  prá mitrā́so ná dadúr usró ágre

translation.text: Remember us, and come to us, for ever men, as their wont is, invocate the Aṣvins. Friends as it were have offered you these juices, sweet, blent with milk at the first break of morning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ति॒रः पु॒रू चि॑दश्विना॒ रजां॑स्याङ्गू॒षो वां॑ मघवाना॒ जने॑षु एह या॑तं प॒थिभि॑र्देव॒यानै॒र्दस्रा॑वि॒मे वां॑ नि॒धयो॒ मधू॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: tiráḥ purū́ cid aśvinā rájāṃsi-  āṅgūṣó vām maghavānā jáneṣu  éhá yātam pathíbhir devayā́nair  dásrāv imé vāṃ nidháyo mádhūnām

translation.text: Even through many regions, O ye Aṣvins high praise is yours among mankind, ye Mighty- Come, helpers, on the paths which Gods have travelled: here your libations of sweet meath are ready.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रा॒णमोकः॑ स॒ख्यं शि॒वं वां॑ यु॒वोर्न॑रा॒ द्रवि॑णं ज॒ह्नाव्या॑म् पुनः॑ कृण्वा॒नाः स॒ख्या शि॒वानि॒ मध्वा॑ मदेम स॒ह नू स॑मा॒नाः
verses.transliteration: purāṇám ókaḥ sakhyáṃ śiváṃ vāṃ  yuvór narā dráviṇaṃ jahnā́vyām  púnaḥ kr̥ṇvānā́ḥ sakhyā́ śivā́ni  mádhvā madema sahá nū́ samānā́ḥ

translation.text: Ancient your home, auspicious is your friendship: Heroes, your wealth is with the house of Jahnu. Forming again with you auspicious friendship, let us rejoice with draughts of meath together.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वि॑ना वा॒युना॑ यु॒वं सु॑दक्षा नि॒युद्भि॑ष्च स॒जोष॑सा युवाना नास॑त्या ति॒रोअ॑ह्न्यं जुषा॒णा सोमं॑ पिबतम॒स्रिधा॑ सुदानू
verses.transliteration: áśvinā vāyúnā yuváṃ sudakṣā  niyúdbhiṣ ca sajóṣasā yuvānā  nā́satyā tiróahnyaṃ juṣāṇā́  sómam pibatam asrídhā sudānū

translation.text: O Aṣvins, Very Mighty ones, with Vâyu and with his steeds, one-minded, ever-youthful, Nâsatyas, joying in the third day's Soma, drink it, not hostile, Very Bounteous Givers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वि॑ना॒ परि॑ वा॒मिषः॑ पुरू॒चीरी॒युर्गी॒र्भिर्यत॑माना॒ अमृ॑ध्राः रथो॑ ह वामृत॒जा अद्रि॑जूतः॒ परि॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी या॑ति स॒द्यः
verses.transliteration: áśvinā pári vām íṣaḥ purūcī́r  īyúr gīrbhír yátamānā ámr̥dhrāḥ  rátho ha vām r̥tajā́ ádrijūtaḥ  pári dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ yāti sadyáḥ

translation.text: Aṣvins, to you are brought abundant viands in rivalry with sacred songs, unceasing. Sprung from high Law your car, urged on by press-stones, goes round the earth and heaven in one brief moment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वि॑ना मधु॒षुत्त॑मो यु॒वाकुः॒ सोम॒स्तं पा॑त॒मा ग॑तं दुरो॒णे रथो॑ ह वां॒ भूरि॒ वर्पः॒ करि॑क्रत्सु॒ताव॑तो निष्कृ॒तमाग॑मिष्ठः
verses.transliteration: áśvinā madhuṣúttamo yuvā́kuḥ  sómas tám pātam ā́ gataṃ duroṇé  rátho ha vām bhū́ri várpaḥ kárikrat  sutā́vato niṣkr̥tám ā́gamiṣṭhaḥ

translation.text: Aṣvins, your Soma sheds delicious sweetness: drink ye thereof and come unto our dwelling. Your car, assuming many a shape, most often goes to the Soma-presser's place of meeting.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒त्रो जना॑न्यातयति ब्रुवा॒णो मि॒त्रो दा॑धार पृथि॒वीमु॒त द्याम् मि॒त्रः कृ॒ष्टीरनि॑मिषा॒भि च॑ष्टे मि॒त्राय॑ ह॒व्यं घृ॒तव॑ज्जुहोत
verses.transliteration: mitró jánān yātayati bruvāṇó  mitró dādhāra pr̥thivī́m utá dyā́m  mitráḥ kr̥ṣṭī́r ánimiṣābhí caṣṭe  mitrā́ya havyáṃ ghr̥távaj juhota

translation.text: MITRA, when speaking, stirreth men to labour: Mitra sustaineth both the earth and heaven. Mitra beholdeth men with eyes that close not. To Mitra bring, with holy oil, oblation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र स मि॑त्र॒ मर्तो॑ अस्तु॒ प्रय॑स्वा॒न्यस्त॑ आदित्य॒ शिक्ष॑ति व्र॒तेन॑ न ह॑न्यते॒ न जी॑यते॒ त्वोतो॒ नैन॒मंहो॑ अश्नो॒त्यन्ति॑तो॒ न दू॒रात्
verses.transliteration: prá sá mitra márto astu práyasvān  yás ta āditya śíkṣati vraténa  ná hanyate ná jīyate tvóto  naínam áṃho aśnoty ántito ná dūrā́t

translation.text: Foremost be he who brings thee food, O Mitra, who strives to keep thy sacred Law, Âditya. He whom thou helpest ne'er is slain or conquered, on him, from near or far, falls no affliction.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न॒मी॒वास॒ इळ॑या॒ मद॑न्तो मि॒तज्ञ॑वो॒ वरि॑म॒न्ना पृ॑थि॒व्याः आ॒दि॒त्यस्य॑ व्र॒तमु॑पक्षि॒यन्तो॑ व॒यं मि॒त्रस्य॑ सुम॒तौ स्या॑म
verses.transliteration: anamīvā́sa íḷayā mádanto  mitájñavo várimann ā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ  ādityásya vratám upakṣiyánto  vayám mitrásya sumataú syāma

translation.text: joying in sacred food and free from sickness, with knees bent lowly on the earth's broad surface, Following closely the Âditya's statute, may we remain in Mitra's gracious favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं मि॒त्रो न॑म॒स्यः॑ सु॒शेवो॒ राजा॑ सुक्ष॒त्रो अ॑जनिष्ट वे॒धाः तस्य॑ व॒यं सु॑म॒तौ य॒ज्ञिय॒स्यापि॑ भ॒द्रे सौ॑मन॒से स्या॑म
verses.transliteration: ayám mitró namasyàḥ suśévo  rā́jā sukṣatró ajaniṣṭa vedhā́ḥ  tásya vayáṃ sumataú yajñíyasya-  -ápi bhadré saumanasé syāma

translation.text: Auspicious and adorable, this Mitra was born with fair dominion, King, Disposer. May we enjoy the grace of him the Holy, yea, rest in his propitious loving-kindness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हाँ आ॑दि॒त्यो नम॑सोप॒सद्यो॑ यात॒यज्ज॑नो गृण॒ते सु॒शेवः॑ तस्मा॑ ए॒तत्पन्य॑तमाय॒ जुष्ट॑म॒ग्नौ मि॒त्राय॑ ह॒विरा जु॑होत
verses.transliteration: mahā́m̐ ādityó námasopasádyo  yātayájjano gr̥ṇaté suśévaḥ  tásmā etát pányatamāya júṣṭam  agnaú mitrā́ya havír ā́ juhota

translation.text: The great Âditya, to be served with wor. ship, who stirreth men, is gracious to the singer. To Mitra, him most highly to be lauded, offer in fire oblation that he loveth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒त्रस्य॑ चर्षणी॒धृतोऽवो॑ दे॒वस्य॑ सान॒सि द्यु॒म्नं चि॒त्रश्र॑वस्तमम्
verses.transliteration: mitrásya carṣaṇīdhŕ̥taḥ-  -ávo devásya sānasí  dyumnáṃ citráśravastamam

translation.text: The gainful grace of Mitra,. God, supporter of the race of man, Gives splendour of most.glorious fame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि यो म॑हि॒ना दिवं॑ मि॒त्रो ब॒भूव॑ स॒प्रथाः॑ अ॒भि श्रवो॑भिः पृथि॒वीम्
verses.transliteration: abhí yó mahinā́ dívam  mitró babhū́va sapráthāḥ  abhí śrávobhiḥ pr̥thivī́m

translation.text: Mitra whose glory spreads afar, he who in might surpasses heaven, Surpasses earth in his renown.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒त्राय॒ पञ्च॑ येमिरे॒ जना॑ अ॒भिष्टि॑शवसे स दे॒वान्विश्वा॑न्बिभर्ति
verses.transliteration: mitrā́ya páñca yemire  jánā abhíṣṭiśavase  sá devā́n víśvān bibharti

translation.text: All the Five Races have repaired to Mitra, ever strong to aid, For he sustaineth all the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒त्रो दे॒वेष्वा॒युषु॒ जना॑य वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषे इष॑ इ॒ष्टव्र॑ता अकः
verses.transliteration: mitró devéṣv āyúṣu  jánāya vr̥ktábarhiṣe  íṣa iṣṭávratā akaḥ

translation.text: Mitra to Gods, to living men, to him who strews the holy grass, Gives food fulfilling sacred Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒हेह॑ वो॒ मन॑सा ब॒न्धुता॑ नर उ॒शिजो॑ जग्मुर॒भि तानि॒ वेद॑सा याभि॑र्मा॒याभिः॒ प्रति॑जूतिवर्पसः॒ सौध॑न्वना य॒ज्ञियं॑ भा॒गमा॑न॒श
verses.transliteration: ihéha vo mánasā bandhútā naraḥ-  uśíjo jagmur abhí tā́ni védasā  yā́bhir māyā́bhiḥ prátijūtivarpasaḥ  saúdhanvanā yajñíyam bhāgám ānaśá

translation.text: HERE is your ghostly kinship, here, O Men: they came desirous to these holy rites with store of wealth, With wondrous arts, whereby, with schemes to meet each need, Ye gained, Sudhanvan's Sons! your share in sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभिः॒ शची॑भिश्चम॒साँ अपिं॑शत॒ यया॑ धि॒या गामरि॑णीत॒ चर्म॑णः येन॒ हरी॒ मन॑सा नि॒रत॑क्षत॒ तेन॑ देव॒त्वमृ॑भवः॒ समा॑नश
verses.transliteration: yā́bhiḥ śácībhiś camasā́m̐ ápiṃśata  yáyā dhiyā́ gā́m áriṇīta cármaṇaḥ  yéna hárī mánasā nirátakṣata  téna devatvám r̥bhavaḥ sám ānaśa

translation.text: The mighty powers wherewith. ye formed the chalices, the thought by which ye drew the cow from out the hide, The intellect wherewith ye wrought the two Bay Steeds,– through these, O R̥ibhus, ye attained divinity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑स्य स॒ख्यमृ॒भवः॒ समा॑नशु॒र्मनो॒र्नपा॑तो अ॒पसो॑ दधन्विरे सौ॒ध॒न्व॒नासो॑ अमृत॒त्वमेरि॑रे वि॒ष्ट्वी शमी॑भिः सु॒कृतः॑ सुकृ॒त्यया॑
verses.transliteration: índrasya sakhyám r̥bhávaḥ sám ānaśur  mánor nápāto apáso dadhanvire  saudhanvanā́so amr̥tatvám érire  viṣṭvī́ śámībhiḥ sukŕ̥taḥ sukr̥tyáyā

translation.text: Friendship with Indra have the R̥ibhus, fully gained: grandsons of Manu, they skilfully urged the work. Sudhanvan's Children won them everlasting life, serving with holy rites, pious with noble acts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रे॑ण याथ स॒रथं॑ सु॒ते सचाँ॒ अथो॒ वशा॑नां भवथा स॒ह श्रि॒या न वः॑ प्रति॒मै सु॑कृ॒तानि॑ वाघतः॒ सौध॑न्वना ऋभवो वी॒र्या॑णि च
verses.transliteration: índreṇa yātha saráthaṃ suté sácām̐  átho váśānām bhavathā sahá śriyā́  ná vaḥ pratimaí sukr̥tā́ni vāghataḥ  saúdhanvanā r̥bhavo vīryā̀ṇi ca

translation.text: :In company with Indra come ye to the juice, then gloriously shall your wishes be fulfilled. Not to be paragoned, ye Priests, are your good deeds, nor your heroic acts, R̥ibhus, Sudhanvan's Sons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑ ऋ॒भुभि॒र्वाज॑वद्भिः॒ समु॑क्षितं सु॒तं सोम॒मा वृ॑षस्वा॒ गभ॑स्त्योः धि॒येषि॒तो म॑घवन्दा॒शुषो॑ गृ॒हे सौ॑धन्व॒नेभिः॑ स॒ह म॑त्स्वा॒ नृभिः॑
verses.transliteration: índra r̥bhúbhir vā́javadbhiḥ sámukṣitaṃ  sutáṃ sómam ā́ vr̥ṣasvā gábhastyoḥ  dhiyéṣitó maghavan dāśúṣo gr̥hé  saudhanvanébhiḥ sahá matsvā nŕ̥bhiḥ

translation.text: O Indra, with the R̥ibhus, Mighty Ones, pour down the Soma juice effused, well-blent, from both thy hands. Maghalan, urged by song, in the drink-offerer's house rejoice thee with the Heroes, with Sudhanvan's Sons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑ ऋभु॒मान्वाज॑वान्मत्स्वे॒ह नो॒ऽस्मिन्त्सव॑ने॒ शच्या॑ पुरुष्टुत इ॒मानि॒ तुभ्यं॒ स्वस॑राणि येमिरे व्र॒ता दे॒वानां॒ मनु॑षश्च॒ धर्म॑भिः
verses.transliteration: índra r̥bhumā́n vā́javān matsvehá no  -asmín sávane śácyā puruṣṭuta  imā́ni túbhyaṃ svásarāṇi yemire  vratā́ devā́nām mánuṣaś ca dhármabhiḥ

translation.text: With R̥ibhu near, and Vâja, Indra, here exult, with Saci, praised of many, in the juice we pour. These homes wherein we dwell have turned themselves to thee, -devotions to the Gods, as laws of men ordain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑ ऋ॒भुभि॑र्वा॒जिभि॑र्वा॒जय॑न्नि॒ह स्तोमं॑ जरि॒तुरुप॑ याहि य॒ज्ञिय॑म् श॒तं केते॑भिरिषि॒रेभि॑रा॒यवे॑ स॒हस्र॑णीथो अध्व॒रस्य॒ होम॑नि
verses.transliteration: índra r̥bhúbhir vājíbhir vājáyann ihá  stómaṃ jaritúr úpa yāhi yajñíyam  śatáṃ kétebhir iṣirébhir āyáve  sahásraṇītho adhvarásya hómani

translation.text: Come with the mighty R̥ibhus, Indra, come to us, strengthening with thy help the singer's holy praise; At hundred eager calls come to the living man, with thousand arts attend the act of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उषो॒ वाजे॑न वाजिनि॒ प्रचे॑ताः॒ स्तोमं॑ जुषस्व गृण॒तो म॑घोनि पु॒रा॒णी दे॑वि युव॒तिः पुरं॑धि॒रनु॑ व्र॒तं च॑रसि विश्ववारे
verses.transliteration: úṣo vā́jena vājini prácetāḥ-  stómaṃ juṣasva gr̥ṇató maghoni  purāṇī́ devi yuvatíḥ púraṃdhir  ánu vratáṃ carasi viśvavāre

translation.text: O Ushas, strong with strength, endowed witli knowledge, accept the singer's praise, O wealthy Lady. Thou, Goddess, ancient, young, and full of wisdom, movest, all-bounteous! as the Law ordaineth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उषो॑ दे॒व्यम॑र्त्या॒ वि भा॑हि च॒न्द्रर॑था सू॒नृता॑ ई॒रय॑न्ती आ त्वा॑ वहन्तु सु॒यमा॑सो॒ अश्वा॒ हिर॑ण्यवर्णां पृथु॒पाज॑सो॒ ये
verses.transliteration: úṣo devy ámartyā ví bhāhi  candrárathā sūnŕ̥tā īráyantī  ā́ tvā vahantu suyámāso áśvāḥ-  híraṇyavarṇām pr̥thupā́jaso yé

translation.text: Shine forth, O Morning, thou auspicious Goddess, on thy bright car awaking pleasant voices. Let docile horses of far-reaching splendour convey thee hitherward, the goldencoloured.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उषः॑ प्रती॒ची भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वो॒र्ध्वा ति॑ष्ठस्य॒मृत॑स्य के॒तुः स॒मा॒नमर्थं॑ चरणी॒यमा॑ना च॒क्रमि॑व नव्य॒स्या व॑वृत्स्व
verses.transliteration: úṣaḥ pratīcī́ bhúvanāni víśvā-  -ūrdhvā́ tiṣṭhasy amŕ̥tasya ketúḥ  samānám árthaṃ caraṇīyámānā  cakrám iva navyasy ā́ vavr̥tsva

translation.text: Thou, Morning, turning thee to every creature, standest on high as ensign of the Immortal, To one same goal ever and ever wending now, like a wheel, O newly-born, roll hi ther.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॒ स्यूमे॑व चिन्व॒ती म॒घोन्यु॒षा या॑ति॒ स्वस॑रस्य॒ पत्नी॑ स्व१॒॑र्जन॑न्ती सु॒भगा॑ सु॒दंसा॒ आन्ता॑द्दि॒वः प॑प्रथ॒ आ पृ॑थि॒व्याः
verses.transliteration: áva syū́meva cinvatī́ maghónī-  uṣā́ yāti svásarasya pátnī  svàr jánantī subhágā sudáṃsāḥ-  ā́ntād diváḥ papratha ā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ

translation.text: Letting her reins drop downward, Morning cometh, the wealthy Dame, the Lady of the dwelling; Bringing forth light, the Wonderful, the Blessed hath spread her from the bounds of earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छा॑ वो दे॒वीमु॒षसं॑ विभा॒तीं प्र वो॑ भरध्वं॒ नम॑सा सुवृ॒क्तिम् ऊ॒र्ध्वं म॑धु॒धा दि॒वि पाजो॑ अश्रे॒त्प्र रो॑च॒ना रु॑रुचे र॒ण्वसं॑दृक्
verses.transliteration: áchā vo devī́m uṣásaṃ vibhātī́m  prá vo bharadhvaṃ námasā suvr̥ktím  ūrdhvám madhudhā́ diví pā́jo aśret  prá rocanā́ ruruce raṇvásaṃdr̥k

translation.text: Hither invoke the radiant Goddess Morning, and bring with reverence your hymn to praise her. She, dropping sweets, hath set in heaven her brightness, and, fair to look on, hath beamed forth her splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒ताव॑री दि॒वो अ॒र्कैर॑बो॒ध्या रे॒वती॒ रोद॑सी चि॒त्रम॑स्थात् आ॒य॒तीम॑ग्न उ॒षसं॑ विभा॒तीं वा॒ममे॑षि॒ द्रवि॑णं॒ भिक्ष॑माणः
verses.transliteration: r̥tā́varī divó arkaír abodhi-  ā́ revátī ródasī citrám asthāt  āyatī́m agna uṣásaṃ vibhātī́ṃ  vāmám eṣi dráviṇam bhíkṣamāṇaḥ

translation.text: From heaven, with hymns, the Holy One was wakened: brightly to both worlds came the wealthy Lady. To Morning, Agni, when she comes refulgent, thou goest forth soliciting fair riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तस्य॑ बु॒ध्न उ॒षसा॑मिष॒ण्यन्वृषा॑ म॒ही रोद॑सी॒ आ वि॑वेश म॒ही मि॒त्रस्य॒ वरु॑णस्य मा॒या च॒न्द्रेव॑ भा॒नुं वि द॑धे पुरु॒त्रा
verses.transliteration: r̥tásya budhná uṣásām iṣaṇyán  vŕ̥ṣā mahī́ ródasī ā́ viveśa  mahī́ mitrásya váruṇasya māyā́  candréva bhānúṃ ví dadhe purutrā́

translation.text: On Law's firm base the speeder of the Mornings, the Bull, hath entered mighty earth and heaven. Great is the power of Varuṇa and Mitra, which, bright, hath spread in every place its splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा उ॑ वां भृ॒मयो॒ मन्य॑माना यु॒वाव॑ते॒ न तुज्या॑ अभूवन् क्व१॒॑ त्यदि॑न्द्रावरुणा॒ यशो॑ वां॒ येन॑ स्मा॒ सिनं॒ भर॑थः॒ सखि॑भ्यः
verses.transliteration: imā́ u vām bhr̥máyo mányamānāḥ-  yuvā́vate ná tújyā abhūvan  kvà tyád indrāvaruṇā yáśo vāṃ  yéna smā sínam bhárathaḥ sákhibhyaḥ

translation.text: YOUR well-known prompt activities aforetime needed no impulse from your faithful servant. Where, Indra-Varuṇa, is now that glory wherewith ye brought support to those who loved you?

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यमु॑ वां पुरु॒तमो॑ रयी॒यञ्छ॑श्वत्त॒ममव॑से जोहवीति स॒जोषा॑विन्द्रावरुणा म॒रुद्भि॑र्दि॒वा पृ॑थि॒व्या शृ॑णुतं॒ हवं॑ मे
verses.transliteration: ayám u vām purutámo rayīyáñ  -śaśvattamám ávase johavīti  sajóṣāv indrāvaruṇā marúdbhir  divā́ pr̥thivyā́ śr̥ṇutaṃ hávam me

translation.text: This man, most diligent, seeking after riches, incessantly invokes you for your favour. Accordant, Indra-Varuṇa, with Maruts, with Heaven and Earth, hear ye mine invocation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मे तदि॑न्द्रावरुणा॒ वसु॑ ष्याद॒स्मे र॒यिर्म॑रुतः॒ सर्व॑वीरः अ॒स्मान्वरू॑त्रीः शर॒णैर॑वन्त्व॒स्मान्होत्रा॒ भार॑ती॒ दक्षि॑णाभिः
verses.transliteration: asmé tád indrāvaruṇā vásu ṣyād  asmé rayír marutaḥ sárvavīraḥ  asmā́n várūtrīḥ śaraṇaír avantu-  asmā́n hótrā bhā́ratī dákṣiṇābhiḥ

translation.text: O Indra-Varuṇa, ours be this treasure ours be wealth, Maruts, with full store of heroes. May the Varûtrîs with their shelter aid us, and Bhâratî and Hotrâ with the Mornings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृह॑स्पते जु॒षस्व॑ नो ह॒व्यानि॑ विश्वदेव्य रास्व॒ रत्ना॑नि दा॒शुषे॑
verses.transliteration: bŕ̥haspate juṣásva no  havyā́ni viśvadevya  rā́sva rátnāni dāśúṣe

translation.text: Be pleased! with our oblations, thou loved of all Gods, Br̥ihaspati: Give wealth to him who brings thee gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शुचि॑म॒र्कैर्बृह॒स्पति॑मध्व॒रेषु॑ नमस्यत अना॒म्योज॒ आ च॑के
verses.transliteration: śúcim arkaír bŕ̥haspátim  adhvaréṣu namasyata  ánāmy ója ā́ cake

translation.text: At sacrifices, with your hymns worship the pure Br̥ihaspati- I pray for power which none may bend-

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृ॒ष॒भं च॑र्षणी॒नां वि॒श्वरू॑प॒मदा॑भ्यम् बृह॒स्पतिं॒ वरे॑ण्यम्
verses.transliteration: vr̥ṣabháṃ carṣaṇīnā́ṃ  viśvárūpam ádābhyam  bŕ̥haspátiṃ váreṇyam

translation.text: The Bull of men, whom none deceive, the wearer of each shape at will, Br̥ihaspati Most Excellent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यं ते॑ पूषन्नाघृणे सुष्टु॒तिर्दे॑व॒ नव्य॑सी अ॒स्माभि॒स्तुभ्यं॑ शस्यते
verses.transliteration: iyáṃ te pūṣann āghr̥ṇe  suṣṭutír deva návyasī  asmā́bhis túbhyaṃ śasyate

translation.text: Divine, resplendent Pûshan, this our newest hymn of eulogy, By us is chanted forth to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तां जु॑षस्व॒ गिरं॒ मम॑ वाज॒यन्ती॑मवा॒ धिय॑म् व॒धू॒युरि॑व॒ योष॑णाम्
verses.transliteration: tā́ṃ juṣasva gíram máma  vājayántīm avā dhíyam  vadhūyúr iva yóṣaṇām

translation.text: Accept with favour this my song, be gracious to the earnest thought, Even as a bridegroom to his bride.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो विश्वा॒भि वि॒पश्य॑ति॒ भुव॑ना॒ सं च॒ पश्य॑ति स नः॑ पू॒षावि॒ता भु॑वत्
verses.transliteration: yó víśvābhí vipáśyati  bhúvanā sáṃ ca páśyati  sá naḥ pūṣā́vitā́ bhuvat

translation.text: May he who sees all living things, see, them together at a glancc,– May lie, may Pûshan be our help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तत्स॑वि॒तुर्वरे॑ण्यं॒ भर्गो॑ दे॒वस्य॑ धीमहि धियो॒ यो नः॑ प्रचो॒दया॑त्
verses.transliteration: tát savitúr váreṇyam  bhárgo devásya dhīmahi  dhíyo yó naḥ pracodáyāt

translation.text: May we attain that excellent glory of Savitar the God: So May he stimulate our prayers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वस्य॑ सवि॒तुर्व॒यं वा॑ज॒यन्तः॒ पुरं॑ध्या भग॑स्य रा॒तिमी॑महे
verses.transliteration: devásya savitúr vayáṃ  vājayántaḥ púraṃdhyā  bhágasya rātím īmahe

translation.text: With understanding, earnestly, of Savitar the God we crave Our portion of prosperity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वं नरः॑ सवि॒तारं॒ विप्रा॑ य॒ज्ञैः सु॑वृ॒क्तिभिः॑ न॒म॒स्यन्ति॑ धि॒येषि॒ताः
verses.transliteration: deváṃ náraḥ savitā́raṃ  víprā yajñaíḥ suvr̥ktíbhiḥ  namasyánti dhiyéṣitā́ḥ

translation.text: Men, singers worship Savitar the God with hymn and holy rites, Urged by the impulse of their thoughts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमो॑ जिगाति गातु॒विद्दे॒वाना॑मेति निष्कृ॒तम् ऋ॒तस्य॒ योनि॑मा॒सद॑म्
verses.transliteration: sómo jigāti gātuvíd  devā́nām eti niṣkr̥tám  r̥tásya yónim āsádam

translation.text: Soma who gives success goes forth, goes to the gathering place of Gods, To seat him at the seat of Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमो॑ अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ द्वि॒पदे॒ चतु॑ष्पदे च प॒शवे॑ अ॒न॒मी॒वा इष॑स्करत्
verses.transliteration: sómo asmábhyaṃ dvipáde  cátuṣpade ca paśáve  anamīvā́ íṣas karat

translation.text: To us and to our cattle may Soma give salutary food, To biped and to quadruped.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माक॒मायु॑र्व॒र्धय॑न्न॒भिमा॑तीः॒ सह॑मानः सोमः॑ स॒धस्थ॒मास॑दत्
verses.transliteration: asmā́kam ā́yur vardháyann  abhímātīḥ sáhamānaḥ  sómaḥ sadhástham ā́sadat

translation.text: May Soma, strengthening our power of life, and conquering our foes, In our assembly take his seat.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ मित्रावरुणा घृ॒तैर्गव्यू॑तिमुक्षतम् मध्वा॒ रजां॑सि सुक्रतू
verses.transliteration: ā́ no mitrāvaruṇā  ghr̥taír gávyūtim ukṣatam  mádhvā rájāṃsi sukratū

translation.text: May Mitra-Varuṇa, sapient Pair, bedew our pasturage with oil, With meath the regions of the air.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒रु॒शंसा॑ नमो॒वृधा॑ म॒ह्ना दक्ष॑स्य राजथः द्राघि॑ष्ठाभिः शुचिव्रता
verses.transliteration: uruśáṃsā namovŕ̥dhā  mahnā́ dákṣasya rājathaḥ  drā́ghiṣṭhābhiḥ śucivratā

translation.text: Far-ruling, joyful when adored, ye reign through majesty of might, With pure laws everlastingly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गृ॒णा॒ना ज॒मद॑ग्निना॒ योना॑वृ॒तस्य॑ सीदतम् पा॒तं सोम॑मृतावृधा
verses.transliteration: gr̥ṇānā́ jamádagninā  yónāv r̥tásya sīdatam  pātáṃ sómam r̥tāvr̥dhā

translation.text: Lauded by Jamadagni's song, sit in the place of holy Law: Drink Soma, ye who strengthen Law.
